|archive-date=November 28, 2022 |access-date=November 28, 2022 |publisher=Sloboden Pecat}}</ref>}}\n| years_active       = 2010\u2013present\n| occupation         = {{hlist|Singer|songwriter}}\n| works              = {{flatlist|\n*[[Bebe Rexha discography|Discography]]\n*[[List of songs recorded by Bebe Rexha|Songs]]\n}}\n| awards             = [[List of awards and nominations received by Bebe Rexha|Full list]]\n| module             = {{Infobox musical artist\n| embed            = yes\n| background       = solo_singer\n| genre            = [[Pop music|Pop]]<ref name=\"AllMusic\" /><ref name=\"RS\" />\n| instruments      = Vocals\n| label            = {{hlist|[[DCD2 Records|DCD2]]|[[First Access Entertainment|First Access]]|[[The Island Def Jam Music Group|Island Def Jam]]|[[Warner Records|Warner]]}}<!--List names only: details go in the article.-->\n| past_member_of   = [[Black Cards]]\n| website          = {{URL|https://www.beberexha.com/|beberexha.com}}\n}}\n}}\n\n'''Bleta''' \"'''Bebe'''\" '''Rexha''' ({{IPAc-en|\u02c8|b|i\u02d0|b|i|_|\u02c8|r|\u025b|k|s|\u0259}} {{respell|BEE|bee|_|REK|s\u0259}}, {{IPA|sq|\u02c8bl\u025bta \u02c8\u027e\u025bd\u0292a|lang}};<ref name=\"MTVFB\">{{Cite Instagram |postid=BGaNA0ivgYg |user=beberexha |title=Try to pronounce my real first name \ud83d\ude0b // Watch my 'Introducing' interview at push.mtv.tv! \ud83d\udd34\u26ab\ufe0f |date=June 8, 2016 |access-date=March 25, 2023 |url=http://ghostarchive.org/iarchive/instagram/beberexha/1268383476080313888 }}</ref> born August 30, 1989) is an American<!--The consensus is to classify her simply as \"American.\"--> singer and songwriter.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Halperin |first=Shirley |date=September 30, 2020 |title=Bebe Rexha Signs With SAL&CO Management, Home to The Weeknd, French Montana |url=https://variety.com/2020/music/news/bebe-rexha-signs-with-weeknd-manager-sal-slaiby-1203489714/ |magazine=Variety |access-date=October 10, 2020 |archive-date=October 11, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231011141301/https://variety.com/2020/music/news/bebe-rexha-signs-with-weeknd-manager-sal-slaiby-1203489714/ |url-status=live }}</ref> After signing with [[Warner Records]] in 2013, Rexha first achieved success as a songwriter, with credits on [[Eminem]]'s single \"[[The Monster (song)|The Monster]]\" (which later received the [[Grammy Award for Best Melodic Rap Performance|Grammy Award for Best Rap/Sung Performance]]) as well as other songs for [[Shinee]], [[Selena Gomez]], and [[Nick Jonas]], among others.<ref name=\"GMA\">{{Cite news |last=Macas |first=Trisha |date=June 28, 2016 |title=Bebe Rexha: Music is about making people know they're not alone |publisher=[[GMA Network (company)|GMA Network]] |url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/571629/lifestyle/artandculture/bebe-rexha-music-is-about-making-people-know-they-re-not-alone |url-status=live |access-date=August 13, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160923080611/http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/571629/lifestyle/artandculture/bebe-rexha-music-is-about-making-people-know-they-re-not-alone |archive-date=September 23, 2016}}</ref><ref name=\"Twitter\">{{Cite tweet |number=811944225155776512 |user=BebeRexha |title=I wrote it in my bedroom.\ud83d\ude0a |date=December 22, 2016 |access-date=February 12, 2019}}</ref><ref name=\"Yahoo\">{{Cite news |date=August 9, 2016 |title=7 Songs You Didn't Know Bebe Rexha Wrote |publisher=[[Yahoo! Music]] |url=https://www.yahoo.com/music/7-songs-didnt-know-bebe-rexha-wrote-194041334.html |url-status=live |access-date=August 13, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160920042246/https://www.yahoo.com/music/7-songs-didnt-know-bebe-rexha-wrote-194041334.html |archive-date=September 20, 2016}}</ref><ref name=\"GQ\">{{Cite magazine |last=Lange |first=Maggie |date=April 6, 2016 |title=Meet Bebe Rexha, the Woman Who's Been Making All Those Top 40 Songs So Catchy |url=https://www.gq.com/story/wcw-bebe-rexha |magazine=[[GQ]] |access-date=August 13, 2016 |archive-date=September 21, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160921040347/http://www.gq.com/story/wcw-bebe-rexha |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name=\"BBJuly\">{{Cite magazine |last=Goodman |first=William |date=July 22, 2016 |title=Bebe Rexha Plays Hits & New Tracks at Acoustic 'Next Up' Seattle Show |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/7446650/bebe-rexha-next-up-seattle-event |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |access-date=August 13, 2016 |archive-date=July 28, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160728120701/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/7446650/bebe-rexha-next-up-seattle-event |url-status=live }}</ref> Rexha released her debut [[extended play]] in 2015, ''[[I Don't Wanna Grow Up]]'', which saw moderate commercial success with its singles \"[[I Can't Stop Drinking About You]]\" and \"[[I'm Gonna Show You Crazy]]\".\n\nRexha released two additional extended plays in 2017, ''[[All Your Fault: Pt. 1]]'' and ''[[All Your Fault: Pt. 2]]'', which again saw the moderate success of the singles \"[[I Got You (Bebe Rexha song)|I Got You]]\" and \"[[The Way I Are (Dance with Somebody)]]\" (featuring [[Lil Wayne]]). Rexha has also seen success with several collaborations including \"[[Hey Mama (David Guetta song)|Hey Mama]]\" (with [[David Guetta]], [[Nicki Minaj]] and [[Afrojack]]), \"[[Me, Myself & I (G-Eazy and Bebe Rexha song)|Me, Myself & I]]\" (with [[G-Eazy]]), \"[[In the Name of Love (Martin Garrix and Bebe Rexha song)|In the Name of Love]]\" (with [[Martin Garrix]]), and \"[[Meant to Be (Bebe Rexha song)|Meant to Be]]\" (featuring [[Florida Georgia Line]]), the latter of which had wide success as a country [[crossover music|crossover]] single, peaking at number two on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] chart in the United States. Rexha's debut studio album, ''[[Expectations (Bebe Rexha album)|Expectations]]'' (2018), reached number 13 on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] chart in the United States and saw the success of its lead single, \"[[I'm a Mess (Bebe Rexha song)|I'm a Mess]]\", and brought Rexha two nominations for [[Grammy Award for Best New Artist|Best New Artist]] and [[Grammy Award for Best Country Duo/Group Performance|Best Country Duo/Group Performance]] at the [[61st Grammy Awards]].<ref name=\"itunes expectations\">{{Cite web |title=Expectations by Bebe Rexha |url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/expectations/1370924192 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180909152753/https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/expectations/1370924192 |archive-date=September 9, 2018 |access-date=April 14, 2018 |publisher=[[iTunes Store]]}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=December 5, 2018 |title=Bebe Rexha |url=https://www.grammy.com/grammys/artists/bebe-rexha |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200626090251/https://www.grammy.com/grammys/artists/bebe-rexha |archive-date=June 26, 2020 |access-date=December 12, 2018 |publisher=Grammy Awards}}</ref> Rexha released her second studio album, ''[[Better Mistakes]]'', in 2021. In 2023, Rexha's [[Bebe (album)|self-titled third album]] spawned her biggest single to date, \"[[I'm Good (Blue)]]\" (with [[David Guetta]]), which peaked at number four on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100 and topped the charts in 22 countries.\n\n== Early life ==\nBleta Rexha was born on August 30, 1989, in [[Brooklyn]], New York City; her family is [[Albanians in North Macedonia|Albanian]] and from [[North Macedonia]].<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Trust |first=Gary |date=April 22, 2019 |title=Why Albanian Artists Are Having a Moment On the Charts |url=https://www.billboard.com/pro/albanian-artists-charts-dua-lipa-bebe-rexha-ava-max/ |url-status=live |magazine=Billboard |archive-url=https://archive.today/20230129210026/https://www.billboard.com/pro/albanian-artists-charts-dua-lipa-bebe-rexha-ava-max/ |archive-date=January 29, 2023 |access-date=January 29, 2023}}</ref><ref name=\"Telegrafi\">{{Cite web |date=December 24, 2021 |title=Bebe Rexha: N\u00eb familjet shqiptare n\u00ebse qeshni kur jeni t\u00eb s\u00ebmur\u00eb, at\u00ebher\u00eb nuk jeni t\u00eb s\u00ebmur\u00eb m\u00eb |trans-title=Bebe Rexha: In Albanian families if you laugh, while being sick then you are not sick no more |url=https://telegrafi.com/bebe-rexha-ne-familjet-shqiptare-nese-qeshni-kur-jeni-te-semure-atehere-nuk-jeni-te-semure/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.today/20230129205142/https://telegrafi.com/bebe-rexha-ne-familjet-shqiptare-nese-qeshni-kur-jeni-te-semure-atehere-nuk-jeni-te-semure/ |archive-date=January 29, 2023 |access-date=January 29, 2023 |website=[[Telegrafi]] |language=sq |quote=Familja nga babai e k\u00ebng\u00ebtares ka prejardhje nga Dibra e Madhe n\u00eb Maqedonin\u00eb e Veriut, nd\u00ebrkoh\u00eb ajo e n\u00ebn\u00ebs nga Gostivari. |trans-quote=The singer's paternal family originate from Dibra e Madhe in North Macedonia, while her maternal family from Gostivar.}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Rosseinsky |first=Katie |date=December 3, 2019 |title=Bebe Rexha visits Albania after major earthquake |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/showbiz/celebrity-news/bebe-rexha-visits-albania-after-major-earthquake-a4302956.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.today/20230129210213/https://www.standard.co.uk/showbiz/celebrity-news/bebe-rexha-visits-albania-after-major-earthquake-a4302956.html |archive-date=January 29, 2023 |access-date=January 29, 2023 |website=[[Evening Standard]]}}</ref> Her father, Flamur Rexha, was born in [[Debar]], North Macedonia when it was part of [[Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|Yugoslavia]] and emigrated to the U.S. at the age of 21.<ref name=\"Telegrafi\" /> Her mother, Bukurije, was born in the United States to an Albanian family with roots in [[Gostivar]] which is northeast of Debar and separated by [[Mavrovo National Park]].<ref name=\"Telegrafi\" /><ref>{{Cite web |last=Zyla |first=Julian |date=April 17, 2014 |title=Bebe Rexha, bashkautorja e k\u00ebng\u00ebs \"The Monster\" |url=http://www.zeriamerikes.com/content/bebe-rexha-bashk%C3%ABautorja-e-k%C3%ABng%C3%ABs-the-monster-interviste/1895479.html |access-date=December 13, 2016 |website=Voice of America in Albanian}}</ref><ref name=\"Kosovo\">{{Cite news |last=Rama |first=Albana |date=June 9, 2014 |title=Singer Bebe Rexha wrote song for Eminem |publisher=Kosovo Diaspora |url=http://www.kosovodiaspora.org/singer-bebe-rexha-wrote-song-for-eminem/ |url-status=live |access-date=December 13, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220815101217/https://www.kosovodiaspora.org/singer-bebe-rexha-wrote-song-for-eminem/ |archive-date=August 15, 2022}}</ref> In the Albanian language, {{lang|sq|blet\u00eb}} means \"[[bee]]\". She said, \"My parents are Albanian, and people started calling me 'Bebe' for short.\"<ref name=\"GMA\" /> She and her family moved to nearby [[Staten Island]] when she was six.<ref name=\"Vid\">{{Cite web |author=[[Ebro Darden]] |author2=Bebe Rexha |date=April 17, 2016 |title=Bebe Rexha talking about being Albanian and songwriting (Ebro Darden Interview) |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S96rcOmHgcM |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200526050636/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S96rcOmHgcM |archive-date=May 26, 2020 |access-date=August 13, 2016 |via=[[YouTube]]}}</ref> Rexha has a brother named Florent.<ref>{{Cite tweet |number=756161676420845569 |user=BeBeRexha |title=Happy b day to my brother Florent. |first=BeBe |date=July 21, 2016 |access-date=July 12, 2021 |last1=Rexha}}</ref><ref>{{Cite Instagram |postid=BSWnL_FA-0j/?hl=en |user=beberexha |title=I love you @florentr best brother and friend I could ever ask for. |date=April 1, 2017 |access-date=July 12, 2021 |first1=bebe |last1=rexha}}</ref>\n\nRexha took trumpet lessons and later taught herself to play guitar and piano.<ref name=\"NYP\">{{Cite news |last=Vincentelli |first=Elisabeth |date=July 4, 2015 |title=Rihanna dissed me, so I wrote her a hit song |work=[[New York Post]] |url=https://nypost.com/2015/07/04/rihanna-dissed-me-so-i-wrote-her-a-hit-song/ |url-status=live |access-date=August 13, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160821073357/http://nypost.com/2015/07/04/rihanna-dissed-me-so-i-wrote-her-a-hit-song/ |archive-date=August 21, 2016}}</ref><ref name=\"People\">{{Cite magazine |last=Nelson |first=Jeff |date=June 30, 2016 |title=5 Things to Know About Bebe Rexha, the Breakout Singer-Songwriter You Need to Know (But Have Already Heard!) |url=http://www.people.com/article/bebe-rexha-5-things-to-know-rihanna-nicki-minaj-songwriter |magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]] |access-date=August 13, 2016 |archive-date=December 4, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201204084928/http://www.people.com/article/bebe-rexha-5-things-to-know-rihanna-nicki-minaj-songwriter |url-status=live }}</ref> She attended [[Tottenville High School]] in Staten Island. Rexha sang in the choir there and took part in a variety of musicals.<ref name=\"Yibada\">{{Cite news |last=Geisler |first=Conan |date=June 29, 2016 |title=Eminem's 'The Monster' co-writer Bebe Rexha visits Philippines, hates to fly |publisher=[[Yibada]] |url=http://en.yibada.com/articles/136252/20160629/eminem-s-monster-co-writer-bebe-rexha-visits-philippines-hates.htm |url-status=live |access-date=August 13, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160807171400/http://en.yibada.com/articles/136252/20160629/eminem-s-monster-co-writer-bebe-rexha-visits-philippines-hates.htm |archive-date=August 7, 2016}}</ref><ref name=\"GQ\" /><ref name=\"Kosovo\" /><ref name=\"People\" /> While in high school choir, she discovered that she is a [[coloratura soprano]].<ref name=\"Nunn\">{{Cite news |last=Nunn |first=Jerry |date=May 31, 2016 |title=NUNN ON ONE: MUSIC Singer Bebe Rexha: 'Hearts' and soul |work=[[Windy City Times]] |url=http://www.windycitymediagroup.com/lgbt/NUNN-ON-ONE-MUSIC-Singer-Bebe-Rexha-Hearts-and-soul/55382.html |url-status=live |access-date=August 13, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160916035211/http://www.windycitymediagroup.com/lgbt/NUNN-ON-ONE-MUSIC-Singer-Bebe-Rexha-Hearts-and-soul/55382.html |archive-date=September 16, 2016}}</ref><ref name=\"Vid2\">{{Cite web |first=Bebe |last=Rexha |date=January 21, 2016 |title=Bebe Rexha: \"Classical Songs Make Me Cry\" |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kjRcc1cCPe4 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191109013336/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kjRcc1cCPe4&gl=US&hl=en |archive-date=November 9, 2019 |access-date=August 13, 2016 |publisher=[[Fuse (TV channel)|Fuse]] |via=YouTube}}</ref> Rexha cites [[Coldplay]], [[the Cranberries]], [[Lauryn Hill]], [[Alanis Morissette]], and [[Kanye West]] as being musical influences.<ref name=\"Nylon\">{{Cite magazine |last=Yotka |first=Steff |date=March 21, 2014 |title=Song Premiere: Bebe Rexha |url=http://www.nylon.com/articles/bebe-rexha-i-can%27t-stop-drinking-about-you |magazine=[[Nylon (magazine)|Nylon]] |access-date=August 14, 2016 |archive-date=December 20, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211220184234/https://www.nylon.com/articles/bebe-rexha-i-can%27t-stop-drinking-about-you |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name=\"Soundtracked\">{{Cite web |first=Bebe |last=Rexha |date=February 9, 2018 |title=Bebe Rexha on How No Doubt, Lauryn Hill & Destiny's Child Shaped Her Sound |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bmm6TGnWssI |access-date=February 19, 2018 |via=[[YouTube]] |archive-date=February 15, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180215225144/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bmm6TGnWssI&gl=US&hl=en |url-status=dead }}</ref>\n\nAs a teenager, she submitted a song to be performed at [[The Recording Academy|the National Academy of Recording Arts & Sciences]]' annual \"Grammy Career Day\" event. Rexha earned the \"Best Teen Songwriter\" award; about 700 were in the competition.<ref name=\"Vid\" /><ref name=\"Pop\">{{Cite news |last=McGahan |first=Michelle |date=August 27, 2014 |title=Bebe Rexha Talks Writing Eminem and Rihanna's 'The Monster,' Her Single 'I Can't Stop Drinking About You' + More [EXCLUSIVE VIDEO] |publisher=[[PopCrush]] |url=http://popcrush.com/bebe-rexha-the-monster-i-cant-stop-drinking-about-you-video/ |url-status=live |access-date=August 13, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160611161711/http://popcrush.com/bebe-rexha-the-monster-i-cant-stop-drinking-about-you-video/ |archive-date=June 11, 2016}}</ref><ref name=\"INFO\">{{Cite news |last=Tanas\u0103 |first=Raluca |date=August 14, 2014 |title=Bebe Rexha pune Albania pe harta starurilor pop interna\u021bionale \u2013 VIDEO |language=ro |publisher=INFOMUSIC |url=http://www.infomusic.ro/2014/08/bebe-rexha-artist-nou-video/ |url-status=live |access-date=August 13, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160921193600/http://www.infomusic.ro/2014/08/bebe-rexha-artist-nou-video/ |archive-date=September 21, 2016}}</ref> As a result, she signed a contract with talent scout Samantha Cox, who encouraged her to enroll in songwriting classes in [[Manhattan]].<ref name=\"NYP\" /><ref name=\"EW\">{{Cite magazine |last=Feeney |first=Nolan |date=June 21, 2016 |title=Bebe Rexha's 7-step guide to breaking into the music industry |url=http://www.ew.com/article/2016/06/21/bebe-rexha-interview |magazine=[[Entertainment Weekly]] |access-date=August 13, 2016 |archive-date=October 17, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231017175556/https://ew.com/article/2016/06/21/bebe-rexha-interview/ |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\n== Career ==\n{{see also|List of awards and nominations received by Bebe Rexha}}\n\n=== 2010\u20132012: Career beginnings with Black Cards ===\n[[File:Black Cards 2011.jpg|thumb|left|Rexha with [[Pete Wentz]] on September 1, 2011, at the Rumsey Playfield]]\nIn 2008 had a shortlived deal with [[The Island Def Jam Music Group|Island Def]] which they canceled. In 2010, she met [[Fall Out Boy]]'s bassist [[Pete Wentz]] and began working with him at a recording studio in [[New York City]].<ref name=\"People\" /><ref name=\"Paper\">{{Cite news |last=Song |first=Sandra |date=April 13, 2016 |title=It's Bebe Rexha's Time to Shine |work=[[Paper (magazine)|Paper]] |url=http://www.papermag.com/hey-bebe-1727183570.html |url-status=live |access-date=August 13, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160818213450/http://www.papermag.com/hey-bebe-1727183570.html |archive-date=August 18, 2016}}</ref> She became a member and a lead vocalist of Wentz's new experimental project called [[Black Cards]]. The band played a variety of live shows and released several singles and remixes. However, in January 2012, Wentz announced that Rexha had left the band to pursue other endeavors.<ref name=\"MTVCards\">{{Cite news |last=Montgomery |first=James |date=January 13, 2012 |title=Pete Wentz Talks Future Of Black Cards |publisher=[[MTV]] |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1677311/peter-wentz-black-cards-future/ |url-status=dead |access-date=August 13, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170517074340/http://www.mtv.com/news/1677311/peter-wentz-black-cards-future/ |archive-date=May 17, 2017}}</ref> Bebe Rexha was awarded the [[Songwriters Hall of Fame#Abe Olman Scholarship|Abe Olman Scholarship]] for her contributions as a songwriter later that year.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Bebe Rexha {{!}} Songwriters Hall of Fame |url=https://www.songhall.org/scholarships/view/bebe_rexha |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181118122810/https://www.songhall.org/scholarships/view/bebe_rexha |archive-date=November 18, 2018 |access-date=November 18, 2018 |website=www.songhall.org}}</ref>\n\n===2013\u20132016: Solo debut, ''I Don't Wanna Grow Up'' and collaborations===\nIn 2013, Rexha signed with [[Warner Bros. Records]] as a solo artist.<ref name=\"Vibe\">{{Cite news |last=Kennedy |first=John |date=October 24, 2013 |title=Singer Bebe Rexha Talks Co-Writing Eminem And Rihanna's 'MMLP2' Collaboration 'The Monster' |work=[[Vibe (magazine)|Vibe]] |url=http://www.vibe.com/2013/10/singer-bebe-rexha-talks-co-writing-eminem-and-rihannas-mmlp2-collaboration-monster/ |url-status=live |access-date=August 13, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160920182102/http://www.vibe.com/2013/10/singer-bebe-rexha-talks-co-writing-eminem-and-rihannas-mmlp2-collaboration-monster/ |archive-date=September 20, 2016}}</ref> Rexha had begun writing songs in 2008, including [[Selena Gomez]]'s \"Like a Champion\" and [[Nikki Williams]]'s \"Glowing\".<ref name=\"Yahoo\" />  She co-wrote [[Eminem|Eminem's]] and [[Rihanna|Rihanna's]] \"[[The Monster (song)|The Monster]]\", which was released as the fourth single from Eminem's album ''[[The Marshall Mathers LP 2]]''. The song topped the US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] and the US [[Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs]] chart winning a [[Grammy Award]] for [[Grammy Award for Best Rap/Sung Performance|Best Rap/Sung Performance]] at the [[57th Annual Grammy Awards]] ceremony.<ref name=\"Pigeons\">{{Cite news |last=Tanners |first=Jon |date=January 7, 2014 |title=Creating a Monster: How Bebe Rexha's Song Became Eminem's Chart-Topping Hit |publisher=[[Pigeons and Planes]] |url=https://www.complex.com/pigeons-and-planes/2014/01/eminem-rihanna-monster-bebe-rexha-jon-bellion |url-status=live |access-date=May 25, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230525001234/https://www.complex.com/pigeons-and-planes/2014/01/eminem-rihanna-monster-bebe-rexha-jon-bellion |archive-date=May 25, 2023}}</ref> That same year, Rexha also wrote and was featured on [[Cash Cash]]'s single \"[[Take Me Home (Cash Cash song)|Take Me Home]]\", which peaked within the top ten of the charts in Australia and the United Kingdom.<ref name=\"Nylon\" /><ref name=\"Vibe\" />\n\nOn March 21, 2014, Rexha released her debut single, \"[[I Can't Stop Drinking About You]]\".<ref name=\"Nylon\" /> The song peaked at number 22 on the US [[Top Heatseekers#Songs chart|Top Heatseekers]] chart.<ref name=\"BBHeat\">{{Cite magazine |last=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |title=Bebe Rexha \u2013 Chart History \u2013 Heatseekers Songs |url=http://www.billboard.com/artist/6253099/bebe-rexha/chart?f=887 |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180717215700/https://www.billboard.com/artist/6253099/bebe-rexha/chart?f=887 |archive-date=July 17, 2018 |access-date=August 14, 2016}}</ref> The [[music video]] was released on August 12, 2014. The video was inspired by imagery from films such as ''[[Girl, Interrupted (film)|Girl, Interrupted]]'' and ''[[Melancholia (2011 film)|Melancholia]]''.<ref name=\"MTV2014\">{{Cite news |last=Midgarden |first=Cory |date=August 13, 2014 |title=Meet Bebe Rexha: The Anti-Katy Perry Of Pop |publisher=[[MTV]] |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1896790/bebe-rexha-i-cant-stop-drinking-about-you/ |url-status=dead |access-date=August 14, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160802000018/http://www.mtv.com/news/1896790/bebe-rexha-i-cant-stop-drinking-about-you/ |archive-date=August 2, 2016}}</ref> In November 2014, Rexha was featured on rapper [[Pitbull (rapper)|Pitbull]]'s song \"This Is Not a Drill\".<ref name=\"IdolDrill\">{{Cite news |last=Wass |first=Mike |date=November 21, 2014 |title=Bebe Rexha Teams Up With Pitbull On \"This Is Not A Drill\": Listen To The 'Globalization' Trap-Pop Anthem |publisher=[[Idolator (website)|Idolator]] |url=http://www.idolator.com/7571447/bebe-rexha-pitbull-this-is-not-a-drill |url-status=live |access-date=August 14, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200530220550/https://www.idolator.com/7571447/bebe-rexha-pitbull-this-is-not-a-drill |archive-date=May 30, 2020}}</ref> and in September 2014, she was picked as [[Elvis Duran]]'s [[Elvis Duran's Artist of the Month|Artist of the Month]] and was featured on [[NBC]]'s ''[[Today (U.S. TV program)|Today]]'' show hosted by [[Kathie Lee Gifford]] and [[Hoda Kotb]], where she performed live her single \"I Can't Stop Drinking About You\".\n\nIn December 2014, Rexha released two more singles, \"[[I'm Gonna Show You Crazy]]\" and \"[[Gone (Bebe Rexha song)|Gone]]\".<ref name=\"IdolCrazy\">{{Cite news |last=Wass |first=Mike |date=December 17, 2014 |title=Bebe Rexha Unveils Her \"I'm Gonna Show You Crazy\" Cover Art And Shares Two New Snippets: Listen |publisher=[[Idolator (website)|Idolator]] |url=http://www.idolator.com/7574664/bebe-rexha-im-gonna-show-you-crazy-cover-snippet |url-status=live |access-date=August 14, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200530220551/https://www.idolator.com/7574664/bebe-rexha-im-gonna-show-you-crazy-cover-snippet |archive-date=May 30, 2020}}</ref><ref name=\"IdolGone\">{{Cite news |last=Stern |first=Bradley |date=December 22, 2014 |title=Bebe Rexha Debuts Powerful Ballad, \"Gone\": Idolator Premiere |publisher=[[Idolator (website)|Idolator]] |url=http://www.idolator.com/7575023/bebe-rexha-gone-idolator-premiere-listen |url-status=live |access-date=August 14, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200530220551/https://www.idolator.com/7575023/bebe-rexha-gone-idolator-premiere-listen |archive-date=May 30, 2020}}</ref> On May 12, 2015, she released her debut EP, ''[[I Don't Wanna Grow Up]]'', through Warner Bros. Records.<ref name=\"BBMama\" /> She also co-wrote and was featured on David Guetta's single \"[[Hey Mama (David Guetta song)|Hey Mama]]\", alongside [[Nicki Minaj]] and [[Afrojack]].<ref name=\"Yahoo\" /> The song peaked at number eight on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100 and received 1.1 million downloads {{as of|2015|June|lc=y}}. The song did not originally credit Rexha, despite the fact that she sings the chorus and is featured on background vocals. Eventually, in June 2015, she was given a credit for her work.<ref name=\"BBMama\">{{Cite magazine |last=Lipshutz |first=Jason |date=April 29, 2015 |title=Bebe Rexha Explains Why She Isn't (Officially) Featured on David Guetta's 'Hey Mama' |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/6546356/bebe-rexha-david-guetta-hey-mama-interview |url-status=live |access-date=August 14, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160819010526/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/6546356/bebe-rexha-david-guetta-hey-mama-interview |archive-date=August 19, 2016}}</ref><ref name=\"USA\">{{Cite news |last=Ryan |first=Patrick |date=June 23, 2015 |title='Hey,' Bebe! 'Mama' singer gets due credit |work=[[USA Today]] |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/music/2015/06/23/bebe-rexha-hey-mama-david-guetta-uncredited-singers/27780041/ |url-status=live |access-date=August 14, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161227014850/http://www.usatoday.com/story/life/music/2015/06/23/bebe-rexha-hey-mama-david-guetta-uncredited-singers/27780041/ |archive-date=December 27, 2016}}</ref>\n\nIn January 2015, Rexha co-wrote and was featured on G-Eazy's \"Me, Myself & I\". The song peaked at number seven on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100<ref name=\"USAEazy\">{{Cite news |last=Ryan |first=Patrick |date=August 5, 2016 |title=Q&A: G-Eazy on 'terrifying' Donald Trump, working with Britney Spears |work=[[USA Today]] |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/music/2016/08/04/g-eazy-donald-trump-britney-spears/87773044/ |url-status=live |access-date=August 14, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160812142906/http://www.usatoday.com/story/life/music/2016/08/04/g-eazy-donald-trump-britney-spears/87773044/ |archive-date=August 12, 2016}}</ref> and at number one on the US [[Mainstream Top 40|Pop Songs]] chart.<ref name=\"BBPop\">{{Cite magazine |last=Trust |first=Gary |date=April 11, 2016 |title=G-Eazy & Bebe Rexha Rule Pop Songs Chart With 'Me, Myself & I' |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/7326553/g-eazy-bebe-rexha-rule-pop-songs-chart-with-me-myself-i |url-status=live |access-date=August 14, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160817223817/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/7326553/g-eazy-bebe-rexha-rule-pop-songs-chart-with-me-myself-i |archive-date=August 17, 2016}}</ref> The song was originally titled \"I Don't Need Anything\" and was intended as a song for Rexha herself. Instead she took the song idea to G-Eazy and was featured in the chorus of the song.<ref name=\"FuseMyself\">{{Cite news |last=Lipshutz |first=Jason |date=January 22, 2016 |title=Bebe Rexha Tells Origin Story of G-Eazy's \"Me, Myself & I\": Interview |publisher=[[Fuse (TV channel)|Fuse]] |url=http://www.fuse.tv/videos/2016/01/bebe-rexha-g-eazy-interview |url-status=live |access-date=August 14, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160825190416/http://www.fuse.tv/videos/2016/01/bebe-rexha-g-eazy-interview |archive-date=August 25, 2016}}</ref> She met Nicki Minaj's manager, Gee Roberson, and asked if Minaj would contribute to a new song. In March 2016, Rexha released her single, called \"[[No Broken Hearts]]\" featuring Nicki Minaj.<ref name=\"EW\" /><ref name=\"MicRelease\">{{Cite news |last=Riotta |first=Chris |date=March 16, 2016 |title=Nicki Minaj and Bebe Rexha's New Song \"No Broken Hearts\" Is the Breakup Anthem You Needed |publisher=[[Mic (media company)|Mic]] |url=https://mic.com/articles/138150/nicki-minaj-and-bebe-rexha-s-new-song-no-broken-hearts-is-the-breakup-anthem-you-needed |url-status=live |access-date=August 13, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160630092217/https://mic.com/articles/138150/nicki-minaj-and-bebe-rexha-s-new-song-no-broken-hearts-is-the-breakup-anthem-you-needed |archive-date=June 30, 2016}}</ref> In April 2016, the music video was released, directed by Dave Meyer.<ref name=\"IdolBroken\">{{Cite news |last=Wass |first=Mike |date=April 14, 2016 |title=Bebe Rexha On \"No Broken Hearts,\" Songwriting & Her Debut LP: Interview |publisher=[[Idolator (website)|Idolator]] |url=http://www.idolator.com/7629936/bebe-rexha-interview-no-broken-hearts-debut-album |url-status=live |access-date=August 14, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200530220551/https://www.idolator.com/7629936/bebe-rexha-interview-no-broken-hearts-debut-album |archive-date=May 30, 2020}}</ref> The video has accumulated over 300 million views on YouTube.<ref>{{Cite web |date=April 7, 2016 |title=Bebe Rexha \u2013 \"No Broken Hearts\" ft. Nicki Minaj (Official Music Video) |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XoiEkEuCWog |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220520062628/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XoiEkEuCWog |archive-date=May 20, 2022 |access-date=June 23, 2019 |publisher=YouTube}}</ref>\n\nOn July 29, 2016, Rexha and Dutch DJ and record producer [[Martin Garrix]] released their single, \"[[In the Name of Love (Martin Garrix and Bebe Rexha song)|In the Name of Love]]\". It peaked at number 24 on the US ''Billboard'' Hot 100, at number four on US Hot [[Dance/Electronic Songs]] chart and entered the top 10 in several countries, including the United Kingdom, Canada, Australia, Italy, and New Zealand. The music video was released on August 23, 2016, on Martin Garrix's YouTube channel.<ref>{{Cite web |date=July 30, 2016 |title=Watch Martin Garrix Talk His Collaboration with Bebe Rexha at Lollapalooza |url=http://www.fuse.tv/videos/2016/07/martin-garrix-bebe-rexha-interview-lollapalooza-2016 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160808070621/http://www.fuse.tv/videos/2016/07/martin-garrix-bebe-rexha-interview-lollapalooza-2016 |archive-date=August 8, 2016 |access-date=August 11, 2016 |website=[[Fuse (TV channel)|Fuse]]}}</ref>\n[[File:Bebe Rexha live at Staples Center, Los Angeles 15 (cropped).jpg|thumb|right|Rexha performing in 2016|283x283px]]\n\n=== 2016\u20132017: ''All Your Fault'' series ===\n{{Main|All Your Fault: Pt. 1|All Your Fault: Pt. 2}}\nOn October 28, 2016, Rexha released \"[[I Got You (Bebe Rexha song)|I Got You]]\". That song along with \"[[No Broken Hearts]]\" were originally intended for the ''All Your Fault'' album.<ref>{{Cite tweet |number=780114715875782656 |user=BebeRexha |title=I have some dope news. So my album got pushed because of it. But you will be getting new music. I promise you this. October. |date=September 25, 2016}}</ref> ''I Got You'' peaked at number 43 on the US ''Billboard'' Hot 100<ref name=\"Billboard-hit100\">{{Cite news |date=January 21, 2017 |title=Billboard Hit 100 |url=http://www.billboard.com/charts/hot-100 |url-status=live |access-date=January 10, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140510174505/http://www.billboard.com/charts/hot-100 |archive-date=May 10, 2014}}</ref> and at number 17 on the US Pop Songs chart.<ref name=\"Billboard-pop\">{{Cite news |date=January 21, 2017 |title=Billboard Pop Songs |url=http://www.billboard.com/charts/pop-songs |url-status=live |access-date=January 10, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151206184511/http://www.billboard.com/charts/pop-songs |archive-date=December 6, 2015}}</ref> The music video was released on January 6, 2017, and reached over 50 million views in four weeks, and has accumulated over 365 million views on YouTube.<ref>{{Cite web |date=January 6, 2017 |title=Bebe Rexha \u2013 \"I Got You\" (Official Music Video) |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uEJuoEs1UxY |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180201042735/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uEJuoEs1UxY |archive-date=February 1, 2018 |access-date=June 23, 2019 |publisher=YouTube}}</ref> Direction changed from a full studio album to a multi EP project and \"No Broken Hearts\" was scrapped, making \"I Got You\" the first and only single from ''[[All Your Fault: Pt. 1]]'', released on February 17, 2017. The EP peaked at number 51 on the ''Billboard'' 200.<ref>{{Cite tweet |number=825320026857209856 |user=BebeRexha |title=My album is coming out in two parts. 1st part is moodier/rhythmic/urban |date=January 28, 2017}}</ref> In March 2017 in [[Dallas]], Rexha began her first solo headlining tour, promoting the EP across North America and Europe, named the [[All Your Fault Tour]], with a total of 29 dates.<ref>{{Cite web |date=January 24, 2017 |title=Bebe Rexha Announces First Headlining Tour |url=http://radio.com/2017/01/24/bebe-rexha-tour-dates/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170202062910/http://radio.com/2017/01/24/bebe-rexha-tour-dates/ |archive-date=February 2, 2017 |access-date=January 30, 2017 |website=Radio.com}}</ref>\n\nOn November 6, 2016, Rexha hosted the [[2016 MTV Europe Music Awards]], at Rotterdam, Netherlands and performed multiple songs throughout the night, such as her single, \"[[I Got You (Bebe Rexha song)|I Got You]]\".<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Atkinson |first=Katie |date=November 6, 2016 |title=Watch Bebe Rexha Perform 'I Got You' at 2016 MTV EMAs |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/7565760/mtv-ema-2016-bebe-rexha-i-got-you |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |access-date=November 14, 2016 |archive-date=November 10, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161110204504/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/7565760/mtv-ema-2016-bebe-rexha-i-got-you |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\nIn May 2017, ''Bebe Rexha: The Ride'', a documentary which explores the moments which changed Rexha's life and journey to stardom, aired on ''MTV''.<ref>{{Cite web |date=April 24, 2017 |title=Bebe Rexha's Journey To Stardom Explored In 'The Ride' Documentary |url=http://www.contactmusic.com/bebe-rexha/news/bebe-rexha-the-ride-documentary_5662927 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170429022928/http://www.contactmusic.com/bebe-rexha/news/bebe-rexha-the-ride-documentary_5662927 |archive-date=April 29, 2017 |access-date=May 7, 2017 |publisher=Contact Music}}</ref>\n\nOn July 21, 2017, [[One Direction]] member [[Louis Tomlinson]] released the single \"[[Back to You (Louis Tomlinson song)|Back to You]]\", with Rexha and [[Digital Farm Animals]] as featured artists. The song peaked at number 40 on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100.\n\n\"[[The Way I Are (Dance with Somebody)]]\" featuring [[Lil Wayne]] was released as the first single from ''[[All Your Fault: Pt. 2]]'' on May 19, 2017.<ref>{{Cite web |title=The Way I Are (Dance With Somebody) [feat. Lil Wayne] |url=https://play.google.com/music/preview/Bk6hnul3zn3e57tgxd7odqorxoa?t=The_Way_I_Are_Dance_With_Somebody_feat_Lil_Wayne_-_Bebe_Rexha |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210314101434/https://music.youtube.com/googleplaymusic |archive-date=March 14, 2021 |access-date=May 19, 2017 |website=[[Google Play]]}}</ref> On June 12, Rexha performed the song at the [[Ubisoft]] E3 press conference, before announcing ''[[Just Dance 2018]]'', on which the song appears.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Bebe Rexha at Ubisoft Conference 2017 |url=http://www.zimbio.com/photos/Bebe+Rexha/Ubisoft+E3+2017+Conference/OouM6AZ-a72 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171023071027/http://www.zimbio.com/photos/Bebe+Rexha/Ubisoft+E3+2017+Conference/OouM6AZ-a72 |archive-date=October 23, 2017 |access-date=October 23, 2017}}</ref> The second EP as part of the project was released on August 11, 2017. In support of the EP and American singer and songwriter [[Marc E. Bassy]]'s debut album, Rexha planned to go on a co-headlining tour across the United States: the Bebe & Bassy Tour, in October 2017. The tour was short-lived due to an infection putting Rexha on strict vocal rest, with Marc E. Bassy eventually going on a solo US tour in March 2018.<ref name=\"auto\">{{Cite tweet |number=922592223820222464 |user=BebeRexha |title=After another appointment with my doctor today, I am on strict vocal rest until Thursday night due to an infection. I'm so sorry Texas. |first=Bebe |last=Rexha |date=October 23, 2017 |access-date=December 13, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |title=Marc E. Bassy announces Spring 2018 tour in support of 'Gossip Columns' |work=AXS |url=https://www.axs.com/marc-e-bassy-announces-spring-2018-tour-in-support-of-gossip-columns-127857 |url-status=live |access-date=March 5, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180306082532/https://www.axs.com/marc-e-bassy-announces-spring-2018-tour-in-support-of-gossip-columns-127857 |archive-date=March 6, 2018}}</ref>\n\nOn October 24, 2017, \"[[Meant to Be (Bebe Rexha song)|Meant to Be]]\" with [[Florida Georgia Line]] was released as the second single from ''All Your Fault: Pt. 2'', with the music video premiering a day earlier.<ref name=\"CHR\">{{Cite web |title=Top 40/M Future Releases |url=https://www.allaccess.com/top40-mainstream/future-releases |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171017050352/https://www.allaccess.com/top40-mainstream/future-releases |archive-date=October 17, 2017 |publisher=All Access Media Group}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |date=October 23, 2017 |title=Bebe Rexha and Florida Georgia Line Drop Music Video For \"Meant to Be\" |work=CBS |url=http://us995.cbslocal.com/2017/10/23/bebe-rexha-and-florida-georgia-line-drop-music-video-for-meant-to-be/ |access-date=October 24, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171025022137/http://us995.cbslocal.com/2017/10/23/bebe-rexha-and-florida-georgia-line-drop-music-video-for-meant-to-be/ |archive-date=October 25, 2017}}</ref> The song peaked at number two on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100<ref>{{Cite magazine |title=Bebe Rexha Chart History |magazine=Billboard |url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/bebe-rexha/chart-history/hsi/ |url-status=live |access-date=February 19, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211118035847/https://www.billboard.com/artist/bebe-rexha/chart-history/hsi/ |archive-date=November 18, 2021}}</ref> and {{as of|2018|11|17|lc=y|df=US}}, has spent 50 weeks at number one on the US [[Hot Country Songs]] chart,<ref>{{Cite magazine |date=July 22, 2018 |title=Bebe Rexha & Florida Georgia Line's 'Meant to Be' Breaks New Record |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8466527/bebe-rexha-florida-georgia-line-meant-to-be-breaks-new-record |magazine=Billboard |access-date=July 24, 2018 |archive-date=July 24, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180724010906/https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8466527/bebe-rexha-florida-georgia-line-meant-to-be-breaks-new-record |url-status=live }}</ref> breaking the record for most weeks atop the chart previously held by \"[[Body Like a Back Road]]\" by [[Sam Hunt]].\n\n===2017\u20132019: ''Expectations''===\n{{Main|Expectations (Bebe Rexha album)}}\nIn September 2017, Rexha began teasing new songs for a third installment in the ''All Your Fault'' series, with her manager going on record about its release.<ref name=\"ayfpt3\">{{Cite magazine |last=Andy Gensler |date=September 12, 2017 |title=Bebe Rexha's Template For Artist Development In the Age of Streaming |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/7964606/bebe-rexha-template-artist-development-age-streaming |magazine=Billboard |access-date=April 14, 2018 |archive-date=September 13, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170913054017/https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/7964606/bebe-rexha-template-artist-development-age-streaming |url-status=live }}</ref> However, it appeared plans had changed, as Bebe revealed through a tweet in November 2017 that her next project would be called ''[[Expectations (Bebe Rexha album)|Expectations]]''.<ref name=\"exconf\">{{Cite tweet |number=928684814470803456 |user=BebeRexha |title=Current Updates: New project coming in New year #Expectations. New record with Machine Gun X Ambassadors called \"Home\" coming soon. |author=Bebe Rexha |date=November 9, 2017 |access-date=April 14, 2018}}</ref> Rexha revealed the cover art for this debut studio album on April 8, 2018, and the album was released on June 22, 2018.<ref name=\"itunes expectations\" /> Previous singles from ''All Your Fault'', \"I Got You\" and \"Meant to Be\" appear on ''Expectations'' as well.\n\nOn April 13, 2018, \"Ferrari\" and \"2 Souls on Fire\", the latter of which features [[Quavo]] of [[Migos]], were released as promotional singles along with the pre-order.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Apaza |first=Kevin |date=April 9, 2018 |title=Bebe Rexha Reveals Cover Art For \"Expectations\" Album, Pre-Order Launches This Week! |url=http://directlyrics.com/bebe-rexha-reveals-cover-art-for-expectations-album-preorder-launches-this-week-news.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180410135908/http://directlyrics.com/bebe-rexha-reveals-cover-art-for-expectations-album-preorder-launches-this-week-news.html |archive-date=April 10, 2018 |access-date=April 10, 2018 |publisher=DirectLyrics}}</ref> On June 15, 2018, \"[[I'm a Mess (Bebe Rexha song)|I'm a Mess]]\" was released as the first single from the album.<ref>{{Cite magazine |title=Pop Shop Podcast: Bebe Rexha Opens Up About Exceeding 'Expectations' With Her Debut Album, 'Meant to Be' Chart Record & More |magazine=Billboard |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/podcasts/8469153/pop-shop-podcast-bebe-rexha-expectations-interview |url-status=live |access-date=August 10, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180808113632/https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/podcasts/8469153/pop-shop-podcast-bebe-rexha-expectations-interview |archive-date=August 8, 2018}}</ref> On November 20, 2018, \"[[Say My Name (David Guetta, Bebe Rexha and J Balvin song)|Say My Name]]\" was released which featured David Guetta and J Balvin.<ref>{{Cite web |title=David Guetta, Bebe Rexha & J Balvin \u2013 Say My Name (Official Video) | date=November 20, 2018 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ft4jcPSLJfY |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200122051908/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ft4jcPSLJfY |archive-date=January 22, 2020 |access-date=January 14, 2020 |via=www.youtube.com}}</ref> In December 2018, Rexha was nominated for [[Grammy Award for Best New Artist|Best New Artist]] at the [[61st Annual Grammy Awards]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Dua Lipa Wins Best New Artist &#124; 2019 GRAMMYs Acceptance Speech | date=February 10, 2019 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F3jA5woMR6k |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200301100328/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F3jA5woMR6k |archive-date=March 1, 2020 |access-date=January 14, 2020 |via=www.youtube.com}}</ref>\n\nOn January 26, 2019, Rexha performed the songs \u201c[[Me, Myself & I (G-Eazy and Bebe Rexha song)|Me, Myself & I]]\u201d and \u201cMeant to Be\u201d on stage at the [[SAP Center]] in [[San Jose, California]] as part of the festivities for the [[2019 National Hockey League All-Star Game]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=January 26, 2019 |title=NHL All-Star Game 2019: Bebe Rexha is on top of her game in San Jose |url=https://www.mercurynews.com/2019/01/26/nhl-all-star-game-2019-bebe-rexha-entertains-fans-in-san-jose/ |access-date=October 14, 2023 |website=San Jose Mercury News |archive-date=February 3, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190203100410/https://www.mercurynews.com/2019/01/26/nhl-all-star-game-2019-bebe-rexha-entertains-fans-in-san-jose/ |url-status=live }}</ref>  On February 15, 2019, Rexha released her single \"[[Last Hurrah (song)|Last Hurrah]]\".<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Rowley |first=Glenn |date=February 15, 2019 |title=Bebe Rexha Unveils New Single 'Last Hurrah': Listen |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/8497182/bebe-rexha-new-single-last-hurrah |magazine=Billboard |access-date=June 1, 2019 |archive-date=February 8, 2019 announced that she would serve as the fifth coach for ''[[The Voice (American TV series)|The Voice]]''{{'}}s Comeback Stage for season 16.<ref>{{Cite web |title='The Voice' Adds Surprise New Coach |url=https://popculture.com/reality-tv/2019/02/27/the-voice-adds-bebe-rexha-coach-comeback-stage/ |url-status=live 14, 2020 |website=Reality TV}}</ref> Rexha tweeted in April 2019 that she has twelve songs ready for her second studio album, and that her new music is inspired by [[Britney Spears]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=April 11, 2019 |title=Bebe Rexha Teases Dance Album Inspired By Britney Spears |url=https://www.idolator.com/7746355/bebe-rexha-teases-dance-album-inspired-by-britney-spears?ios=1&safari=1 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210314101457/https://www.idolator.com/7746355/bebe-rexha-teases-dance-album-inspired-by-britney-spears?ios=1&safari=1 |archive-date=March 14, 2021 |access-date=July 4, 2019 |website=Idolator}}</ref> On May 1, 2019, it was announced that Rexha will be one of the opening acts of the [[Jonas Brothers]]' [[Happiness Begins Tour]].<ref>{{Cite magazine |date=May 15, 2019 |title=Jonas Brothers Reveal Bebe Rexha & Jordan McGraw Will Join All the New Happiness Begins Tour Dates |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/8511664/jonas-brothers-bebe-rexha-jordan-mcgraw-new-happiness-begins-tour-dates |magazine=Billboard |access-date=January 14, 2020 |archive-date=May 24, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190524122331/https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/8511664/jonas-brothers-bebe-rexha-jordan-mcgraw-new-happiness-begins-tour-dates |url-status=live }}</ref> On May 31, Rexha and [[the Chainsmokers]] released \"[[Call You Mine]]\".<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Bein |first=Kat |date=May 31, 2019 |title=Bebe Rexha Poisons The Chainsmokers In 'Call You Mine' Video: Watch |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/dance/8513257/the-chainsmokers-bebe-rexha-call-you-mine-video |magazine=Billboard |access-date=June 1, 2019 |archive-date=April 20, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210420174607/https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/dance/8513257/the-chainsmokers-bebe-rexha-call-you-mine-video |url-status=live }}</ref> The song is the Chainsmokers' third project using Rexha's voice, following their remixes of \"[[Take Me Home (Cash Cash song)|Take Me Home]]\" by production trio [[Cash Cash]], and her debut solo single, \"I Can't Stop Drinking About You\".<ref>{{Cite web |last=Tryon |first=Oliver |date=May 28, 2019 |title=The Chainsmokers And Bebe Rexha's New Song Is Named 'Call You Mine' & Its Out Friday |url=https://www.cultr.com/news/chainsmokers-bebe-rexha-new-song |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210226091637/https://www.cultr.com/news/chainsmokers-bebe-rexha-new-song/ |archive-date=February 26, 2021 |access-date=May 30, 2019 |website=Cultr}}</ref>\n\n===2019\u20132021: ''Better Mistakes''===\n[[File:Bebe Rexha 2020 Vogue Taiwan 01.png|left|thumb|232x232px|Rexha in 2020]]\nRexha gave further information on her second studio album in June 2019, confirming to ''Bang Showbiz'', \"I am heading off to the studio now and I am just creating, creating and creating.\" She further revealed a feminist theme to the new music, stating that \"everything I have been writing now is very empowering and in-your-face and I am really excited about it.\"<ref>{{Cite web |date=June 5, 2019 |title=Bebe Rexha teases 'very empowering' new album |url=https://www.list.co.uk/article/108921-bebe-rexha-teases-very-empowering-new-album/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190704152038/https://www.list.co.uk/article/108921-bebe-rexha-teases-very-empowering-new-album/ |archive-date=July 4, 2019 |access-date=July 4, 2019 |website=List.co.uk}}</ref> In July 2019, Rexha tweeted that she had a song called \"Mama\".<ref>{{Cite tweet |number=1154388293007450113 |user=beberexha |title=MAMA |date=July 25, 2019 |access-date=August 4, 2019}}</ref>\nIn January 2020, Rexha confirmed in an interview with [[Ryan Seacrest]] on the red carpet of the [[62nd Annual Grammy Awards]] that the album is inspired by her mental health journey, and that she \"[has] a tracklisting and it's really exciting. I'm about to pick my next single... either a slower one or an up-tempo one.\"<ref>{{Cite web |date=January 26, 2020 |title=Bebe Rexha says new album was inspired by her mental health journey: 'I talk about everything' |url=https://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/bebe-rexha-new-album-mental-health |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200302181442/https://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/bebe-rexha-new-album-mental-health |archive-date=March 2, 2020 |access-date=April 19, 2020 |website=[[Fox News]]}}</ref> On October 9, 2020, she released \"[[Baby, I'm Jealous]]\" featuring [[Doja Cat]].<ref name=\"jealous\">{{Cite tweet |number=1313134891454717952 |user=BebeRexha |title=#BabyImJealous ft @dojacat out Friday, pre-save now http://beberexha.lnk.to/babyimjealous |date=October 5, 2020 |access-date=October 5, 2020}}</ref>{{Better source needed|reason=The current source is insufficiently reliable ([[WP:NOTRS]]).|date=July 2024}} Rexha confirmed in an interview in October 2020 that the album would be a [[visual album]].<ref>{{Cite news |last=Nelson |first=Jeff |date=October 28, 2020 |title=Bebe Rexha Talks Overcoming Insecurities \u2014 and Teases New, Britney Spears-Inspired Music |work=[[People (magazine)|People]] |url=https://people.com/music/bebe-rexha-baby-im-jealous-overcoming-insecurities-new-album/ |url-status=live |access-date=October 30, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210501112240/https://people.com/music/bebe-rexha-baby-im-jealous-overcoming-insecurities-new-album/ |archive-date=May 1, 2021}}</ref>\n\nOn March 5, 2021, Rexha released her new single \"[[Sacrifice (Bebe Rexha song)|Sacrifice]]\", with the music video premiering later that day.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Bebe Rexha to premiere video for new song \"Sacrifice\" Thursday on YouTube's 'RELEASED' |url=http://abcnewsradioonline.com/music-news/2021/3/2/bebe-rexha-to-premiere-video-for-new-song-sacrifice-thursday.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211220184237/http://abcnewsradioonline.com/music-news/2021/3/2/bebe-rexha-to-premiere-video-for-new-song-sacrifice-thursday.html |archive-date=December 20, 2021 |access-date=April 14, 2021 |website=ABC News Radio}}</ref> In March 2021, she released an accessory line with [[Puma (brand)|Puma]] titled \"Bebe X Puma\", which is sold exclusively in [[Deichmann SE|Deichmann]] stores in Europe.{{citation needed|date=March 2021}} On April 14, 2021, she announced that her second album ''[[Better Mistakes]]'' was scheduled for release on May 7, 2021.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Alvarado, Karen |date=April 14, 2021 |title=Bebe Rexha Announces Her Sophomore Album ''Better Mistakes'' |work=Celeb Secrets |url=https://www.celebsecrets.com/bebe-rexha-announces-her-sophomore-album-better-mistakes/ |url-status=live |access-date=April 14, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211220184238/https://www.celebsecrets.com/bebe-rexha-announces-her-sophomore-album-better-mistakes/ |archive-date=December 20, 2021}}</ref>{{Better source needed|reason=The current source is insufficiently reliable ([[WP:NOTRS]]).|date=July 2024}} On May 7, she released her second studio album ''[[Better Mistakes]],'' along with a music video for \"[[Break My Heart Myself]]\". The album debuted at #140 on the US ''Billboard'' 200.<ref>{{Cite web |date=May 17, 2021 |title=Bebe Rexha Addresses 'Upsetting' Album Debut, Plus More Chart Feats and Defeats |url=https://variety.com/2021/music/news/charts-bebe-rexha-j-cole-moneybagg-yo-1234974986/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211220184238/https://variety.com/2021/music/news/charts-bebe-rexha-j-cole-moneybagg-yo-1234974986/ |archive-date=December 20, 2021 |access-date=July 21, 2021}}</ref>\n\nOn October 25, 2021, Rexha announced she would feature on \"Family\" by [[David Guetta]] featuring [[Ty Dolla Sign]] and [[A Boogie wit da Hoodie]]. On November 19, [[Masked Wolf]] released a remix of \"[[Sabotage (Bebe Rexha song)|Sabotage]]\" titled, \"It's You, Not Me\".{{Citation needed|date=July 2024}}\n\n=== 2022\u2013present: ''Bebe'' ===\nIn August 2022, a remix of [[Eiffel 65]]'s song \"[[Blue (Da Ba Dee)]]\", titled \"[[I'm Good (Blue)]]\", by David Guetta with vocals from Rexha was released after it went viral on [[TikTok]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=August 26, 2022 |title=TikTok Helps Bebe Rexha and David Guetta Bring Back a Throwaway Remix of Club Classic 'Blue' |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/bebe-rexha-and-david-guetta-drop-feel-good-blue-1234581770/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220826051912/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/bebe-rexha-and-david-guetta-drop-feel-good-blue-1234581770/ |archive-date=August 26, 2022 |access-date=August 26, 2022 |publisher=Rolling Stone}}</ref>\n\nOn February 17, 2023, Rexha released the music video for \"[[Heart Wants What It Wants]]\", the lead single from her third studio album, ''[[Bebe (album)|Bebe]]''. The album was released on April 28, 2023, and also includes second single, \"Call on Me\", released on March 31, 2023, as well as \"I'm Good (Blue)\". The album features appearances from [[Dolly Parton]] and [[Snoop Dogg]]. Rexha has described the album as being inspired by 1970s retro style.<ref>{{Cite news |date=February 5, 2023 |title=Bebe Rexha Channels Barbie in Hot Pink GRAMMYs Look and Details '70s-Inspired New Album (Exclusive) {{!}} Entertainment Tonight |work=www.etonline.com |url=https://www.etonline.com/bebe-rexha-channels-barbie-in-hot-pink-grammys-look-and-details-70s-inspired-new-album-exclusive |url-status=live |access-date=March 31, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230331122956/https://www.etonline.com/bebe-rexha-channels-barbie-in-hot-pink-grammys-look-and-details-70s-inspired-new-album-exclusive |archive-date=March 31, 2023}}</ref> The album's third single, \"Satellite\" featuring [[Snoop Dogg]], was released on April 20, 2023, accompanied by an animated music video uploaded on Rexha's [[YouTube]] channel. ''Bebe'' was released on April 28, 2023 through [[Warner Records]].\n\nAt a June 2023 concert, a [[New Jersey]] man assaulted Rexha by throwing a cell phone at her head from the audience; she had a black eye and required stitches for her injuries.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Ashford |first=Joy |date=June 19, 2023 |title=New Jersey man charged with assault after throwing phone at Bebe Rexha during show |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/celebrities/2023/06/19/bebe-rexha-assault-man-charged-throwsphone-at-star-onstage/70335320007/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230619202423/https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/celebrities/2023/06/19/bebe-rexha-assault-man-charged-throwsphone-at-star-onstage/70335320007/ |archive-date=June 19, 2023 |access-date=June 20, 2023 |website=USA Today}}</ref> The man was quickly identified and arrested for assault and battery. Under interrogation, the assailant admitted to the act, saying that he figured it would make for a funny prank. Pending a hearing set for July 31, 2023, Rexha got a [[restraining order]] against him.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Kaufman |first=Gil |date=June 20, 2023 |title=Bebe Rexha Phone Thrower Told Police He Tossed His Cell at Singer Because He Thought 'It Would Be Funny' |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/bebe-rexha-cell-phone-thrower-cell-explanation-funny-1235357636/ |url-status=live |magazine=Billboard |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230621234352/https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/bebe-rexha-cell-phone-thrower-cell-explanation-funny-1235357636/ |archive-date=June 21, 2023 |access-date=June 21, 2023}}</ref>\n\nOn June 1, 2024, at a concert in [[Green Bay, Wisconsin]], Rexha had multiple attendees removed by police for throwing items at her.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://people.com/bebe-rexha-crowd-members-removed-wisconsin-concert-throwing-items-8657645 | title=Bebe Rexha Has Crowd Members Removed from Wisconsin Concert by Police for Throwing Items at Her }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=https://pagesix.com/2024/06/03/entertainment/bebe-rexha-boots-fan-for-hurling-object-at-her-1-year-after-phone-throwing-incident-left-her-with-black-eye/ | title=Bebe Rexha boots fan for hurling object at her 1 year after phone-throwing incident left her with black eye | date=June 3, 2024 }}</ref>{{Better source needed|reason=The current source is insufficiently reliable ([[WP:NOTRS]]).|date=July 2024}}\n\n== Artistry ==\nDescribed as a \"pop chameleon\",<ref>{{cite magazine |last=Mier |first=Tom\u00e1s |magazine=Rolling Stone |title=We Got High With Bebe Rexha and Unpacked Her Surprisingly Bright New Album |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-features/bebe-rexha-new-album-dolly-parton-albania-weed-1234723321/ |access-date=December 13, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231124145528/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-features/bebe-rexha-new-album-dolly-parton-albania-weed-1234723321/ |archive-date=November 24, 2023 |date=April 26, 2023 |url-status=live}}</ref> Rexha is known for a variety of genres, primarily [[Pop music|pop]].<ref name=\"AllMusic\">{{Cite web |last=Nijjar |first=Aneet |title=Bebe Rexha Biography |url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/bebe-rexha-mn0002992951 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190324005612/https://www.allmusic.com/artist/bebe-rexha-mn0002992951 |archive-date=March 24, 2019 |access-date=August 25, 2019 |website=[[AllMusic]]}}</ref><ref name=\"RS\">{{Cite magazine |date=December 5, 2017 |title=On the Charts: Bebe Rexha, Florida Georgia Line |access-date=September 14, 2019 |website=[[MusicRow]]}}</ref> Her first songwriting credit was a [[K-pop]] song for [[Shinee]], the [[Lucifer (Shinee song)|title song]] from the album [[Lucifer (Shinee album)|''Lucifer'']],<ref>{{Cite web |title=Composer of SHINee's 'Lucifer', Bebe Rexha Revealed One Surprising Fact of Her Writing That Not Many Know |url=https://kstarlive.com/article/2019/02/24/composer-of-shinee-s-lucifer-bebe-rexha-revealed-one-surprising-fact-of-her-writing-that-not-many-know-186728 |archive-date=October 14, 2020 |access-date=January 14, 2020 |website=KStarLive}}</ref> and since then she has released music in the [[Hip hop music|hip hop]],<ref name=\"MusicRow\" /><ref name=\"BroadwayWorld\">{{Cite web |last=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=February 21, 2019 |title=Bebe Rexha Premieres Video For LAST HURRAH |access-date=October 14, 2019 |website=[[Broadway World]]}}</ref> [[alternative rock]],<ref name=\"MusicRow\" /> [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]],<ref name=\"BroadwayWorld\"/> [[Country music|country]],<ref name=\"MusicRow\" /><ref name=\"BroadwayWorld\"/> [[Rock music|rock]],<ref name=\"BroadwayWorld\"/> [[Dance music|dance]]<ref name=\"BroadwayWorld\"/> and [[electronic music]]<ref name=\"BroadwayWorld\"/> genres.\n\nShe was mainly influenced by [[Lauryn Hill]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=March 6, 2018 |title=Bebe's biggest musical influence is Queen of R&B Lauryn Hill. |url=http://www.capitalxtra.com/features/facts/bebe-rexha/musical-influences/ |url-status=live Extra}}</ref> Rexha was also influenced by other artists such as [[Bob Marley]], [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]], [[Christina Aguilera]], [[Blondie (band)|Blondie]], [[Pink (singer)|Pink]], [[Alanis Morissette]], [[Avril Lavigne]], [[Coldplay]],<ref>{{Cite web |date=April 4, 2019 |title=Bebe Rexha talks anxiety, acceptance and why she won't lie about her age |url=https://www.marieclaire.co.uk/entertainment/music/bebe-rexha-650238 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200229083537/https://www.marieclaire.co.uk/entertainment/music/bebe-rexha-650238 |archive-date=February 29, 2020 |access-date=February 29, 2020 |website=[[Marie Claire]]}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Bebe Rexha schedule, dates, events, and tickets \u2013 AXS |url=https://www.axs.com/artists/1084611/bebe-rexha-tickets |url-status=live [[Johnny Cash]], [[Dolly Parton]], [[The Chicks]], [[Shania Twain]], [[Taylor Swift]], and [[Carrie Underwood]].<ref>{{Cite tweet |number=1021465647115571200 |user=BebeRexha |title=I'm grateful for all the love and warmth from the country community. Johnny Cash, Dolly Parton, The Dixie Chicks, Shania Twain, Taylor Swift, Carrie Underwood and so many more. |first=Bebe |last=Rexha |date=July 23, 2018 |access-date=March 4, 2021}}</ref>{{Better source needed|reason=The current source is insufficiently reliable ([[WP:NOTRS]]).|date=July 2024}}\n\n== Personal life ==\nRexha is a vocal supporter of the LGBTQ+ community;<ref>{{Cite magazine |title=Bebe Rexha: Love Letter to the LGBTQ Community |magazine=Billboard |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/pride/7809687/bebe-rexha-gay-pride-month-love-letter |url-status=live |access-date=November 20, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181120055224/https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/pride/7809687/bebe-rexha-gay-pride-month-love-letter |archive-date=November 20, 2018}}</ref> she says her sexuality is \"[[Sexual fluidity|fluid]]\".<ref>{{Cite web |last=Nelson |first=Jeff |date=May 8, 2019 |title=Bebe Rexha on Dating in the Spotlight and Defining Her Sexuality: \"I Consider Myself Fluid\" |url=https://www.health.com/celebrities/bebe-rexha |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190509004105/https://www.health.com/celebrities/bebe-rexha |archive-date=May 9, 2019 |access-date=January 14, 2020 |website=[[Health (magazine)|Health]]}}</ref> In 2019, she revealed that she has [[bipolar disorder]],<ref>{{Cite news |date=April 15, 2019 |title=Bebe Rexha Reveals She's Bipolar: 'I'm Not Ashamed Anymore' |work=Entertainment Tonight |url=https://www.etonline.com/bebe-rexha-reveals-shes-bipolar-im-not-ashamed-anymore-123416 |url-status=live |access-date=April 15, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190415195520/https://www.etonline.com/bebe-rexha-reveals-shes-bipolar-im-not-ashamed-anymore-123416 |archive-date=April 15, 2019}}</ref> and in 2023 said she has [[polycystic ovary syndrome]].<ref name=\"Nast 2023 k349\">{{Cite web |date=May 26, 2023 |title=Bebe Rexha Talks PCOS Diagnosis and Body Image |url=https://www.glamour.com/story/bebe-rexha-talks-pcos-diagnosis-body-image-body-shaming |access-date=June 28, 2023 |website=Glamour |archive-date=June 28, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230628235330/https://www.glamour.com/story/bebe-rexha-talks-pcos-diagnosis-body-image-body-shaming |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\nRexha has opened up about being sexually harassed on various accounts in September 2019 during an interview with [[Cosmopolitan (magazine)|Cosmopolitan]], stating how she felt like she \"was going to get raped\" during one encounter with an unnamed producer in Los Angeles. \"He\u2019s really famous,\" Rexha told the publication, before adding that her former managers pressured her to work with him because she \u2018need[ed] a hit song.\u2019<ref>{{Cite web |title=Bebe Rexha Opens Up About Sexual Misconduct From Music Producers\n |date=September 3, 2019 |url=https://www.huffpost.com/entry/bebe-rexha-music-producers-cosmopolitan_n_5d6e8309e4b09bbc9ef530cc/amp |access-date=2024-08-03 }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Bebe Rexha says she felt like she was 'going to get raped' one night in recording studio\n|website=[[Independent.co.uk]] |date=September 3, 2019 |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/women/bebe-rexha-rape-sexual-assault-male-music-producer-a9088726.html |access-date=2024-08-03 }}</ref>\n\nRexha began dating cinematographer Keyan Safyari in 2020. The singer announced their break-up in July 2023.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Bebe Rexha Tells Fans She 'Just Went Through a Breakup' After Keyan Safyari's Body-Shaming Texts\n|url=https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/bebe-rexha-announces-keyan-safyari-split-after-body-shaming-texts/ |access-date=2024-08-06 |website=[[Us (magazine)|Us]] |date=August 2023 }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Bebe Rexha and Keyan Safyari Break Up After 3 Years After Alleged 'Weight Gain' Text\n|url=https://www.etonline.com/bebe-rexha-and-keyan-safyari-break-up-after-3-years-after-alleged-weight-gain-text-208983 |access-date=2024-08-06 }}</ref>\n\nIn July 2023, Rexha appeared on ''[[Celebrity Family Feud]]'' with her family; they competed against [[Nikki Glaser]] and Glaser's family.<ref>{{Cite web |date=July 16, 2023 |title=Nikki Glaser and Bebe Rexha Battle It Out on an All-New Celebrity Family Feud |url=https://www.feelingthevibe.com/news/nikki-glaser-and-bebe-rexha-battle-it-out-on-an-all-new-celebrity-family-feud/ |access-date=July 18, 2023 |publisher=Feeling the Vibe |archive-date=July 19, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230719062110/https://www.feelingthevibe.com/news/nikki-glaser-and-bebe-rexha-battle-it-out-on-an-all-new-celebrity-family-feud/ |url-status=live }}</ref>{{Better source needed|reason=The current source is insufficiently reliable ([[WP:NOTRS]]).|date=July 2024}}\n\nIn June 2024, Rexha, who was previously injured by a crowd member's thrown phone at a New York City show the previous year, had multiple people removed from her audience during a concert in Wisconsin for throwing items at her direction. \"If you want to hit me in the face, I had them press charges to the other guy. I would love to become richer,\" Rexha has stated about the incident. She later assured that she was making a \"joke\" and was \"not inviting that\" behavior.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Bebe Rexha Threatens Legal Action After Concertgoer Tries to Throw Object at Her: 'I'll Take You for Everything'\n|url=https://people.com/bebe-rexha-threatens-legal-action-concertgoer-tried-to-throw-object-8674594 |access-date=2024-08-03 |website=[[People (magazine)|People]] }}</ref>\n\nRexha claimed that she was [[hate crime|hate crimed]] in a social media post when she was due to board the Munich-based Lufthansa plane on August 17, 2024 until she spoke to a security agent in [[Albanian language|Albanian]], resulting in her getting banned from the flight.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Bebe Rexha says she was banned from flight for speaking Albanian and accuses airline of 'hate crime'\n|website=[[Independent.co.uk]] |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/news/bebe-rexha-airline-incident-video-b2598271.html |access-date=2024-08-19 }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Bebe Rexha Claims She Was Banned From Boarding Flight In 'Hate Crime'\n|url=https://www.huffpost.com/entry/bebe-rexha-banned-lufthansa-flight-hate-crime_n_66c211aae4b00547468b73ba |access-date=2024-08-20 |website=[[HuffPost]] |date=August 18, 2024 }}</ref>\n\n== Discography ==\n{{Main|Bebe Rexha discography|List of songs recorded by Bebe Rexha}}\n\n* ''[[Expectations (Bebe Rexha album)|Expectations]]'' (2018)\n* ''[[Better Mistakes]]'' (2021)\n* ''[[Bebe (album)|Bebe]]'' (2023)\n\n==Filmography==\n\n===Film===\n{| class=\"wikitable plainrowheaders\"\n|-\n!Year\n! This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"Demi_Lovato","to":"Demi Lovato"}],"pages":{"12520860":{"pageid":12520860,"ns":0,"title":"Demi Lovato","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{Short description|American singer (born 1992)}}\n{{pp-blp|reason=[[WP:AE|Arbitration enforcement]]: [[WP:ARBGS]]|small=yes}}\n{{pp-move}}\n<!-- Please note that Demi Lovato uses both she/her and they/them pronouns as of August 2, 2022; this article reflects that. -->\n{{Good article}}\n{{Use American English|date=March 2021}}\n{{Use mdy dates|date=August 2022}}\n{{Infobox person\n| name               = Demi Lovato\n| image              = Demi Lovato Interview Feb 2020.png\n| caption            = Lovato in 2020\n| birth_name         = Demetria Devonne Lovato\n| birth_date         = {{Birth date and age|1992|8|20}}\n| birth_place        = [[Albuquerque, New Mexico]], US\n| relatives          = {{ubl|[[Madison De La Garza]] (half-sister)|[[Francisco Perea]] (great-great-great-grandfather)}}\n| occupation         = {{hlist|Singer|songwriter|actress}}\n| works              = {{hlist|[[Demi Lovato discography|Discography]]|[[List of songs recorded by Demi Lovato|songs recorded]]|[[Demi Lovato videography|videography]]|[[List of Demi Lovato live performances|performances]]}}\n| years_active       = 2002\u2013present<ref name=\"nydailynews1\">{{cite news |last=Bitette |first=Nicole |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/gossip/demi-lovato-break-music-spotlight-article-1.2817487 |title=Demi Lovato is taking a break from music and the spotlight |newspaper=New York Daily News |date=October 4, 2016 |access-date=December 8, 2016 |archive-date=April 10, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190410141815/https://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/gossip/demi-lovato-break-music-spotlight-article-1.2817487 |url-status=live }}</ref>\n| awards             = [[List of awards and nominations received by Demi Lovato|Full list]]\n| module             = {{Infobox musical artist|embed=yes\n| genre        = <!--Do not add any additional genres without a source. Genres sourced below.-->{{hlist|[[Pop music|Pop]]<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.sputnikmusic.com/bands/Demi-Lovato/12763/ |title=Demi Lovato reviews, music, news |publisher=sputnikmusic |date=May 14, 2013 |access-date=June 29, 2019 |archive-date=March 5, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240305125506/https://www.sputnikmusic.com/bands/Demi-Lovato/12763/ |url-status=live }}</ref>|[[Rock music|rock]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.excite.com/events/concert-tickets/Demi-Lovato/Demi-Lovato-Anaheim-CA/index.php |title=Demi Lovato Anaheim Tickets |publisher=Excite.com |access-date=June 29, 2019 |archive-date=January 5, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210105133503/https://www.excite.com/events/concert-tickets/Demi-Lovato/Demi-Lovato-Anaheim-CA/index.php |url-status=dead }}</ref>}}\n| instrument  = {{hlist|Vocals|guitar|piano}}<!--- For instrument(s) that the artist is primarily known for using, per reliable sources. The instruments infobox parameter is not intended as a WP:COATRACK for every instrument the subject has ever used--->\n| label      = {{flatlist|\n* [[Island Records|Island]]\n* [[Safehouse Records|Safehouse]]\n* [[Hollywood Records|Hollywood]]\n}}\n| website            = {{URL|https://demilovato.com}}\n}}\n}}\n\n'''Demetria Devonne''' \"'''Demi'''\" ''' Lovato''' ({{IPAc-en|'|d|\u025b|m|i|_|l|\u0259|\u02c8|v|\u0251\u02d0|t|o\u028a}} {{respell|DEM|ee|_|l\u0259|VAH|toh}};<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ICAa3s8eVDA&t=5s|title=Demi Lovato Talks Favorite Dishes, Poot, and the Rock Version of \"Sorry Not Sorry\"|date=July 14, 2023 |time=0:05 |url-status=live |author=Harper's BAZAAR|via=YouTube|archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/ICAa3s8eVDA|archive-date=December 22, 2023}}{{cbignore}}</ref> born August 20, 1992) is an American singer, songwriter, and actress. After appearing on the children's television series ''[[Barney & Friends]]'' (2002\u20132004), she{{Efn|Lovato uses both [[She (pronoun)|she/her]] and [[Singular they|they/them]] pronouns. This article uses she/her pronouns for consistency.|name=pronouns|group=lower-alpha}} starred in the [[Disney Channel]] short series ''[[As the Bell Rings (American TV series)|As the Bell Rings]]'' (2007\u20132008). Lovato rose to prominence for playing Mitchie Torres in the musical television film ''[[Camp Rock]]'' (2008) and its sequel ''[[Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam]]'' (2010). The former film's [[Camp Rock (soundtrack)|soundtrack]] contained \"[[This Is Me (Demi Lovato song)|This Is Me]]\", her debut single and duet, which peaked at number nine on the US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]].\n\nAfter signing with [[Hollywood Records]], Lovato released her [[pop rock]] debut album, ''[[Don't Forget]]'' (2008), which debuted at number two on the US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]]. Its follow-up, ''[[Here We Go Again (Demi Lovato album)|Here We Go Again]]'' (2009), debuted at number one in the US, while its [[Here We Go Again (Demi Lovato song)|title track]] reached number 15 on the Hot 100. Her third studio album, ''[[Unbroken (Demi Lovato album)|Unbroken]]'' (2011), experimented with [[Pop music|pop]] and [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]], and spawned the US top-ten single \"[[Skyscraper (song)|Skyscraper]]\". She released her self-titled [[Demi (album)|fourth album]] in 2013, which debuted at number three on the ''Billboard'' 200, and contained the international top-ten song \"[[Heart Attack (Demi Lovato song)|Heart Attack]]\". Lovato's fifth and sixth albums, ''[[Confident (album)|Confident]]'' (2015) and ''[[Tell Me You Love Me (album)|Tell Me You Love Me]]'' (2017), infused [[Soul music|soul]] and mature themes. She earned a [[Grammy Award for Best Pop Vocal Album|Grammy Award]] nomination for ''Confident'', while \"[[Sorry Not Sorry (Demi Lovato song)|Sorry Not Sorry]]\", the lead single from ''Tell Me You Love Me'', became her highest-charting single in the US, reaching number six. After a hiatus, she released her seventh and eighth albums ''[[Dancing with the Devil... the Art of Starting Over]]'' (2021) and ''[[Holy Fvck]]'' (2022), which respectively reached numbers two and seven in the US; the latter marked a return to rock-influenced music.\n\nOn television, Lovato starred as the titular character on the sitcom ''[[Sonny with a Chance]]'' (2009\u20132011), served as a judge on the music competition series ''[[The X Factor (American TV series)|The X Factor USA]]'' for its [[The X Factor (American TV series) season 2|second]] and [[The X Factor (American TV series) season 3|third]] seasons (2012\u20132013), appeared as a recurring character on the musical comedy ''[[Glee (TV series)|Glee]]'' (2013\u20132014) and the sitcom ''[[Will & Grace]]'' (2020), and hosted her [[The Demi Lovato Show|self-titled talk show]] and the docuseries ''Unidentified with Demi Lovato'' (both 2021). She also starred in the television drama film ''[[Princess Protection Program]]'' (2009), the animated films ''[[Smurfs: The Lost Village]]'' (2017) and [[Charming (film)|''Charming'']] (2018), the musical comedy ''[[Eurovision Song Contest: The Story of Fire Saga]]'' (2020), and the documentary ''[[Child Star (film)|Child Star]]'' (2024); the last of which she also co-directed. \n\nLovato has sold over 24 million records in the United States and has also received numerous [[List of awards and nominations received by Demi Lovato|accolades]], including an [[MTV Video Music Award]], 14 [[Teen Choice Awards]], five [[People's Choice Awards]], two [[Latin American Music Awards]], and a ''[[Guinness World Records|Guinness World Record]]''; she was included on the [[Time 100|''Time'' 100]] annual list in 2017. She co-founded the former record label [[Safehouse Records]], under [[Universal Music Group]], with singer [[Nick Jonas]] in 2015. An activist for various social causes, Lovato's struggles with an eating disorder and [[substance abuse]] have received considerable media attention, in response to which she published the [[Self-help book|self-help]] memoir ''Staying Strong: 365 Days a Year'' (2013) and released the documentaries ''[[Demi Lovato: Stay Strong]]'' (2012), ''[[Demi Lovato: Simply Complicated]]'' (2017), and ''[[Demi Lovato: Dancing with the Devil]]'' (2021).\n\n==Early life and career beginnings==\nDemetria Devonne Lovato was born on August 20, 1992, in [[Albuquerque, New Mexico]],<!--SEE TALK BEFORE CHANGING TO DALLAS --><ref name=\"BioChannelBiography\">{{cite web|url=https://www.biography.com/musician/demi-lovato|title=Demi Lovato|date=June 14, 2021|publisher=Biography|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=April 15, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190415172913/https://www.biography.com/people/demi-lovato-481444|url-status=live}}</ref> to former [[Dallas Cowboys Cheerleaders|Dallas Cowboys cheerleader]] Dianna De La Garza (n\u00e9e Lee Smith)<ref name=MotherLine>{{cite web|title=Sue Emmons and Donald Smith|url=http://familytreemaker.genealogy.com/users/h/a/r/Sue-D-Hart-Ar/GENE3-0008.html|publisher=Family Tree Maker|access-date=February 17, 2014|archive-date=October 15, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141015103853/http://familytreemaker.genealogy.com/users/h/a/r/Sue-D-Hart-Ar/GENE3-0008.html|url-status=live}}</ref> and engineer and musician Patrick Martin Lovato.<ref name=PatrickDeathBillboard>{{cite magazine|last=Payne|first=Chris|title=Demi Lovato's Father Dies|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/demi-lovatos-father-passes-away-1568025/|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=March 4, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304081941/https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/demi-lovatos-father-passes-away-1568025/|url-status=live}}</ref> Lovato has an older full sister named Dallas,<ref name=\"DallasBirthday\">{{cite web|title=Happy 24th Birthday Dallas Lovato February 4, 2012 |url=http://www.disneydreaming.com/2012/02/04/happy-24th-birthday-dallas-lovato-february-4-2012/ |publisher=Disney Dreaming |access-date=February 4, 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120208061154/http://www.disneydreaming.com/2012/02/04/happy-24th-birthday-dallas-lovato-february-4-2012/ |archive-date=February 8, 2012 }}</ref> a younger maternal half-sister, actress [[Madison De La Garza]],<ref name=\"WP\">{{cite news|first=Laura|last=Yao|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2008/06/20/AR2008062003077_pf.html|title=Disney Demi-Goddess|newspaper=[[The Washington Post]]|date=June 21, 2008|access-date=March 11, 2013|archive-date=June 29, 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110629025242/http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2008/06/20/AR2008062003077_pf.html|url-status=live}}</ref> and an older paternal half-sister, Amber, whom Lovato first spoke to at age 20.<ref name=\"amber-lovato\">{{cite magazine|title=Demi Lovato Reveals Secret
