Half-Sister|url=https://people.com/celebrity/demi-lovato-has-a-30-year-old-half-sister/|magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]] |date=March 6, 2013|access-date=April 3, 2017|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170404013116/http://people.com/celebrity/demi-lovato-has-a-30-year-old-half-sister/|archive-date=April 4, 2017}}</ref>\n\nIn mid-1994, shortly after Lovato's second birthday, her parents divorced.<ref name=Chance>{{cite book|first=Jody|last=Jensen Shaffer|title=Demi Lovato: Taking Another Chance|year=2013|publisher=Lerner Publications|location=Minneapolis, Minnesota|isbn=978-1467715515|page=7}}</ref> Her father was of [[Hispanos of New Mexico|Nuevomexicano]] descent, with mostly Spanish and [[Indigenous peoples of the Americas|Native American]] ancestors, and came from a family that had been living in New Mexico for generations; he also had distant Portuguese and [[Jews|Jewish]] ancestry.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5xMrNnZ21Ck |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211221/5xMrNnZ21Ck |archive-date=December 21, 2021 |url-status=live|title=Demi Lovato finds out she's Jewish!?|last=KISS FM UK|date=September 22, 2015|access-date=March 10, 2017|via=YouTube}}{{cbignore}}</ref><ref name=\"Hispanic Hollywood\">{{cite news|title=The Young Hispanic Hollywood Class of 2013|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/lists/young-hispanic-hollywood-class-2013-658782/|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|access-date=March 4, 2022|date=November 22, 2013|quote=In honor of her Mexican-American father,|archive-date=March 14, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140314151249/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/lists/demi-lovato-658894|url-status=dead}}</ref> He was a descendant of [[American Civil War|Civil War]] [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] veteran [[Francisco Perea]] and [[Santa Fe de Nuevo M\u00e9xico]] governor [[Francisco Xavier Ch\u00e1vez]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.somosprimos.com/sp2010/spjun10/spjun10.htm|title=Somos Primos|publisher=Diario El Carabobe\u00f1o|access-date=October 5, 2013|archive-date=September 15, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180915193007/http://www.somosprimos.com/sp2010/spjun10/spjun10.htm|url-status=live}}</ref> Lovato had no interest in forging a relationship with Patrick after her parents divorced.<ref>{{cite web|last=Hoyle|first=Antonia|date=April 22, 2012|title=The fame, the drugs, the self-harm|url=http://fabulousmag.co.uk/2012/04/22/the-fame-the-drugs-the-self-harm/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121101094046/http://fabulousmag.co.uk/2012/04/22/the-fame-the-drugs-the-self-harm/|archive-date=November 1, 2012|access-date=March 16, 2013|website=Fabulous}}</ref> Her mother is of Irish descent.<ref>{{cite web|first=Nicola|last=Murphy|url=https://www.irishcentral.com/culture/entertainment/how-irish-ancestry-links-demi-lovato-megan-fox-and-olivia-wilde-photos-213964591-237761091|title=How Irish ancestry links Demi Lovato, Megan Fox and Olivia Wilde|website=Irish Central|date=March 15, 2014|access-date=August 26, 2015|archive-date=April 15, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190415173414/https://www.irishcentral.com/culture/entertainment/how-irish-ancestry-links-demi-lovato-megan-fox-and-olivia-wilde-photos-213964591-237761091|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite tweet|user=ddlovato|number=267890338557992960|title= actually - I found out that I am Irish, Hispanic, Native American, Portuguese and Jewish!!!|first=Demi|last=Lovato|access-date=March 4, 2022}}</ref>\n\nShe has been vocal about her strained relationship with her father, calling him abusive and once stated, \"He was mean, but he wanted to be a good person. And he wanted to have his family, and when my mom married my stepdad, he still had this huge heart where he said, 'I'm so glad that [he's] taking care of you and doing the job that I wish I could do.'\"<ref>{{cite web|last=Bueno|first=Antoinette|date=October 20, 2015|title=Demi Lovato Opens Up About Her 'Abusive' Father: 'I Was Very Conflicted When He Passed'|url=http://www.etonline.com/news/174362_demi_lovato_opens_up_about_her_abusive_father_patrick_lovato/|access-date=February 27, 2017|work=[[Entertainment Tonight]]|archive-date=March 17, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230317123647/https://www.etonline.com/news/174362_demi_lovato_opens_up_about_her_abusive_father_patrick_lovato|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|date=October 22, 2015|title=Demi Lovato talks about her relationship with her father|url=https://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/demi-lovato-talks-about-her-relationship-with-her-father|access-date=March 4, 2022|publisher=[[Fox News]]|archive-date=March 4, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304081934/https://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/demi-lovato-talks-about-her-relationship-with-her-father|url-status=live}}</ref> After Patrick died of cancer on June 22, 2013,<ref name=\"Cover\">{{cite news|date=June 27, 2013|title=Demi Lovato speaks on dad's death|publisher=[[CNN]]|url=http://www.cnn.com/2013/06/27/showbiz/celebrity-news-gossip/demi-lovato-father-mental-illness|access-date=June 28, 2013|archive-date=March 12, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210312035327/https://www.cnn.com/2013/06/27/showbiz/celebrity-news-gossip/demi-lovato-father-mental-illness|url-status=live}}</ref> Lovato said that he had been mentally ill, and she created the Lovato Treatment Scholarship Program in his honor.<ref name=\"Lovece\">{{cite news|last=Lovece|first=Frank|date=June 27, 2013|title=Demi Lovato discusses father's death on 'Good Morning America'|work=Newsday|url=http://www.newsday.com/entertainment/celebrities/demi-lovato-discusses-father-s-death-on-good-morning-america-1.5583327|access-date=June 28, 2013|archive-date=March 12, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210312035332/https://www.newsday.com/entertainment/celebrities/demi-lovato-discusses-father-s-death-on-good-morning-america-1.5583327|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nLovato was brought up in [[Dallas]], Texas.<ref name=\"Biography Today\">{{cite book|title=Biography Today|year=2009|page=[https://archive.org/details/biographytodaypr0000unse/page/103 103]|publisher=Omnigraphics|location=Detroit, Michigan|isbn=978-0-7808-1052-5|url-access=registration|url=https://archive.org/details/biographytodaypr0000unse/page/103}}</ref><ref name=\"ref091\">{{cite news|first=Jon|last=Caramanica|title=Tween Princess, Tweaked|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|date=July 15, 2009|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/07/19/arts/music/19cara.html|access-date=November 4, 2009|archive-date=July 21, 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090721030658/https://www.nytimes.com/2009/07/19/arts/music/19cara.html|url-status=live}}</ref> She began playing the piano at age seven and guitar at 10,<ref>\"Biography Today\", p.105.</ref> when she began dancing and acting classes.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/videos/this-is-how-i-made-it-ep-6-demi-lovato-and-bob/1698279/playlist.jhtml|title=Demi Lovato and B.o.B.|website=[[MTV]]|date=December 18, 2012|agency=[[MTV]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141115114500/http://www.mtv.com/videos/this-is-how-i-made-it-ep-6-demi-lovato-and-bob/1698279/playlist.jhtml|archive-date=November 15, 2014|url-status=dead|access-date=March 7, 2013}}</ref> In 2002, Lovato began her acting career on the children's television series ''[[Barney & Friends]]'', portraying the role of Angela.<ref name=\"Barney\">{{cite web|last=Bryson|first=Carey|title=Demi Lovato The Disney Star Machine Does It Again|url=http://kidstvmovies.about.com/od/camprock/a/demilovato.htm|access-date=March 11, 2013|agency=[[Dotdash]]|archive-date=May 26, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160526215857/http://kidstvmovies.about.com/od/camprock/a/demilovato.htm|url-status=dead}}</ref> She appeared on ''[[Prison Break]]'' in 2006 and on ''[[Just Jordan]]'' the following year.<ref name=\"BioChannelBiography\" /> Due to her acting career, Lovato was bullied and consequently requested [[homeschooling]],<ref>{{cite news|last=Culbertson|first=Caroline|date=November 2, 2010|title=Demi Lovato in rehab: Dad blames Hollywood, acting for her issues|newspaper=[[New York Daily News]]|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/gossip/demi-lovato-rehab-dad-blames-hollywood-acting-issues-article-1.451886|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=April 15, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190415172920/https://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/gossip/demi-lovato-rehab-dad-blames-hollywood-acting-issues-article-1.451886|url-status=live}}</ref> through which she eventually received her high-school diploma.<ref>{{cite web|date=April 23, 2009|title=Demi Lovato Graduates High School|url=http://www.disneydreaming.com/2009/04/23/demi-lovato-graduates-high-school/|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100407010117/http://www.disneydreaming.com/2009/04/23/demi-lovato-graduates-high-school/|archive-date=April 7, 2010|access-date=July 27, 2011|website=Disney Dreaming}}</ref>\n\n==Career==\n===2007\u20132008: Breakthrough with ''Camp Rock'' and ''Don't Forget''===\n[[File:Demi Lovato Crop.jpg|left|thumb|upright|Lovato in [[London]] in September 2008]]\nFrom 2007 to 2008, Lovato played Charlotte Adams on the [[Disney Channel]] short series ''[[As the Bell Rings (U.S. TV series)|As the Bell Rings]]''.<ref name=AboutDemi>{{cite web|title=About Demi Lovato|url=http://demilovatotour.com/html/about_demi_lovato.html|publisher=demilovatotour.com|access-date=September 13, 2013|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131104011501/http://demilovatotour.com/html/about_demi_lovato.html |archive-date=November 4, 2013}}</ref> Lovato auditioned for the channel's television film ''[[Camp Rock]]'' and series ''[[Sonny with a Chance]]'' during 2007 and got both roles.<ref name=\"Victoria\">{{cite news|url=http://www.victoriaadvocate.com/news/2009/jun/22/bc-mus-demilovatoaa-_-entertainment/?entertainment&national-entertainment|title=Disney singing sensation Demi Lovato ready for new album, first tour as headliner|first=John J.|last=Moser|work=[[The Victoria Advocate]]|publisher=Victoria Advocate Publishing Co.|date=June 22, 2009|access-date=March 11, 2013|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130818042131/http://www.victoriaadvocate.com/news/2009/jun/22/bc-mus-demilovatoaa-_-entertainment/?entertainment&national-entertainment|archive-date=August 18, 2013}}</ref> Lovato played the lead character, aspiring singer Mitchie Torres, in ''Camp Rock''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://kidstvmovies.about.com/od/camprock/fr/camprockr.htm|title=Camp Rock (2008) \u2013 Movie Review for Parents|first=Carey|last=Bryson|website=[[About.com]]|publisher=[[IAC (company)|IAC]]|location=New York City|access-date=March 11, 2013|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130421105530/http://kidstvmovies.about.com/od/camprock/fr/camprockr.htm|archive-date=April 21, 2013}}</ref> The film premiered on June 20, 2008, to 8.9&nbsp;million viewers.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/showtracker/2008/06/high-ratings-fo.html|title=High ratings for 'Camp Rock,' the Disney Channel's Jonas Brothers movie|newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=June 21, 2008|access-date=March 11, 2013|archive-date=May 21, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220521194702/https://latimesblogs.latimes.com/showtracker/2008/06/high-ratings-fo.html|url-status=live}}</ref> [[Gillian Flynn]] of ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' wrote that Lovato's acting skills were underwhelming and that she has \"the knee-jerk smile of someone who is often told she has a great smile\".<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://ew.com/article/2008/06/13/camp-rock/|title=Camp Rock (2008)|first=Gillian|last=Flynn|author-link=Gillian Flynn|date=June 20, 2008|magazine=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=November 26, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221126183705/https://ew.com/article/2008/06/13/camp-rock/|url-status=live}}</ref> [[Camp Rock (soundtrack)|The film's soundtrack]] was released three days earlier; however, the music was considered less current than that of ''[[High School Musical]]''.<ref name=\"Hinkley\">{{cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv-movies/camp-rock-rock-steady-disney-hit-article-1.293920|title='Camp Rock' is a rock-steady Disney hit|first=David|last=Hinkley|work=[[New York Daily News]]|date=June 18, 2008|access-date=June 1, 2013|archive-date=December 1, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221201150213/https://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv-movies/camp-rock-rock-steady-disney-hit-article-1.293920|url-status=live}}</ref> It debuted at number three on the US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]], with 188,000 units sold in its first week of release.<ref>{{cite magazine|first=Katey|last=Hasty|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/coldplay-cruises-to-no-1-on-the-billboard-200-1044979/|title=Coldplay Cruises To No. 1 On The Billboard 200|magazine=Billboard|date=June 25, 2008|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=March 4, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304081940/https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/coldplay-cruises-to-no-1-on-the-billboard-200-1044979/|url-status=live}}</ref> Lovato sang four songs on the soundtrack, including \"[[We Rock (Camp Rock song)|We Rock]]\" and \"[[This Is Me (Demi Lovato song)|This Is Me]]\".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0017LFKMO|title=Camp Rock: Original Television Soundtrack: Music|website=Amazon|access-date=March 11, 2013|archive-date=January 10, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160110215437/http://www.amazon.com/dp/B0017LFKMO|url-status=live}}</ref> The latter, Lovato's debut single, debuted at number 11 on the US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] and later peaked at number nine, marking her first entry on the chart.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/hot-100|title=Top 100 Songs {{!}} Billboard Hot 100 Chart|magazine=Billboard|access-date=May 11, 2019|archive-date=October 27, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211027024922/https://www.billboard.com/charts/hot-100|url-status=live}}</ref> That summer, Lovato signed with [[Hollywood Records]] and began her Demi Live! Warm Up Tour before the release of her debut studio album,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ovguide.com/demi-live!-warm-up-tour-9202a8c04000641f800000000879c65e|title=Demi Live! Warm Up Tour Video|publisher=OVGuide|access-date=March 11, 2013|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131022024108/http://www.ovguide.com/demi-live!-warm-up-tour-9202a8c04000641f800000000879c65e|archive-date=October 22, 2013}}</ref> and appeared on the [[Jonas Brothers]]' [[Burnin' Up Tour]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zvents.com/essex_junction_vt/events/show/83554500-jonas-brothers-the-burning-up-tour-with-special-guest-demi-lovato |title=Jonas Brothers: The Burning Up Tour with special guest Demi Lovato |publisher=Zvents |access-date=March 11, 2013 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131103200933/http://www.zvents.com/essex_junction_vt/events/show/83554500-jonas-brothers-the-burning-up-tour-with-special-guest-demi-lovato |archive-date=November 3, 2013 }}</ref>\n\nLovato's debut studio album, ''[[Don't Forget]]'', released on September 23, 2008, was met with generally positive reviews from critics.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.absolutepunk.net/showthread.php?t=1279002|title=Demi Lovato \u2013 Don't Forget|work=AbsolutePunk.net|access-date=August 26, 2015|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://archive.today/20120716221811/http://www.absolutepunk.net/showthread.php?t=1279002|archive-date=July 16, 2012}}</ref><ref name=\"DigitalSpy\">{{cite news|url=https://www.digitalspy.com/music/album-reviews/a154015/demi-lovato-dont-forget/|title=Demi Lovato: 'Don't Forget'|date=April 20, 2009|last=Levine|first=Nick|work=[[Digital Spy]]|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=August 3, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210803150405/https://www.digitalspy.com/music/album-reviews/a154015/demi-lovato-dont-forget/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=\"Allmusic\">{{cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/album/here-we-go-again-r2278939/review|title=Here We Go Again \u2013 Demi Lovato|work=[[AllMusic]]|publisher=[[Rovi Corporation]]|location=San Carlos, California|last=Erlewine|first=Stephen Thomas|access-date=October 9, 2011|archive-date=March 5, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240305125612/https://www.allmusic.com/album/here-we-go-again-mw0000822778/trackListingAjax|url-status=live}}</ref> Michael Slezak of ''Entertainment Weekly'' said, \"Demi Lovato might satisfy her 'tween fans but she won't be winning any rockers over with ''Don't Forget''\".<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://ew.com/article/2008/09/17/dont-forget/|title=Don't Forget|first=Michael|last=Slezak|magazine=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|date=September 17, 2008|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=March 5, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220305234901/https://ew.com/article/2008/09/17/dont-forget/|url-status=live}}</ref> The album debuted at number two in the US, with first-week sales of 89,000 copies.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/on-the-charts-demi-lovato-kings-of-leon-debut-high-metallica-rule-102719/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081004053422/http://www.rollingstone.com/rockdaily/index.php/2008/10/01/on-the-charts-demi-lovato-kings-of-leon-debut-high-metallica-rule/|title=On the Charts: Demi Lovato & Kings of Leon Debut High, Metallica Rule|first=Daniel|last=Kreps|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=October 1, 2008|archive-date=October 4, 2008|access-date=March 4, 2022}}</ref> Ten of its songs were co-written with the Jonas Brothers.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/music-jonas-dc-idUSN1541696620080615|title=Jonas Brothers thrilling tweens|first=Amy|last=Donahue|work=[[Reuters]]|publisher=[[Thomson Reuters]]|location=London, England|date=June 25, 2008|access-date=July 7, 2011|archive-date=December 21, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151221234223/http://www.reuters.com/article/music-jonas-dc-idUSN1541696620080615|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n''Don't Forget'' was certified gold by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA) for US sales of over 500,000 copies.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.riaa.com/gold-platinum/?tab_active=default-award&ar=Demi+Lovato&ti=don%27t+forget&lab=&genre=&format=&date_option=release&from=&to=&award=&type=&category=&adv=SEARCH#search_section|title=Don't Forget|publisher=[[Recording Industry Association of America]]|access-date=March 18, 2017|archive-date=May 27, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230527203902/https://www.riaa.com/gold-platinum/?tab_active=default-award&ar=Demi+Lovato&ti=don%27t+forget&lab=&genre=&format=&date_option=release&from=&to=&award=&type=&category=&adv=SEARCH#search_section|url-status=live}}</ref> Its lead single, \"[[Get Back (Demi Lovato song)|Get Back]]\", was praised for its [[pop rock]] style and peaked at number 43 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' Hot 100, also selling over 560,000 copies in the United States.<ref name=\"billboard.com\">{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/ask-billboard-songs-two-good-not-to-be-no-1-474115/|title=Ask Billboard: Songs Two Good Not To Be No. 1|magazine=Billboard|access-date=March 4, 2022|date=November 17, 2012|archive-date=March 4, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304081935/https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/ask-billboard-songs-two-good-not-to-be-no-1-474115/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://archive.boston.com/ae/music/cd_reviews/articles/2008/09/23/at_sweet_16_lovatos_ready_for_her_close_up/ |title=At sweet 16, Lovato's ready for her close-up |newspaper=[[The Boston Globe]] |publisher=Boston Globe Media Partners, L.P. |location=Boston, Massachusetts |date=September 23, 2008 |access-date=March 4, 2022 |archive-date=March 4, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304081937/http://archive.boston.com/ae/music/cd_reviews/articles/2008/09/23/at_sweet_16_lovatos_ready_for_her_close_up/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name=\"BillboardChartHistory\">{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/demi-lovato/chart-history/|title=Demi Lovato \u2013 Chart History|magazine=Billboard|access-date=March 11, 2013|archive-date=November 21, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211121094938/https://www.billboard.com/artist/demi-lovato/chart-history/|url-status=live}}</ref> The album's second single, \"[[La La Land (Demi Lovato song)|La La Land]]\", was cited for its strong rock elements<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/blogs/legacy/chartblog/2009/05/demi_lovato_la_la_land.shtml|title=Demi Lovato \u2013 'La La Land'|first=Fraser|last=McAlpine|publisher=[[BBC Music]]. [[BBC]]|date=May 31, 2009|access-date=June 1, 2013|archive-date=July 2, 2014|archive-url=https://archive.today/20140702050632/http://www.bbc.co.uk/blogs/legacy/chartblog/2009/05/demi_lovato_la_la_land.shtml|url-status=live}}</ref> and peaked at number 52 in the US,<ref name=\"BillboardChartHistory\"/> and cracked the top 40 in Ireland and the United Kingdom.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chart-track.co.uk/index.jsp?c=p%2Fmusicvideo%2Fmusic%2Farchive%2Findex_test.jsp&ct=240001&arch=t&lyr=2009&year=2009&week=18|title=Chart Track|publisher=[[Irish Singles Chart]]|access-date=July 26, 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120516115853/http://www.chart-track.co.uk/index.jsp?c=p%2Fmusicvideo%2Fmusic%2Farchive%2Findex_test.jsp&ct=240001&arch=t&lyr=2009&year=2009&week=18|archive-date=May 16, 2012|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.officialcharts.com/search/singles/La%20La%20Land|title=Demi Lovato \u2013 La La Land|publisher=[[Official Charts Company]]|access-date=July 26, 2011|archive-date=June 11, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150611072907/http://www.officialcharts.com/search/singles/la%20la%20land/|url-status=live}}</ref> The music video for the song was directed by [[The Malloys|Brendan Malloy]] and Tim Wheeler.<ref name=\"Video\">{{cite AV media| people= Demi Lovato, Brendan Malloy, Tim Wheeler| title = Making the Video: La La Land| medium = DVD| publisher =Don't Forget (Deluxe Edition)}}</ref>{{full citation needed|date=March 2019}} The third single<ref name=\"Don'tForget\">Sources concerning the single release of \"Don't Forget\":\n*{{cite magazine |title=''Billboard'' |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=QdKeU1ZYfwsC |magazine=Billboard |access-date=April 11, 2021 |date=April 25, 2009 |archive-date=March 5, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240305125512/https://books.google.com/books?id=QdKeU1ZYfwsC |url-status=live }}\n*{{cite book |last=Burlingame |first=Jeff |title=Demi!: Latina Star Demi Lovato (Sizzling Celebrities) |date=September 1, 2013 |publisher=[[Enslow Publishing]] |page=25 |quote=''Don't Forget''{{'}}s songs included popular singles 'Get Back,' and 'Don't Forget'.}}</ref> and title track, \"[[Don't Forget (Demi Lovato song)|Don't Forget]]\", peaked at number 41 in the US.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/demi-lovato|title=Demi Lovato Chart History|magazine=Billboard|access-date=June 1, 2019|archive-date=November 9, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211109103938/https://www.billboard.com/music/Demi-Lovato|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n===2009\u20132010: ''Sonny with a Chance'' and ''Here We Go Again''===\nLovato's Disney Channel sitcom ''[[Sonny with a Chance]]'', in which she played Sonny Munroe, the newest cast member of the [[show-within-a-show]] ''So Random!'', premiered on February 8.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/tv-season/sonny-with-a-chance-season-1/id303224140|title=Sonny With a Chance, Season 1|date=February 7, 2009|publisher=iTunes Store (US). Apple Inc|access-date=March 11, 2013|archive-date=July 12, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180712124154/https://itunes.apple.com/us/tv-season/sonny-with-a-chance-season-1/id303224140|url-status=live}}</ref> Robert Lloyd of the ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' described Lovato's acting ability as \"very good\", comparing her favorably to ''[[Hannah Montana]]'' star [[Miley Cyrus]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.latimes.com/archives/la-xpm-2009-feb-06-et-sonny6-story.html |title='Sonny' tests the tween climate |first=Robert |last=Lloyd |newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]] |date=February 6, 2009 |access-date=March 4, 2022 |archive-date=November 29, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201129075407/https://www.latimes.com/archives/la-xpm-2009-feb-06-et-sonny6-story.html |url-status=live }}</ref> That June, Lovato starred as Rosie Gonzalez / Princess Rosalinda in the Disney Channel film ''[[Princess Protection Program]]'', alongside [[Selena Gomez]]. The film, the fourth highest-rated Disney Channel original movie, premiered to 8.5&nbsp;million viewers.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://blogs.mcall.com/tvwatchers/2009/07/jon-kate-divorce-episode-bet-jackson-tribute-draw-record-audiences.html |title=Jon & Kate divorce episode/ BET Jackson tribute draw record audiences |first=Kathy |last=Lauer-Williams |newspaper=[[The Morning Call]] |publisher=[[Tribune Company]] |location=[[Allentown, Pennsylvania]] |date=July 1, 2009 |access-date=March 4, 2022 |archive-date=August 3, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210803150406/https://blogs.mcall.com/tvwatchers/2009/07/jon-kate-divorce-episode-bet-jackson-tribute-draw-record-audiences.html |url-status=live }}</ref> For the film's soundtrack, the pair recorded the song \"One and the Same\", which was later released as a promotional single.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://yaay.today/music/Selena-Gomez-and-Demi-Lovatos-18-year-long-friendship-20200916-0009.html |title=Selena Gomez and Demi Lovato's 18 year-long friendship |publisher=Yaay |date=September 16, 2020 |access-date=October 22, 2020 |archive-date=December 28, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211228173004/https://yaay.today/music/Selena-Gomez-and-Demi-Lovatos-18-year-long-friendship-20200916-0009.html |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\n[[File:DemiLovatoSep10 4.jpg|thumb|upright|Lovato performing on the [[List of Jonas Brothers concert tours#Live in Concert|Jonas Brothers: Live in Concert]] tour in September 2010]]\nLovato's second studio album, ''[[Here We Go Again (Demi Lovato album)|Here We Go Again]]'', was released on July 21, 2009;<ref name=\"BioChannelBiography\"/> she described its acoustic style as similar to that of [[John Mayer]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sugarslam.com/demi-lovato-on-second-album/|title=Demi Lovato on second album|author=Chelsea|date=January 28, 2009|publisher=Sugar Slam|access-date=June 13, 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090604140130/http://www.sugarslam.com/demi-lovato-on-second-album/|archive-date=June 4, 2009|url-status=dead}}</ref> The album received favorable reviews from critics who appreciated its enjoyable pop-rock elements, echoing reviews of ''Don't Forget''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/music/here-we-go-again/demi-lovato|title=Here We Go Again (2009): Reviews|website=[[Metacritic]]|publisher=[[CBS Interactive]]|location=Chicago, Illinois|access-date=July 27, 2011|archive-date=October 23, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121023065458/http://www.metacritic.com/music/here-we-go-again/demi-lovato|url-status=live}}</ref> Lovato's first number-one album, it debuted atop the ''Billboard'' 200 with first-week sales of 108,000 copies, and was later certified Gold.<ref name=\"Here We Go Again billboard 200\">{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-debuts-at-no-1-on-billboard-200-but-michael-jackson-still-reigns-267911/|title=Demi Lovato Debuts At No. 1 On Billboard 200, But Michael Jackson Still Reigns|first=Keith|last=Caulfield|magazine=Billboard|date=July 29, 2009|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=March 4, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304081939/https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-debuts-at-no-1-on-billboard-200-but-michael-jackson-still-reigns-267911/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=\"Gold & Platinum\">{{cite web |url=https://www.riaa.com/gold-platinum/?tab_active=default-award&se=demi+lovato#search_section |title=Gold & Platinum: Demi Lovato |publisher=[[Recording Industry Association of America]] |access-date=January 19, 2023 |archive-date=May 29, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160529160226/http://www.riaa.com/gold-platinum/?tab_active=default-award&se=Demi+Lovato#search_section |url-status=live }}</ref> The album's lead single and title track, \"[[Here We Go Again (Demi Lovato song)|Here We Go Again]]\", debuted at number 59 on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100, and managed to peak at number 15, becoming Lovato's highest-charting solo single to that point.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/demi-lovato/chart-history/|title=Demi Lovato Album & Song Chart History \u2013 Hot 100|magazine=Billboard|access-date=October 9, 2011|archive-date=November 21, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211121094938/https://www.billboard.com/artist/demi-lovato/chart-history/|url-status=live}}</ref> The song also peaked at number 68 on the [[Canadian Hot 100]] and number 38 in New Zealand.<ref>{{cite magazine |url={{BillboardURLbyName|artist=demi lovato|chart=Billboard Canadian Hot 100}} |title=Demi Lovato Album & Song Chart History \u2013 Canadian Hot 100 |magazine=Billboard |access-date=October 9, 2011 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211121100048/https://www.billboard.com/artist/demi-lovato/chart-history/billboard-canadian-hot-100/ |archive-date=November 21, 2021 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/album/here-we-go-again-mw0000822778|title=Here We Go Again \u2013 Demi Lovato|first=Stephen Thomas|last=Erlewine|website=[[AllMusic]]|publisher=[[Rovi Corporation]]|location=San Carlos, California|date=July 21, 2009|access-date=June 2, 2013|archive-date=April 24, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220424230751/https://www.allmusic.com/album/here-we-go-again-mw0000822778|url-status=live}}</ref> \"Here We Go Again\" was additionally certified Platinum in the US.<ref name=\"Gold & Platinum\"/> The album's second and final single, \"[[Remember December]]\" failed to match the success of its predecessor, but peaked at number 80 on the [[UK Singles Chart]]. Lovato made her first 40-city national concert tour, Live in Concert, in support of ''Here We Go Again''.<ref name=\"Summer Tour 2009\">{{cite web|url=http://www.aeglive.com/news/view/10206|title=Demi Lovato Announces \"Summer Tour 2009\" North American Headline Tour|publisher=AEG Live|access-date=January 1, 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140416183028/http://www.aeglive.com/news/view/10206|archive-date=April 16, 2014|url-status=dead}}</ref> The tour, from June 21 to August 21, 2009,<ref name=\"LiveInConcert\">{{cite web|url=http://www.artistdirect.com/nad/news/article/0,,5289041,00.html|title=Demi Lovato Lines Up Lengthy Summer Tour|date=April 16, 2009|publisher=ArtistDirect|access-date=October 5, 2013|archive-date=October 25, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121025091856/http://www.artistdirect.com/nad/news/article/0,,5289041,00.html|url-status=dead}}</ref> had [[David Archuleta]],<ref name=\"LiveInConcert\" /> [[KSM (band)|KSM]], and [[Jordan Pruitt]] as opening acts.<ref>{{cite web|first=Jocelyn|last=Vena|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1609297/demi-lovato-to-tour-with-david-archuleta-this-summer/|title=Demi Lovato To Tour With David Archuleta This Summer|date=April 15, 2009|website=[[MTV News]]|publisher=[[Viacom (2005\u2013present)|Viacom]]|location=New York City|access-date=October 5, 2013|archive-date=December 6, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141206030722/http://www.mtv.com/news/1609297/demi-lovato-to-tour-with-david-archuleta-this-summer/|url-status=dead}}</ref> Lovato and Archuleta received the Choice Music Tour award at the [[2009 Teen Choice Awards]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.popsugar.com/entertainment/Winners-2009-Teen-Choice-Awards-3904879|title=Announcing the Winners of the 2009 Teen Choice Awards!|website=[[Buzz Sugar]]|date=August 9, 2009|access-date=October 5, 2013|archive-date=June 30, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150630060545/http://www.popsugar.com/entertainment/Winners-2009-Teen-Choice-Awards-3904879|url-status=live}}</ref> Lovato was featured alongside the [[Jonas Brothers]], [[Miley Cyrus]], and [[Selena Gomez]] on the song \"[[Send It On (Disney's Friends for Change song)|Send It On]]\", a [[charity record|charity single]] and the theme song for [[Disney's Friends for Change]].<ref name=\"pressrelease\">{{cite press release|url=https://thewaltdisneycompany.com/disney-news/press-releases/2009/08/send-it-anthem-worlds-biggest-teen-stars-miley-cyrus-jonas-0|title=\"Send It On\", an anthem by the world's biggest teen stars, Miley Cyrus, Jonas Brothers, Selena Gomez and Demi Lovato, for Disney's \"Friends For Change: Project Green\", will debut on Radio Disney, Disney Channel, disney.com and iTunes|date=August 6, 2009|publisher=The Walt Disney Company|access-date=October 2, 2015|archive-date=July 12, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150712162256/https://thewaltdisneycompany.com/disney-news/press-releases/2009/08/send-it-anthem-worlds-biggest-teen-stars-miley-cyrus-jonas-0|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=\"iTunes\">{{cite web|url= https://music.apple.com/us/album/send-it-on-feat-demi-lovato-jonas-brothers-hannah-montana/1445753300 |title=Send It On (feat. Demi Lovato, Jonas Brothers, Miley Cyrus & Selena Gomez) \u2013 Single |publisher=[[Apple Music]] |date=August 11, 2009 |access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130722024414/https://itunes.apple.com/WebObjects/MZStore.woa/wa/viewAlbum?id=325770503&s=143441 |archive-date=July 22, 2013 }}</ref> All proceeds from the song were donated to environmental charities supported by the Disney Worldwide Conservation Fund.<ref name=\"pressrelease\" /> Lovato recorded \"Gift of a Friend\" as a soundtrack for the Disney movie ''[[Tinker Bell and the Lost Treasure]]''. The movie was released in October 2009.\n\nIn 2010, Lovato and [[Joe Jonas]] recorded \"[[Make a Wave]]\" as the second charity single for Disney's Friends for Change.<ref name=\"iTunesMakeAWave\">{{cite web|url=https://music.apple.com/us/album/make-a-wave-feat-joe-jonas-demi-lovato-ep/1445865450|title=Make a Wave (feat. Joe Jonas & Demi Lovato) \u2013 EP|publisher=Apple Music|date=March 15, 2010|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=March 4, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304084402/https://music.apple.com/us/album/make-a-wave-feat-joe-jonas-demi-lovato-ep/1445865450|url-status=live}}</ref> That May, Lovato guest-starred as Hayley May, a teenager with [[schizophrenia]], in the [[Grey's Anatomy (season 6)|sixth-season]] ''[[Grey's Anatomy]]'' episode, \"[[Shiny Happy People (Grey's Anatomy)|Shiny Happy People]]\".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.metrolyrics.com/2010-demi-lovato-stars-in-greys-anatomy-news.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100522045923/http://www.metrolyrics.com/2010-demi-lovato-stars-in-greys-anatomy-news.html|title=Demi Lovato stars in Grey's Anatomy|website=[[MetroLyrics]]|date=May 14, 2010|archive-date=May 22, 2010|access-date=March 14, 2013|url-status=dead}}</ref> Although critics praised her versatility, they were underwhelmed by her acting and felt that her appearance was designed primarily to attract viewers.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.entertainmentwise.com/photos/53471/1/Demi-Lovato-Stars-In-Greys-Anatomy-Pictures|title=Demi Lovato Stars In Grey's Anatomy \u2013 Pictures|first=Helen|last=Sanders|website=Entertainment Wise|date=May 14, 2010|access-date=June 2, 2013|url-status=dead|archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20131106182729/http://www.entertainmentwise.com/photos/53471/1/Demi-Lovato-Stars-In-Greys-Anatomy-Pictures|archive-date= November 6, 2013}}</ref> Later that year, she headlined her first international tour, [[Demi Lovato: Live in Concert]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.disneydreaming.com/2010/03/21/demi-lovato-announces-south-american-tour-2010/ |title=Demi Lovato Announces South American Tour 2010 |website=[[Disney Dreaming]] |publisher=[[Walt Disney Company]]|location=Burbank, California|date=March 21, 2010 |access-date=October 5, 2013 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131006170036/http://www.disneydreaming.com/2010/03/21/demi-lovato-announces-south-american-tour-2010/ |archive-date=October 6, 2013 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.myspace.com/demilovato/blog/531920790|title=Demi's coming to South America!! |website=[[Myspace]]|publisher=Specific Media LLC|location=Beverly Hills, California|date=March 30, 2010|access-date=March 13, 2013|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://archive.today/20120327073542/http://www.myspace.com/demilovato/blog/531920790|archive-date=March 27, 2012}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> and joined the [[List of Jonas Brothers concert tours#Live in Concert|Jonas Brothers: Live in Concert]] tour as a guest.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.myspace.com/demilovato/blog/533484912|title=Summer tour announcement|website=[[Myspace]]|publisher= Specific Media LLC|location=Beverly Hills, California|date=April 27, 2010 |access-date=March 13, 2013|url-status=dead|archive-url= https://archive.today/20120327073553/http://www.myspace.com/demilovato/blog/533484912|archive-date=March 27, 2012}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref>\n\n''[[Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam]]'', with Lovato reprising her role as Mitchie Torres, premiered on September 3, 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1637866/camp-rock-2-the-final-jam-premieres-september-3-on-disney-channel/|title='Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam' Premieres September 3 On Disney Channel|first=Jocelyn|last=Vena|website=[[MTV News]]|publisher=[[Viacom (2005\u2013present)|Viacom]]|location=New York City|date=April 27, 2010|access-date=May 14, 2010|archive-date=June 13, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210613203226/http://www.mtv.com/news/1637866/camp-rock-2-the-final-jam-premieres-september-3-on-disney-channel/|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam Premier Had 8 Million Viewers |url=http://www.bsckids.com/2010/09/camp-rock-2-the-final-jam-premier-had-8-million-viewers/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110827173931/http://www.bsckids.com/2010/09/camp-rock-2-the-final-jam-premier-had-8-million-viewers/|first=Sarah|last=Peel|website=BSC Kids|date=September 7, 2010|archive-date=August 27, 2011|access-date=March 14, 2010}}</ref> Critics were ambivalent about the film's plot, and it has a 40-percent approval rating\non [[Rotten Tomatoes]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/camp-rock-2/|title=Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam (2010)|website=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|date=September 7, 2010|publisher=[[Fandango Media]]|location=Los Angeles, California|access-date=March 13, 2013|archive-date=November 28, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121128123557/http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/camp-rock-2/|url-status=live}}</ref> However, Lovato's performance was called \"dependably appealing\" by Jennifer Armstrong of ''Entertainment Weekly''.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://ew.com/article/2010/08/25/camp-rock-2-final-jam/|title=Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam|first=Jennifer|last=Armstrong|magazine=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|date=August 25, 2010|access-date=March 2, 2022|archive-date=March 4, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304084358/https://ew.com/article/2010/08/25/camp-rock-2-final-jam/|url-status=live}}</ref> The film premiered to eight million viewers, the number-one cable television movie of the year by the number of viewers.<ref name=\"CR2\">{{cite web|url=http://www.medialifemagazine.com/camp-rock-2-becomes-years-top-movie/|title='Camp Rock 2' becomes year's top movie|first=Toni|last=Fitzgerald|work=[[Media Life Magazine]]|publisher=Media Life Co.|location=Portland, Oregon|date=September 7, 2010|access-date=April 9, 2013|archive-date=July 25, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220725201925/http://www.medialifemagazine.com/camp-rock-2-becomes-years-top-movie/|url-status=live}}</ref> Its accompanying [[Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam (soundtrack)|soundtrack]] was released on August 10 with Lovato singing nine songs, including \"[[Can't Back Down (song)|Can't Back Down]]\" and \"[[Wouldn't Change a Thing (Camp Rock song)|Wouldn't Change a Thing]]\".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://music.apple.com/us/album/camp-rock-2-the-final-jam-music-from-the-disney/1440622360|title=Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam (Soundtrack from the Motion Picture)|publisher=Apple Music|date=August 10, 2010|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=March 4, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304084405/https://music.apple.com/us/album/camp-rock-2-the-final-jam-music-from-the-disney/1440622360|url-status=live}}</ref> The soundtrack debuted at number three on the ''Billboard'' 200, with first-week sales of 41,000 copies.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://oceanup.com/2010/08/18/camp-rock-2-soundtrack-41863-sold/|title=Camp Rock 2 Soundtrack 41,863 Sold|work=OceanUp|publisher=As If Productions|location=Los Angeles, California|access-date=April 9, 2013|archive-date=September 15, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180915193008/http://oceanup.com/2010/08/18/camp-rock-2-soundtrack-41863-sold/|url-status=live}}</ref> Jonas Brothers: Live in Concert was reworked to incorporate Lovato and the rest of the film's cast;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.disneydreaming.com/2010/04/27/jonas-brothers-2010-world-tour-camp-rock-2-tour/ |title=Jonas Brothers 2010 World Tour Camp Rock 2 Tour 20 of the show have been cancelled or moved |website=[[Disney Dreaming]]|publisher=[[The Walt Disney Company]] |location=Burbank, California|date=April 27, 2010 |access-date=March 13, 2013 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130816182438/http://www.disneydreaming.com/2010/04/27/jonas-brothers-2010-world-tour-camp-rock-2-tour/ |archive-date=August 16, 2013 }}</ref> it began on August 7, two weeks later than planned.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.disneydreaming.com/2010/07/03/jonas-brothers-cancel-camp-rock-2-tour-dates-add-others/ |title=Jonas Brothers Cancel Camp Rock 2 Tour Dates, Add Others |website=[[Disney Dreaming]] |publisher=[[The Walt Disney Company]]|location=Burbank, California|date=July 3, 2010 |access-date=March 13, 2013 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120829033628/http://www.disneydreaming.com/2010/07/03/jonas-brothers-cancel-camp-rock-2-tour-dates-add-others/ |archive-date=August 29, 2012 }}</ref> The ''[[Sonny with a Chance (soundtrack)|Sonny with a Chance]]'' soundtrack was released on October 5; Lovato sang on four tracks, including \"[[Me, Myself and Time]]\".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://music.apple.com/us/album/sonny-with-a-chance-soundtrack-from-the-tv-series/1443917355|title=Sonny With a Chance (Soundtrack from the TV Series)|publisher=Apple Music|date=October 5, 2010|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=March 4, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304084404/https://music.apple.com/us/album/sonny-with-a-chance-soundtrack-from-the-tv-series/1443917355|url-status=live}}</ref> It debuted (and peaked) at number 163 on the ''Billboard'' 200, her lowest-selling soundtrack.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/album/sonny-with-a-chance-mw0002032615/awards|title=Sonny with a Chance \u2013 Original TV Soundtrack: Awards|website=[[AllMusic]]|publisher=[[Rovi Corporation]]|location=San Carlos, California|access-date=March 14, 2013|archive-date=January 17, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140117010709/http://www.allmusic.com/album/sonny-with-a-chance-mw0002032615/awards|url-status=live}}</ref> In November 2010, Lovato announced her departure from ''Sonny with a Chance'', putting her acting career on hiatus and ending the series;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/237137/demi-lovato-quitting-sonny-with-a-chance|title=Demi Lovato Quitting Sonny With a Chance|first=Josh|last=Grossberg|date=April 19, 2011|website=[[E!]]|publisher=[[NBCUniversal]]|location=New York City|access-date=March 11, 2013|archive-date=July 16, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230716093431/https://www.eonline.com/news/237137/demi-lovato-quitting-sonny-with-a-chance|url-status=live}}</ref> she later said that she would return to acting when she felt confident doing so.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KFFkhGJ_RiY |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211221/KFFkhGJ_RiY |archive-date=December 21, 2021 |url-status=live|title=Demi Lovato \u2013 Koko Pop UK|date=April 7, 2012|publisher=[[YouTube]]|access-date=March 14, 2013}}{{cbignore}}</ref> Her departure led to the actual spin-off series ''[[So Random!]]'' with the ''Sonny'' cast, featuring sketches from the former show-within-a-show. The series was canceled after one season.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://tvline.com/2011/04/19/demi-lovato-exits-sonny-with-a-chance/|title=Demi Lovato Exits Disney Series: 'I Don't Think It Would Be Healthy for My Recovery{{'-}}|date=April 19, 2011|work=[[TVLine]]|location=Los Angeles, California|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130310192437/http://tvline.com/2011/04/19/demi-lovato-exits-sonny-with-a-chance/|archive-date=March 10, 2013|url-status=dead|access-date=March 14, 2013}}</ref>\n\n===2011\u20132012: ''Unbroken'' and ''The X Factor''===\n[[File:Demi Lovato 8, 2012.jpg|left|thumb|upright|Lovato performing on ''[[Good Morning America]]'' in July 2012 as part of the program's Summer Concert Series]]\nLovato released her third studio album, ''[[Unbroken (Demi Lovato album)|Unbroken]]'', on September 20, 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1667730/demi-lovato-new-album-september/|title=Demi Lovato To Release New Album September 20|author=James Dinh|publisher=MTV News|date=July 22, 2011|access-date=March 15, 2013|archive-date=August 3, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210803150405/http://www.mtv.com/news/1667730/demi-lovato-new-album-september/|url-status=dead}}</ref> Begun in July 2010, the album experimented with [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]] and featured less pop rock than her first two albums.<ref name=\"Vena\">{{cite news|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1644100/demi-lovato-wants-to-embrace-her-inner-soul-diva-on-next-album/|title=Demi Lovato Wants To Embrace Her 'Inner Soul' Diva On Next Album|last=Vena|first=Jocelyn|date=July 21, 2010|publisher=[[MTV News]]|access-date=March 15, 2013|archive-date=August 5, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210805141513/http://www.mtv.com/news/1644100/demi-lovato-wants-to-embrace-her-inner-soul-diva-on-next-album/|url-status=dead}}</ref> Lyrically, ''Unbroken'' encompassed more mature themes as opposed to Lovato's previous works, with some songs focusing on her personal struggles.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1670726/demi-lovato-unbroken-reviews/|title=Demi Lovato's Unbroken: Putting It Back Together|last=Vena|first=Jocelyn|publisher=MTV News|access-date=June 24, 2019|archive-date=November 23, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171123100146/http://www.mtv.com/news/1670726/demi-lovato-unbroken-reviews/|url-status=dead}}</ref> The album and its stylistic change received mixed reviews from critics, who praised Lovato's vocals and saw a growth in her musicianship due to the songs focusing on her struggles, but criticized the album's \"party songs\" and found the music to be more generic than her previous efforts.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/music/unbroken-2010/demi-lovato/critic-reviews|title=Critic Reviews for Unbroken|publisher=Metacritic|access-date=March 15, 2013|archive-date=March 22, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140322171416/http://www.metacritic.com/music/unbroken-2010/demi-lovato/critic-reviews|url-status=live}}</ref> ''Unbroken'' debuted at number four in the US, selling 97,000 copies in its first week of release; it was later certified Gold.<ref name=\"billboard\">{{cite magazine |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/tony-bennett-85-achieves-first-no-1-album-on-billboard-200-467230/ |title=Tony Bennett, 85, Achieves First No. 1 Album on Billboard 200 |magazine=Billboard |first=Tony |last=Caulfield |date=September 28, 2011 |access-date=March 4, 2022 |archive-date=March 4, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304085502/https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/tony-bennett-85-achieves-first-no-1-album-on-billboard-200-467230/ |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\n\"[[Skyscraper (song)|Skyscraper]]\", the lead single from ''Unbroken'', was released on July 12, and was noted for its messages of self-worth and confidence.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://top40.about.com/od/singles/gr/Demi-Lovato-Skyscraper.htm|title=Demi Lovato \u2013 \"Skyscraper\"|first=Bill|last=Lamb|publisher=Dotdash Meredith|access-date=June 2, 2013|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130505015245/http://top40.about.com/od/singles/gr/Demi-Lovato-Skyscraper.htm|archive-date=May 5, 2013}}</ref> It debuted at number ten in the US, selling 176,000 downloads during the first week of release, becoming Lovato's highest first week sales at the time.<ref name=\"Billboard\"/> The song also became Lovato's highest-charting single since \"[[This Is Me (Camp Rock song)|This Is Me]]\" peaking at number nine in July 2008,<ref name=\"Billboard\">{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/lmfao-still-atop-hot-100-demi-lovato-debuts-in-top-10-469163/|title=LMFAO Still Atop Hot 100, Demi Lovato Debuts In Top 10|last=Trust|first=Gary|magazine=Billboard|date=July 20, 2011|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=March 4, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304085501/https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/lmfao-still-atop-hot-100-demi-lovato-debuts-in-top-10-469163/|url-status=live}}</ref> and it also debuted at number two on the [[Hot Digital Songs]] chart.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/blake-sheltons-river-runs-to-no-1-on-billboard-200-469172/|title=Blake Shelton's 'River' Runs to No. 1 on Billboard 200|date=July 20, 2011|last=Caulfield|first=Kevin|magazine=Billboard|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=March 4, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304085505/https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/blake-sheltons-river-runs-to-no-1-on-billboard-200-469172/|url-status=live}}</ref> \"Skyscraper\" received the Best Video With a Message award at the September [[2012 MTV Video Music Awards]], and the track was also certified Platinum by the RIAA and Silver by the [[British Phonographic Industry|BPI]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/ontv/vma/2012/best-video-with-a-message/|title=Demi Lovato nominated for Best Video With A Message at the 2012 VMA's.|publisher=MTV News. Viacom|date=July 31, 2012|access-date=March 15, 2013|archive-date=May 4, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130504072100/http://www.mtv.com/ontv/vma/2012/best-video-with-a-message/|url-status=dead}}</ref> The album's second and final single, \"[[Give Your Heart a Break]]\", was released on January 23, 2012, and later peaked on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100 at number 16, making Lovato's fourth highest-charting song to that point.<ref name=autogenerated1>{{cite magazine |url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/demi-lovato/chart-history/ |title=Hot 100 Songs & New Music: 1 \u2013 10 Songs |magazine=Billboard |access-date=December 6, 2012 |archive-date=November 21, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211121094938/https://www.billboard.com/artist/demi-lovato/chart-history/ |url-status=live }}</ref> It peaked at number 12 on the US [[Adult Pop Songs|Adult Top 40]] chart and number one on the US [[Mainstream Top 40 (Pop Songs)|Pop Songs]] chart. It also became the longest climb by a female artist{{Efn|Lovato identified as female at that time.|name=femalechart|group=lower-alpha}} to reach No. 1 in the [[Mainstream Top 40 (Pop Songs)|Pop Songs]] chart history until 2019, when [[Halsey (singer)|Halsey]]'s feature on \"[[Eastside (song)|Eastside]]\" broke the record.<ref name=\"BillboardChartHistory\"/><ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/pro/benny-blanco-halsey-khalid-eastside-no-1-pop-songs/|title=Benny Blanco, Halsey & Khalid Complete Record Rise to No. 1 on Pop Songs Chart With 'Eastside'|magazine=Billboard|access-date=March 4, 2022|date=February 25, 2019|archive-date=March 4, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304085500/https://www.billboard.com/pro/benny-blanco-halsey-khalid-eastside-no-1-pop-songs/|url-status=live}}</ref> The song was certified triple Platinum in the US; {{as of|2014|10|lc=y}}, \"Give Your Heart a Break\" has sold 2.1 million digital copies.<ref name=\"sales\">{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/pro/ask-billboard-baseball-hits-gwen-stefanis-delay-demi-lovatos/|title=Ask Billboard: Baseball Hits, Gwen Stefani's Delay & Demi Lovato's Best-Selling Songs|magazine=Billboard|date=October 12, 2014|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=March 4, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304085502/https://www.billboard.com/pro/ask-billboard-baseball-hits-gwen-stefanis-delay-demi-lovatos/|url-status=live}}</ref> ''Billboard'' has ranked the song as Lovato's best, calling it \"timeless\".<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/demi-lovato-best-songs-8238640/|title=Demi Lovato's 10 Best Songs: Critic's Picks|magazine=Billboard|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=December 2, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221202044131/https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/demi-lovato-best-songs-8238640/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nIn May, Lovato became a judge and mentor for the [[The X Factor (American season 2)|second season]] of the [[The X Factor (U.S. TV series)|U.S. version]] of ''[[The X Factor]]'', with a reported salary of one million dollars.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zap2it.com/blogs/demi_lovatos_x_factor_salary_cant_compare_to_britney_spears-2012-05|title=Demi Lovato's 'X Factor' salary can't compare to Britney Spears'|publisher=Zap2It|date=May 30, 2012|access-date=March 7, 2013|archive-date=November 29, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141129042645/http://www.zap2it.com/blogs/demi_lovatos_x_factor_salary_cant_compare_to_britney_spears-2012-05|url-status=dead}}</ref> Joining [[Britney Spears]], [[Simon Cowell]], and [[L.A. Reid]],<ref name=\"JoinX-Factor\">{{cite web|last=Bricker|first=Tierney|title=It's Official! Demi Lovato Joins X Factor as Fourth Judge|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/315906/it-s-official-demi-lovato-joins-x-factor-as-fourth-judge|publisher=E! Online|date=May 13, 2012|access-date=May 13, 2012|archive-date=April 29, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230429211647/https://www.eonline.com/news/315906/it-s-official-demi-lovato-joins-x-factor-as-fourth-judge|url-status=live}}</ref> it was speculated that she was chosen to attract a younger audience.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1684289/demi-lovato-x-factor-judge-miley-cyrus/|title=Demi Lovato, Miley Cyrus Rumored For 'X Factor' Judge Spot|author=Gil Kaufman|publisher=MTV News. Viacom|date=May 2, 2012|access-date=May 16, 2012|archive-date=June 10, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220610123828/http://www.mtv.com/news/1684289/demi-lovato-x-factor-judge-miley-cyrus/|url-status=dead}}</ref> Mentoring the Young Adults category, her final act (CeCe Frey) finished sixth.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1698571/x-factor-cece-frey-elimination-reaction/|title=CeCe Frey 'Knew' She Wasn't Going To Win 'X Factor'|author=Chris Kim|publisher=MTV News|date=December 7, 2012|access-date=March 15, 2013|archive-date=June 14, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220614144558/http://www.mtv.com/news/1698571/x-factor-cece-frey-elimination-reaction/|url-status=dead}}</ref> At the Minnesota State Fair in August, Lovato announced that after a pre-show performance at the 2012 MTV Video Music Awards<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kovideo.net/demi-lovato-reveals-she-is-recording-fourth-album-soon-news-demi-lovato-6153.html |first=Irene|last=Test|title=Demi Lovato Reveals She is Recording Fourth Album Soon |work=Kovideo |publisher=Glam Entertainment |date=September 1, 2012 |access-date=March 16, 2013 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130402182638/http://www.kovideo.net/demi-lovato-reveals-she-is-recording-fourth-album-soon-news-demi-lovato-6153.html |archive-date=April 2, 2013 }}</ref> she would release a single by December.<ref>{{cite web|author=Ashley E. |url=http://www.bsckids.com/2012/08/demi-lovato-to-release-new-single-by-december/ |title=Demi Lovato To Release New Single By December |publisher=Bsckids |date=August 31, 2012 |access-date=March 16, 2013 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120905131521/http://www.bsckids.com/2012/08/demi-lovato-to-release-new-single-by-december/ |archive-date=September 5, 2012 }}</ref> On December 24, she released a video on her [[YouTube]] account of herself singing \"[[Angels Among Us]]\" dedicated to the victims of the [[Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r8TgMkbMPkc |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211221/r8TgMkbMPkc |archive-date=December 21, 2021 |url-status=live|title=Demi Lovato \u2013 Angels Among Us |publisher=YouTube|date=December 24, 2012}}{{cbignore}}</ref> In March, she was confirmed as returning for ''The X Factor''{{'}}s [[The X Factor (American season 3)|third season]],<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-returning-for-third-season-of-x-factor-1554926/|title=Demi Lovato Returning for Third Season of 'X Factor'|magazine=Billboard|date=March 28, 2013|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=March 5, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220305032426/https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-returning-for-third-season-of-x-factor-1554926/|url-status=live}}</ref> with her salary reportedly doubling.<ref>{{cite news|title=Demi Lovato Making More Money Than Paulina Rubio, Kelly Rowland In 'The X Factor'|url=https://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/demi-lovato-making-more-money-than-paulina-rubio-kelly-rowland-in-the-x-factor|publisher=Fox News|access-date=March 4, 2022|date=May 22, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130615010806/http://latino.foxnews.com/latino/entertainment/2013/05/22/demi-lovato-making-more-money-than-paulina-rubio-and-kelly-rowland-for-x-factor/|archive-date=June 15, 2013}}</ref>\n\n===2013\u20132014: ''Demi'' and ''Glee''===\n[[File:Demi Lovato 2, 2013.jpg|thumb|upright|Lovato at the Redlight Traffic's Inaugural Dignity Gala in October 2013]]\nLovato's fourth studio album, ''[[Demi (album)|Demi]]'', was released on May 14, 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://abcnewsradioonline.com/music-news/2013/4/1/demi-lovato-releasing-new-album-demi-on-may-14.html|title=Demi Lovato Releasing New Album \"Demi\" on May 14|work=ABC News Radio|author=Andrea Dresdale|date=April 1, 2013|access-date=March 24, 2020|archive-date=August 3, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210803150407/http://abcnewsradioonline.com/music-news/2013/4/1/demi-lovato-releasing-new-album-demi-on-may-14.html|url-status=dead}}</ref> The album features influences of [[synthpop]] and [[bubblegum pop]] and was met with generally positive reviews from music critics.<ref name=\"metacritic1\">{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/music/demi/demi-lovato |title=''Demi'' Reviews |website=[[Metacritic]] |publisher=[[CBS Corporation]] |location=Chicago, Illinois |access-date=May 15, 2013 |archive-date=June 7, 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130607184240/http://www.metacritic.com/music/demi/demi-lovato |url-status=live }}</ref> Although Jon Carmichael of ''[[The New York Times]]'' found Lovato's transition fun, according to ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' it signified a less mature image.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/05/14/arts/music/demi-lovato-and-talib-kweli-have-new-albums.html |title=New Albums by Demi Lovato and Talib Kweli |first=Jon |last=Carmichael |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |date=May 13, 2013 |access-date=June 1, 2013 |archive-date=August 3, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210803150406/https://www.nytimes.com/2013/05/14/arts/music/demi-lovato-and-talib-kweli-have-new-albums.html |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://ew.com/article/2013/05/07/demi-lovatos-new-album-demi-now-streaming-online-read-ews-review-here/|title=Demi Lovato's new album 'Demi' now streaming online|magazine=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|date=May 7, 2013|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=August 3, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210803150406/https://ew.com/article/2013/05/07/demi-lovatos-new-album-demi-now-streaming-online-read-ews-review-here/|url-status=live}}</ref> The album debuted at number three in the US, with first-week sales of 110,000 copies, the best-selling debut week of Lovato's discography.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/pro/vampire-weekend-debuts-at-no-1-on-billboard-200-chart/|title=Vampire Weekend Debuts at No. 1 on Billboard 200 Chart|author=Keith Caulfield|magazine=Billboard|date=May 22, 2013|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=March 5, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220305032429/https://www.billboard.com/pro/vampire-weekend-debuts-at-no-1-on-billboard-200-chart/|url-status=live}}</ref> It was also successful internationally, charting in the top ten in New Zealand, Spain and the UK.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ultratop.be/nl/album/34b93/Demi-Lovato-Demi|title=Demi Lovato \u2013 Demi|publisher=Ultratop. Hung Medien|access-date=June 1, 2013|archive-date=July 16, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230716231340/https://www.ultratop.be/nl/album/34b93/Demi-Lovato-Demi|url-status=live}}</ref> The album has been certified Gold in the US.<ref name=\"us_sales\">{{cite web|url=https://www.riaa.com/gold-platinum/?tab_active=default-award&ar=Demi+Lovato&ti=&lab=&genre=&format=Album&date_option=release&from=&to=&award=&type=&category=&adv=SEARCH#search_section|title=American album certifications \u2013 Demi Lovato \u2013 Demi|date=July 11, 2016|publisher=[[Recording Industry Association of America|RIAA]]|access-date=March 18, 2017|archive-date=May 27, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230527203906/https://www.riaa.com/gold-platinum/?tab_active=default-award&ar=Demi+Lovato&ti=&lab=&genre=&format=Album&date_option=release&from=&to=&award=&type=&category=&adv=SEARCH#search_section|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nThe lead single from ''Demi'', \"[[Heart Attack (Demi Lovato song)|Heart Attack]]\", was released on February 25, and debuted at number 12 in the US, with first-week sales of 215,000 copies, the highest first week sales of Lovato's discography.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/pro/baauers-harlem-shake-still-atop-hot-100-although-lead-shrinks/|title=Baauer's 'Harlem Shake' Still Atop Hot 100, Although Lead Shrinks|author=Gary Trust|magazine=Billboard|date=March 6, 2013|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=March 5, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220305032430/https://www.billboard.com/pro/baauers-harlem-shake-still-atop-hot-100-although-lead-shrinks/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/pro/macklemore-ryan-lewis-top-hot-100-imagine-dragons-ariana-grande-hit-top-10/|title=Macklemore & Ryan Lewis Top Hot 100; Imagine Dragons, Ariana Grande Hit Top 10|author=Gary Trust|magazine=Billboard|date=April 3, 2013|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=January 31, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220131221338/https://www.billboard.com/pro/macklemore-ryan-lewis-top-hot-100-imagine-dragons-ariana-grande-hit-top-10/|url-status=live}}</ref> The song peaked at number ten (Lovato's third top ten entry in the US),<ref name=\"BillboardChartHistory\" /> and was also successful in the UK, Australia, and Europe.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ultratop.be/nl/song/110bf5/Demi-Lovato-Heart-Attack|title=Demi Lovato \u2013 Heart Attack|publisher=[[Ultratop]]. Hung Medien|access-date=June 1, 2013|archive-date=July 16, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230716231327/https://www.ultratop.be/nl/song/110bf5/Demi-Lovato-Heart-Attack|url-status=live}}</ref> The second single, \"[[Made in the USA (song)|Made in the USA]]\" peaked at number 80 in the US.<ref name=\"sales\" /> The third and fourth singles from ''Demi'', \"[[Neon Lights (Demi Lovato song)|Neon Lights]]\" and \"[[Really Don't Care]]\", both peaked in the top forty of the US, and at number one in the country's [[Dance Club Songs]] chart.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1823485/its-demi-lovatos-demiversary-new-single-new-lyric-video-and-performances|title=It's Demi Lovato's #Demiversary: New Single, New Lyric Video And Performances|website=[[MTV]]|publisher=[[Viacom (2005\u2013present)|Viacom]]|location=New York City|access-date=August 3, 2014|archive-date=May 19, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220519215507/http://www.mtv.com/news/1823485/its-demi-lovatos-demiversary-new-single-new-lyric-video-and-performances/|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/2014-09-06/dance-club-play-songs|title=Hot Dance Club Songs|magazine=Billboard|date=September 6, 2014|access-date=August 28, 2014|archive-date=September 29, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140929203152/http://www.billboard.com/charts/2014-09-06/dance-club-play-songs|url-status=live}}</ref> She was also certified Platinum in the US.<ref name=\"riaa.com\">{{cite web|url=https://www.riaa.com/gold-platinum/|title=Gold & Platinum|website=RIAA|access-date=June 1, 2019|archive-date=November 10, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201110084738/https://www.riaa.com/gold-platinum/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nLovato later released a deluxe version of ''Demi'', which included seven new tracks, consisting of four live performances and three studio recordings.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://nz.news.yahoo.com/a/-/latest/25441065/demi-lovato-announces-demi-deluxe |title=Demi Lovato announces Demi \u2013 Deluxe |url-status=dead|archive-url= https://archive.today/20141107021305/https://nz.news.yahoo.com/a/-/latest/25441065/demi-lovato-announces-demi-deluxe/|archive-date=November 7, 2014|date=November 6, 2014}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> One of these songs was \"[[Up (Olly Murs song)|Up]]\", a collaboration with [[Olly Murs]] for his fourth studio album ''[[Never Been Better]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.digitalspy.com/music/a612094/listen-to-olly-murs-and-demi-lovatos-new-single-up/|title=Listen to Olly Murs and Demi Lovato's new single 'Up'|work=[[Digital Spy]]|access-date=March 4, 2022|date=November 24, 2014|first=Finbow|last=Katy|archive-date=August 3, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210803150416/https://www.digitalspy.com/music/a612094/listen-to-olly-murs-and-demi-lovatos-new-single-up/|url-status=live}}</ref> Lovato contributed to [[The Mortal Instruments: City of Bones (soundtrack)|''The Mortal Instruments: City of Bones'' soundtrack album]] with \"[[Heart by Heart]]\".<ref>{{cite web|last=Guidry |first=Ken |title='The Mortal Instruments: City Of Bones' Soundtrack Features Jessie J, Demi Lovato, Owl City & More |url=https://www.indiewire.com/2013/07/the-mortal-instruments-city-of-bones-soundtrack-features-jessie-j-demi-lovato-owl-city-more-96428/|work=[[IndieWire]] |access-date=March 4, 2022 |date=July 2, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130813083820/http://blogs.indiewire.com/theplaylist/the-mortal-instruments-city-of-bones-soundtrack-features-jessie-j-demi-lovato-owl-city-more-20130702 |archive-date=August 13, 2013 }}</ref>\n\nOn June 11, Lovato released an [[e-book]], ''Demi'', on [[Apple Books|iBooks]].<ref name=\"auto\">{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/2304349/demi-lovato-ebook/|title=Buzz Bites (5/23/13): Demi Lovato Is Releasing An E-Book!|first=Althea|last=Legaspi|date=May 23, 2013|website=[[MTV News]]|publisher=Viacom|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=March 5, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220305032426/http://www.mtv.com/news/2304349/demi-lovato-ebook/|url-status=dead}}</ref> She planned to appear in at least six episodes of the [[Glee (season 5)|fifth season]] of ''[[Glee (TV series)|Glee]]'', but only appeared in four. She played Dani, a struggling New York-based artist who befriends [[Rachel Berry]] ([[Lea Michele]]) and [[Santana Lopez]] ([[Naya Rivera]]) and interacts with fellow newcomer [[Adam Lambert]]'s character. Lovato debuted in the season's second episode, which aired on October 3, and made her final appearance in March 2014.<ref name=DemiGlee>{{cite magazine|last=Strecker|first=Erin|title=Demi Lovato headed to 'Glee'|url=https://ew.com/article/2013/08/22/demi-lovato-glee-phoebe-strole/|magazine=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|date=August 22, 2013|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=August 3, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210803150406/https://ew.com/article/2013/08/22/demi-lovato-glee-phoebe-strole/|url-status=live}}</ref> On November 19, she released a book, ''Staying Strong: 365 Days a Year'', which topped ''The New York Times'' bestseller list.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sugarscape.com/bookclub/news/a992770/demi-lovato-becomes-a-new-york-times-bestseller-with-book-staying-strong-365-days-a-year/ |title=Demi Lovato becomes a ''New York Times'' bestseller with book ''Staying Strong: 365 Days A Year'' |website=Sugarscape |date=September 15, 2011 |access-date=December 24, 2013 |archive-date=November 18, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161118192224/http://www.sugarscape.com/bookclub/news/a992770/demi-lovato-becomes-a-new-york-times-bestseller-with-book-staying-strong-365-days-a-year/ |url-status=live }}</ref> She then agreed to write a [[memoir]], which has yet to be released.<ref name=StayingStrong>{{cite news|last=Deutsch|first=Lindsay|title=Demi Lovato is writing an inspirational book|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/books/2013/09/09/demi-lovato-book-deal/2787867/|newspaper=[[USA Today]]|location=Mclean, Virginia|access-date=September 9, 2013|date=September 9, 2013|archive-date=September 13, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130913012005/http://www.usatoday.com/story/life/books/2013/09/09/demi-lovato-book-deal/2787867/|url-status=live}}</ref> While on ''The X Factor'', her final act (Rion Paige) finished fifth.\n\nLovato announced her [[The Neon Lights Tour|Neon Lights Tour]] (including a Canadian leg) on September 29, 2013;<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Lipshutz|first=Jason|title=Demi Lovato Announces 2014 Tour with Little Mix, Cher Lloyd, Fifth Harmony|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-announces-2014-tour-with-little-mix-cher-lloyd-fifth-5740663/|magazine=Billboard|access-date=March 4, 2022|date=September 30, 2013|archive-date=December 24, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221224192557/https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-announces-2014-tour-with-little-mix-cher-lloyd-fifth-5740663/|url-status=live}}</ref> it began on February 9, 2014, and ended on May 17.<ref name=\"NeonLightsTour\">{{cite web|last=Lovato|first=Demi|title=Neon Lights Tour|url=https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?v=550289248377294|publisher=Facebook|access-date=September 29, 2013|archive-date=January 21, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160121095637/https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?v=550289248377294|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=\"NeonBrazilMexico\">{{cite web|last=Lovato|first=Demi|title=The Neon Lights Tour comes to Brazil and Mexico|url=http://www.demilovato.com/the-neon-lights-tour-comes-to-brazil-and-mexico/|website=demilovato.com|date=October 14, 2013|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131019090346/http://www.demilovato.com/the-neon-lights-tour-comes-to-brazil-and-mexico/|archive-date=October 19, 2013}}</ref> On October 21, she released her cover of \"[[Let It Go (Demi Lovato song)|Let It Go]]\" for the Disney film ''[[Frozen (2013 film)|Frozen]]'', which was released in theaters on November 27. Lovato's cover was described as more \"radio friendly\" and \"pop\" as compared to the original by [[Idina Menzel]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.tubefilter.com/2017/12/04/disney-let-it-go-frozen-lawsuit-volar-youtube-cover-views/|title=Disney Sued Over Alleged \"Let It Go\" Song Theft, Millions Of YouTube Covers Could Be Affected|date=December 4, 2017|website=Tubefilter|access-date=June 1, 2019|archive-date=August 3, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210803150407/https://www.tubefilter.com/2017/12/04/disney-let-it-go-frozen-lawsuit-volar-youtube-cover-views/|url-status=live}}</ref> Lovato's cover appears in the film's credits, and the song was promoted as the single for the [[Frozen (soundtrack)|film's soundtrack]].<ref name=\"DemiFrozen\">{{cite web|last=Rubin|first=Julia Lynn|title=Demi Lovato Releases New Song 'Let It Go' From Disney's 'Frozen' Soundtrack|url=http://www.hngn.com/articles/15461/20131021/demi-lovato-releases-new-song-let-it-go-from-disneys-frozen-soundtrack-listen.htm|website=HNGN|date=October 21, 2013|access-date=October 24, 2013|archive-date=December 29, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211229162520/https://www.hngn.com/articles/15461/20131021/demi-lovato-releases-new-song-let-it-go-from-disneys-frozen-soundtrack-listen.htm|url-status=live}}</ref> The song peaked at number 38 on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]], spending 20 weeks on the chart. It was certified double Platinum by the RIAA.<ref name=\"riaa.com\"/> On May 18, 2014, \"[[Somebody to You]]\" featuring Lovato was released as the fourth single from [[The Vamps (British band)|the Vamps]]' debut album, ''[[Meet the Vamps]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://music.apple.com/gb/album/somebody-to-you-feat-demi/880517513|title=Somebody to You (feat. Demi Lovato) by The Vamps|publisher=Apple Music|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=March 4, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304081937/https://music.apple.com/gb/album/somebody-to-you-feat-demi/880517513|url-status=dead}}</ref>\n\nOn May 29, Lovato announced the [[Demi World Tour]], which marked her fourth concert tour (and first world tour, covering 25 cities) and second in support of her album ''Demi''.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/546419/demi-lovato-announces-first-world-tour-dates|website=[[E!]]|publisher=[[NBCUniversal]]|location=New York City|date=May 29, 2014|access-date=May 29, 2014|first=Zach|last=Johnson|title=Demi Lovato Announces First World Tour Dates!|archive-date=January 17, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230117162939/https://www.eonline.com/news/546419/demi-lovato-announces-first-world-tour-dates|url-status=live}}</ref> In November 2014, she opened the UK shows on [[Enrique Iglesias]]' [[Sex and Love|Sex and Love Tour]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/music/news/a575916/enrique-iglesias-announces-uk-tour-with-demi-lovato.html |title=Enrique Iglesias announces UK tour with Demi Lovato \u2013 Music News |website=[[Digital Spy]] |date=June 6, 2014 |access-date=August 3, 2014 |archive-date=August 11, 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811182524/http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/music/news/a575916/enrique-iglesias-announces-uk-tour-with-demi-lovato.html |url-status=live }}</ref> and worked with longtime friend [[Nick Jonas]] on the song \"Avalanche\" from [[Nick Jonas (album)|his self-titled album]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.idolator.com/7569396/nick-jonas-demi-lovato-avalanche-listen-duet|title=Nick Jonas And Demi Lovato's \"Avalanche\": Listen To Their Gorgeous Duet|work=[[Idolator (website)|Idolator]]|date=November 6, 2014|access-date=November 7, 2014|archive-date=March 5, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240305125542/https://www.idolator.com/7569396/nick-jonas-demi-lovato-avalanche-listen-duet|url-status=live}}</ref> On December 24, Lovato released a music video for the song \"[[Nightingale (Demi Lovato song)|Nightingale]]\".<ref>{{cite web|last1=De Wilde|first1=Karen|title=Demi Lovato releases 'Nightingale' video showing Wilmer Valderrama|url=http://www.axs.com/news/demi-lovato-releases-nightingale-video-showing-wilmer-valderrama-34574|website=[[AXS (ticket merchant)|AXS]]|access-date=April 5, 2015|date=December 25, 2014|archive-date=April 6, 2015|archive-url=https://archive.today/20150406041801/http://www.axs.com/news/demi-lovato-releases-nightingale-video-showing-wilmer-valderrama-34574|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n===2015\u20132016: ''Confident''===\n[[File:Demi Lovato, Future Now 2016 (Cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Lovato performing on her [[Future Now Tour]] in September 2016]]\nIn May 2015, ''Billboard'' revealed that Lovato was in the process of starting an \"artist-centric\" new record label, [[Safehouse Records]], of which she would be co-founder and co-owner. The label would be a partnership between Lovato, Nick Jonas, and her then-manager Phil McIntyre, and will form part of a new collaborative arrangement with record label [[Island Records|Island]].<ref name=island2015>{{cite web|url=http://www.islandrecords.com/artists/demi-lovato/ |title=Demi Lovato on Island Records Website |publisher=Island |access-date=December 5, 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160929182014/http://www.islandrecords.com/artists/demi-lovato/ |archive-date=September 29, 2016 }}</ref> Her fifth studio album, ''[[Confident (album)|Confident]]'', was released through the new venture deal. This would be Lovato's second multi-label venture of her career; she was formerly part of Jonas Records, a UMG/Hollywood/Jonas Brothers partnership, which is now defunct.<ref name=\"Safehouse Records (Billboard)\">{{cite magazine|last1=Halperin |first1=Shirley |title=Demi Lovato, Nick Jonas, Manager Phil McIntyre Launch Joint Venture with Island Records (Exclusive) |url=https://www.billboard.com/pro/demi-lovato-nick-jonas-manager-phil-mcintyre-launch-joint-venture-with/ |access-date=March 4, 2022 |magazine=Billboard |date=May 26, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150528214542/http://www.billboard.com/articles/business/6576003/demi-lovato-nick-jonas-manager-phil-mcintyre-launch-joint-venture-with |archive-date=May 28, 2015 |url-status=dead }}</ref>\n\nLovato released \"[[Cool for the Summer]]\" as the lead single from her fifth studio album, in July 1, 2015.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Garibaldi|first1=Christina|title=YES! Demi Lovato Just Announced Her New Single 'Cool For The Summer'|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/2196416/demi-lovato-cool-for-the-summer-single/|access-date=June 25, 2015|website=[[MTV News]]|publisher=Paramount|location=New York City|date=June 25, 2015|archive-date=August 2, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210802155202/http://www.mtv.com/news/2196416/demi-lovato-cool-for-the-summer-single/|url-status=dead}}</ref> The song attracted attention for its [[bi-curious]] theme,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theatlantic.com/entertainment/archive/2015/07/demi-lovatos-cool-for-the-summer-is-the-anti-i-kissed-a-girl/398426/|title=Demi Lovato's 'Cool for
