the Summer': The Next Great Gay Anthem?|last=Kornhaber|first=Spencer|date=July 14, 2015|magazine=[[The Atlantic]]|location=Boston, Massachusetts|access-date=May 11, 2019|archive-date=August 3, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210803150407/https://www.theatlantic.com/entertainment/archive/2015/07/demi-lovatos-cool-for-the-summer-is-the-anti-i-kissed-a-girl/398426/|url-status=live}}</ref> and was a commercial success, peaking at number eleven on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100,<ref>{{cite web|first=Gordon|last=Murray|url=https://www.billboard.com/pro/demi-lovato-cool-for-summer-dance-club-songs-chart/|title=Demi Lovato's 'Cool for the Summer' Is Fastest No. 1 on Dance Club Songs in Two Years|magazine=Billboard|date=September 1, 2015|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=March 5, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220305032448/https://www.billboard.com/pro/demi-lovato-cool-for-summer-dance-club-songs-chart/|url-status=live}}</ref> and reached the top ten in the United Kingdom and New Zealand,<ref>Chart positions:\n* {{cite web|url=https://www.officialcharts.com/artist/5202/demi-lovato/|title=Demi Lovato|publisher=[[Official Charts Company]]|access-date=May 1, 2023|archive-date=July 14, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230714205034/https://www.officialcharts.com/artist/5202/demi-lovato|url-status=live}}\n* {{cite web|url=https://charts.nz/showinterpret.asp?interpret=Demi+Lovato|title=Discography Demi Lovato|publisher=New Zealand Charts Portal. Hung Medien|access-date=May 1, 2023|archive-date=February 15, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180215205059/http://charts.nz/showinterpret.asp?interpret=Demi+Lovato|url-status=live}}</ref> and was certified triple-platinum by the RIAA.<ref name=\"riaa.com\"/> On September 18, 2015, the title track \"[[Confident (Demi Lovato song)|Confident]]\" was released as the album's second single and peaked at number 21 on the Hot 100.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Maslow|first1=Nick|title=Demi Lovato Takes Control in Her New Song 'Confident': 'You Can't Make Me Behave'|url=https://people.com/celebrity/demi-lovato-releases-new-single-confident/|access-date=September 20, 2015|work=People|date=September 18, 2015|archive-date=August 3, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210803150407/https://people.com/celebrity/demi-lovato-releases-new-single-confident/|url-status=live}}</ref> It topped the ''Billboard'' [[Dance Club Songs]] chart and was later certified quadruple platinum by the RIAA.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Bell |first=Sadie |date=August 18, 2023 |title=Demi Lovato Releases Anthemic Rock Version of Her Hit 'Confident' |url=https://people.com/demi-lovato-releases-confident-rock-version-revamped-7693147/ |access-date=September 17, 2024 |magazine=People}}</ref> Lovato performed as the musical guest on an episode of the [[NBC]] late-night sketch comedy ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' in October 2015.<ref>{{cite news|last=Lewittes|first=Michael|title=Demi Lovato Performs \"Cool For The Summer\" And \"Confident\" Medley On 'SNL' \u2013 WATCH VIDEO|url=http://www.gossipcop.com/demi-lovato-snl-cool-for-the-summer-confident-video-saturday-night-live-watch-performance/|access-date=October 18, 2015|work=[[Gossip Cop]]|date=October 18, 2015|archive-date=April 5, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170405175858/http://www.gossipcop.com/demi-lovato-snl-cool-for-the-summer-confident-video-saturday-night-live-watch-performance/|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|last1=Kreps|first1=Daniel|title=See Demi Lovato's Confident 'SNL' Performances|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/see-demi-lovatos-confident-snl-performances-192113/|access-date=March 4, 2022|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=October 18, 2015|archive-date=March 5, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220305032426/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/see-demi-lovatos-confident-snl-performances-192113/|url-status=dead}}</ref> Lovato was also featured on the re-release of \"[[Irresistible (Fall Out Boy song)|Irresistible]]\", the fourth single from [[Fall Out Boy]]'s sixth studio album ''[[American Beauty/American Psycho]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://medium.com/@falloutboy/fall-out-boy-are-smack-in-the-middle-of-leaving-the-hoth-system-in-empire-strikes-back-a6ebbdb49021|title=Fall Out Boy are smack in the middle of leaving the hoth system in empire strikes back\u2026|author=Fall Out Boy|work=[[Medium (website)|Medium]]|publisher=A Medium Corporation|location=New York City|date=October 12, 2015|access-date=October 14, 2015|archive-date=August 2, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210802050147/https://medium.com/@falloutboy/fall-out-boy-are-smack-in-the-middle-of-leaving-the-hoth-system-in-empire-strikes-back-a6ebbdb49021|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nLovato's fifth album, ''[[Confident (album)|Confident]]'', was released on October 16, 2015,<ref>{{cite news|title=Demi Lovato's fifth studio album 'Confident' due out Oct. 16|url=http://www.upi.com/Entertainment_News/Music/2015/08/27/Demi-Lovatos-fifth-studio-album-Confident-due-out-Oct-16/6001440705839/|publisher=United Press International|access-date=August 27, 2015|last1=Butler|first1=Karen|date=August 26, 2015|archive-date=March 17, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210317213153/https://www.upi.com/Entertainment_News/Music/2015/08/27/Demi-Lovatos-fifth-studio-album-Confident-due-out-Oct-16/6001440705839/|url-status=live}}</ref> and was nominated for [[Grammy Award for Best Pop Vocal Album|Best Pop Vocal Album]] at the [[59th Annual Grammy Awards]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Grammys 2017: The Complete Winners List|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/lists/grammys-2017-winners-list-966483/|access-date=March 5, 2017 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=February 12, 2017|url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170310061315/https://www.grammy.com/nominees |archive-date=March 10, 2017 }}</ref> The album debuted at number two on the US ''Billboard'' 200 with first-week sales of 98,000 album units,<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/pro/pentatonix-first-no-1-album-billboard-200-chart/|title=Pentatonix Scores First No. 1 Album on Billboard 200 Chart|magazine=Billboard|date=October 26, 2015|access-date=March 4, 2022|last=Caulfield|first=Keith|archive-date=March 5, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220305032453/https://www.billboard.com/pro/pentatonix-first-no-1-album-billboard-200-chart/|url-status=live}}</ref> and was certified Platinum by the RIAA.<ref name=\"Gold & Platinum\"/> The album received mixed to positive reviews from critics.<ref>{{cite magazine|last1=Johnston|first1=Maura|author-link=Maura Johnston |title=Demi Lovato Lays It All Bare on 'Confident': Album Review|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/review/6730170/demi-confident-album-review|magazine=Billboard|access-date=October 16, 2015|archive-date=October 18, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151018153115/http://www.billboard.com/articles/review/6730170/demi-confident-album-review|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Ryan|first1=Patrick|title=Album of the week: Demi Lovato|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/music/reviews/2015/10/16/album-review-demi-lovato-confident/73876754/|newspaper=USA Today|access-date=October 16, 2015|archive-date=October 17, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151017081857/http://www.usatoday.com/story/life/music/reviews/2015/10/16/album-review-demi-lovato-confident/73876754/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Erlewine|first1=Stephen Thomas|author-link=Stephen Thomas Erlewine|title=''Confident'' \u2013 Demi Lovato|url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/confident-mw0002876585|publisher=[[AllMusic]]|access-date=October 17, 2015|archive-date=October 18, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151018201907/http://www.allmusic.com/album/confident-mw0002876585|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Reviews for Confident by Demi 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151018153109/http://www.metacritic.com/music/confident/demi-lovato|url-status=live}}</ref> [[Annie Zaleski]] from ''[[The A.V. Club]]'' stated that \"''Confident'' is an impressive album by a pop star who knows what she wants\u2014and also knows exactly how to get there.\"<ref>{{cite news|last1=Zaleski|first1=Annie|title=Demi Lovato comes into her own on Confident|url=http://www.avclub.com/review/demi-lovato-comes-her-own-confident-226542|newspaper=The A.V. Club|access-date=October 16, 2015|archive-date=October 18, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151018153249/http://www.avclub.com/review/demi-lovato-comes-her-own-confident-226542|url-status=live}}</ref> During the album's production, Lovato commented: \"I've already started recording for my new album, and I have plans to record during the tour. The sound just evolves into everything that I've been and everything that I want to become.\"<ref name=\"Lovato Exit\">{{cite magazine|title=Demi Lovato Leaving 'X Factor'|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/demi-lovato-leaving-x-factor-5840366/|magazine=Billboard|access-date=December 19, 2013|last1=Lewis|first1=Hillary|last2=Willis|first2=Cortney|date=December 19, 2013|archive-date=December 29, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211229170006/https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/demi-lovato-leaving-x-factor-5840366/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Legaspi|first=Althea|title=Buzz Bites: Demi Lovato Has Begun Recording Her Fifth Studio Album|website=[[MTV]]|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/2306588/demi-lovato-fifth-album-details/|date=February 10, 2014|access-date=April 5, 2014|archive-date=January 21, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160121095637/http://www.mtv.com/news/2306588/demi-lovato-fifth-album-details/|url-status=dead}}</ref> She further stated, \"I've never been so sure of myself as an artist when it comes down to confidence, but not only personal things, but exactly what I want my sound to be and what I know I'm capable of and this album will give me the opportunity to show people what I can really do.\"<ref>{{cite web|last=Williott|first=Carl|title=Demi Lovato Is Already Working On Album #5|url=http://www.idolator.com/7505121/demi-lovato-tour-fifth-album|work=[[Idolator (website)|Idolator]]|location=San Francisco, California|date=February 10, 2014|access-date=April 5, 2014|archive-date=March 5, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240305125528/https://www.idolator.com/7505121/demi-lovato-tour-fifth-album|url-status=live}}</ref> On October, she signed with the major modeling agency, [[Wilhelmina Models]].<ref>{{cite magazine|title=Demi Lovato Just Signed With a Major Modeling Agency|url=http://www.teenvogue.com/story/demi-lovato-signed-wilhelmina-major-modeling-agency|magazine=[[Teen Vogue]]|location=New York City|access-date=October 16, 2015|last1=Lewis|first1=Casey|date=October 16, 2015|archive-date=July 16, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230716093431/https://www.teenvogue.com/story/demi-lovato-signed-wilhelmina-major-modeling-agency|url-status=live}}</ref> Lovato released the music video for her R&B-infused song \"[[Waitin for You]]\" featuring rapper [[Sirah (rapper)|Sirah]] on October 22, 2015.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/demi-lovato-tough-waitin-for-you-confident-video-6738435/|title=Demi Lovato Gets Tough in 'Waitin for You' Video: Watch|magazine=Billboard|date=October 23, 2015|access-date=March 4, 2022|last=Stutz|first=Colin|archive-date=March 5, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220305032428/https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/demi-lovato-tough-waitin-for-you-confident-video-6738435/|url-status=live}}</ref> On October 26, 2015, Lovato and [[Nick Jonas]] announced that they would be touring together on the [[Future Now Tour]], to further promote ''Confident'', with shows in North America and Europe.<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Strecker|first=Eric|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/nick-jonas-demi-lovato-joint-tour-6738561/|title=Nick Jonas & Demi Lovato Announce Joint Future Now Tour|magazine=Billboard|access-date=March 4, 2022|date=October 26, 2015|archive-date=March 5, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220305032446/https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/nick-jonas-demi-lovato-joint-tour-6738561/|url-status=live}}</ref> Lovato was honored with the first-ever [[Billboard Women in Music#Rulebreaker Award|Rulebreaker Award]] at the [[Billboard Women in Music|2015 ''Billboard'' Women in Music]] event.<ref name=\"Rulebreaker\">{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/awards/demi-lovato-billboards-rulebreaker-women-in-music-6746374/|title=Demi Lovato to Receive Billboard's Inaugural 'Rulebreaker' Award; Will Perform at Women in Music|magazine=Billboard|access-date=March 4, 2022|date=November 2, 2015|archive-date=March 5, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220305032435/https://www.billboard.com/music/awards/demi-lovato-billboards-rulebreaker-women-in-music-6746374/|url-status=live}}</ref> On March 21, 2016, \"[[Stone Cold (Demi Lovato song)|Stone Cold]]\" was released as the third and final single from ''Confident''.<ref name=\"stonecold\">Sources regarding the contemporary hit radio release of \"Stone Cold\":\n* {{cite tweet|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160406152143/https://twitter.com/gthot20/status/710156449930993664|archive-date=April 6, Records|Republic Playbook]]|publisher=[[Republic Records]]}}</ref> On July 1, 2016, Lovato released a new single titled \"[[Body Say]]\" to promote her tour.<ref name=\"bodysay\">{{cite magazine|last=Iasimone|first=Ashley|title=Demi Lovato Releases Steamy New Song 'Body Say'|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/demi-lovato-body-say-released-listen-7424023/|access-date=March 4, with the [[GLAAD Vanguard Award]] at the [[27th GLAAD Media Awards]], for her support of the [[LGBT rights by country or territory|rights of the LGBT community]].<ref name=\"GLAAD Vanguard\">{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/awards/7318828/demi-lovato-caitlyn-jenner-2016-glaad-media-awards-winners|title=Demi Lovato, Caitlyn Jenner Receive 2016 GLAAD Media Lovato was also named to ''[[Forbes]]''' [[30 Under 30]] list in the music category.<ref name=\"forbeslist\">{{Cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/demi-lovato/?sh=370a9aba13d1|title=Demi 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221211124400/https://www.forbes.com/profile/demi-lovato/?sh=370a9aba13d1|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n===2017\u20132018: ''Tell Me You Love Me''===\n[[File:Demi Lovato 8 (41898569045).jpg|thumb|upright|Lovato performing in [[Glasgow]] on her [[Tell Me You Love Me World Tour]] in June 2018]]\nIn February 2017, Lovato executive-produced a documentary, ''Beyond Silence'', which follows three individuals and their experiences with [[Mental disorder|mental illnesses]] including [[bipolar disorder]], [[schizophrenia]], [[Major depressive disorder|depression]], and [[Anxiety disorder|anxiety]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/demi-lovato-executive-produces-beyond-silence-mental-health-documentary-1201994230/|last=Ahern|first=Sarah|title=Demi Lovato on Her New Documentary: Mental Health Is 'Just as Important as Physical Health'|access-date=March 1, 2017|date=February 22, 2017|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|archive-date=March 1, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170301182921/http://variety.com/2017/film/news/demi-lovato-executive-produces-beyond-silence-mental-health-documentary-1201994230/|url-status=live}}</ref> Lovato featured in [[Cheat Codes (DJs)|Cheat Codes]]' song \"[[No Promises (Cheat Codes song)|No Promises]]\", released in March 2017,<ref>{{cite web|last1=Malone|first1=Dolph|title=Cheat Codes & Demi Lovato's \"No Promises\" Heading To Pop Radio|url=https://headlineplanet.com/home/2017/03/30/cheat-codes-demi-lovatos-no-promises-heading-pop-radio/|website=Headline Planet|access-date=March 31, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181106144341/https://headlineplanet.com/home/2017/03/30/cheat-codes-demi-lovatos-no-promises-heading-pop-radio/|url-status=live}}</ref> and [[Jax Jones]]'s \"[[Instruction (song)|Instruction]]\" along with [[Stefflon Don]], released in June 2017.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Jax Jones Has Released A Snippet Of His Demi Lovato Collab & It Has Mad Carnival Vibes|url=http://www.capitalfm.com/artists/demi-lovato/news/jax-jones-instruction/|work=[[Capital (radio network)|Capital]]|date=June 14, 2017|access-date=June 14, 2016|archive-date=June 25, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180625083113/http://www.capitalfm.com/artists/demi-lovato/news/jax-jones-instruction/|url-status=live}}</ref> In 2017, Lovato was included in ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' magazine's annual list of the [[Time 100|100 most influential people in the world]].<ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://time.com/4747191/time-100-john-legend-demi-lovato-gala/|title=Time 100: John Legend and Demi Lovato to Perform at Gala|first=Mahita|last=Gajanan|access-date=April 20, 2017|magazine=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|archive-date=July 27, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170727033852/http://time.com/4747191/time-100-john-legend-demi-lovato-gala/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite 2017|magazine=Time|archive-date=October 19, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181019212644/http://time.com/4745798/time-100-2017-full-list/|url-status=live}}</ref> On May 8, 2017, she announced a collaboration with sportswear line [[Fabletics]] to support the [[United Nations]]' initiative, Girl Up.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-kate-hudson-fabletics-line-girl-up-7785106/|title=Demi Lovato Teams Up With Kate Hudson's Fabletics Line to Support Girl Up|magazine=Billboard|last=Saunders|first=Nicole|date=May 8, 2017|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=March 5, Lovato released \"[[Sorry Not Sorry (Demi Lovato song)|Sorry Not Sorry]]\" as the lead single from her sixth studio album,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/3024567/demi-lovato-sorry-not-sorry/|title=Demi Lovato to Release New Single 'Sorry Not Sorry' July 11|publisher=MTV News|access-date=September 22, 2017|date=July 11, 2017|first=Deepa|last=Lakshmin|archive-date=October 5, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181005063642/http://www.mtv.com/news/3024567/demi-lovato-sorry-not-sorry/|url-status=dead}}</ref> which became her highest-charting song in New Zealand and the United States at number six<ref name=\"NZ\">{{cite web|url=https://charts.nz/showinterpret.asp?interpret=Demi+Lovato|title=Discography Demi Lovato|publisher=New Zealand Charts|access-date=October 30, 2017|archive-date=February 15, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180215205059/http://charts.nz/showinterpret.asp?interpret=Demi+Lovato|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite well as Australia at number eight.<ref>{{cite web|title=Taylor Swift holds #1 for second week|url=http://www.ariacharts.com.au/news/2017/taylor-swift-holds-1-for-second-week|publisher=Australian Recording Industry Association|date=September 9, 2017|access-date=October 7, 2017|archive-date=September 17, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170917034506/http://www.ariacharts.com.au/news/2017/taylor-swift-holds-1-for-second-week|url-status=live}}</ref> It also became her best-selling single in the US for its 5\u00d7 Platinum certification by RIAA.<ref>{{Cite tweet|number=1220114014799310849|title=Demi's new certifieds in the United States: Sorry Not Sorry \u2014 5\u00d7 Platinum Charts|user=chartdlovato|date=January 22, 2020|access-date=January 23, 2020}}</ref> The album, titled ''[[Tell Me You Love Me (album)|Tell Me You Love Me]]'', was released on September 29 and debuted at number three on the US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] with first-week sales of 78,000 copies.<ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-announces-new-album-tell-me-you-love-me-253178/|title=Demi Lovato Announces New Album 'Tell Me You Love Me'|magazine=[[Rolling 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612144147/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/demi-lovato-announces-new-album-tell-me-you-love-me-w499316|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=BBdebut>{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/pro/shania-twain-now-debuts-no-1-billboard-200-albums-chart/|last=Caulfield|first=Keith|title=Shania Twain's 'Now' Debuts at No. 1 on from music critics and became Lovato's first album to be certified Platinum in the US.<ref name=\"metacritic\">{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/music/tell-me-you-love-me/demi-lovato|title=Demi Lovato released ''[[Demi Lovato: Simply Complicated]]'' on [[YouTube]], a documentary focusing on her career and personal struggles.<ref>{{cite October 2017, Lovato announced the tour dates for the North American leg of her [[Tell Me You Love Me World Tour]], with special guests [[DJ Khaled]] and [[Kehlani]]. She confirmed European and South American legs of the tour in the following months, and the tour commenced in February 2018.<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Blistein|first=Jon|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/demi-lovato-plots-2018-tour-with-dj-khaled-w510328|title=Demi Lovato Plots 2018 Tour With DJ Khaled|magazine=[[Rolling 2018|archive-date=February 2, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230202141249/https://popcrush.com/demi-lovato-tell-me-you-love-me-tour/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nIn November 2017, Lovato released the single \"[[\u00c9chame la Culpa]]\" with Puerto Rican singer [[Luis Fonsi]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.etonline.com/demi-lovato-and-luis-fonsi-drop-fiery-music-video-their-spanish-song-echame-la-culpa-watch-91243|title=Demi Lovato and Luis Fonsi Drop the Fiery Music Video For Their Lovato performed at the [[March for Our Lives]] anti-gun violence rally in Washington, D.C. on March 24, 2018.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/demi-lovato-apos-performance-skyscraper-200620381.html|title=Demi Lovato's performance of \"Skyscraper\" at March for Our Lives will send actual chills through 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210803150406/https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/demi-lovato-apos-performance-skyscraper-200620381.html|url-status=live}}</ref> In May, Lovato was featured on [[Christina Aguilera]]'s \"[[Fall in Line]]\" and [[Clean Bandit]]'s \"[[Solo (Clean Bandit song)|Solo]]\".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/christina-aguilera-and-demi-lovato-release-their-much-anticipated-collaboration-fall-in-line__22928/|title=Christina Aguilera and Demi Lovato release their much-anticipated collaboration Fall In Line|publisher=Official Charts Company|last=White|first=Jack|date=May 16, 2018|access-date=May 19, 2018|archive-date=May 18, news|last=Wass|first=Mike|title=Demi Lovato Lends Her Voice To Clean Bandit's Next Single, \"Solo\"|url=https://www.idolator.com/7679512/demi-lovato-clean-bandit-new-single-solo|access-date=May 18, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200527190122/https://www.idolator.com/7679512/demi-lovato-clean-bandit-new-single-solo|url-status=live}}</ref> The latter became Lovato's first number-one song in the United Kingdom.<ref>{{cite web|last=Myers|first=Justin|url=http://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/clean-bandit-and-demi-lovato-take-solo-to-number-1-we-cant-believe-it-__23225/|title=Clean Bandit and Demi Lovato take Solo to On June 21, Lovato released a new single, titled \"[[Sober (Demi Lovato song)|Sober]]\", which she referred to as \"my truth\"; it discusses struggles with addiction and sobriety.<ref>{{cite news |title=Demi Lovato sings about addiction struggles on 'Sober' |url=http://www.thenewstribune.com/entertainment/celebrities/article213598949.html |newspaper=[[The News Tribune]] |access-date=June 23, 2018 |date=June 21, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180623222023/http://www.thenewstribune.com/entertainment/celebrities/article213598949.html |archive-date=June 23, 2018 |url-status=dead}}</ref> The Tell Me You Love Me World Tour concluded the following month, having originally been scheduled to end in November 2018.<ref>{{cite news|last=Halperin|first=Shirley|url=https://variety.com/2018/music/news/demi-lovato-concert-canceled-hospital-overdose-1202883262/|title=Demi Lovato Concert Canceled Following Hospitalization for Suspected Overdose|website=Variety|date=July 24, 2018|access-date=November 15, 2021|archive-date=March 5, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240305125527/https://variety.com/2018/music/news/demi-lovato-concert-canceled-hospital-overdose-1202883262/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Murphy|first=Desiree|title=Demi Lovato Temporarily Leaves Rehab for Further Treatment in Another Facility|url=https://www.etonline.com/demi-lovato-temporarily-leaves-rehab-for-further-treatment-in-another-facility-107752|website=[[Entertainment Tonight]]|date=August 10, 2018|access-date=November 15, 2021|archive-date=March 5, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240305125554/https://www.etonline.com/demi-lovato-temporarily-leaves-rehab-for-further-treatment-in-another-facility-107752|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n===2019\u20132021: Acting return and ''Dancing with the Devil... the Art of Starting Over''===\nOn May 11, 2019, Lovato revealed she had signed with a new manager, [[Scooter Braun]].<ref name=\"variety.com\">{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2019/music/news/demi-lovato-signs-scooter-braun-manager-1203212073/|title=Demi Lovato Signs With Scooter Braun for Management|date=May 12, 2019|website=Variety|access-date=May 13, 2019|archive-date=May 12, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190512194924/https://variety.com/2019/music/news/demi-lovato-signs-scooter-braun-manager-1203212073/|url-status=live}}</ref> She shared that she \"couldn't be happier, inspired and excited to begin this next chapter\".<ref name=\"variety.com\" /> In August 2019, it was revealed that Lovato would appear in ''[[Eurovision Song Contest: The Story of Fire Saga]]'', a [[Netflix]] original film, directed by [[David Dobkin (director)|David Dobkin]], based on the song competition [[Eurovision Song Contest|of the same name]]. The film was ultimately released on June 26, 2020, and starred [[Will Ferrell]] and [[Rachel McAdams]].<ref name=\"Billboard Eurovision\">{{cite magazine|first=Ashley|last=Iasimone|url=https://www.billboard.com/culture/tv-film/demi-lovato-eurovision-will-ferrell-cast-announcement-8527879/|title=Will Ferrell Welcomes Demi Lovato to 'Eurovision' Cast|date=August 20, 2019|magazine=Billboard|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=March 5, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220305032439/https://www.billboard.com/culture/tv-film/demi-lovato-eurovision-will-ferrell-cast-announcement-8527879/|url-status=live}}</ref> This marked Lovato's first acting appearance since her guest role on ''[[Glee (TV series)|Glee]]'' in 2013 and her first film role since ''[[Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam]]'' (2010). Later in the month, after teasing that she had been working on a new project, Lovato revealed her return to television with a recurring guest role in the final season of the [[NBC]] sitcom ''[[Will & Grace]]'', where she played Will's surrogate.<ref name=\"eonline.com\">{{cite web|first=Chris|last=Harnick|url=https://www.eonline.com/news/1068218/demi-lovato-joins-will-and-grace-s-final-season|title=Demi Lovato Joins Will and Grace's Final Season|date=August 27, 2019|website=[[E! News]]|publisher=[[NBCUniversal]]|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=March 5, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220305032427/https://www.eonline.com/news/1068218/demi-lovato-joins-will-and-grace-s-final-season|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nIn January 2020, Lovato made her first musical appearance since her hiatus with a performance of single \"[[Anyone (Demi Lovato song)|Anyone]]\" at the [[62nd Annual Grammy Awards]].<ref>{{Cite magazine|last=Bruner|first=Raisa|date=January 27, 2020|title=Demi Lovato Brought the Audience to Its Feet In Her Grammys Return|url=https://time.com/5772107/demi-lovato-grammys/|access-date=January 27, 2020|magazine=Time|archive-date=January 27, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200127064100/https://time.com/5772107/demi-lovato-grammys/|url-status=live}}</ref> The song, which was recorded four days prior to her 2018 drug overdose, was released on iTunes immediately after. On February 2, 2020, Lovato performed \"[[The Star-Spangled Banner]]\" at [[Super Bowl LIV]].<ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.si.com/nfl/2020/02/02/demi-lovato-super-bowl-liv-national-anthem-video-chiefs-49ers|title=Watch: Demi Lovato Sings National Anthem at Super Bowl LIV|last=Swinton|first=Elizabeth|date=February 2, 2020|magazine=[[Sports Illustrated]]|access-date=February 2, 2020|archive-date=May 13, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210513195732/https://www.si.com/nfl/2020/02/02/demi-lovato-super-bowl-liv-national-anthem-video-chiefs-49ers|url-status=live}}</ref> On March 6, Lovato released a new single titled \"[[I Love Me (song)|I Love Me]]\".<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.cnn.com/2020/03/06/entertainment/demi-lovato-i-love-me-music-video/index.html|title=Demi Lovato drops new single and music video for 'I Love Me'|first=Chloe|last=Melas|publisher=CNN|date=March 6, 2020|access-date=March 11, 2020|archive-date=March 7, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200307081641/https://www.cnn.com/2020/03/06/entertainment/demi-lovato-i-love-me-music-video/index.html|url-status=live}}</ref> The release was supplemented by both a guest appearance and guest-host role on ''[[The Ellen DeGeneres Show]]''. On April 16, she released a collaboration with [[Sam Smith]] titled \"[[I'm Ready (Sam Smith and Demi Lovato song)|I'm Ready]]\".<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.pressparty.com/pg/newsdesk/CapitolMusicGroup/view/209098/|title=Sam Smith and Demi Lovato announce new single|website=Pressparty|access-date=April 14, 2020|archive-date=May 15, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200515085443/https://www.pressparty.com/pg/newsdesk/CapitolMusicGroup/view/209098/|url-status=live}}</ref> ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' ranked this song at number 32 on its list of The 50 Most Inspirational LGBTQ Songs of All Time.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-lists/best-inspirational-lgbtq-anthems-pride-songs-1234773829/|title=The 50 Most Inspirational LGBTQ Songs of All Time|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=June 28, 2023|access-date=June 29, 2023|archive-date=June 29, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230629001056/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-lists/best-inspirational-lgbtq-anthems-pride-songs-1234773829/|url-status=live}}</ref> A remix of \"[[Lonely Hearts (JoJo song)|Lonely Hearts]]\" by [[JoJo (singer)|JoJo]] featuring Lovato was released on August 28, 2020.<ref>{{Cite magazine|date=August 5, 2020|title=JoJo Calls to Call on Demi Lovato for Upcoming 'Lonely Hearts' Remix|first=Rania|last=Aniftos|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/jojo-demi-lovato-lonely-hearts-remix-9429906/|access-date=March 4, 2022|magazine=Billboard|archive-date=March 5, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220305032433/https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/jojo-demi-lovato-lonely-hearts-remix-9429906/|url-status=live}}</ref> At the [[2020 MTV Video Music Awards]], Lovato received two nominations for her song \"I Love Me\", becoming the first artist in VMA history to receive a nomination every year for eight consecutive years.<ref>{{Cite magazine|date=July 30, 2020|first=Gab|last=Ginsberg|title=Ariana Grande & Lady Gaga Lead 2020 MTV VMA Nominations: See Full List|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/awards/2020-mtv-vma-nominations-full-list-9427019/|access-date=March 4, 2022|magazine=Billboard|archive-date=May 19, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220519172850/https://www.billboard.com/music/awards/2020-mtv-vma-nominations-full-list-9427019/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{Cite tweet|user=mikeadamonair|number=1289624464854888448|title=#DemiLovato is now the first artist in #VMAs history to receive a nomination every year for EIGHT consecutive years, since her first nom in 2012. \"I Love Me\" is nominated in the 'Video for Good' category this year. pic.twitter.com/YMjpNkeAvt|date=August 1, 2020|access-date=August 11, 2020}}</ref> On September 10, Lovato released a collaboration with American DJ [[Marshmello]], titled \"[[OK Not to Be OK]]\", in partnership with the [[Hope For The Day]] [[suicide prevention]] movement.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.idolator.com/7914193/demi-lovato-marshmello-announce-ok-not-to-be-ok|title=Demi Lovato & Marshmello Announce \"OK Not To Be OK\"|work=[[Idolator (website)|Idolator]]|date=September 8, 2020|access-date=September 9, 2020|archive-date=March 5, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240305130048/https://www.idolator.com/7914193/demi-lovato-marshmello-announce-ok-not-to-be-ok|url-status=live}}</ref> On September 30, 2020, Lovato released \"[[Still Have Me]]\" via Twitter; the song was later released on digital platforms.<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Rowley|first=Glenn|date=September 30, 2020|title=Demi Lovato Unveils Somber Ballad 'Still Have Me' Following Max Ehrich Breakup: Listen|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/demi-lovato-still-have-me-9457558/|magazine=Billboard|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=March 5, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220305032426/https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/demi-lovato-still-have-me-9457558/|url-status=live}}</ref> On October 14, she released a political ballad titled \"[[Commander in Chief (song)|Commander in Chief]]\", ahead of the [[2020 United States presidential election|2020 presidential election]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Melas |first=Chloe |title=Demi Lovato has a few words for President Trump |url=https://www.cnn.com/2020/10/14/entertainment/demi-lovato-commander-in-chief-song-interview/index.html |publisher=CNN |date=October 14, 2020 |access-date=October 14, 2020 |archive-date=November 10, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211110015432/https://www.cnn.com/2020/10/14/entertainment/demi-lovato-commander-in-chief-song-interview/index.html |url-status=live }}</ref> She hosted the [[46th People's Choice Awards]] on November 15, 2020.<ref>{{Cite web|date=October 27, 2020|title=Demi Lovato to Host the 2020 E! People's Choice Awards|url=https://www.eonline.com/news/1202042/demi-lovato-to-host-the-2020-e-peoples-choice-awards|access-date=October 28, 2020|website=E! Online|archive-date=December 19, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211219152848/https://www.eonline.com/news/1202042/demi-lovato-to-host-the-2020-e-peoples-choice-awards|url-status=live}}</ref> On November 20, she featured on American rapper [[Jeezy]]'s song \"My Reputation\" from his album ''[[The Recession 2]]''. On December 4, Lovato featured on a remix of the song \"[[Monsters (All Time Low song)|Monsters]]\" by rock band [[All Time Low]], alongside [[Blackbear (musician)|Blackbear]].<ref>{{Cite web|title=Are All Time Low Teasing A Collaboration With Demi Lovato?|url=https://www.kerrang.com/the-news/are-all-time-low-teasing-a-collaboration-with-demi-lovato/|access-date=December 3, 2020|website=Kerrang!|date=December 3, 2020|archive-date=May 17, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210517160430/https://www.kerrang.com/the-news/are-all-time-low-teasing-a-collaboration-with-demi-lovato/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nLovato was chosen to perform during ''[[Celebrating America]]'', the [[primetime television]] special marking the [[inauguration of Joe Biden]]. Lovato sang \"[[Lovely Day]]\" by [[Bill Withers]], with appearances from President [[Joe Biden]] with his grandson.\n\nA four-part documentary series following Lovato's life premiered on [[YouTube]] in March 2021.<ref>{{Cite magazine|title=Demi Lovato to Revisit 'Darkest Point' of Her Life for 'Dancing With the Devil' Docuseries|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/demi-lovato-youtube-originals-docuseries-dancing-with-the-devil-9510795/|access-date=March 4, 2022|magazine=Billboard|date=January 13, 2021|archive-date=April 26, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230426084134/https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/demi-lovato-youtube-originals-docuseries-dancing-with-the-devil-9510795/|url-status=live}}</ref> The series, titled ''[[Demi Lovato: Dancing with the Devil]]'', was directed by Michael D. Ratner and showcased her personal and musical journey over the past three years.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Haylock|first=Zoe|date=June 25, 2020|title=A New Demi Lovato Docuseries Is Coming to YouTube to Break Us|url=https://www.vulture.com/2020/06/new-demi-lovato-documentary-coming-to-youtube.html|access-date=August 2, 2020|website=[[vulture.com|Vulture]]|archive-date=April 26, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230426075632/https://www.vulture.com/2020/06/new-demi-lovato-documentary-coming-to-youtube.html|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=White|first=Peter|date=June 25, 2020|title=YouTube Gets Back With Demi Lovato With Four-Part Documentary Series|url=https://deadline.com/2020/06/youtube-demi-lovato-documentary-series-1202969255/|access-date=August 2, 2020|website=Deadline|archive-date=November 13, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201113054046/https://deadline.com/2020/06/youtube-demi-lovato-documentary-series-1202969255/|url-status=live}}</ref> It was later announced that Lovato's seventh studio album, titled ''[[Dancing with the Devil... the Art of Starting Over]]'', would be released on April 2, 2021. Lovato defined it \"the non-official soundtrack to the documentary\".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.iheartradio.ca/news/demi-lovato-shares-new-album-details-1.14778379|first=John R.|last=Kennedy|title=Demi Lovato Shares New Album Details|publisher=iHeartRadio|date=March 16, 2021|access-date=March 16, 2021|archive-date=August 3, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210803150409/https://www.iheartradio.ca/news/demi-lovato-shares-new-album-details-1.14778379|url-status=live}}</ref> The album features collaborations with [[Ariana Grande]], [[Noah Cyrus]] and [[Saweetie]], as well as the previously released \"[[What Other People Say]]\", a collaboration between Lovato and Australian singer-songwriter [[Sam Fischer]], initially released on February 4, 2021.<ref>{{cite web|last=Blakemore|first=Peyton|date=February 5, 2021|title=Demi Lovato Teams Up With Sam Fischer For New Song 'What Other People Say'|url=https://www.iheart.com/content/2021-02-05-demi-lovato-teams-up-with-sam-fischer-for-new-song-what-other-people-say/|access-date=March 16, 2021|publisher=iHeartRadio|archive-date=April 26, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230426082856/https://www.iheart.com/content/2021-02-05-demi-lovato-teams-up-with-sam-fischer-for-new-song-what-other-people-say/|url-status=live}}</ref> ''Dancing with the Devil... the Art of Starting Over'' debuted at number two on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] with first-week sales of 74,000 album-equivalent units in the US.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/pro/justin-bieber-justice-returns-to-number-one-billboard-200/|first=Keith|last=Caulfield|title=Justin Bieber's 'Justice' Returns to No. 1 on Billboard 200 Albums Chart|magazine=Billboard|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=April 22, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230422044937/https://www.billboard.com/pro/justin-bieber-justice-returns-to-number-one-billboard-200/|url-status=live}}</ref> Prior to the release of the album, Lovato released one of the two title tracks \"[[Dancing with the Devil (song)|Dancing with the Devil]]\" on March 26,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://pitchfork.com/news/demi-lovato-releases-new-song-dancing-with-the-devil-listen/|first=Evan|last=Minsker|title=Demi Lovato Releases New Song \"Dancing With the Devil\": Listen|website=Pitchfork|date=March 26, 2021|access-date=March 26, 2021|archive-date=March 27, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210327132137/https://pitchfork.com/news/demi-lovato-releases-new-song-dancing-with-the-devil-listen/|url-status=live}}</ref> and \"[[Met Him Last Night]]\" on April 1, 2021.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-ariana-grande-met-him-last-night-interview-1150415/|title=Demi Lovato Talks Collaborating With Ariana Grande on 'Met Him Last Night'|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=April 2, 2021|access-date=April 6, 2021|archive-date=October 29, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211029174416/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-ariana-grande-met-him-last-night-interview-1150415/|url-status=live}}</ref> The [[Dave Aud\u00e9]] remix of the song was nominated for [[Grammy Award for Best Remixed Recording, Non-Classical|Best Remixed Recording]] at the [[64th Annual Grammy Awards]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.grammy.com/grammys/news/2022-grammys-nominations-64th-annual-grammy-awards-announced-nov-23|title=2022 GRAMMYs Awards Show: Complete Nominations List|access-date=December 22, 20, 2021, Lovato released the \"[[Melon Cake]]\" music video.<ref name=\"vulture.com\">{{cite magazine |url=https://www.vulture.com/2021/08/watch-demi-lovatos-melon-cake-birthday-music-video.html |title=Demi Lovato's New Single Is a Break-Up Song for Melons |first=Rebecca |last=Alter |date=August 21, 2021 |magazine=Vulture |access-date=August 22, 2021 |archive-date=April 26, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230426082855/https://www.vulture.com/2021/08/watch-demi-lovatos-melon-cake-birthday-music-video.html |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\nLovato launched a podcast series titled ''[[4D with Demi Lovato]]'' on May 19, 2021, with new episodes releasing every Wednesday.<ref>{{Cite web|date=March 30, 2021|title=Demi Lovato launching her own podcast|url=https://www.yardbarker.com/entertainment/articles/demi_lovato_launching_her_own_podcast/s1_13132_34501706|access-date=April 25, 2021|website=Yardbarker|archive-date=October 29, Confirmed guests for the podcast include [[Chelsea Handler]], [[Jane Fonda]], [[Jameela Jamil]], [[Alok Vaid-Menon]], and [[Glennon Doyle]].<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-new-podcast-4d-1168532/|title=Demi Lovato to Launch New Podcast '4D'|date=May 12, 2021|access-date=May 19, 2021|magazine=Rolling Stone|first=Jon|last=Blistein|archive-date=August 23, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230823151129/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-new-podcast-4d-1168532/|url-status=live}}</ref> On July 30, 2021, a talk show hosted by Lovato titled ''[[The Demi Lovato Show]]'' was released on [[The Roku Channel]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bustle.com/entertainment/the-demi-lovato-show-trailer-celebrity-guests-experts-premiere-date|title=Watch An Exclusive First Look & See The Guest List For Demi Lovato's New Talk Show|website=[[Bustle (website)|Bustle]]|first=Brad|last=Witter|date=July 21, 2021|access-date=August 2, 2021|archive-date=August 2, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210802160058/https://www.bustle.com/entertainment/the-demi-lovato-show-trailer-celebrity-guests-experts-premiere-date|url-status=live}}</ref> Consisting of ten-minute episodes, it features candid, unfiltered conversations between Lovato and both expert and celebrity guests, exploring topics such as activism, body positivity, gender identity, sex, relationships, social media, and wellness.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Pedersen|first=Erik|date=February 6, 2020|title=Demi Lovato Talk Show Gets Quibi Greenlight|url=https://deadline.com/2020/02/demi-lovato-quibi-talk-show-1202852886/|access-date=January 26, 2021|website=Deadline|archive-date=April 26, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230426231157/https://deadline.com/2020/02/demi-lovato-quibi-talk-show-1202852886/|url-status=live}}</ref> The show had initially been announced in February 2020 to air on [[Quibi]] under the title ''Pillow Talk with Demi Lovato'' before Quibi sold its contents to Roku.<ref>{{Cite web|date=February 6, 2020|title=Quibi Sets Demi Lovato Talk Show 'Pillow Talk With Demi Lovato'|url=https://www.thewrap.com/quibi-sets-demi-lovato-talk-show-pillow-talk-with-demi-lovato/|access-date=March 11, 2020|website=TheWrap|archive-date=April 26, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230426082855/https://www.thewrap.com/quibi-sets-demi-lovato-talk-show-pillow-talk-with-demi-lovato/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Spangler|first=Todd|date=January 8, 2021|title=Roku Acquires Global Rights to 75-Plus Quibi Shows, Will Stream Them for Free|url=https://variety.com/2021/digital/news/roku-acquires-quibi-shows-free-streaming-1234881238/|access-date=January 26, 2021|website=Variety|archive-date=January 8, American rapper [[G-Eazy]] released \"[[Breakdown (G-Eazy song)|Breakdown]]\" featuring Lovato as the second single from his album ''[[These Things Happen Too]]''.<ref>{{Cite magazine|last=Mamo|first=Heran|date=September 17, 2021|title=G-Eazy & Demi Lovato Confront Their Most Harrowing Headlines in 'Breakdown' Video|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/rb-hip-hop/g-eazy-demi-lovato-breakdown-music-video-9632129/|access-date=March 4, 2022|magazine=Billboard|archive-date=February 27, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230227202936/https://www.billboard.com/music/rb-hip-hop/g-eazy-demi-lovato-breakdown-music-video-9632129/|url-status=live}}</ref> On September 30, Lovato launched a four-episode series titled ''Unidentified with Demi Lovato'' on [[Peacock (service)|Peacock]].<ref>{{Cite magazine|last=Aniftos|first=Rania|date=September 29, 2021|title=How to Watch 'Unidentified With Demi Lovato' Online|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/unidentified-with-demi-lovato-watch-stream-online-9638199/|access-date=March 4, 2022|magazine=Billboard|archive-date=March 5, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220305032457/https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/unidentified-with-demi-lovato-watch-stream-online-9638199/|url-status=live}}</ref> The show follows Lovato as she searches for signs of [[extraterrestrial life]] with her sister Dallas and friend Matthew Montgomery.<ref>{{Cite magazine|last=Kinane|first=Ruth|date=September 27, 2021|title=Demi Lovato dishes on alien abductions and making contact on UFO docuseries ''Unidentified''|url=https://ew.com/tv/demi-lovato-unidentified-interview/|access-date=October 29, 2021|magazine=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|archive-date=September 21, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230921222426/https://ew.com/tv/demi-lovato-unidentified-interview/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n===2022\u2013present: ''Holy Fvck'' and ''Revamped''===\n[[File:Demi Bogot\u00e1 20220709.jpg|thumb|upright|Lovato performing in [[Bogot\u00e1]] on her [[Holy Fvck Tour]] in September 2022]]\nIn early 2022, Lovato began teasing her eighth studio album, and described it as \"more rock than anything\".<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Rubin |first=Julia Lynn |date=May 9, 2022 |title=Living for the Moment |url=https://www.inkedmag.com/original-news/demi-lovato |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220608205324/https://www.inkedmag.com/original-news/demi-lovato |archive-date=June 8, 2022 |access-date=June 8, 2022 |magazine=[[Inked (magazine)|Inked]] }}</ref> She stated that the record is reminiscent of her debut studio album, ''[[Don't Forget]]'' (2008), and would explore \"heaviness\" in its sound.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Gelhoren |first=Giovana |date=April 22, 2022 |title=Demi Lovato Says They Are 'So Proud' of Forthcoming Album: 'It's My Absolute Best Yet' |url=https://people.com/music/demi-lovato-proud-of-forthcoming-album-my-absolute-best-yet/ |magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]] |access-date=May 17, 2022 |archive-date=June 7, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220607190535/https://people.com/music/demi-lovato-proud-of-forthcoming-album-my-absolute-best-yet/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Lovato further called the album her \"absolute best yet\" and \"so representative of [her]\".<ref>{{Cite magazine|last=Dailey|first=Hannah|date=April 22, 2022|title=Demi Lovato Teases New Album: It's 'So Representative of Me'|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-teases-new-album-1235062445/|access-date=May 14, 2022|magazine=Billboard|archive-date=June 5, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220605230136/https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-teases-new-album-1235062445/|url-status=live}}</ref> In February, the singer appeared on \"FIIMY (Fuck It, I Miss You)\", a collaboration with [[Winnetka Bowling League]]; its live rendition followed later that month.<ref name=\"Fiimy_RS\">* {{Cite magazine |last=Mier |first=Tom\u00e1s |date=February 17, 2022 |title=Demi Lovato Is 'Good' with Being Alone. But Their New Winnetka Bowling League Collab Deals With Past Heartbreak |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-matthew-koma-talk-fiimy-1292843/ |url-access=subscription |access-date=March 24, 2023 |magazine=Rolling Stone |archive-date=June 8, 2022 \"[[Skin of My Teeth]]\", the lead single from Lovato's forthcoming album, was released on June 10, 2022.<ref>* {{Cite magazine |last=Dailey |first=Hannah |title=Demi Lovato Drops 'Holy Fvck' Lead }}\n* {{Cite web|first=Michele|last=Mendez|title=Demi's Pop-Punk Era Is Here by the \"Skin of My premiered the song a day earlier on ''[[The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon]]''.<ref name=\"BillboardFallon2022\">{{Cite magazine|first=Starr|last=Bowenbank|date=June 10, 2022|title=Demi Lovato Made New Album While 'Clean & Sober': 'I'm Really, Really Proud'|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-made-new-album-while-sober-1235085489/|access-date=June 11, of the album was officially announced as ''[[Holy Fvck]]'', along with its cover art and a trailer; it was released on August 19, 2022.<ref name=\"BillboardHolyFvck\">{{Cite magazine|last=Aniftos|first=Rania|date=June 6, 2022|title=Demi Lovato Announces New Album 'Holy Fvck' & Release \"[[Substance (song)|Substance]]\" and \"[[29 (Demi Lovato song)|29]]\", in July and August.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Zemler |first=Emily |date=July 15, 2022 |title=Demi Lovato Evokes Old School It also topped the ''Billboard'' Top Rock Albums and Top Alternative Albums charts.<ref>{{Cite magazine|first=Kevin|last=Rutherford|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/chart-beat/demi-lovato-five-finger-death-punch-rock-album-charts-1235132792/|title=Demi Lovato & Five Finger Death Punch Crown support of the album, she embarked on the [[Holy Fvck Tour]], which commenced in [[Springfield, Illinois]] on August 13, 2022, and ended in [[Rosemont, Illinois|Rosemont]], Illinois on November 10.<ref name=\"HFTour\">{{Cite magazine|last=Kaufman|first=Gil|date=June 7, 2022|title=Demi Lovato Announces Dates for Holy Fvck Fall 2022 advertising the album and featuring Lovato in a bondage-style outfit lying on a cushioned crucifix was banned in the UK by the [[Advertising Standards Authority (United Kingdom)|Advertising Standards Authority]] for being \"likely to cause serious offence to Christians\".<ref>* {{Cite news |last=Meierhans |first=Jennifer |title=Demi Lovato poster banned for being offensive to Christians March 3, 2023, Lovato released \"[[Still Alive (Demi Lovato song)|Still Alive]]\", the lead single for the [[Scream VI (soundtrack)|soundtrack]] to the slasher film ''[[Scream VI]]''.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Brandle |first=Lars |title=Demi Lovato Unleashes 'Scream VI' Cut 'Still Alive': Stream It Now nomination for the [[MTV Movie & TV Awards|MTV Movie & TV Award]] for Best Song.<ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/awards/2023-mtv-movie-tv-awards-winners-list-1235323674/|title=Here Are the 2023 MTV Movie & TV Awards Winners: Full version of her 2013 song \"[[Heart Attack (Demi Lovato song)#\"Heart Attack (Rock Version)\"|Heart Attack]]\" on tour, Lovato officially released it with re-recorded vocals on March 24.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Mier |first=Tom\u00e1s |title=Demi Lovato Reimagines 'Heart Attack' as a Rock Anthem for Song's 10th Anniversary |url-status=live }}</ref> In the following months, she continued to release rock versions of her previous hits, \"[[Cool for the Summer#\"Cool for the Summer (Rock Version)\"|Cool for the Summer]]\" and \"[[Sorry Not Sorry (Demi Lovato song)#\"Sorry Not Sorry (Rock Version)\"|Sorry Not Sorry]]\" (the latter featuring guitarist [[Slash (musician)|Slash]]), with a \"darker sound backed by electric guitars and grittier lyric delivery from Lovato.\"<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Bowenbank |first=Starr |title=Demi Lovato Updates 'Cool For the Summer' With New Rock Version: Listen ''[[Forbes]]'' said that re-recording her hits as \"rock anthems\" is a \"brilliant business move,\" and stated that it \"showcases her artistic versatility and demonstrates her willingness to evolve as an artist.\"<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=McIntyre |first=Hugh |title=Demi Lovato Is Re-Recording Her Hits As Rock Anthems, Which Is A Brilliant Business Move |url-status=live }}</ref> In May, Lovato guest-starred as herself in \"Met Gala\", the eighth episode of the third season of comedy series ''[[Dave (TV series)|Dave]]''.<ref>{{Cite magazine |url-status=live }}</ref> On June 22, she surprise-released the song \"[[Swine (Demi Lovato song)|Swine]]\" as a protest song two days before the one-year anniversary of the [[Supreme Court of the United States|Supreme Court]]'s decision to overturn ''[[Roe v. Wade]]''.<ref name=\"swine\">{{Cite magazine |last1=Paul |first1=Larisha |title=Demi Lovato Wages War to Protect Reproductive Rights on Protest Single 'Swine' |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-releases-protest-song-swine-addressing-abortion-rights-1234776097/ |magazine=Rolling Stone |date=June 22, 2023 |access-date=July 10, 2023 |archive-date=July 6, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230706003807/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-releases-protest-song-swine-addressing-abortion-rights-1234776097/ |url-status=live }}</ref> A [[charity single]], Lovato's net profits from it were donated to the Demi Lovato Foundation's Reproductive Justice Fund for a year, which used the proceeds to support the nonprofits: [[NARAL Pro-Choice America]], [[Plan C]], and the [[National Network of Abortion Funds]].<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Denis |first=Kyle |date=June 22, 2023 |title=Demi Lovato Drops New Song 'Swine' Inspired by 1-Year Anniversary of ''Roe v. }}</ref>\n\nOn July 14, 2023, accompanying the release of the rock version of \"Sorry Not Sorry\", she announced her first remix album titled ''[[Revamped]]'', which features ten re-recordings of previous songs in rock format; it was released on September 15, 2023.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last1=Mier |first1=Tom\u00e1s |title=Demi Lovato Will 'Reenvision' Their Pop Hits as Rock Bangers on Upcoming In a press release, she said: \"breathing new life into the songs that played such a huge role in my career has allowed me to feel so much closer to my music than ever before.\"<ref>{{Cite magazine |url-status=live }}</ref> Also in August, it was revealed that Lovato was no longer represented by Scooter Braun and SB Projects, having left his management that July.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Havens |first=Lyndsey |date=August 21, 2023 |title=Demi Lovato Splits With Manager Scooter Braun |url=https://www.billboard.com/pro/demi-lovato-leaves-manager-scooter-braun-sb-projects/ |url-access=subscription |access-date=January 4, 2024 |magazine=Billboard |archive-date=January 8, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240108005143/https://www.billboard.com/pro/demi-lovato-leaves-manager-scooter-braun-sb-projects/ |url-status=live }}</ref> She signed with Brandon Creed and his Good World Management in September.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Aswad |first=Jem |date=September 8, 2023 |title=Demi Lovato Signs With Brandon Creed for Management |url=https://variety.com/2023/music/news/demi-lovato-signs-with-brandon-creed-management-1235717858/ |access-date=January 4, 2024 |magazine=Variety |archive-date=January 4, 2024 2023, Lovato did a special performance in the \"Kickoff Show\" for the [[The Masked Singer (American season 10)|tenth season]] of ''[[The Masked Singer (American TV series)|The Masked Singer]]'' as \"Anonymouse\".<ref>{{cite magazine|title=''The Masked Singer'' season 10 premiere kickoff reveals special all-star unmasking|url=https://ew.com/tv/the-masked-singer-season-10-premiere-kickoff-reveals-demi-lovato-anonymouse/|magazine=Entertainment Weekly|date=September 11, 2023|access-date=September 15, 2023|archive-date=October 20, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231020002720/https://ew.com/tv/the-masked-singer-season-10-premiere-kickoff-reveals-demi-lovato-anonymouse/|url-status=live}}</ref> She performed a medley at the [[2023 MTV Video Music Awards]] two days later, and was chosen by ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' and ''[[USA Today]]'' as one of the best performances of the show.<ref>{{cite magazine |last=Lynch |first=Joe |title=2023 VMAs Performances Ranked From Worst to Best |url=https://www.billboard.com/lists/best-2023-mtv-vmas-performances-ranked/ |magazine=[[Billboard conducted a New Year's Eve concert at the [[Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas]] in [[Paradise, Nevada]].<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Johnston |first=Rylee |date=October 12, 2023 |title=You Can Still Ring in }}</ref> She was featured on a [[blues]] cover of \"[[Papa Was a Rollin' Stone|Papa Was a Rolling Stone]]\" with [[Slash (musician)|Slash]], from his second solo album ''[[Orgy of the Damned]]'', released on May 17, 2024.<ref>{{cite magazine |last=Grow |first=Kory |title=Demi Lovato Dives Deeper Into Rock With Slash on Temptations' 'Papa Was a Rolling Stone' Cover [[Spanglish]] collaboration with [[regional Mexican]] band [[Grupo Firme]], titled \"[[Chula (song)|Chula]]\", was released on August 15.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Mier |first=Tom\u00e1s |date=August 3, 2024 |title=Demi Lovato and Grupo Firme Debut Spanglish Dance Collab, 'Chula' |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-latin/demi-lovato-grupo-firme-chula-1235073549/ |url-access=subscription |access-date=August 3, 2024 |magazine=Rolling Stone}}</ref> Lovato co-headlined the inaugural Hera HSBC festival on August 25 in Mexico City.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Mier |first=Tom\u00e1s |date=August 20, 2024 |title='It Was About Time': How an All-Women Fest Got Demi, Camila, and Danna to Take a Chance on Them |magazine=Rolling Stone}}</ref> Lovato starred in and made her directorial debut with ''[[Child Star (film)|Child Star]]'', a documentary film she co-directed with Nicola Marsh and co-produced under her own DLG, alongside [[OBB Media]] and [[SB Projects]].<ref name=\"childstardoc\">{{Cite magazine |last=Rose |first=Lace |date=July 31, 2024 |title=Demi Lovato Lines Up Drew Barrymore, JoJo Siwa, More for 'Child Star' Doc (Exclusive) |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-news/demi-lovato-jojo-siwa-drew-barrymore-child-star-hulu-doc-1235961830/ |access-date=August 3, 2024 |magazine=The Hollywood Reporter}}</ref> The film features Lovato's interviews with six former child stars, and \"examines the high highs and low lows of growing up in the spotlight\". It was released on [[Hulu]] on September 17, 2024.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Gonzalez |first=Lilian |date=September 17, 2024 |title='Child Star': How to Watch Demi Lovato's Hulu Documentary for Free |url=https://www.billboard.com/culture/product-recommendations/demi-lovato-child-star-hulu-documentary-stream-online-1235777897/ |access-date=September 17, 2024 |magazine=Billboard}}</ref> In promotion of the film, Lovato released the single \"[[You'll Be OK, Kid]]\" on September 13.<ref>{{cite magazine |last=Zemler |first=Emily |date=September 13, 2024 |title=Demi Lovato Reassures Her Stone}}</ref> \n\nLovato will star alongside [[Rose Byrne]] and [[Dominic Sessa]] in the [[Stephanie Laing]]-directed ''[[Tow (film)|Tow]]''.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Wiseman |first=Andreas }}</ref>\n\n==Artistry==\n===Influences===\n{{multiple image\n| footer = Lovato credits [[Kelly Clarkson]] (left) and [[Christina Aguilera]] (right) as her main musical influences.\n| image1 = Kelly Clarkson 57th Presidential Inauguration-cropped.jpg\n| width1 = 153\n| alt1   = Kelly Clarkson standing\n| image2 = Christina Aguilera Sanremo.jpg\n| width2 = 144\n| alt2   = Christina Aguilera performing\n| align  = right\n}}\nLovato has frequently cited \"power vocalists\" such as [[Christina Aguilera]], [[Kelly Clarkson]], [[Whitney Houston]], and [[Aretha Franklin]] as major musical and vocal influences.<ref name=\"influences\">{{cite web|title=Demi Talks About Her Influences|url=http://www.bopandtigerbeat.com/2011/09/demi-talks-about-her-influences/|work=[[Tiger Beat]]|access-date=March 16, 2013|date=September 8, 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130921054808/http://www.bopandtigerbeat.com/2011/09/demi-talks-about-her-influences/|archive-date=September 21, 2013|url-status=dead}}<!-- The video embedded in this article is unavailable, even in the archived version, which makes verification impossible. --></ref><ref>{{Cite web|title=Demi Lovato dishes on her current pop faves, from Harry Styles to Dua Lipa \u2013 Music News \u2013 ABC News Radio|url=http://abcnewsradioonline.com/music-news/2020/4/15/demi-lovato-dishes-on-her-current-pop-faves-from-harry-style.html|access-date=August 11, 2020|website=ABC News Radio|archive-date=April 19, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200419053411/http://abcnewsradioonline.com/music-news/2020/4/15/demi-lovato-dishes-on-her-current-pop-faves-from-harry-style.html|url-status=dead}}</ref> Lovato says, \"I had a lot of respect for Whitney Houston, and Christina Aguilera.\"<ref>{{cite magazine|title=Demi Lovato Q&A: On 'Demi,' Her 'X Factor' Return and Being Sick of Party Songs|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=May 13, 2013|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-qa-on-demi-her-x-factor-return-and-being-sick-of-party-1561404/|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=April 26, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220426133232/https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-qa-on-demi-her-x-factor-return-and-being-sick-of-party-1561404/|url-status=live}}</ref> About her admiration for Clarkson, Lovato says, \"I just thought she was a great role model. I feel like she set a really great example and she was extremely talented.\"<ref>{{cite journal|last=Nguyen|first=Vi-An|date=March 25, 2013|title=Demi Lovato: I Want to 'Settle Down' in the Next Few Years|url=http://parade.com/40734/viannguyen/25-demi-lovato-i-want-to-settle-down-in-the-next-few-years/|journal=Parade|access-date=April 17, 2014|archive-date=April 27, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230427004026/https://parade.com/40734/viannguyen/25-demi-lovato-i-want-to-settle-down-in-the-next-few-years/|url-status=live}}</ref> Lovato also said that she was \"obsessed with Kelly Clarkson\" as a child, and she even had an [[AOL]] username, \"Little Kelly\", inspired by the singer.<ref>{{Cite magazine|date=March 22, 2018|title=Demi Lovato Says Her AOL Screen Name Was Inspired by Kelly Clarkson|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-says-her-aol-screen-name-was-inspired-by-kelly-clarkson-8257646/|access-date=March 4, 2022|magazine=Billboard|archive-date=March 4, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304081946/https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-says-her-aol-screen-name-was-inspired-by-kelly-clarkson-8257646/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nHer other influences or inspirations include [[Britney Spears]],<ref name=\"younginf\">{{cite magazine|url=http://www.younghollywood.com/scene/she-did-it-again-britney-spears-lands-back-on-top.html |title=SHE DID IT AGAIN: BRITNEY SPEARS LANDS BACK ON TOP |last=Boyce |first=Shannon |date=September 1, 2011 |access-date=January 7, 2012 |website=[[Young Hollywood]] |publisher=[[Fremantle Media]]|location=Los Angeles, California|url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121020044704/https://www.younghollywood.com/scene/she-did-it-again-britney-spears-lands-back-on-top.html |archive-date=October 20, 2012 }}</ref> [[Rihanna]], [[JoJo (singer)|JoJo]], [[Keri Hilson]],<ref name=\"Demi Lovato influence\">{{cite web|first=Marcell|last=Minaya|title=Lovato 'inspired by Rihanna R&B sound'|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/music/news/a257783/lovato-inspired-by-rihanna-rb-sound.html|website=[[Digital Spy]]|access-date=June 15, 2013|date=August 7, 2010|archive-date=May 2, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130502224552/http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/music/news/a257783/lovato-inspired-by-rihanna-rb-sound.html|url-status=live}}</ref> [[Jennifer Lopez]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Demi Lovato inspired by Jennifer Lopez|url=http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/music/demi-lovato-inspired-by-jennifer-lopez/|website=[[The Indian Express]]|access-date=September 21, 2015|date=January 29, 2017|archive-date=July 16, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230716093432/https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/music/demi-lovato-inspired-by-jennifer-lopez/|url-status=live}}</ref> [[Gladys Knight]], [[Alexz Johnson]],<ref name=\"Demi Lovato youth influences\">{{cite web|url=https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=cTW9Z7VKtQU |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211221/cTW9Z7VKtQU |archive-date=December 21, 2021 |url-status=live|title=Demi Lovato talks about Alexz Johnson|date=October 16, 2012|website=YouTube|access-date=January 18, 2017}}{{cbignore}}</ref> [[Billie Holiday]], the [[Spice Girls]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://myx.abs-cbn.com/features/29/look-demi-lovato-reveals-her-first-love-was-spice |title=Look: Demi Lovato reveals her first love was The Spice Girls!|publisher= [[Myx]] |author=Karen Jane Ng |date=September 30, 2017 |access-date=August 21, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190821080025/https://myx.abs-cbn.com/features/29/look-demi-lovato-reveals-her-first-love-was-spice |archive-date=August 21, 2019}}</ref> and [[Billy Gilman]].<ref name=\"influences\" /> About Gilman she said, \"We had the same voice range when I was young. I would practice to his songs all the time.\"<ref name=\"houstonchronicle\">{{cite web|author=Joey Guerra|title=Demi Lovato: Texas' own 'tween star|url=https://www.chron.com/life/article/Demi-Lovato-Texas-own-tween-star-1792031.php|work=[[Houston Chronicle]]|access-date=March 31, 2013|date=June 19, 2008|archive-date=October 21, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121021201648/http://www.chron.com/life/article/Demi-Lovato-Texas-own-tween-star-1792031.php|url-status=live}}</ref> In her teens, Lovato listened to [[heavy metal music]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1593780/demi-lovato-metalhead-plus-dillinger-escape-plan-dragonforce-more-news-that-rules-in-metal-file/|title=Demi Lovato metalhead?|author=Chris Harris|work=MTV News|publisher=Viacom|date=August 29, 2008|access-date=March 16, 2013|archive-date=August 15, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210815130134/http://www.mtv.com/news/1593780/demi-lovato-metalhead-plus-dillinger-escape-plan-dragonforce-more-news-that-rules-in-metal-file/|url-status=dead}}</ref> including bands such as [[The Devil Wears Prada (band)|the Devil Wears Prada]], [[Job for a Cowboy]], [[Maylene and the Sons of Disaster]], and [[Bring Me the Horizon]].<ref>{{Cite web|last=Smith-Engelhardt|first=Joe|date=August 23, 2019|title=10 metal-loving mainstream musicians who might surprise you|url=https://www.altpress.com/features/pop-musicians-like-metal/|access-date=August 11, 2020|website=Alternative Press|archive-date=August 3, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210803150407/https://www.altpress.com/features/pop-musicians-like-metal/|url-status=live}}</ref> She has said that [[John Mayer]]'s songwriting has in particular been a \"huge influence\" on hers<ref name=\"influences\" /> and that he taught her to write songs by starting with the titles.<ref name=\"BillboardFallon2022\"/> Following the release of ''Unbroken'', her musical style shifted towards [[Hip hop music|hip hop]] and [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]].<ref name=\"influences\" /> Upon the release of the song \"[[Without a Fight (song)|Without a Fight]]\" by [[country music]] singer [[Brad Paisley]] featuring Lovato, she cited the country genre as a lifelong strong musical influence of hers, as she \"grew up listening to country\" and her mother \"was a country singer\".<ref>{{Cite web|date=July 18, 2016|first=Laura|last=McClellan|title=Demi Lovato Wants to Cut More Country Music|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/demi-lovato-country-music-album/|access-date=August 11, 2020|website=Taste of Country|archive-date=August 3, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210803150408/https://tasteofcountry.com/demi-lovato-country-music-album/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nLovato's [[The Neon Lights Tour|Neon Lights Tour]] was \"inspired by [[Beyonc\u00e9]]\" and specifically her 2013 [[Beyonc\u00e9 (album)|self-titled]] visual album in regard to the visuals shown onscreen.<ref>{{cite web|last=Garibaldi|first=Christina|title=Demi Lovato Will Make Like Queen Bey On Neon Lights Tour|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1721955/demi-lovato-nick-jonas-neon-lights-tour/|publisher=MTV|access-date=February 7, 2014|archive-date=August 3, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210803150409/http://www.mtv.com/news/1721955/demi-lovato-nick-jonas-neon-lights-tour/|url-status=dead}}</ref> Moreover, Lovato revealed that her sixth studio album, ''Tell Me You Love Me'', was inspired by Aguilera.<ref name=\"people\">{{Cite web|title=Demi Lovato Reveals Christina Aguilera Album Inspiration|url=https://people.com/music/demi-lovato-reveals-christina-aguilera-really-inspired-album/|access-date=August 11, 2020|website=PEOPLE.com|archive-date=August 15, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210815135605/https://people.com/music/demi-lovato-reveals-christina-aguilera-really-inspired-album/|url-status=live}}</ref> Lovato said \"I grew up listening to Christina Aguilera. She was one of my idols growing up. She still is. Her voice is incredible, and in ''[[Stripped (Christina Aguilera album)|Stripped]]'' you really got to hear that. I think it was her breakout album that really transformed her into the icon that she is today. So that inspired me \u2026 she really inspired this album. I was even inspired by the black and white artwork!\"<ref name=\"people\"/>\n\n===Voice===\nThroughout her career, Lovato has received acclaim from critics for her singing abilities and [[mezzo-soprano]] voice.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.idolator.com/7457954/demi-lovato-demi-album-review?chrome=1| title=Demi Lovato's 'Demi': Album Review| work=[[Idolator (website)|Idolator]]| date=May 14, 2014| access-date=October 11, 2023| first=Sam| last=Lansky| archive-date=March 5, 2024| archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240305130049/https://www.idolator.com/7457954/demi-lovato-demi-album-review?chrome=1| url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.charlottemagazine.com/Blogs/Revue/February-2014/This-Weekend-in-Charlotte-2/19/14-Rock-of-Ages-Charlotte-Symphony-Demi-Lovato-Housingfest/| title=This Weekend in Charlotte (2/19/14): Rock of Ages, Charlotte Symphony, Demi Lovato, & HousingFest| work=Charlotte Magazine| date=February 19, 2014| access-date=October 11, 2023| first=Andy| last=Smith| archive-date=June 29, 2019| archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190629212611/http://www.charlottemagazine.com//Blogs/Revue/February-2014/This-Weekend-in-Charlotte-2/19/14-Rock-of-Ages-Charlotte-Symphony-Demi-Lovato-Housingfest| url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url = http://www.tbo.com/events/demi-lovato-gives-fans-what-they-want-at-tampa-show-20140226/| title = Review: Demi Lovato gives fans what they want in Tampa| work=[[The Tampa Tribune]]| date=February 26, 2014| access-date=October 11, 2023| first=Christopher| last=Spata|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180621115850/https://www.tbo.com/events/demi-lovato-gives-fans-what-they-want-at-tampa-show-20140226/|archive-date=June 21, 2018}}</ref>  Regarding her vocals on ''Don't Forget'', Nick Levine of [[Digital Spy]] stated, \"she's certainly a stronger singer than the [[Jonas Brothers|Jonases]]. In fact, her full-bodied vocal performances are consistently impressive.\"<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.digitalspy.com/music/album-reviews/a154015/demi-lovato-dont-forget/|title=Demi Lovato: 'Don't Forget'|author=Nick Levine|publisher=Digital Spy|date=April 26, 2009|access-date=March 4, 2022|archive-date=August 3, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210803150405/https://www.digitalspy.com/music/album-reviews/a154015/demi-lovato-dont-forget/|url-status=live}}</ref> Becky Brain of ''[[Idolator (website)|Idolator]]'' remarked that Lovato has a \"killer voice and the A-list material to put it to good use\".<ref>{{cite web|last=Brain|first=Becky|title=Demi Lovato 'Unbroken': Fall Preview|url=http://idolator.com/5996492/demi-lovato-unbroken-fall-music-preview|publisher=Idolator. Buzz Media|access-date=September 16, 2011|date=September 7, 2011|archive-date=March 5, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240305130021/https://www.idolator.com/5996492/demi-lovato-unbroken-fall-music-preview|url-status=live}}</ref> According to Sophie Schillaci of ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'', Lovato \"has a voice that can silence even the harshest of critics.\"<ref>{{cite news|author= Sophie Schillaci|title=Demi Lovato at The Greek: Concert Review|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/general-news/demi-lovato-concert-review-x-factor-greek-351436/|work=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=March 31, 2013|date=July 19, 2012}}</ref> In his review of Lovato's second studio album ''Here We Go Again'', Jeff Miers from ''The Buffalo News'' stated, \"Unlike so many of her Disney-fied peers, Lovato can really sing,\" and he found it \"refreshing\" that she \"doesn't need the help of [[Auto-Tune]] ... to mask any lack of natural ability.\"<ref name=\"Buffalo News\">{{cite news |url=http://www.buffalonews.com/incoming/article5800.ece |title=Demi Lovato shows her talents on new disc |date=July 31, 2009 |work=[[The Buffalo News]] |publisher=[[Berkshire Hathaway]] |last=Miers |first=Jeff |access-date=October 9, 2011 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://archive.today/20120630053744/http://www.buffalonews.com/incoming/article5800.ece |archive-date=June 30, 2012 }}</ref>\n\nCommenting on working with Lovato on her third studio album ''Unbroken'', [[Ryan Tedder]] stated that Lovato \"blew me out of the water vocally! I had no idea how good her voice is. She's one of the best singers I've ever worked with. Literally, that good&nbsp;... I mean, she's a Kelly Clarkson-level vocalist. And Kelly has a set of pipes.\" He also commented on their work together on the song \"Neon Lights\" from her fourth studio album, saying that Lovato \"has one of the biggest ranges, possibly the highest full voice singer I've ever worked with.\"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.capitalfm.com/artists/onerepublic/news/ryan-tedder-demi-lovato-video/|title=OneRepublic's Ryan Tedder Hails Demi Lovato's Voice And \"Incredible\" Range \u2013 Video|date=October 12, 2013|work=Capital|access-date=November 3, 2014}}</ref> Tamsyn Wilce from Alter the Press commented on her vocals on ''Demi'', stating \"it shows just how strong her vocal chords {{sic}} are and the variation of styles that she can completely work to make her own.\"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.alterthepress.com/2013/05/atp-album-review-demi-lovato-demi.html|title=Alter The Press!: ATP! Album Review: Demi Lovato \u2013 Demi|access-date=November 3, 2014}}</ref>\n\nIn a review of the Neon Lights Tour, Mike Wass from Idolator remarked \"you don't need shiny distractions when you can belt out songs like Demi and connect with the crowd on such an emotional level\".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.idolator.com/7505188/demi-lovato-neon-lights-tour-review-setlist|title=Demi Lovato's 'Neon Lights' Tour Shines Bright In Vancouver, Canada: Live Review|work=Idolator|date=February 10, 2014|access-date=March 4, 2022}}{{Dead link|date=August 2024 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> In a review of the Demi World Tour, Marielle Wakim from ''[[Los Angeles (magazine)|Los Angeles]]'' magazine praised Lovato's vocals, commenting, \"For those who haven't bothered to follow Lovato's career, let's get something out of the way: [Lovato] can sing.... At 22 years old, her vocal range is astounding.\" Wakim also described Lovato's vocals as \"spectacular\".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.lamag.com/culturefiles/need-shelf-pride-start-listening-demi-lovato/|title=If You're Not Listening to Demi Lovato, You're Doing Music Wrong|work=[[Los Angeles (magazine)|Los Angeles]] |date=October 2014|access-date=March 4, 2022}}</ref>\n\nLovato was lauded for her performance of \"[[The Star-Spangled Banner]]\" at [[Super Bowl LIV]] in 2020. Patrick Ryan of ''[[USA Today]]'' commended her for delivering a \"flawless performance\" and described Lovato as \"one of the best vocalists in the industry today\".<ref name=\"Ryan\">{{Cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/music/2020/02/02/demi-lovatos-super-bowl-national-anthem/4641831002/|title=Demi Lovato wows with flawless, confident national anthem at Super Bowl|last=Ryan|first=Patrick|website=USA TODAY|access-date=March 16, 2020}}</ref> He remarked that Lovato \"hit all the high notes with ease\" and ultimately \"even added some of her own riffs\" which he says resulted in \"a rendition that was uniquely and phenomenally\" her own.<ref name=\"Ryan\"/>\n\n==Personal life==\n===Residence===\nOn August 20, 2010, her 18th birthday, Lovato purchased a Mediterranean-style house in Los Angeles for her family; however, Lovato decided to live in a \"[[Sober living houses|sober house]]\" in Los Angeles after leaving rehab in January 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mstarz.com/articles/7562/20130111/demi-lovato-likes-sober-move-addiction-again.htm|title=Demi Lovato Likes To Be Sober And Not Move Into Addiction Again, Makes Sober House Her Home|publisher=Mstarz|date=January 11, 2013|access-date=March 1, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160306125523/http://www.mstarz.com/articles/7562/20130111/demi-lovato-likes-sober-move-addiction-again.htm|archive-date=March 6, 2016|url-status=dead}}</ref> In September 2016, Lovato also purchased a [[Laurel Canyon]] home in Los Angeles for $8.3 million, which she sold in June 2020 for $8.25 million.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://variety.com/2020/dirt/entertainers/demi-lovato-house-hollywood-hills-1234634291/|title=Demi Lovato Sells Notorious Sunset Strip Villa to Real Estate Scion|last=McClain|first=James|date=June 13, 2020|website=Variety|access-date=June 26, 2020}}</ref> In September 2020, Lovato purchased a [[Studio City]] home in Los Angeles for $7 million.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://variety.com/2020/dirt/entertainers/demi-lovato-buys-all-new-modern-farmhouse-1234762828/|title=Demi Lovato Buys All-New Modern Farmhouse|last=McClain|first=James|website=Variety|date=September 8, 2020|access-date=September 8, 2020}}</ref>\n\n===Hobbies===\nLovato started training in [[Brazilian jiu-jitsu]] in 2016.<ref>{{cite AV media|last=Demi Lovato|title=Demi Lovato Does Jiu Jitsu|date=October 10, 2017|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J1E0RCW1yT0
