|archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211221/J1E0RCW1yT0 |archive-date=December 21, 2021 |url-status=live|access-date=October 11, 2017}}{{cbignore}}</ref> She was promoted to a purple belt in the sport on February 4, 2023.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Burne |first1=Kathrine |title=Demi Lovato Promoted To Purple Belt In BJJ |url=https://jitsmagazine.com/demi-lovato-promoted-to-purple-belt-in-bjj/ |website=JitsMagazine |date=February 5, 2023 |access-date=5 February 2023}}</ref>\n\n===Sexuality, gender, and relationships===\nFor a few months, Lovato dated singer [[Trace Cyrus]] in 2009.<ref>{{cite news|last=Garcia|first=Jennifer|title=Demi Lovato and Trace Cyrus Split|url=https://people.com/celebrity/demi-lovato-and-trace-cyrus-split/|website=People}}</ref> Lovato briefly dated her ''Camp Rock'' co-star [[Joe Jonas]] in 2010.<ref>{{cite web|last=Michaels|first=Wendy|title=Did Demi Lovato & Joe Jonas Date? 'Tell Me You Love Me' Singer Opens Up About Their Past|url=https://www.elitedaily.com/p/did-demi-lovato-joe-jonas-date-tell-me-you-love-me-singer-opens-up-about-their-past-2890123|website=[[Elite Daily]]|date=October 11, 2017 }}</ref> Lovato then had an [[on-again, off-again relationship]] with actor [[Wilmer Valderrama]]; they first began dating in August 2010 when Valderrama was 29 and Lovato was 18. They ended their relationship in June 2016.<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Walsh|first=Savannah|title=Demi Lovato's Complete Dating History, From Wilmer Valderrama to Joe Jonas|url=https://www.elle.com/culture/celebrities/g30707639/demi-lovato-dating-history/|access-date=July 14, 2020|magazine=[[Elle (magazine)|Elle]]}}</ref> Her 2022 single \"[[29 (Demi Lovato song)|29]]\" was widely believed to be about Valderrama and the significant age gap in their relationship, although Lovato did not directly confirm this.<ref name=\":0\">{{Cite web |last=Ahlgrim |first=Callie |title=Demi Lovato is teasing a song that seems to slam ex-boyfriend Wilmer Valderrama for dating her as a teen |url=https://www.insider.com/demi-lovato-who-is-29-about-wilmer-valderrama-explanation-2022-8 |access-date=August 22, 2022 |publisher=Insider Inc.}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=De Loera |first=Carlos |date=August 18, 2022 |title=Demi Lovato's '29' has become a TikTok anthem exposing older men dating teenage girls |url=https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/music/story/2022-08-17/demi-lovato-29-song-tiktok-wilmer-valderrama |access-date=August 31, 2022 |newspaper=Los Angeles Times}}</ref> Lovato later dated UFC athlete Guilherme \"Bomba\" Vasconcelos from January to July 2017.<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Chiu|first=Melody|title=Demi Lovato Splits from MMA Fighter Guilherme 'Bomba' Vasconcelos|url=https://people.com/celebrity/demi-lovato-guilherme-bomba-vasconcelos-split/|access-date=November 30, 2020|magazine=People}}</ref> In late 2018, Lovato briefly dated designer [[Enfants Riches D\u00e9prim\u00e9s|Henry Levy]] until March 2019.<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Mizoguchi|first=Karen|title=Demi Lovato and Designer Henry Levy Break Up: Source|url=https://people.com/music/demi-lovato-henry-levy-break-up/|access-date=November 30, 2020|magazine=People}}</ref> She dated model Austin Wilson for a few months until late 2019.<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Chiu|first=Melody|title=Demi Lovato and Austin Wilson Split After Months of Dating: 'She's Concentrating on Herself'|url=https://people.com/music/demi-lovato-henry-levy-break-up/|access-date=November 30, 2020|magazine=People}}</ref> On July 23, 2020, Lovato announced her engagement to actor [[Max Ehrich]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.eonline.com/news/1173062/demi-lovato-is-engaged-to-max-ehrich|title=Demi Lovato Is Engaged to Max Ehrich|work=[[E!]]|last=Aiello|first=McKenna|date=July 23, 2020|access-date=March 4, 2022}}</ref> The two had begun dating four months prior, but eventually called off the engagement that September.<ref>{{Cite magazine|first=Ruth|last=Kinane|title=Demi Lovato drops breakup ballad 'Still Have Me' after split from fianc\u00e9|url=https://ew.com/music/demi-lovato-still-have-me/|magazine=Entertainment Weekly|date=September 30, 2020|access-date=September 30, 2020}}</ref> In early August 2022, ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'' reported that Lovato was in a \"happy and healthy relationship\" with a male musician.<ref>{{Cite magazine|first1=Jack|last1=Irvin|first2=Melody|last2=Chiu|title=Demi Lovato Is in a 'Happy and Healthy Relationship' with New Musician Boyfriend: Source|url=https://people.com/music/demi-lovato-dating-musician-happy-healthy-relationship/|magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=August 8, 2022|access-date=August 21, 2022}}</ref> On August 20, Canadian musician Jutes announced the relationship in an Instagram post marking Lovato's 30th birthday.<ref>{{cite web|first=Tionah|last=Lee|url=https://www.etonline.com/demi-lovatos-boyfriend-jute-celebrates-her-30th-birthday-with-romantic-post-189471|title=Demi Lovato's Boyfriend Jute$ Celebrates Her 30th Birthday With Romantic Post|website=[[Entertainment Tonight]]|date=August 21, 2022|access-date=August 21, 2022}}</ref><ref>{{Cite magazine|first=Kelsie|last=Gibson|title=Who Is Demi Lovato's Boyfriend? All About Jutes|url=https://people.com/music/who-is-jutes-demi-lovato/|magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=August 31, 2022|access-date=September 26, 2022}}</ref> On December 16, 2023, it was announced Lovato and Jutes were engaged.<ref>{{cite magazine |last=Chiu |first=Melody |title=Demi Lovato and Jordan 'Jutes' Lutes Are Engaged! Inside the 'Personal and Intimate' Proposal (Exclusive) |url=https://people.com/demi-lovato-engaged-jordan-jutes-lutes-intimate-proposal-exclusive-8417129 |magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]] |publisher=[[Dotdash Meredith]] |access-date=December 17, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231217185006/https://people.com/demi-lovato-engaged-jordan-jutes-lutes-intimate-proposal-exclusive-8417129 |archive-date=December 17, 2023 |location=United States |issn=0093-7673 |oclc=794712888 |language=en |date=December 17, 2023 |url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nLovato describes her sexuality as fluid, and has said she is open to finding love with someone of any gender.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.eonline.com/news/919029/demi-lovato-is-happily-single-and-ready-to-slide-into-your-dms|title=Demi Lovato Is Happily Single\u2014and Ready to Slide Into Your DMs|last=Johnson|first=Zach|date=March 7, 2018|agency=[[E!]]|access-date=January 31, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.eonline.com/news/1118008/demi-lovato-reveals-the-really-beautiful-moment-she-came-out-to-her-parents|title=Demi Lovato Reveals the \"Really Beautiful\" Moment She Came Out to Her Parents|last=Aiello|first=McKenna|date=January 30, 2020|website=[[E!]]|access-date=January 31, 2020}}</ref> In July 2020, she labeled herself [[queer]] in a social media statement mourning the [[Death of Naya Rivera|death]] of her ''Glee'' co-star [[Naya Rivera]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Dodgson|first=Lindsay|title=Demi Lovato said she would forever cherish the opportunity to play Naya Rivera's girlfriend on 'Glee,' because 'she helped queer girls like me'|website=[[Insider.com]] |url=https://www.insider.com/naya-rivera-demi-lovato-lgbtq-people-post-tributes-glee-star-2020-7|access-date=July 14, 2020|agency=Insider Inc.}}</ref> In March 2021, Lovato came out as [[pansexual]] and [[Sexual fluidity|sexually fluid]], stating, \"I've always known I was hella queer, but I have fully embraced it.\" In the same interview, she called herself \"just too queer\" to date men at the time. She also expressed feeling proud of belonging to the \"alphabet mafia\", referring to the [[LGBT community]].<ref name=\"pansexualcomeout1\">{{cite news|last1=Vivinetto|first1=Gina|date=March 29, 2021|title=Demi Lovato says she's pansexual: 'I'm so fluid now'|work=[[Today (American TV program)|Today]]|url=https://www.today.com/tmrw/demi-lovato-says-she-s-pansexual-i-m-so-fluid-t213350|access-date=March 29, 2021}}</ref><ref name=\"pansexualcomeout3\">{{cite news|last1=Byrne|first1=Suzy|date=March 29, 2021|title=Demi Lovato comes out as pansexual|publisher=[[Yahoo! News]]|url=https://ca.movies.yahoo.com/demi-lovato-comes-out-as-pansexual-193646742.html|access-date=March 29, 2021}}</ref>\n\nOn May 19, 2021, Lovato publicly came out as [[Non-binary gender|non-binary]] and announced the decision to change her gender pronouns to [[Singular they|they/them]], stating that \"this has come after a lot of healing and self-reflective work. I'm still learning and coming into myself; I don't claim to be an expert or a spokesperson. Sharing this with you now opens another level of vulnerability for me.\"<ref>{{Cite web|first=Ryan|last=Gajewski|title=Demi Lovato Comes Out as Non-Binary and Changes Pronouns to They/Them |date=May 19, 2021 |url=https://www.eonline.com/news/1271071/demi-lovato-comes-out-as-non-binary-and-changes-pronouns-to-they-them|access-date=March 4, 2022|agency=E!}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Demi Lovato is non-binary and is changing pronouns to they/them, singer announces |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/newsbeat-57169541 |access-date=May 19, 2021 |publisher=[[BBC News]] |date=May 19, 2021}}</ref> She had previously come out as non-binary to her family and friends towards the end of 2020.<ref>{{Cite web|first=Demi|last=Lovato |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kmk5vciFbek  |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211221/kmk5vciFbek |archive-date=December 21, 2021 |url-status=live|title=Demi Lovato performs their greatest hits this Pride season {{!}} YouTube Pride 2021 |date=June 25, 2021 |via=[[YouTube]] |access-date=July 14, 2021}}{{cbignore}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/benhenry/demi-lovato-nonbinary-they-them-pronouns |title=Demi Lovato Opened Up About The \"Reality\" Of Coming Out As Nonbinary |last=Henry |first=Ben |date=June 28, 2021 |website=[[BuzzFeed News]] |access-date=July 14, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url= https://www.buzzfeed.com/amphtml/natashajokic1/demi-lovato-max-ehrich-non-binary |title= Demi Lovato Called Their Breakup With Max Ehrich The \"Best Thing That's Happened\" To Them |last=Jokic |first=Natasha |date=August 20, 2021 |website=[[BuzzFeed News]] |access-date=August 26, 2021}}</ref> Lovato later changed her pronouns to include she/her in April 2022,<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.out.com/celebs/2022/4/29/demi-lovato-just-quietly-updated-their-pronouns-instagram|title=Demi Lovato Just Quietly Updated Their Pronouns on Instagram|magazine=[[Out (magazine)|Out]]|last=Sim|first=Bernardo|date=April 29, 2022|access-date=April 30, 2022}}</ref> and described herself the following August as a \"fluid person\" who had \"adopted the pronouns of she/her again\" after starting to feel \"more feminine\".<ref>{{cite magazine|title=Demi Lovato Explains Why She Started Using She/Her Pronouns Again in Addition to They/Them|first=Jack|last=Irvin|magazine=People|url=https://people.com/music/demi-lovato-using-she-her-pronouns-again/|date=August 2, 2022|access-date=August 3, 2022}}</ref><ref name=\"Kingsberry Aug 3 2022\">{{cite news |last1=Kingsberry |first1=Janay |title=Demi Lovato's pronouns can help normalize gender fluidity, advocates say |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/arts-entertainment/2022/08/03/demi-lovato-pronouns-change/ |access-date=August 4, 2022 |newspaper=[[The Washington Post]] |date=August 3, 2022}}</ref> That September, she reiterated that she \"still feel[s] very comfortable with they/them\".<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Cardenas|first=Cat|title=Demi Lovato Has Risen|url=https://www.spin.com/featured/demi-lovato-has-risen/|magazine=[[Spin (magazine)|Spin]]|date=September 21, 2022|access-date=September 26, 2022}}</ref>\n\n===Mental health and substance abuse===\nLovato had suffered from [[bulimia nervosa]], [[self-harm]], and being bullied before her first stint in rehab at age 18.<ref name=\"PunchApology\">{{cite news|first=Janice|last=Johnston|url=https://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/demi-lovato-interview-teen-star-opens-bulimia-cutting/story?id=13405090&page=1|title=Demi Lovato Interview: Teen Star Opens Up on Bulimia, Cutting Issues|publisher=[[ABC News (United States)|ABC News]]|date=April 19, 2011|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110521143956/https://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/demi-lovato-interview-teen-star-opens-bulimia-cutting/story?id=13405090&page=1|archive-date=May 21, 2011|access-date=March 14, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|first=Peter|last=Gicas|title=Demi Lovato Still Has \"Nightmares\" About the Childhood Bullying She Endured |url=http://www.eonline.com/news/434771/demi-lovato-still-has-nightmares-about-the-childhood-bullying-she-endured|publisher=[[E! News]]|access-date=December 27, 2015|date=June 28, 2013}}</ref> On November 1, 2010, Lovato withdrew from the [[List of Jonas Brothers concert tours#Live in Concert|Jonas Brothers: Live in Concert]] tour, entering a treatment facility for \"physical and emotional issues\".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/208889/demi-lovato-enters-treatment-center-for-issues|title=Demi Lovato Enters Treatment Center for 'Issues'|first=Natalie|last=Finn|publisher=E! News|date=November 1, 2010|access-date=March 14, 2010}}</ref> It was reported<ref name=\"ussales\">{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/media/podcasts/hozier-ask-pop-shop-podcast-7423955/|title=Pop Shop Podcast: Hozier Talks 'Better Love' & What's Next, Plus Burning Questions About Britney, Demi & More|last1=Atkinson|first1=Katie|date=July 5, 2016|magazine=Billboard|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160706161316/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/podcasts/7423955/hozier-ask-pop-shop-podcast|archive-date=July 6, 2016|last2=Caulfield|first2=Keith|access-date=March 4, 2022}}</ref> that she decided to enter treatment after punching backup dancer [[Beat Freaks#Alex \"BGirl Shorty\" Welch|Alex Welch]]; her family and management team convinced her that she needed help. Lovato said she took \"100 percent, full responsibility\" for the incident.<ref name=\"PunchApology\" /> On January 28, 2011, she completed in-patient treatment at Timberline Knolls and returned home. Lovato acknowledged that she had bulimia, had cut herself, and had been \"self-medicating\" with drugs and alcohol \"like a lot of teens do to numb their pain\".<ref>{{cite magazine|first=Ellen|last=Collis|title=Demi Lovato Exclusive Interview|url=https://www.seventeen.com/celebrity/g2206/exclusive-interview-demi-lovato/|magazine=[[Seventeen (American magazine)|Seventeen]]|access-date=March 14, 2013}}</ref> She added that she \"basically had a nervous breakdown\" and had been diagnosed with bipolar disorder during her treatment.<ref>{{cite news|title=Disney Star Demi Lovato: I'm Bipolar|url=https://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/disney-star-demi-lovato-im-bipolar|publisher=[[Fox News]]|date=April 20, 2011|access-date=March 4, 2022}}</ref> She later commented that she used to use [[cocaine]] several times a day and smuggled cocaine onto airplanes.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.accessonline.com/articles/demi-lovato-reveals-i-would-smuggle-cocaine-on-planes-exclusive-140900|title=Demi Lovato Reveals: I Would 'Smuggle' Cocaine On Airplanes (Exclusive)|website=[[Access Hollywood]]|first=Jesse|last=Spero|date=December 10, 2013|access-date=August 1, 2021}}</ref> In a 2022 interview on the podcast ''[[Call Her Daddy]]'', Lovato added that she began using [[opiate]]s at the age of 13 after a car accident and \"was already drinking\" by that time.<ref name=\"CallHerDaddyIndependent\">{{cite web|first=Amber|last=Raiken|title=Demi Lovato reveals she used opiates for first time at 13|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/demi-lovato-podcast-opiates-substance-use-b2152252.html|website=[[The Independent (UK)|The Independent]]|date=August 25, 2022|access-date=August 25, 2022}}</ref><ref name=\"CallHerDaddyPeople\">{{cite magazine|first=Stephanie|last=Wenger|title=Demi Lovato Recalls Starting to Use Opiates at 13 After a Car Accident: 'Looking for an Escape'|url=https://people.com/music/demi-lovato-recalls-starting-to-use-opiates-at-13-after-car-accident/|magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=August 23, 2022|access-date=August 25, 2022}}</ref> She said that this eventually led her to use cocaine at the age of 17.<ref name=\"CallHerDaddyIndependent\"/>\n\n[[File:Demi Lovato at the Democratic National Convention, July 2016 (cropped C).jpg|thumb|upright|Lovato speaking at the [[2016 Democratic National Convention]] in Philadelphia in July 2016]]\nIn April 2011, Lovato became a contributing editor for ''[[Seventeen (American magazine)|Seventeen]]'' magazine, penning an article that described her struggles.<ref name=\"Seventeen2011\">{{cite news|url=https://www.seventeen.com/health/advice/g2102/demi-lovato-pressure-to-be-perfect/ |title=The Pressure to Be Perfect |work=Seventeen|date=April 14, 2011 |access-date=March 4, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110417050727/http://www.seventeen.com/health/tips/demi-lovato-hub |archive-date=April 17, 2011 }}</ref> In March 2012, [[MTV]] aired a documentary, ''[[Demi Lovato: Stay Strong]]'', about her rehab and recovery.<ref>{{cite web|first=X.|last=Alexander|url=http://idolator.com/6210151/demi-lovatos-stay-strong-documentary-watch|title=Demi Lovato's 'Stay Strong' Documentary: Watch|website=[[Idolator (website)|Idolator]]|date=March 7, 2012|access-date=May 31, 2013}}{{Dead link|date=July 2024 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> She began work on her fourth studio album the following month.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sawfnews.com/Entertainment/68532.aspx|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120407232620/http://www.sawfnews.com/Entertainment/68532.aspx|title=Demi Lovato Starts Work on Her Fourth Album|publisher=Sawfnews. [[WordPress]]|date=April 5, 2012|archive-date=April 7, 2012|access-date=November 1, 2012}}</ref> In January 2013, it was reported that Lovato had been living in a sober-living facility in Los Angeles for over a year because she felt it was the best way to avoid returning to her addiction and eating disorder.<ref name=\"Time Warner\">{{cite web|title=Demi Lovato: The Sober Living House Is My Home!|url=https://www.tmz.com/2013/01/11/demi-lovato-sober-living-house-home-x-factor/|website=[[TMZ]]|access-date=January 24, 2013|date=January 11, 2013}}</ref> Lovato celebrated the five-year anniversary of her sobriety on March 15, 2017.<ref>{{cite magazine|last1=Aniftos|first1=Rania|title=Demi Lovato Celebrates 5-Year Anniversary of Her Sobriety|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-celebrates-five-years-sobriety-7727833/|access-date=March 4, 2022|magazine=Billboard|date=March 16, 2017}}</ref>\n\nIn her 2017 [[YouTube]] documentary ''Demi Lovato: Simply Complicated'', Lovato revealed that her treatment at Timberline Knolls had not been entirely successful, stating that she still struggled with alcoholism and a [[cocaine addiction]] in the year following her stint in the treatment center and further admitting that she was in fact under the influence of cocaine while being interviewed about her sobriety for ''Demi Lovato: Stay Strong''.<ref name=\"Simply Complicated\">{{cite web|title=Demi Lovato: Simply Complicated \u2013 Official Documentary| date=October 17, 2017 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZWTlL_w8cRA |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211221/ZWTlL_w8cRA |archive-date=December 21, 2021 |url-status=live|publisher=[[YouTube]]|access-date=October 21, 2017}}{{cbignore}}</ref><ref name=\"SC Billboard\" /><ref name=\"SC Maxim\" /><ref name=\"SC InStyle\" /> She stated, \"I wasn't working my program. I wasn't ready to get sober. I was sneaking it on planes, sneaking it in bathrooms, sneaking it throughout the night. Nobody knew.\"<ref name=\"SC Billboard\">{{cite magazine|last1=Armstrong|first1=Megan|title=The 10 Most Honest Confessions From Demi Lovato's 'Simply Complicated' YouTube Documentary|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/8005791/demi-lovato-simply-complicated-documentary-youtube-best-moments|access-date=October 22, 2017|magazine=Billboard|date=October 18, 2017}}</ref>\n\nLovato also stated that her drug and alcohol addiction not only caused her to nearly [[Drug overdose|overdose]] several times, but later began to impact her ability to perform live and promote her ''Unbroken'' album, referencing a 2012 performance on ''[[American Idol]]'' where she was severely [[Hangover|hungover]].<ref name=\"Simply Complicated\" /><ref name=\"SC Maxim\">{{cite news|title=Demi Lovato Talks About Casual Sex and Cocaine Addiction in Her Revealing 'Simply Complicated'|url=https://www.maxim.com/women/demi-lovato-talks-cocaine-casual-sex-simply-complicated-2017-10|access-date=October 22, 2017|magazine=[[Maxim (magazine)|Maxim]]|date=October 22, 2017}}</ref><ref name=\"SC InStyle\">{{cite news|last1=Fowler|first1=Brandi|title=Demi Lovato's Childhood Bullies Were So Intense They Petitioned for Her Suicide|url=http://www.instyle.com/news/demi-lovato-simply-complicated-documentary-interview|magazine=[[InStyle]]|date=October 17, 2017|access-date=October 22, 2017|archive-date=October 21, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171021134552/http://www.instyle.com/news/demi-lovato-simply-complicated-documentary-interview|url-status=dead}}</ref> After her management team had expressed their intentions to leave her, Lovato agreed to resume treatment and counseling for her addiction, leading to her move to a sober-living facility in Los Angeles with roommates and responsibilities to help her overcome her drug and alcohol problems.<ref name=\"Simply Complicated\" /><ref name=\"SC InStyle\" /> Although she had previously stated that she was entirely done with hard drugs such as heroin, Lovato revealed in March 2021 that she was not completely sober; she drank alcohol and smoked [[Cannabis (drug)|marijuana]] in moderation at that point, a choice that many of her friends openly disagreed with. She decided on moderation as she felt she was setting herself up for failure if she told herself she was never going to drink or smoke again. Lovato said it was because it had been drilled into her that \"one drink was equivalent to a crack pipe.\"<ref>{{Cite web|last=McRady|first=Rachel|date=March 16, 2021|title=Demi Lovato on Deciding to Drink Alcohol and Smoke Weed After Overdose|url=https://www.etonline.com/demi-lovato-on-her-decision-to-consume-alcohol-and-marijuana-in-moderation-following-2018-overdose|access-date=March 18, 2021|website=Entertainment Tonight}}</ref> This changed the following December when she abandoned her \"California sober ways\" and declared herself \"sober sober\".<ref>{{Cite web|last=Mamo|first=Heran|date=December 2, 2021|title=Demi Lovato Is No Longer 'California Sober': 'Sober Sober Is the Only Way to Be'|url=https://www.billboard.com/culture/lifestyle/demi-lovato-not-california-sober-1235005411/|access-date=December 5, 2021|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Grimes|first=Gary|date=December 5, 2021|title=Demi Lovato declares they're no longer 'California sober': 'Sober sober is the only way to be'|url=https://www.pinknews.co.uk/2021/12/05/demi-lovato-california-sober/|access-date=December 5, 2021|website=[[PinkNews]]}}</ref>\n\nIn 2021, Lovato said she had initially accepted her bipolar diagnosis and shared this in 2011 because it explained her erratic behavior, but later came to believe it was inaccurate: \"I was acting out when I was 18 for many reasons, but I know now from multiple different doctors that it was not because I was bipolar. I had to grow the fuck up.\"<ref>{{Cite web|date=March 16, 2021|title=Demi Lovato Said She Was Misdiagnosed With Bipolar Disorder|url=https://www.instyle.com/celebrity/demi-lovato/demi-lovato-misdiagnosed-bipolar-disorder|access-date=June 3, 2022|website=[[InStyle]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210317025132/https://www.instyle.com/celebrity/demi-lovato/demi-lovato-misdiagnosed-bipolar-disorder|archive-date=March 17, 2021|url-status=dead}}</ref> Lovato also stated that the diagnosis has been revised to [[attention deficit hyperactivity disorder]] (ADHD).<ref>{{Cite news|last=Ganz|first=Caryn|date=March 16, 2021|title=How Honest Can Demi Lovato Be?|newspaper=The New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/16/arts/music/demi-lovato-interview.html |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/archive/20211228/https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/16/arts/music/demi-lovato-interview.html |archive-date=December 28, 2021 |url-access=limited|url-status=live|access-date=March 17, 2021|issn=0362-4331}}{{cbignore}}</ref>\n\n====2018 drug overdose====\nOn June 21, 2018, Lovato released the single \"Sober\" in which she revealed she had relapsed after six years of sobriety.<ref>{{cite web|first=Nick|last=Romano|url=https://ew.com/music/2018/06/21/demi-lovato-sober-song-video/|title=Demi Lovato confesses 'I'm not sober anymore' in new song|magazine=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|date=June 21, 2018|access-date=July 28, 2018}}</ref> On July 24, 2018, she was rushed to the [[Cedars-Sinai Medical Center]] in Los Angeles after emergency services were called to her home due to an [[opioid overdose]].<ref name=\"cnn\" /><ref name=\"bbc\">{{cite web |title=Demi Lovato addresses addiction battle |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/entertainment-arts-45079386 |publisher=[[BBC News]] |date=August 6, 2018|access-date=August 9, 2018 }}</ref> Lovato recalled, \"The doctors told me that I had five to 10 minutes, like, if no one had found me, then I wouldn't be here.\"<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/demi-lovato-on-life-after-surviving-overdose-i-had-to-essentially-die-to-wake-up/|title=Demi Lovato on life after surviving overdose: I had to \"essentially die to wake up\"|publisher=[[CBS News]]|date=March 21, 2021|access-date=March 21, 2021}}</ref> The singer was reported to be stable and recovering later in the day.<ref name=\"cnn\">{{Cite news|first1=Sandra|last1=Gonzalez|first2=Chloe|last2=Melas|first3=Lisa|last3=Respers France|url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/07/24/entertainment/demi-lovato-hospitalized/index.html|title=Demi Lovato stable and recovering after apparent overdose|publisher=[[CNN]]|date=July 24, 2018|access-date=July 27, 2018}}</ref> She reportedly overdosed on [[oxycodone]] laced with [[fentanyl]]<ref>{{cite news |last1=Ross |first1=Martha |title=Demi Lovato's overdose likely caused by drug laced with fentanyl, report says |url=https://www.mercurynews.com/2018/08/14/demi-lovatos-overdose-likely-caused-by-fentanyl-opioid-report-says/ |access-date=October 18, 2018 |work=San Jose Mercury News |date=August 14, 2018}}</ref> and was revived with [[naloxone]].<ref>{{cite web |last1=Ryan |first1=Lisa |title=Demi Lovato Will Reportedly Be in Rehab for Several Months |url=https://www.thecut.com/2018/08/demi-lovato-drug-overdose-tmz-report.html |website=The Cut |access-date=October 18, 2018|date=August 14, 2018}}</ref>\n\nLovato also had multiple health complications stemming from the overdose, including multiple [[stroke]]s, a heart attack, and brain damage, the latter of which caused lasting vision problems.<ref>{{cite news|url = https://www.cnn.com/2021/02/17/entertainment/demi-lovato/index.html|title = Demi Lovato reveals she had multiple strokes, brain damage after overdose|publisher = CNN|date = February 17, 2021|access-date = February 17, 2021|last = Gonzalez|first = Sandra}}</ref> She was hospitalized for two weeks and subsequently entered an in-patient rehab facility.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/demi-lovato-released-from-hospital-enters-in-patient-facility-report-8468762/|title=Demi Lovato Released From Hospital, Enters In-Patient Facility: Report|magazine=Billboard|date=August 6, 2018|access-date=March 4, 2022}}</ref>\n\nLovato's drug overdose received widespread media coverage, leading to her becoming the most [[Google Search|googled]] person of 2018, ahead of other figures who had received extensive coverage throughout the year, due largely to the public interest surrounding the overdose.<ref>{{cite news|url= https://www.elle.com/culture/celebrities/a25552917/google-most-searched-person-of-2018/|title=Google's Most-Searched Person of 2018 is Demi Lovato|publisher=Elle|date=December 18, 2018|access-date=April 18, 2021}}</ref> [[CBS News]] ranked the overdose the 29th biggest story of 2018.<ref>{{cite news|url= https://www.cbsnews.com/pictures/biggest-stories-of-2018-ranked/|title=Biggest stories of 2018, ranked|publisher=CBS News|date=November 30, 2018|access-date=April 18, 2021}}</ref>\n\nIn December 2018, Lovato took to [[Twitter]] to dismiss rumors regarding her overdose and went on to thank fans, writing, \"If I feel like the world needs to know something, I will tell them MYSELF. All my fans need to know is I'm working hard on myself, I'm happy and clean and I'm SO grateful for their support.\"<ref name=\"ReferenceA\">{{cite web|first=Bonnie|last=Steirnberg|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-recovery-response-twitter-8491314/|title=Demi Lovato Responds to Rumors About Her Recovery|magazine=Billboard|date=December 22, 2018|access-date=March 4, 2022}}</ref> She added that some day she would \"tell the world what exactly happened, why it happened and what my life is like today&nbsp;.. but until I'm ready to share that with people please stop prying and making up shit that you know nothing about. I still need space and time to heal.\"<ref name=\"ReferenceA\" />\n\nLovato addressed the matter during a 2020 appearance on ''[[The Ellen DeGeneres Show]]'', elaborating on how her worsened struggles with bulimia in 2018 contributed to her eventual drug overdose as she relapsed three months prior to the incident due to being extremely unhappy.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nydailynews.com/snyde/ny-demi-lovato-discusses-relapse-sobriety-20200305-6tn3b2xpgva75gaoj4r6yomglm-story.html|title=Demi Lovato reveals what led to her 2018 overdose|last=Ganz|first=Jami|website=New York Daily News|date=March 5, 2020 |access-date=March 11, 2020}}</ref> The singer attributed these struggles to the extreme measures that her then-manager, Phil McIntyre, took to control the food she ingested.<ref name=\"popbuzz.com\">{{Cite web|url=https://www.popbuzz.com/music/artists/demi-lovato/news/manager-phil-mcintyre-eating-disorder-i-love-me/|title=Demi Lovato says her old manager used to \"control\" what she ate|website=PopBuzz|access-date=March 16, 2020}}</ref> Lovato further explained that, along with the controlling nature of her management team, they did not provide her with the help she needed: \"People checking what my orders at [[Starbucks]] were on my bank statements&nbsp;... just little things like that&nbsp;... it led me to being really unhappy and my bulimia got really bad and I asked for help and I didn't receive the help that I needed.\"<ref name=\"popbuzz.com\" /> Moreover, she recounted that her thought process the night she relapsed after six years of sobriety was as follows, \"I'm six years sober and I'm miserable. I'm even more miserable than I was when I was drinking. Why am I sober?\"<ref name=\"popbuzz.com\" /> When Lovato confronted her management about these thoughts, the latter responded with, \"You're being very selfish, this would ruin things for not just you but for us as well.\" This made Lovato feel \"completely abandoned\" due to triggering her underlying abandonment issues with her birth father, and so she \"drank&nbsp;... that night\".<ref name=\"popbuzz.com\" />\n\n====Rape trauma====\nIn 2021, Lovato said she was raped at age 15 when she was an actor on the [[Disney Channel]], and that the rapist was a co-star whom she had to continue seeing thereafter. The incident contributed to her bulimia and self-harm. She told someone about the incident, but the assaulter \"never got in trouble for it. They never got taken out of the movie they were in.\" Lovato stated she did not acknowledge the act as rape at the time, because sexual activity was not normalized to her, and she was part of the Disney crowd who wore [[purity ring]]s and were waiting until marriage. However, she decided to share her experience because she believed that everyone should \"speak their voice if they can and feel comfortable doing so\". Lovato also stated she was raped during her 2018 drug overdose, realizing a month after the incident that she was not in a place to consent at that point.<ref>{{cite news|last=Maltceva|first=Margarita|date=March 17, 2021|title='I lost my virginity in a rape': Demi Lovato reveals she was raped as a teenager when she was acting on Disney Channel|work=National Post|url=https://nationalpost.com/news/world/i-lost-my-virginity-in-a-rape-demi-lovato-reveals-she-was-raped-as-a-teenager-when-she-was-acting-on-disney-channel|access-date=March 18, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Horton|first=Adrian|date=March 17, 2021|title=Demi Lovato says she was raped as a teenager by someone she knew|newspaper=The Guardian|url=http://www.theguardian.com/music/2021/mar/16/demi-lovato-rape-youtube-docuseries-dancing-with-the-devil|access-date=March 18, 2021}}</ref>\n\n==Other ventures==\n===Activism and philanthropy===\nLovato's work as an [[LGBT rights]] activist has been recognized by [[GLAAD]], which awarded her the Vanguard Award in 2016.<ref name=\"pinknews.co.uk\">{{Cite web|date=July 25, 2018|title=This is why Demi Lovato is an LGBT icon|url=https://www.pinknews.co.uk/2018/07/25/demi-lovato-sexuality-addiction-mental-illness-lgbt-icon/|access-date=March 16, 2020|website=PinkNews}}</ref> When the [[Defense of Marriage Act]] was appealed in June 2013, Lovato celebrated the occasion on social media.<ref name=\"LoveIsLove\">{{cite web|last=Blake|first=Emily|title=Lady Gaga, Demi Lovato Proclaim '#LoveIsLove' After Gay-Marriage Ruling|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1709619/supreme-court-gay-marriage-ruling-celebrity-reactions/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140706180840/http://www.mtv.com/news/1709619/supreme-court-gay-marriage-ruling-celebrity-reactions/|url-status=dead|archive-date=July 6, 2014|access-date=June 26, 2013|publisher=MTV}}</ref> Lovato has previously affirmed her support for the LGBT community: \"I believe in [[gay marriage]], I believe in equality. I think there's a lot of hypocrisy with religion. But I just found that you can have your own relationship with God, and I still have a lot of faith.\"<ref>{{cite web|last=Tang|first=Vivian|date=November 22, 2013|title=Demi's New Image? \"[Neon Lights] Was My Grown-Up Sexy Video\"|url=http://www.cambio.com/2013/11/22/demis-new-image-neon-lights-was-my-grown-up-sexy-video/|access-date=November 24, 2013|publisher=Cambio}}</ref> In May 2014, Lovato was named lead performer for NYC Pride Week and Grand Marshal of the [[Los Angeles Pride|LA Pride Parade]], where she later filmed the music video for \"[[Really Don't Care]]\".<ref>{{cite press release|url=http://www.nycpride.org/uploads/press_releases/2014%20Pier%20Dance%20-%20Demi%20Release.pdf|work=NYC Pride|access-date=May 6, 2014|date=May 5, 2014|title=MULTI-PLATINUM SELLING RECORDING ARTIST, DEMI LOVATO GOES BICOASTAL FOR PRIDE|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140506093833/http://www.nycpride.org/uploads/press_releases/2014%20Pier%20Dance%20-%20Demi%20Release.pdf|archive-date=May 6, 2014|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{Cite magazine|date=June 26, 2014|title=Demi Lovato & Cher Lloyd's 'Really Don't Care' Video: Demi Invade L.A. Pride|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-really-dont-care-video-cher-lloyd-los-angeles-pride-6140783/|access-date=March 4, 2022|magazine=Billboard}}</ref> Lovato became the face of Human Rights Campaign's America's for Marriage Equality in 2015.<ref>{{cite web|title=Demi Lovato Face of Human Rights Campaign's Americans for Marriage Equality \u2013 Fuse|url=http://www.fuse.tv/2014/07/demi-lovato-human-rights-campaign-marriage-equality|access-date=August 26, 2015|work=Fuse}}</ref> In June 2016, Lovato participated in a video released by the [[Human Rights Campaign]] honoring the victims of the [[Orlando nightclub shooting]].<ref>{{cite web|title=49 Celebrities Honor 49 Victims of Orlando Tragedy &#124; Human Rights Campaign|url=http://www.hrc.org/blog/watch-49-celebrities-honor-49-victims-of-orlando-tragedy-in-new-ryan-murphy|access-date=June 30, 2016|publisher=Hrc.org|archive-date=August 23, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160823154109/http://www.hrc.org/blog/watch-49-celebrities-honor-49-victims-of-orlando-tragedy-in-new-ryan-murphy|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Rothaus|first=Steve|date=June 12, 2016|title=Pulse Orlando shooting scene a popular LGBT club where employees, patrons 'like family'|work=The Miami Herald|url=http://www.miamiherald.com/news/local/community/gay-south-florida/article83301677.html|access-date=June 15, 2016}}</ref>\n\n[[File:Demi Lovato May 2013.jpg|thumb|upright|Lovato at the [[Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration|SAMHSA]]'s [[National Children's Mental Health Awareness Week|National Children's Mental Health Awareness Day]] in May 2013]]\nLovato has also raised awareness for health and mental health issues. For her efforts to fight mental health stigma, she was honored with the Artistic Award of Courage by The Jane and Terry Semel Institute.<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Washington|first=Arlene|date=March 3, 2017|title=Demi Lovato to be Honored for Mental Health Advocacy|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-honored-mental-health-advocacy-7710060/|magazine=Billboard|access-date=March 4, 2022}}</ref> In May 2009, Lovato was named an Honorary Ambassador of Education by the American Partnership For [[Eosinophilia|Eosinophilic]] Disorders.<ref>{{cite web|date=May 12, 2009|title=Demi Lovato Accepts Eosinophilic Honorary Ambassador Award|url=http://crushable.com/entertainment/demi-lovato-accepts-eosinophilic-honorary-ambassador-award/|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120531065317/http://crushable.com/entertainment/demi-lovato-accepts-eosinophilic-honorary-ambassador-award/|archive-date=May 31, 2012|access-date=March 16, 2013|publisher=Crushable}}</ref> In December 2011, Lovato condemned the Disney Channel for airing episodes of ''[[Shake It Up (American TV series)|Shake It Up]]'' and ''[[So Random!]]'' in which characters joked about eating disorders. The network subsequently issued an apology and removed the episodes from their broadcast and video-on-demand services.<ref name=\"SlamDisney\">{{cite news|last=Derschowitz|first=Jessica|date=December 26, 2011|title=Demi Lovato slams Disney Channel over eating disorder joke|work=CBS News|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/demi-lovato-slams-disney-channel-over-eating-disorder-joke/|access-date=December 26, 2011}}</ref> In May 2013, she was cited for her dedication to mentoring teens and young adults with mental health problems at a National Children's Mental Health Awareness Day hosted by the [[Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration]] in Washington.<ref>{{cite web|last=Harris|first=Nadia-Elysse|date=May 8, 2013|title=Demi Lovato Honored At National Children's Mental Health Awareness Day Event|url=http://www.medicaldaily.com/demi-lovato-honored-national-childrens-mental-health-awareness-day-event-245654|access-date=August 22, 2013|publisher=Medicaldaily.com}}</ref> Lovato has paid treatment costs for mentally ill patients through the Lovato Treatment Scholarship Program, named for her late father, since 2013.<ref name=\"Lovece\" /> Her speech at the [[2016 Democratic National Convention]] focused on raising awareness for mental health.<ref>{{cite web|last=Johnson|first=Ted|date=July 25, 2016|title=Demi Lovato Performs AT DNC, Talks Mental Health Care|url=https://variety.com/2016/biz/news/demi-lovato-democratic-national-convention-1201822654/|access-date=September 30, 2016|work=Variety}}</ref> In September 2017, Lovato was named a [[Global Citizen (website)|Global Citizen]] ambassador for championing the mental health of thousands of children displaced within [[Iraq]] and other communities\" and helped \"fund the expansion of a [[Save the Children]] pilot program, Healing, and Education through the Arts, to violence-scarred young people living around [[Kirkuk]] and [[Saladin Governorate]], Iraq\".<ref>{{cite news|date=September 23, 2017|title=Demi Lovato to help war-scarred children in Iraq|publisher=[[nydailynews]]|agency=Associated Press|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/newswires/entertainment/demi-lovato-war-scarred-children-iraq-article-1.3516422|url-status=dead|access-date=September 26, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170926143703/http://www.nydailynews.com/newswires/entertainment/demi-lovato-war-scarred-children-iraq-article-1.3516422|archive-date=September 26, 2017}}</ref> In April 2020, Lovato joined a mental health campaign in support of Irish charity SpunOut.i.e. to launch The Mental Health Fund which is raising money for mental health support.<ref>{{cite web|last=Hillyer|first=Hannah|date=April 20, 2020|title=Demi Lovato includes Irish charity in urgent mental health appeal|url=https://vipmagazine.ie/demi-lovato-includes-irish-charity-in-urgent-mental-health-appeal/|access-date=November 24, 2020|work=[[VIP (magazine)|VIP]]}}</ref>\n\nLovato identifies as a [[Feminism|feminist]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Simone|first=Chima|date=August 8, 2014|title=Demi Lovato Gets Feminism Right, See the Celebs That Have Gotten It All Wrong!|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/567636/demi-lovato-gets-feminism-right-see-the-celebs-that-have-gotten-it-all-wrong|access-date=May 31, 2015|publisher=[[E! Online]]}}</ref> In a 2017 interview with ''[[Dolly (magazine)|Dolly]]'' magazine, she explained that \"Feminism&nbsp;... doesn't have to mean burning bras and hating men\" but instead \"standing up for gender equality and trying to empower our youth. And showing women that you can embrace your sexuality and you deserve to have confidence and you don't need to conform to society's views on what women should be or how you should dress. So, I think it is just about supporting other women and empowering other women.\"<ref>{{Cite magazine|last=Galea|first=Matt|title=Demi Lovato talks about feminism and cyber-bullying|url=http://www.dolly.com.au/dolly-doctor/demi-lovato-exclusively-talks-to-dolly-15164|access-date=March 16, 2020|magazine=[[Dolly (magazine)|Dolly]]|archive-date=August 3, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210803150408/http://www.dolly.com.au/dolly-doctor/demi-lovato-exclusively-talks-to-dolly-15164|url-status=dead}}</ref> In May 2017, Lovato partnered with [[Fabletics]] to create a limited edition activewear collection<ref>{{cite magazine|author=Kim Duong|date=May 8, 2017|title=Demi Lovato Is Launching an Activewear Collection with Fabletics|url=http://www.instyle.com/news/demi-lovato-fabletics-collection-workout-clothes|magazine=InStyle}}</ref> for the United Nations Foundation's Girl Up campaign to fund programs for \"the world's most marginalized adolescent girls\".<ref>{{cite web|author=Dominique Astorino|date=May 12, 2017|title=Brace Your Wallets: Fabletics Is Launching a Collaboration With Demi Lovato|url=https://www.popsugar.com/fitness/Demi-Lovato-Fabletics-Collection-43514494|publisher=PopSugar}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Faith Brar|date=May 8, 2017|title=Demi Lovato Teams Up with Fabletics to Empower Young Girls|url=http://www.shape.com/fitness/clothes/demi-lovato-empower-young-girls-fabletics|publisher=Shape.com|access-date=July 10, 2017|archive-date=November 18, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181118222021/https://www.shape.com/fitness/clothes/demi-lovato-empower-young-girls-fabletics|url-status=dead}}</ref>\n\nLovato is a vocal anti-bullying advocate. In October 2010, she served as spokesperson for the anti-bullying organization PACER and appeared on ''[[America's Next Top Model]]'' to speak out against bullying.<ref>{{cite web|title=Demi Lovato America's Next Top Model|url=http://oceanup.com/2010/09/02/demi-lovato-americas-next-top-model|access-date=July 27, 2011|publisher=Ocean Up. As If Productions|archive-date=April 15, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190415174436/http://oceanup.com/2010/09/02/demi-lovato-americas-next-top-model/|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite press release|url=http://www.pacer.org/bullying/about/pressrelease.asp?file=2010/nr20101001-1.asp|title=Demi Lovato, PACER and Facebook\u00ae Team Up to Stop Cyberbullying During National Bullying Prevention Month|publisher=National Bullying Prevention Center|date=October 1, 2010|access-date=March 16, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130613100604/http://www.pacer.org/bullying/about/pressrelease.asp?file=2010%2Fnr20101001-1.asp|archive-date=June 13, 2013|url-status=live}}</ref> Lovato participated in the \"A Day Made Better\" school advocacy campaign<ref>{{cite web|last=Peel|first=Sarah|date=October 7, 2010|title=Demi Lovato Does 'A Day Made Better' School Advocacy Campaign|url=http://www.bsckids.com/2010/10/demi-lovato-does-a-day-made-better-school-advocacy-campaign/|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121114143446/http://www.bsckids.com/2010/10/demi-lovato-does-a-day-made-better-school-advocacy-campaign/|archive-date=November 14, 2012|access-date=March 16, 2013|website=BSCKids}}</ref> and has supported DonateMyDress.org, [[Kids Wish Network]], Love Our Children USA, [[St. Jude Children's Research Hospital]] and [[City of Hope (charity)|City of Hope]].<ref name=\"Philanthropy\">{{cite web|title=Demi Lovato's Charity Work, Events and Causes|url=http://www.looktothestars.org/celebrity/demi-lovato|access-date=March 10, 2013|publisher=Look to the Stars: The World of Celebrity Giving}}</ref> In April 2012, she became a contributing editor of ''[[Seventeen (American magazine)|Seventeen]]'' magazine, describing her personal struggles to its female teenage readers.<ref name=\"Seventeen2011\" /> In September 2012, Lovato was named the ambassador of ''Mean Stinks'', a campaign focused on eliminating bullying by girls.<ref>{{cite web|author=Cory Midgarden|date=September 24, 2012|title=Demi Lovato Tackling Girl-To-Girl Bullying, One 'Mean' Girl At A Time|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1694351/demi-lovato-mean-stinks-bullying/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140725185242/http://www.mtv.com/news/1694351/demi-lovato-mean-stinks-bullying/|url-status=dead|archive-date=July 25, 2014|access-date=March 16, 2013|publisher=MTV News. Viacom}}</ref>\n\nLovato is politically active, often speaking out against gun violence and racial injustice. In January 2010, she was featured in a public-service announcement for Voto Latino to promote the organization's \"Be Counted\" campaign ahead of the [[2010 United States Census]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Voto Latino campaign, January 10, 2010|url=http://demilovatodaily.com/news.php?start_from=232&ucat=&archive=&subaction=&id=&|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160110220730/http://demilovatodaily.com/news.php?start_from=232&ucat=&archive=&subaction=&id=&|archive-date=January 10, 2016|access-date=March 16, 2013|publisher=Demi Lovato Daily}}</ref> In June 2016, Lovato signed an open letter from ''Billboard'' urging [[Gun politics in the United States|gun reform]]<ref>{{cite magazine|title=An Open Letter to Congress from the Music Industry|url=https://www.billboard.com/open-letter/|access-date=June 26, 2016|magazine=Billboard}}</ref> and performed at the [[March for Our Lives]] anti-gun violence rally in Washington, D.C. in March 2018.<ref name=\"CBS\">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x1XfTAoS7hg \"Demi Lovato Performs At March For Our Lives In Washington, D.C.\"]. CBS Miami. (March 24, 2018).</ref><ref name=\"MP\">Maria Pasquini. [http://people.com/music/demi-lovato-miley-cyrus-march-for-our-lives/ \"Demi Lovato and Miley Cyrus Reunite at March for Our Lives: 'Happy to Stand with You'\"]. People Music (May 2, 2017).</ref> In May 2020, Lovato condemned police brutality and the officers responsible for the [[murder of George Floyd]] and the [[shooting of Breonna Taylor]]. She shared resources to support the [[Black Lives Matter]] movement and black-owned businesses and denounced [[white privilege]].<ref>{{cite news|author=Benjamin Vanhoose|date=May 27, 2020|title=Kim Kardashian, Chance the Rapper and More Celebs React to George Floyd Killing: 'This Is Not Okay'|magazine=People|url=https://people.com/crime/celebrities-react-to-george-floyd-death-and-police-brutality/|access-date=June 17, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Patrick Hosken|date=June 3, 2020|title=Demi Lovato Memorialized Breonna Taylor And Speaks Out Against White Privilege|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/3166351/demi-lovato-breonna-taylor-support/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200604042033/http://www.mtv.com/news/3166351/demi-lovato-breonna-taylor-support/|url-status=dead|archive-date=June 4, 2020|access-date=June 17, 2020|magazine=MTV News}}</ref>\n\nThroughout her career, Lovato has donated to and partnered with various charities. In 2009, she recorded the theme song \"[[Send It On (Disney song)|Send It On]]\" with the [[Jonas Brothers]], [[Miley Cyrus]], and [[Selena Gomez]] for Disney's Friends for Change program. The song debuted on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100 at number 20,<ref name=autogenerated2>{{cite press release|url=http://www.disneychannelmedianet.com/DNR/2009/doc/Send_It_On_Disneys_Friends_for_Change%20_081909.doc |title='Send It On,' an anthem by the world's biggest teen stars, Miley Cyrus, Jonas Brothers, Selena Gomez and Demi Lovato, for Disney's 'Friends for Change: Project Green,' will debut on Radio Disney, Disney Channel, Disney.com and iTunes |date=August 6, 2009 |website=Disney Channel Media Net|publisher=[[The Walt Disney Company]] |location=Burbank, California|access-date=August 20, 2009 |format=DOC |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110511155245/http://www.disneychannelmedianet.com/DNR/2009/doc/Send_It_On_Disneys_Friends_for_Change%20_081909.doc |archive-date=May 11, 2011 }}</ref> and its proceeds were directed to environmental charities through the Disney Worldwide Conservation Fund.<ref name=\"pressrelease\" /> Lovato and Joe Jonas recorded the song \"[[Make a Wave]]\" for the charity in March 2010.<ref name=\"iTunesMakeAWave\"/> In August 2013, she traveled to [[Kenya]] for her 21st birthday to participate in a program of the international charity organization [[Free the Children]].<ref name=\"Kenya2013\">{{cite web|last1=Nesbitt|first1=Cherylann|title=Demi Lovato Celebrates 21st Birthday In Kenya During Me to We Volunteer Trip|url=http://news.mtv.ca/blogs/we-day/demi-lovato-celebrates-21st-birthday-in-kenya-during-me-to-we-volunteer-trip/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160521080749/http://news.mtv.ca/blogs/we-day/demi-lovato-celebrates-21st-birthday-in-kenya-during-me-to-we-volunteer-trip|archive-date=May 21, 2016|access-date=April 5, 2017|website=MTV Canada}}</ref> She returned to Kenya in January 2017 with [[We Day|We Movement]] to work with women and children.<ref>{{cite web|last=Baila|first=Morgan|date=January 13, 2017|title=Demi Lovato Kenya Travel Pics We Movement Charity|url=http://www.refinery29.com/2017/01/136014/demi-lovato-africa-trip-charity|access-date=January 20, 2017|work=Refinery29}}</ref> In March 2017, as a celebration of her five-year anniversary of [[sobriety]], Lovato donated money to Los Angeles-based charities specializing in [[Animal rights|animal]], [[LGBT rights|LGBT]], and adoption rights.<ref>{{cite web|last=Aiello|first=McKenna|date=March 19, 2017|title=Demi Lovato Celebrates Five Years of Sobriety by Hand Delivering Donations to Charities|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/837076/demi-lovato-celebrates-five-years-of-sobriety-by-hand-delivering-donations-to-charities|access-date=March 21, 2017|publisher=[[Eonline.com]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=de la Cretaz|first=Britni|date=March 19, 2017|title=Demi Lovato Celebrated Five Years Sober With A Selfless Act Of Kindness|url=http://www.refinery29.com/2017/03/145949/demi-lovato-five-years-sober|access-date=March 21, 2017|publisher=[[Refinery29]]}}</ref> In August 2017, Lovato donated $50000 to [[Hurricane Harvey]] relief and started fund with [[Nick Jonas]], [[DNCE]], and her then-manager Phil McIntyre. Lovato's second limited edition activewear collection with Fabletics, released in June 2020, pledged up to $125,000 in proceeds to [[COVID-19 pandemic]] relief efforts.<ref>{{cite news|author=Kara Nesvig|date=April 1, 2020|title=Demi Lovato Launches New Fabletics Line, Announces Part of the Profits Will Go to COVID-19 Relief|magazine=Teen Vogue|url=https://www.teenvogue.com/story/demi-lovato-fabletics-line-coronavirus-relief|access-date=June 17, 2020}}</ref> As spokesperson for the Join the Surge Campaign, DoSomething.Org, and Joining the Surge by [[Clean & Clear]], she has encouraged fans to take action in their own communities.<ref>{{cite press release|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/clean--clear-skincare-demi-lovato-and-dosomethingorg-join-forces-to-start-a-massive-movement-encouraging-teens-to-give-back-96372024.html|title=CLEAN & CLEAR\u00ae Skincare, Demi Lovato and DoSomething.org Join Forces to Start a Massive Movement Encouraging Teens to Give Back|publisher=[[PR Newswire]]|access-date=December 27, 2015|date=June 15, 2010}}</ref>\n\nIn September 2021, Lovato performed at the [[Greek Theatre (Los Angeles)|Greek Theatre]] in Los Angeles to raise awareness of the different crises that the world is going through and promote global unity, as part of the [[Global Citizen Live]] organization.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Lee Lenker |first1=Maureen |title=Watch Global Citizen Live featuring performances from Lizzo, Elton John, Demi Lovato, and more |url=https://www.yahoo.com/news/watch-global-citizen-live-featuring-133000798.html |access-date=September 26, 2021 |work=[[Yahoo! News]] |date=September 25, 2021}}</ref> In December 2023, Lovato voiced her support for [[United Nations Human Rights Council|United Nations Human Rights]]' climate change campaign, urging leaders to work towards [[climate justice]], in tandem with the [[2023 United Nations Climate Change Conference|COP28]] conference.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Bain |first=Katie |date=December 1, 2023 |title=Demi Lovato, Cyndi Lauper & More Artists Join Climate Change Human Rights Campaign |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/demi-lovato-cyndi-lauper-join-climate-change-human-rights-campaign-1235530068/ |magazine=Billboard |access-date=December 9, 2023}}</ref>\n\n===Products and endorsements===\n[[File:Demi Lovato (Red carpet) - Global Citizen Festival Hamburg 07.jpg|upright|right|thumb|Lovato at the [[Global Citizen Festival]] in [[Hamburg]] in July 2017]]\n\nFrom 2014 to 2016, Lovato was the face of the [[Skechers]] footwear brand.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.latina.com/fashion/celebrity/demi-lovato-skechers-campaign-first-look|title=Get a Sneak Peek at Demi Lovato's Skechers Campaign!|work=Latina|date=September 10, 2014|access-date=June 22, 2020|archive-date=November 30, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201130053004/http://www.latina.com/fashion/celebrity/demi-lovato-skechers-campaign-first-look|url-status=dead}}</ref> She partnered with [[Shazam (music app)|Shazam]] on the [[Demi World Tour]] in 2014.<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Flanagan|first=Andrew|date=April 28, 2014|title=Demi Lovato, Shazam Announce Deal to Let Fans Plan New Tour|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/6070133/demi-lovato-shazam-announce-deal-to-let-fans-plan-new-tour|magazine=Billboard|access-date=May 11, 2014}}</ref> Lovato launched her skincare line ''Devonne by Demi'' in December of the same year.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://stylenews.peoplestylewatch.com/2014/09/03/demi-lovato-devonne-skincare-line/ |title=Demi Lovato on Her New Skincare Line: 'If You Use Products That Work, You'll Find Inner Confidence'|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|access-date=September 3, 2014|first=Ana|last=Calderone|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140904000701/http://stylenews.peoplestylewatch.com/2014/09/03/demi-lovato-devonne-skincare-line/|archive-date=September 4, 2014 }}</ref> In addition, she became the first-ever brand ambassador of the makeup brand N.Y.C. New York Color in 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.teenvogue.com/story/demi-lovato-new-york-color-brand-ambassador|title=Demi Lovato Just Scored a Big-Deal New Gig That's 100% Perfect for Her|work=Teen Vogue|date=September 26, 2014|access-date=June 22, 2020}}</ref> That year, Lovato promoted The Radiant Collection for [[Tampax]] for \"empowering females of all ages to stay fearless and wear what they want anytime of the month.\"<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20150212005187/en/Demi-Lovato-Steps-Spotlight-Face-Radiant-Collection|title=Demi Lovato Steps into the Spotlight as the Face of The Radiant Collection|work=Business Wire|date=February 12, 2015|access-date=May 20, 2021}}</ref> In June 2016, Lovato partnered with streaming service [[Tidal (service)|Tidal]] to livestream the first date of her [[Future Now Tour]] with Nick Jonas.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/7416728/tidal-livestream-nick-jonas-demi-lovato-tour-date|title=Tidal To Livestream Nick Jonas & Demi Lovato Tour Date|magazine=Billboard|first=Gil|last=Kaufman|date=June 28, 2016|access-date=June 30, 2016}}</ref> Since 2017, Lovato has released activewear collections with the women's athleisure brand [[Fabletics]] to raise money for organizations such as United Nations Foundation's Girl Up campaign and [[COVID-19]] relief efforts.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/lifestyle/7800103/demi-lovato-on-her-fabletics-campaign-and-new-music|title=Demi Lovato on Her New Fabletics Collection: 'It's All About Being the Best Version of Yourself'|last=Saunders|first=Nicole|magazine=Billboard|date=May 17, 2017|access-date=June 22, 2020}}</ref> Also in 2017, she performed at a dinner hosted by the jewelry company [[Bulgari]] to celebrate the opening of the brand's [[Fifth Avenue]] flagship store in [[New York City]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.wmagazine.com/story/lily-aldridge-bulgari-party-bella-hadid-sofia-richie-demi-lovato/|title=Lily Aldridge Takes Us Inside Bulgari's Extravagant, Top Secret Party with Bella Hadid, Sofia Richie, and Demi Lovato|last=McCarthy|first=Lauren|work=[[W (magazine)|W]]|date=October 21, 2017|access-date=December 8, 2020}}</ref>\n\nLovato became a brand ambassador for the [[JBL]] audio company in 2017<ref>{{cite web|url=https://news.harman.com/releases/demi-lovato-named-jblR-brand-ambassador|title=Demi Lovato Named JBL\u00ae Brand Ambassador|work=Harman|last=Shewchuk|first=Darrin|date=November 21, 2016|access-date=June 22, 2020}}</ref> and for the mug company Ember in 2018.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://babe.net/2018/03/12/demi-lovatos-mug-meme-41327|title=Demi Lovato turned this humiliating meme about her into an ad deal and honestly, I'm inspired|work=Babe|date=March 12, 2018|access-date=June 22, 2020}}</ref> That year, she starred in CORE Hydration's \"Finding Balance\" campaign; she had become an initial investor of CORE Hydration after first discovering the brand in 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://alltvspots.com/2018/core-hydration-water-demi-lovato-commercial/|title= Core Hydration Water Demi Lovato Commercial|website=All TV Spots|date= June 18, 2018|access-date=June 24, 2020}}</ref> [[Jaguar Cars|Jaguar]], JBL, [[Lyft]], [[Ferrari]], [[TikTok]] and [[Samsung]] products have been featured in Lovato's music videos.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://productplacementblog.com/?s=demi+Lovato+|title=Demi Lovato Product Placement Photos|website=Product Placement Blog|access-date=June 22, 2020}}</ref> She also appeared in commercials for Skechers, [[Acuvue]], [[Apple Inc.|Apple]], and Fabletics.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.ispot.tv/topic/musician/qC/demi-lovato|title=Demi Lovato TV Commercials Ads|website=i-Spot|access-date=September 14, 2020}}</ref> In 2019, [[Dior]] used Lovato's song \"Only Forever\" from the album ''[[Tell Me You Love Me (album)|Tell Me You Love Me]]'' in a series of commercials and social media posts to promote the brand's \"Dior Forever\" makeup collection; the brand later used Lovato's song \"[[Confident (Demi Lovato song)|Confident]]\" in March 2021 to promote a new \"Dior Forever\" foundation in a series of social media campaigns. Since September 2020, Lovato has served as a Mental Health Spokesperson for the online and mobile therapy company [[Talkspace]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.eonline.com/news/1186061/demi-lovato-is-talkspaces-new-mental-health-spokesperson|title=Demi Lovato Is Talkspace's New Mental Health Spokesperson!|last=Lehmann|first=Carolin|publisher=E!|date=September 9, 2020|access-date=September 14, 2020}}</ref> In November 2021, Lovato announced the launch of her own vibrator, named Demi Wand, in partnership with [[Bellesa]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.glamour.com/story/demi-lovato-just-released-their-own-sex-toy|title=Demi Lovato Just Released Their Own Sex Toy|website=[[Glamour (magazine)|Glamour]]|publisher=[[Cond\u00e9 Nast]]|last=Tannenbaum|first=Emily|date=November 9, 2021|access-date=November 9, 2021}}</ref> The same month, she became [[Gaia, Inc.]]'s first celebrity ambassador;<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.teenvogue.com/story/demi-lovato-joined-gaia-heres-why-it-matters|title=Demi Lovato Joined Gaia \u2014 Here's Why It Matters|website=[[Teen Vogue]]|publisher=[[Cond\u00e9 Nast]]|last=McNab|first=Kaitlyn|date=November 18, 2021|access-date=December 15, 2021}}</ref> this endorsement attracted criticism from fans and the media due to the contents of the platform, which are widely described as promoting conspiracy theories.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.elle.com/uk/life-and-culture/culture/a38274874/demi-lovato-gaia-conspiracy-site/|title=Demi Lovato Joins Conspiracy Site Gaia - Here's What You Need To Know|website=[[Elle (magazine)|Elle]]|location=UK|last=Strunck|first=Clara|date=November 17, 2021|access-date=December 15, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.papermag.com/demi-lovato-gaia-conspiracy-2655528288.html|title=Demi Lovato Is Out Here Promoting a Site for Conspiracy Theorists|website=[[Paper (magazine)|Paper]]|author=Paper Magazine|date=November 9, 2021|access-date=December 15, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.out.com/celebs/2021/11/09/what-you-need-know-about-demi-lovato-joining-conspiracy-site-gaia|title=What You Need to Know About Demi Lovato Joining Conspiracy Site Gaia|website=[[Out (magazine)|Out]]|last=Rude|first=Mey|date=November 9, 2021|access-date=December 15, 2021}}</ref> In March 2024, Lovato became a brand ambassador for and celebrity partner of Xeomin, a [[Neurotoxic drug|neurotoxic]] [[injectable filler]] by [[Merz Pharma#Merz Aesthetics|Merz Aesthetics]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=March 6, 2024 |title=Merz Aesthetics\u00ae Continues Multi-Year 'Beauty on Your Terms' Campaign for XEOMIN\u00ae (incobotulinumtoxinA) with Announcement of Demi Lovato as New Brand Partner |url=https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20240306431486/en/Merz-Aesthetics%C2%AE-Continues-Multi-Year-%E2%80%98Beauty-on-Your-Terms%E2%80%99-Campaign-for-XEOMIN%C2%AE-incobotulinumtoxinA-with-Announcement-of-Demi-Lovato-as-New-Brand-Partner |access-date=March 10, 2024 |publisher=[[Business Wire]]}}</ref><ref>{{Cite journal |last=Carballo |first=Charlie |date=March 6, 2024 |title=Demi Lovato Lends Her Voice to Empowerment Through Self Care and Maintaining a 'Natural Look' With Anti-wrinkle Injectable Xeomin |url=https://wwd.com/pop-culture/culture-news/demi-lovato-xeomin-campaign-1236249443/ |journal=[[Women's Wear Daily]] |access-date=March 10, 2024}}</ref> In July, she released a song on TikTok, titled \"OG Anthem\", for haircare brand OGX's \"OG Who? OGX\" campaign.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Santino |first=Catherine |date=July 18, 2024 |title=Demi Lovato Collabs with OGX on a Song for Your Summer Playlist: 'It's About Feeling Yourself' (Exclusive) |url=https://people.com/demi-lovato-creates-song-with-hair-brand-ogx-for-new-campaign-exclusive-8678978/ |access-date=August 3, 2024 |magazine=People}}</ref>\n\n== Achievements ==\n{{see also|List of awards and nominations received by Demi Lovato}}\nLovato has won an [[MTV Video Music Awards|MTV Video Music Award]], a ''[[Guinness World Records|Guinness World Record]]'', an [[iHeartRadio MMVAs|iHeartRadio Much Music Video Award]], two [[Latin American Music Awards]], and five [[People's Choice Awards]].{{efn|name=Awards|Adapted from [[List of awards and nominations received by Demi Lovato]].}} For her work in music, she was nominated for two [[Grammy Awards]], an [[American Music Awards|American Music Award]], four [[Billboard Music Awards|''Billboard'' Music Awards]], and three [[Brit Awards]].{{efn|name=Awards}} With 14 wins, Lovato is the [[Teen Choice Awards#Most wins|eighth-most-awarded solo artist]] at the [[Teen Choice Awards]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.goldderby.com/gallery/teen-choice-awards-most-wins-taylor-swift-one-direction-photos/|title=Teen Choice Awards: Most Wins|work=Gold Derby|date=July 26, 2018 |access-date=July 26, 2018}}</ref> She was named the #1 ''[[The New York Times]]'' [[The New York Times Best Seller list|Best Seller Author]] of 2013.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.nytimes.com/books/best-sellers/2013/12/08/|title=The New York Times Best Sellers|magazine=[[The New York Times]]|date=December 8, 2013|access-date=August 3, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190729113151/https://www.nytimes.com/books/best-sellers/2013/12/08|archive-date=July 29, 2019|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|last=Mancuso|first=Christina|url=https://www.broadwayworld.com/bwwbooks/article/Demi-Lovato-Becomes-1-New-York-Times-Best-Selling-Author-20131202|title=Demi Lovato Becomes #1 The New York Times Best-Selling Author|magazine=[[BroadwayWorld]]|date=December 2, 2013|access-date=August 3, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131207105805/http://www.broadwayworld.com/bwwbooks/article/Demi-Lovato-Becomes-1-New-York-Times-Best-Selling-Author-20131202|archive-date=December 7, 2013|url-status=live}}</ref> In 2015, Lovato was honored with the [[Billboard Women in Music#Rulebreaker Award|Rulebreaker Award]] at the [[Billboard Women in Music|''Billboard'' Women in Music]] event.<ref name=\"Rulebreaker\"/> In 2016, for her activism in the [[LGBT rights by country or territory|LGBT rights movement]], she was awarded a [[GLAAD Vanguard Award]] at the [[27th GLAAD Media Awards]].<ref name=\"GLAAD Vanguard\"/> That year, she was named to ''[[Forbes]]''' [[30 Under 30]] list in the music category.<ref name=\"forbeslist\"/> ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' included Lovato on its annual [[Time 100|list of the 100 most influential people]] in 2017.<ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://time.com/collection/2017-time-100/4736200/demi-lovato/|title=Demi Lovato: The 100 Most Influential People of 2017|magazine=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|access-date=April 20, 2017}}</ref> ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' ranked her as [[Billboard Decade-End|one of the most successful artists of the 2010s decade]] in 2019.<ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/decade-end/top-artists/|title=Top Artists - 2010s|magazine=Billboard|access-date=November 3, 2022|archive-date=March 26, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230326040714/https://www.billboard.com/charts/decade-end/top-artists/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nAccording to ''Billboard'', Lovato sold over 24 million records in the United States.<ref>{{Cite magazine|date=October 15, 2017|title=Ask Billboard: Demi Lovato's Career Album & Song Sales|url=https://www.billboard.com/pro/demi-lovato-21-savage-tom-petty-ask-billboard/|access-date=July 10, 2020|magazine=Billboard|archive-date=April 26, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220426131038/https://www.billboard.com/pro/demi-lovato-21-savage-tom-petty-ask-billboard/|url-status=live}}</ref> In 2009, when she was 16, her album ''[[Here We Go Again (Demi Lovato album)|Here We Go Again]]'' debuted atop the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]],<ref name=\"Here We Go Again billboard 200\"/> making her one of the eleven artists of all time who topped the chart before turning 18.<ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/photos/6546259/number-1-album-under-18-solo-artists|title=These 11 Solo Artists Scored a No. 1 Album Before Turning 18|author =Lynch, Joe|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=April 29, 2015|access-date=June 7, 2020}}</ref> Lovato has released [[Demi Lovato discography#Albums|eight studio albums]], all of which debuted in the top-ten of the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]],<ref name=bb200>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/demi-lovato/chart-history/tlp/ |title=Demi Lovato \u2013 Chart History: Billboard 200 |magazine=Billboard|access-date=July 11, 2016}}</ref> (four [[Music recording certification|platinum]], two [[Music recording certification|gold]]).<ref name=\"Gold & Platinum\"/> She has four top-ten songs on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]].<ref name=\"BillboardChartHistory\"/> Two of Lovato's songs and music videos have reached more than one billion streams and views on Spotify and [[YouTube]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://open.spotify.com/playlist/37i9dQZF1DX7iB3RCnBnN4|title=BILLIONS CLUB|publisher=Spotify|access-date=May 6, 2022}}</ref><ref>{{cite AV media|url=https://youtube.com/watch?v=TyHvyGVs42U&feature=share|title=\"\u00c9chame la Culpa\"|publisher=[[YouTube]]|date=November 7, 2017|access-date=August 4, 2023}}<br>{{cite AV media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8JnfIa84TnU|title=Clean Bandit - Solo (feat. Demi Lovato) [Official Video]|publisher=[[YouTube]]|date=May 31, 2018|access-date=November 30, 2023}}</ref> In 2012, she became the youngest ''X Factor'' judge in the show's history.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/world-records/107714-youngest-x-factor-judge|title=Youngest X Factor judge|website=[[Guinness World Records]]|access-date=July 16, 2020|date=May 24, 2012}}</ref> Lovato is the [[List of most-followed Instagram accounts|eleventh most-followed musician]] on [[Instagram]] with over 157 million followers on this platform,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://instagram.com/ddlovato?igshid=MzRlODBiNWFlZA==|title=Demi Lovato|access-date=August 3, 2023|via=[[Instagram]]}}</ref> and the [[List of most-followed Twitter accounts|tenth most-followed musician]] on [[Twitter]] with over 53 million followers on this platform.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/ddlovato|title=Demi Lovato|access-date=August 3, 2023|via=[[Twitter]]}}</ref>\n\n== Filmography ==\n{{Main|Demi Lovato videography}}\n\n* ''[[Camp Rock]]'' (2008)\n* ''[[Jonas Brothers: The 3D Concert Experience]]'' (2009)\n* ''[[Princess Protection <https://lists.wikimedia.org/postorius/lists/mediawiki-api-announce.lists.wikimedia.org/> for notice of API deprecations and breaking changes. Use [[Special:ApiFeatureUsage]] to see usage of deprecated features by your application."},"revisions":{"*":"Because \"rvslots\" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"Nikki_Hornsby","to":"Nikki Hornsby"}],"pages":{"13515154":{"pageid":13515154,"ns":0,"title":"Nikki Hornsby","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{short description|American singer, songwriter, and guitarist}}\n\n{{Use mdy dates|date=July 2023}}\n{{Infobox musical artist | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject Musicians -->\n| name            = Nikki Hornsby\n| image           = JWgreyScale2x1wTxt.jpg\n| caption         = Hornsby in 2007\n| birth_name      = Nikki Hornsby\n| birth_date      = \n| birth_place     = [[Long Beach, California]], U.S.\n| instrument      = Vocals, guitar\n| genre           = [[Pop music|Pop]], [[Americana (music)|Americana]], [[country music|country]], [[Christian music]] and [[Blues]]\n| years_active    = 1970s\u2013present\n| label           = CJP-NHRecords\n| current_member_of = \n| website         = www.cjp-nhrecords.com \n}}\n\n'''Nikki Hornsby''' is an American musician who has been active in the [[Pop music|pop]], [[Americana music|Americana]], [[country music|country]], and [[blues]] genres as a songwriter, singer, and guitarist.<ref name=\"TCO\" /> From [[Long Beach, California]],<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.newspapers.com/article/news-pilot-taking-on-country-solo/127288533/ |title=Taking on country solo |newspaper=News-Pilot |location=San Pedro, California | date=April 20, 1988 | page=13 }}</ref> Hornsby grew up in Fairfax County of [[Northern Virginia]]. She is the granddaughter of [[Dan Hornsby]], who was a songwriter, musician, recording artist, talent scout, engineer and producer for [[Columbia Records]] [[RCA Victor]]. Her family association with songwriter [[Jimmy Van Heusen]] influenced her when young.<ref name=\"TCO\">{{cite news|url=https://www.newspapers.com/article/the-charlotte-observer-she-wants-grandpa/127279922/ |title=She wants Grandpa in hall of fame|newspaper=The Charlotte Observer |date=February 12, 2003 | page=67}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.shelbystar.com/story/news/2013/02/27/musician-who-wrote-song-about/34129944007/ |title=Musician who wrote song about 1928 Shelby Disaster recognized by Grammy Museum|first1=Jackie |last1=Bridges | date=February 27, 2013 }}</ref> Hornsby inherited her grandfather's archive of early Americana music and has worked to document his legacy, including that he discovered many songwriter-singers, like [[Bessie Smith]], for Columbia Records.<ref name=\"TCO\" />\n\n== Career ==\n=== Before 2000 ===\nHornsby played gigs in the eastern US while a college student. She moved back to California in the 1970s and began playing regularly, but did not begin to record until the late 1980s, when she founded her own label, NH Records (later CJP-NH Records). Around that time, her song \"Shoe String and a Prayer\" began to get radio play in America and Europe; the tune charted on the [[Cash Box Top 100]]<ref>Cash Box Top 100 No.&nbsp;78, June 24, 1989 Issue</ref> and hit the independent country charts in America, and she was named Female Singer of the Year in [[Scandinavia]] in 1988.<ref name=amg>[https://www.allmusic.com/artist/nikki-hornsby-mn0000345873/biography Nikki Hornsby biography] at Allmusic.com</ref> By 1991, she formed Nikki Hornsby and the Rangers.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.newspapers.com/article/news-pilot-nikki-hornsby-and-the-rangers/127286331/ |title=Nikki Hornsby and the Rangers at Alpine Inn|newspaper=News-Pilot|location=San Pedro, California| date=October 4, 1991 | page=56 }}</ref>\n\nIn the early 1990s, she routinely sang at the Alpine Village in Torrance, California.<ref>''[[Long Beach Press-Telegram]]'' (September 23, 1993) ''Coming-up.'' Section: Life/Style. Page D2.</ref> In August 1991, she drew the largest crowd of the summer at [[Redondo Beach]]'s summer Concert in the Park series.<ref>Faristimes, Ald. (August 16, 1991) \"New Redondo Budget Silences Concert Series.\" ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' Section: ME-Metro; Page 3.</ref> Nikki Hornsby and the Rangers played the Concert in the Park series again in August 1993 and July 1994.<ref>Berg, Mary Helen. (July 16, 1993) \"Summer Concerts: Pleasing tunes will fill the air along the beach on hot days and balmy nights.\" ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' Section: Metro; Page 4.</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.newspapers.com/article/the-daily-breeze-dixieland-musicians-ope/127285604/| title=Dixieland musicians open summer series|newspaper=The Daily Breeze|date=June 26, 1994 |page=14 }}</ref>\n\nIn the 1980s, she recorded as a solo singer-songwriter musician with Steve Duncan, [[JayDee Maness]],  and [[John Jorgenson]] from [[The Desert Rose Band]]; Jack Daniels (Hwy 101 Band); and guitarist Al Bruno.<ref>{{cite news |title=Nikki Hornsby|newspaper=CA Country Music News |location=San Jose, California| volume=2 | number=20|page=9|date=April 1991}}</ref>\n\n=== 2000\u20132006 ===\n{{multiple image\n  | direction = vertical\n  | width     = \n  | footer    = \n  | image1    = Dr Laura Schlessinger with Nikki Hornsby.jpg\n  | alt1      = \n  | caption1  = [[Laura Schlessinger]] (left) with Hornsby in 2009. Schlessinger used Hornsby's song \"Hot Talkin' Big Shot\" for several years as theme music.\n  | image2    = Nikki Hornsby - Hot Talkin Big Shot.ogg\n  | alt2      = \n  | caption2  = \"Hot Talkin' Big Shot\"\n}}\n\nIn August 2001, Nikki Hornsby sang at the [[Cliffie Stone]] Memorial Jamboree in [[Santa Clarita, California]].<ref>\"Memorial jamboree for Stone on Sunday.\" ''[[Los Angeles Daily News]]'' (August 31, 2001) Section: News; Page 4.</ref> Hornsby also acted as a judge for a number of California country music competitions and as a judge of talent for the Colgate Talent Contests.<ref name=amg /> \"Hot Talkin' Big Shot\" is an original song by Hornsby.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.newspapers.com/article/news-pilot-nikki-hornsby-hot-talkin/127286742/ |title=Nikki Hornsby \u2013 'Hot Talkin' Big Shot' |newspaper=News-Pilot | location=San Pedro, California | date =August 21, 1987 |page=57 }}</ref>\n\n=== 2006\u2013present ===\nHornsby appeared on the Spanish TV channel IB3 in April 2006. She also performed on commercial radio telecasts in [[Palma de Mallorca|Palma]].<ref>Majorca Daily Bulletin, Tuesday April 4, 2006</ref> In 2009, CJP-NHRecords released ''Just Wait Instrumentally'' (the instrumental version of the 2006 album ''Just Wait'').<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/nikki-hornsby-mn0000345873/discography|title=Nikki Hornsby discography|website=allmusic.com|accessdate=June 28, 2023 }}</ref> In 2014, CJP-NHRecords released Hornsby's original song \"Just Lovin' You\"<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/album/just-lovin-you-mw0002771972 |title=Just Lovin' You |website=allmusic.com|accessdate=June 28, 2023 }}</ref> that was covered by the singer Zita Sabon as \"''Ich Liebe Dich''\" (translated into German).<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/album/ich-liebe-dich-just-lovin-you-mw0002771969 |title=Ich Liebe Dich [Just Lovin' You] |website=allmusic.com|accessdate=June 28, 2023 }}</ref> In 2011 she was nominated for [[Billboard (magazine)|''Billboard'']]'s Women in Music award.<ref>{{Cite magazine |date=2011-12-02 |title=Billboard Women In Music 2011: List of Nominees |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/billboard-women-in-music-2011-list-of-nominees-1158739/ |access-date=2023-08-01 |magazine=Billboard |language=en-US}}</ref>\n\n== Discography ==\n\n{| class=\"wikitable\"\n! width = 5% | year !! width = 20% | album or song title !! comments\n|-\n| 1986 || ''Let Me Take You on a CJP-NHRecords\n|}\n\n== References ==\n{{Reflist|30em}}\n\n== External links ==\n{{Commons category|Nikki Hornsby}}\n* [http://cjp-nhrecords.com/ CJP-NHRecords
