College alumni]]\n[[Category:Singer-songwriters from Oklahoma]]"}]}}}}{"batchcomplete":"","warnings":{"main":{"*":"Subscribe to the mediawiki-api-announce mailing list at <https://lists.wikimedia.org/postorius/lists/mediawiki-api-announce.lists.wikimedia.org/> for notice of API deprecations and breaking changes. Use [[Special:ApiFeatureUsage]] to see usage of deprecated features by your application."},"revisions":{"*":"Because \"rvslots\" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"Danny_Gokey","to":"Danny Gokey"}],"pages":{"21501500":{"pageid":21501500,"ns":0,"title":"Danny Gokey","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{Short description|American singer}}\n{{Use mdy dates|date=July 2022}}\n{{Infobox musical artist\n| name             = Danny Gokey\n| image            = DannyGokeyLifest2019.jpg\n| caption          = Gokey performing at [[Lifest]] in 2019\n| image_size       = \n| birth_name       = Daniel Jay Gokey\n| alias            = \n| birth_date       = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1980|4|24}}\n| origin           = [[Milwaukee, Wisconsin]], {{nowrap|United States}}\n| spouse           = {{Unbulleted list\n  | {{marriage|Sophia Martinez|2004|2008|reason=d.}}\n  | {{marriage|Leyicet Peralta|2012}}\n}}\n| genre            = {{Hlist|[[Pop music|Pop]]|[[Contemporary Christian music|CCM]]|[[blue-eyed soul]]}}\n| instrument       = Vocals\n| occupation       = {{Hlist|Singer|songwriter}}\n| discography      = [[Danny Gokey discography]]\n| label            = {{Hlist|[[19 Recordings]]|[[RCA Records Nashville]]|[[BMG Rights Management]]}}\n| years_active     = 2008\u2013present\n| website          = {{URL|dannygokey.com}}\n}}\n'''Daniel Jay Gokey''' (born April 24, 1980) is an American singer and former church music director. He was the third-place finalist on the [[American Idol season 8|eighth season]] of ''[[American Idol]]''.<ref>{{cite web |date=February 18, 2009 |title=Danny Gokey: 'Idol's' New 'Hero' |url=http://extratv.com/2009/02/18/danny-gokey-idols-new-hero/ |access-date=October 16, 2015 |website=Extra}}</ref><ref>[http://www.americanidol.com/videos/season_8/danny_gokey/introducing_danny_gokey \"Introducing Danny Gokey: Get to know Hollywood Hopeful Danny Gokey.\"] American Idol. {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110523043125/http://www.americanidol.com/videos/season_8/danny_gokey/introducing_danny_gokey|date=May 23, 2011}}. Retrieved January 18, 2022.</ref> After his placing on the show, Gokey signed to [[19 Recordings]] and [[RCA Records Nashville|RCA Nashville]] at the beginning of a career in [[country music]], releasing the [[single (music)|single]] \"[[My Best Days Are Ahead of Me]].\" His debut album, ''[[My Best Days]]'', was released in March 2010.\n\nAfter leaving RCA Nashville in November 2011, he gravitated his music towards an adult pop/contemporary Christian sound and subsequently made a record deal with [[BMG Rights Management]] in May 2013. He released his second studio album, ''[[Hope in Front of Me]]'', in 2014.\n\n==Early life==\nGokey started singing with his family in church, but stated he would rather record mainstream music than perform solely Christian/gospel music. He was the worship director at his church in Milwaukee, Faith Builders International Ministries, for several years.<ref>[http://www.wnct.com/nct/lifestyles/faith_values/article/american_idol_finalists_are_church_worship_leaders/32095/ \"American Idol finalists are church worship leaders\"] Associated Press via WNCT, February 20, 2009. {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090421002658/http://www.wnct.com/nct/lifestyles/faith_values/article/american_idol_finalists_are_church_worship_leaders/32095/|date=April 21, 2009}}. Retrieved January 18, 2022.</ref><ref name=\"CHRISTIANPOST1\">{{Cite news |last=Sun |first=Eryn |date=December 27, 2011 |title=Former American Idol Finalist Danny Gokey Engaged |work=The Christian Post |url=http://www.christianpost.com/news/former-american-idol-finalist-danny-gokey-engaged-65853/ |access-date=October 16, 2015}}</ref>\n\nHe is the fifth of six children. He has a brother named Charles, and four sisters: Angela, Janell, Gina, and Tracey.<ref>{{cite web |title=Danny Gokey Biography |url=http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/danny-gokey/bio/296849 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090402053504/http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/danny-gokey/bio/296849 |archive-date=April 2, 2009 |access-date=October 16, 2015 |website=TV Guide}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=Wiggins |first=Leslie Anne |title=American Idol Top 36: Danny Gokey |publisher=WITI-TV Fox 6 |url=http://www.fox6now.com/entertainment/sns-american_idol-top_36-danny_gokey,0,3775152.story |access-date=October 16, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110711022423/http://www.fox6now.com/entertainment/sns-american_idol-top_36-danny_gokey%2C0%2C3775152.story |archive-date=July 11, 2011}}</ref>\n\nHe has acknowledged the influence of Jeffrey and Robin Pruitt, who are the pastors of the church where he worked, and also Matthew Barnett, the founder of the LA Dream Center.  He has stated that his faith is the \"key to who I am\".<ref>[http://www.jsonline.com/entertainment/tvradio/39823267.html \"Milwaukee's Gokey wows judges, makes 'Idol' finals\"] Tim Cuprisin, Milwaukee Journal Sentinel, February 18, 2009. Archivied from [https://web.archive.org/web/20090221131515/http://www.jsonline.com/entertainment/tvradio/39823267.html the original] on February 21, 2009. Retrieved January 18, 2022.</ref> Gokey was a church music director, while also driving a semi truck for a local logistics company for two years.<ref name=\"CHRISTIANPOST1\"/>\n\n==''American Idol''==\n[[File:Danny Gokey.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Gokey in his hometown of Milwaukee, Wisconsin in 2009]]\n\n===Overview===\nGokey rose to national fame with his participation in the eighth season of ''American Idol''. Gokey's ''American Idol'' audition occurred only four weeks after his wife's death in July 2008.<ref>{{cite web |date=January 14, 2009 |title=Danny Gokey \u2014 \"I Heard It Through The Grapevine\" Audition \u2014 American Idol 8 |url=http://www.rickey.org/?p=11026 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20120907214504/http://www.rickey.org/?p=11026 |archive-date=September 7, 2012 |access-date=October 16, 2015 |website=Rickey}}</ref> He auditioned with his friend Jamar Rogers, who also made it through to Hollywood but was eliminated before the live shows.\n\nDuring Rock Week (Top 4 week), Gokey's take on [[Aerosmith]]'s \"[[Dream On (Aerosmith song)|Dream On]]\" was planned for the extended scream with which he finished the song.<ref name=\"scream\">{{cite web |last=Cantiello |first=Jim |date=May 7, 2009 |title='American Idol' Rock Week Makes Us Scream On Like Danny Gokey |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1610808/20090507/story.jhtml |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090510132131/https://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1610808/20090507/story.jhtml |archive-date=May 10, 2009 |access-date=October 16, 2015 |website=MTV}}</ref> Gokey was the only contestant in that season who was never in the bottom two or three, but he was eliminated in third place on May 13, 2009, after his performance of [[Joe Cocker]]'s \"[[You Are So Beautiful]]\".<ref>{{Cite news |date=May 14, 2009 |title=American Idol 8: Final 2 results show eliminates Danny Gokey |work=NJ |url=https://www.nj.com/entertainment/tv/2009/05/american_idol_8_final_2_result.html |access-date=September 12, 2023}}</ref>\n\nDuring the season 8 finale on May 20, 2009, Gokey performed a duet with [[rhythm and blues]] singer-songwriter [[Lionel Richie]]. The performance opened with Gokey singing a true-to-the-original soulful ballad solo of Richie's \"[[Hello (Lionel Richie song)|Hello]],\" and then Richie joined Gokey for a duet of his hits \"[[Just Go (Lionel Richie song)|Just Go]]\" and \"[[All Night Long (All Night)|All Night Long]]\".<ref>{{cite news |date=May 20, 2009 |title=Top 2: Lionel Ritchie and Danny Gokey jam |website=CNN |url=http://marquee.blogs.cnn.com/2009/05/20/top-2-lionel-ritchie-and-danny-gokey-jam/ |access-date=2010-01-10 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090528151847/http://marquee.blogs.cnn.com/2009/05/20/top-2-lionel-ritchie-and-danny-gokey-jam/ |archive-date=May 28, 2009}}</ref>\n\n=== Performances ===\n{| class=\"wikitable collapsible collapsed\" style=\"text-align:center;\"\n|-\n!Theme week\n!Song sung\n!Artist\n|-\n| Audition\n| \"[[I Heard It Through the Grapevine]]\"\n| [[Marvin Gaye]]\n|-\n| Hollywood (part 1)\n| \"[[Kiss from a Rose]]\"\n| [[Seal (musician)|Seal]]\n|-\n| Hollywood (part 2)\n| \"[[Somebody to Love (Queen song)|Somebody to Love]]\"\n| [[Queen (band)|Queen]]\n|-\n| Hollywood (part 3)\n| \"[[I Hope You Dance (song)|I Hope You Dance]]\"\n| [[Lee Ann Womack]]\n|-\n| Top 36<br />[[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] hits week\n| \"[[Hero (Mariah Carey song)|Hero]]\"\n| [[Mariah Carey]]\n|-\n| Top 13<br />[[Michael Jackson]] week\n| \"[[P.Y.T. (Pretty Young Thing)]]\"\n| [[Michael Jackson]]\n|-\n| Top 11<br />[[Grand Ole Opry]] week\n| \"[[Jesus, Take the Wheel]]\"\n| [[Carrie Underwood]]\n|-\n| Top 10<br />[[Motown]] week\n| \"[[Get Ready (The Temptations song)|Get Ready]]\"\n| [[The Temptations]]\n|-\n| Top 9<br />Top Downloads week\n| \"[[What Hurts the Most]]\"\n| [[Rascal Flatts]]\n|-\n| Top 8<br />Year They Were Born week\n| \"[[Stand by Me (Ben E. King song)|Stand by Me]]\"\n| [[Mickey Gilley]]\n|-\n| Top 7<br />Songs from the Cinema week{{efn|Due to the judges using their one save to save [[Matt Giraud]], the Top 7 remained intact for another week.}}\n| \"[[Endless Love (song)|Endless Love]]\"<br />{{small|(from ''[[Endless Love (1981 film)|Endless Love]]'')}}\n| [[Diana Ross]] and [[Lionel Richie]]\n|-\n| Top 7<br />[[Disco]] week\n| \"[[September (Earth, Wind & Fire song)|September]]\"\n| [[Earth, Wind & Fire]]\n|-\n| Top 5<br />[[Rat Pack|Rat Pack Standards]] week\n| \"[[Come Rain or Come Shine]]\"\n| [[Frank Sinatra]]\n|-\n| Top 4<br />[[Rock and roll]] week; [[Duet (music)|duet]] and [[Solo (music)|solo]]{{efn|It was only announced that [[Allison Iraheta]] received the lowest number of votes this week. The other member(s) of the bottom two or three were never revealed.}}\n| \"[[Renegade (Styx song)|Renegade]]\" {{small|(with [[Kris Allen]])}}<br />\"[[Dream On (Aerosmith song)|Dream On]]\"\n| [[Styx (band)|Styx]]<br />[[Aerosmith]]\n|-\n| Top 3<br />Judge's Choice ([[Paula Abdul]]) and Contestant's Choice week\n| \"[[Introducing the Hardline According to Terence Trent D'Arby|Dance Little Sister]]\"<br />\"[[You Are So Beautiful]]\"\n| [[Terence Trent D'Arby]]<br />[[Billy Preston]]\n|}\n\n==Post-''Idol'' career==\n[[File:DannyGokeyApr10.jpg|thumb|right|150px|Gokey in April 2010]]\nGokey was nominated in his home state of Wisconsin in the WAMI ([[Wisconsin Area Music Industry]]) Awards for Best Christian/Gospel Artist of the Year.<ref name=\"WAMI\">{{Cite news |last=Tianen |first=Dave |date=April 2, 2009 |title=East Troy Singer Beats Danny Gokey at WAMI Awards |work=Milwaukee Journal Sentinel |publisher= |url=https://archive.jsonline.com/entertainment/musicandnightlife/42290917.html |url-status=live |access-date=September 13, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160820155754/https://archive.jsonline.com/entertainment/musicandnightlife/42290917.html |archive-date=August 20, 2016}}</ref> In September 2009, Gokey finished his tour with the other idols on the [[American Idols Live! Tour 2009]], and he worked on his foundation, Sophia's Heart Foundation, which was set up to help disadvantaged children.<ref>{{Cite news |date=October 1, 2013 |title=Outreach to homeless is my calling, my dream for Sophia's Heart is to make it a 'Harvard' for the homeless |work=Fox News Opinion |url=http://www.foxnews.com/opinion/2013/10/01/outreach-to-homeless-is-my-calling-my-dream-for-sophia-heart-is-to-be-harvard.html |access-date=October 16, 2015 }}</ref>\n\nGokey, known for his many pairs of [[eyeglasses]] that he often wore on the show, had stated he might start an eyewear line to help raise funds for his foundation and Match Eyewear teamed with him for the Danny Gokey Eyewear collection.<ref>{{cite web |last=Borzillo-Vrenna |first=Carrie |date=2009-05-15 |title=American Idol's Danny Gokey Sees Rosy Future in Glasses |url=http://www.eonline.com/uberblog/watch_with_kristin/b124061_american_idols_danny_gokey_sees_rosy.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090519035322/http://www.eonline.com/uberblog/watch_with_kristin/b124061_american_idols_danny_gokey_sees_rosy.html |archive-date=2009-05-19 |access-date=2015-10-16 |website=E! Online}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Shapiro |first=Rachel |date=March 26, 2012 |title=American Idol's Danny Gokey Launches Eyewear Collection |work=The Hollywood Reporter |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/idol-worship/american-idols-danny-gokey-launches-304266 |access-date=October 16, 2015}}</ref> Launched in March 2012, the collection has exceeded sales projections with over 1.7 million in net retail sales.<ref>{{Cite web |date=April 8, 2014 |title=American Idol star and chart-topping artist Danny Gokey unviels eagerly awaited sophomore album, 'Hope in Front of Me' |url=https://www.jesusfreakhideout.com/news/2014/04/08.American%20Idol%20Star%20Danny%20Gokey%20Unveils%20New%20Album,%20Hope%20In%20Front%20Of%20Me.asp |access-date=September 12, 2023 |website=Jesus Freak Hideout}}</ref>\n\n===2009\u20132010: ''My Best Days''===\nOn September 1, 2009, Gokey signed with [[19 Recordings]]/[[RCA Records Nashville|RCA Nashville]], becoming the first third-place finisher to record with 19 and the first male ''Idol'' to be signed to a major country label.<ref>{{cite web |date=2009-09-02 |title=American Idol's Danny Gokey Signs to 19 Recordings/RCA Nashville |url=http://www.cmt.com/news/news-in-brief/1620651/american-idols-danny-gokey-signs-to-19-recordings-rca-nashville.jhtml |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090906070705/https://www.cmt.com/news/news-in-brief/1620651/american-idols-danny-gokey-signs-to-19-recordings-rca-nashville.jhtml |archive-date=September 6, 2009 |access-date=2015-10-16 |publisher=CMT}}</ref> On November 19, 2009, 19 Recordings and RCA Records announced the release of the debut single \"[[My Best Days Are Ahead of Me]]\".<ref>{{cite news |last=Mansfield |first=Brian |date=2009-11-19 |title=Danny Gokey switches singles |work=[[USA Today]] |url=http://content.usatoday.com/communities/idolchatter/post/2009/11/danny-gokey-switches-singles/1 |access-date=November 20, 2009}}</ref> He released his debut album, ''[[My Best Days]]'', on March 2, 2010.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Herrera |first=Monica |date=September 2, 2009 |title=''Idol'' finalist Danny Gokey signs record deal |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/267522/idol-finalist-danny-gokey-signs-record-deal |access-date=September 12, 2023 |magazine=Billboard}}</ref> It debuted on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' charts at number four, and it netted him the best opening-week sales by a debut country male in 18 years and the highest debut of digital downloads sold by any new country artist ever.<ref>{{cite web |date=March 10, 2010 |title=Danny Gokey Achieves Best First-week Album Sales by a Debut Country Male in 18 Years (press release) |url=http://www.missionmgmt.net/2010/03/10/danny-gokey-achieves-best-first-week-album-sales-by-a-debut-country-male-in-18-years/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151118223244/http://www.missionmgmt.net/2010/03/10/danny-gokey-achieves-best-first-week-album-sales-by-a-debut-country-male-in-18-years/ |archive-date=November 18, 2015 |access-date=October 16, 2015 |publisher=Rendy Lovelady Management}}</ref> In support of the album, Gokey was the opening act on [[Sugarland]]'s ''Incredible Machine'' tour which began in April.<ref>{{cite web |author=Don Walker |date=February 9, 2010 |title=Gokey to tour with Sugarland |url=http://www.jsonline.com/entertainment/83923832.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100213003745/http://www.jsonline.com/entertainment/83923832.html |archive-date=February 13, 2010 |access-date=January 20, 2022 |website=Milwaukee Journal Sentinel}}</ref> He also performed at country singer [[Darryl Worley]]'s ninth annual Tennessee River Run festival in Savannah, Tennessee along with other artists such as [[Joe Diffie]] and [[Lee Brice]].<ref name=\"DARRYWORLEYS\"/> The event helped raise $200,000 for the Darryl Worley Foundation.<ref name=\"DARRYWORLEYS\">{{cite web |date=September 27, 2010 |title=Darryl Worley's Tennessee River Raises $200,000 |url=http://www.cmt.com/news/news-in-brief/1648822/darryl-worleys-tennessee-river-run-raises-200000.jhtml |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101002131953/https://www.cmt.com/news/news-in-brief/1648822/darryl-worleys-tennessee-river-run-raises-200000.jhtml |archive-date=October 2, 2010 |access-date=October 6, 2010 |publisher=[[Country Music Television]]}}</ref>\n\nOn October 18, 2010, Gokey earned a nomination for Best New/Breakthrough Artist at the first annual [[American Country Awards]].<ref name=\"AMERICANCOUNTRY\">{{Cite web |title=With Rise I want to be a positive voice, a voice that connects, a voice that unifies, a voice that finds common ground |url=https://risefmohio.com/danny-gokey/ |access-date=September 12, 2023 |website=Rise FM|date=January 30, 2019 }}</ref> On November 21, 2010, Gokey was a part of ABC's pre-show event at the [[American Music Awards]].<ref>{{cite web |last=Richardson |first=Gayle |date=2010-10-25 |title=Danny Gokey, Jennette McCurdy to Host AMA Red Carpet |url=http://www.theboot.com/2010/10/25/danny-gokey-jennette-mccurdy-ama-red-carpet/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101126151352/http://www.theboot.com/2010/10/25/danny-gokey-jennette-mccurdy-ama-red-carpet/ |archive-date=November 26, 2010 |access-date=December 4, 2010 |website=The Boot}}</ref>\n\n===2011\u20132018: Label change and ''Hope in Front of Me''===\n[[File:Danny Gokey 2014.png|thumb|left|150px|Gokey at an interview in 2014]]\nGokey released the single \"Second Hand Heart\", written by [[Cary Barlowe]], Shane Stevens and [[Josh Kear]], in 2011.<ref>{{cite news |last=Mansfield |first=Brian |date=July 15, 2011 |title=Country dominates week's 'Idol' track sales |work=USA Today |url=http://content.usatoday.com/communities/idolchatter/post/2011/07/country-dominates-weeks-idol-track-sales/1 |access-date=October 17, 2015}}</ref> He was one of opening acts on [[Taylor Swift]]'s [[Speak Now World Tour]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Mansfield |first=Brian |date=March 3, 2011 |title=Danny Gokey added to Taylor Swift's summer tour |work=USA Today |url=http://content.usatoday.com/communities/idolchatter/post/2011/03/danny-gokey-added-to-taylor-swifts-summer-tour/1 |access-date=January 19, 2022}}</ref> He also made an appearance in a TV movie with [[Candace Cameron Bure]] called ''Truth Be Told''.<ref>{{cite tweet|number=30029719965536258|user=dannygokey|title=Having a blast on set 2day! Making an appearance on a made 4 TV movie. http://yfrog.com/hs98tokj I'll let u know more info later-Stay tuned|date=January 25, 2011|access-date=January 19, 2022}}</ref><ref>{{cite tweet|number=29936430830583809|user=candacecbure|title=The mystery guest on my movie will be revealed soon! He is a former American Idol contestant. I have D.G. fever!!!! Having so much fun|date=January 25, 2011|access-date=January 19, 2022}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Nashville |first=Kat |date=February 2, 2011 |title=Danny Gokey to Appear in New Movie ''Truth Be Told'' |url=http://tasteofcountry.com/danny-gokey-truth-be-told-movie-appearance/ |access-date=January 19, 2022 |work=Taste of Country}}</ref> Subsequently, he left RCA Nashville in November of the same year.<ref>{{cite web |last=Thompson |first=Gayle |date=November 21, 2011 |title=Danny Gokey Parts Ways With RCA Records |url=http://www.theboot.com/2011/11/21/danny-gokey-rca-records/ |access-date=October 17, 2015 |work=The Boot}}</ref> In 2012, he released his [[Extended play|EP]], ''Love Again''.<ref>{{cite news |last=Mansfield |first=Brian |date=December 16, 2010 |title=Danny Gokey planning new single for early 2011 |work=USA Today |url=http://content.usatoday.com/communities/idolchatter/post/2010/12/danny-gokey-plans-new-single-for-early-2011/1 |access-date=January 18, 2022}}</ref> It was self-released limitedly via his official website only as physical CD format. His memoir, ''Hope in Front of Me: Find Purpose in Your Darkest Moments'', was published on October 1, 2013.<ref>{{cite web |title=Hope In Front of Me: Find Purpose in Your Darkest Moments by Danny Gokey &#124; 9781612914756 &#124; Hardcover |url=http://www.barnesandnoble.com/w/hope-in-front-of-me-daniel-j-gokey/1114757995?ean=9781612914756 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130916134353/http://www.barnesandnoble.com/w/hope-in-front-of-me-daniel-j-gokey/1114757995?ean=9781612914756 |archive-date=September 16, 2013 |access-date=2015-11-17 |publisher=Barnes & Noble}}</ref>\n\nIn 2014, Gokey released \"Hope in Front of Me\" as a single, under the record label [[BMG Rights Management]].<ref>{{cite web |date=2014-01-06 |title=artistspotlight &#124; American Idol's Danny Gokey Releases New Single 'Hope in Front of Me' |url=http://www.christianactivities.com/american-idols-danny-gokey-releases-new-single-hope-front-me |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151118141249/http://www.christianactivities.com/american-idols-danny-gokey-releases-new-single-hope-front-me |archive-date=2015-11-18 |access-date=2015-11-17 |publisher=Christian Activities}}</ref> Subsequently, his second studio album, ''[[Hope in Front of Me]]'', was released.<ref>{{cite web |date=2014-06-16 |title=Danny Gokey Win It Before You Can Buy It |url=http://wjtl.com/pages/danny-gokey-win-it-before-you-can-buy-it/ |access-date=2015-11-17 |publisher=WJTL}}</ref> The album debuted at number one on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Christian Albums]] chart.<ref>{{cite web |author=Fred Bronson |date=July 4, 2014 |title='American Idol' on the Charts: New Album 'Hope' Brings Danny Gokey First Billboard No. 1 |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/idol-worship/american-idol-charts-new-album-716727 |access-date=January 18, 2022 |work=The Hollywood Reporter}}</ref> In late August, \"Hope in Front of Me\" topped both the [[Christian Airplay]] chart (lasted 3 weeks) and ''[[Mediabase]]'' Christian Adult Contemporary chart.<ref>{{cite magazine |last=Trust |first=Gary |date=August 18, 2014 |title=Chart Highlights: Sam Smith's 'Stay' Hits No. 1 On Pop Songs |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/6221820/chart-highlights-sam-smiths-stay-hits-no-1-on-pop-songs |magazine=Billboard |access-date=January 18, 2022}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |date=October 15, 2012 |title=USA Today's airplay charts |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/music/2012/10/15/airplay-charts/1635101/ |access-date=January 18, 2022 |work=USA Today}}</ref> For the week ending of September 20, it also topped the [[Hot Christian AC|Christian AC Songs]] chart.<ref>{{cite magazine |title=Danny Gokey Chart History (Christian AC Songs) |url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/danny-gokey/chart-history/ica/ |access-date=September 12, 2023 |magazine=Billboard}}</ref> \"Hope in Front of Me\" was nominated for Song of the Year at [[K-LOVE]] Fan Awards 2015, held on May 31, and one of award-winning songs at 2015 [[Broadcast Music, Inc.|BMI]] Christian Awards, held on June 23.<ref>{{cite web |date=May 31, 2015 |title=K-LOVE Fan Awards |url=http://www.klove.com/events/fan-awards/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150630113528/https://www.klove.com/events/fan-awards/ |archive-date=June 30, 2015 |access-date=September 12, 2023 |work=K-LOVE}}</ref><ref name=\"BMI2015\">{{cite web |date=June 24, 2015 |title=2015 BMI Christian Awards Celebrates Christian Music's Best Songs, Songwriters and Publishers |url=http://www.bmi.com/news/entry/2015_bmi_christian_awards/ |access-date=January 18, 2022 |publisher=[[Broadcast Music, Inc.|BMI]]}}</ref> In July, \"More Than You Think I Am\" peaked at number 6 on the Christian Airplay chart.<ref>{{cite magazine |title=Danny Gokey Chart History (Christian Airplay) |url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/danny-gokey/chart-history/cri/ |access-date=September 12, 2023 |magazine=Billboard}}</ref> In August, Gokey earned nominations for New Artist of the Year and Song of the Year for \"Hope in Front of Me\" at [[46th GMA Dove Awards]].<ref name=\"DOVEAWARDS2015\">{{cite web |last=Nsenduluka |first=Benge |date=August 12, 2015 |title=Lecrae, for KING & COUNTRY Score Most Nods in GMA's List of 2015 Dove Award Nominees, Including 'Artist of the Year' |url=http://www.christianpost.com/news/lecrae-for-king-country-score-most-nods-in-gmas-list-of-2015-dove-award-nominees-including-artist-of-the-year-142712/ |access-date=2023-09-12 |website=The Christian Post }}</ref>\n\nIn the spring of 2015, Gokey joined [[Natalie Grant]]'s Burn Bright Tour as a special guest, followed by The Bible Tour 2015 with [[Steven Curtis Chapman]], [[Brandon Heath]] and [[Francesca Battistelli]].<ref>{{cite web |title=The Bible Tour 2015 |url=http://thebibletour2015.com/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150403142820/http://thebibletour2015.com/ |archive-date=April 3, 2015 |access-date=January 19, 2022 |website=The Bible Tour}}</ref> In September of the same year, Gokey released the lead single \"Lift Up Your Eyes\" from his holiday album, ''[[Christmas Is Here (Danny Gokey album)|Christmas Is Here]],'' which was released on October 16.<ref>{{cite web |title=Danny Gokey - New songs from 'Christmas is Here' |url=http://daily.plaympe.com/danny-gokey-new-songs-from-christmas-is-here/ |access-date=2016-11-17 |website=PlayMPE|date=October 7, 2015 }}</ref> In October, Gokey joined [[NewSong]]'s Beating Hearts Tour with [[Mandisa]].<ref>[http://www.jesusfreakhideout.com/news/2015/07/23.NewSongs%20Beating%20Hearts%20Tour%20Features%20Mandisa%20and%20Danny%20Gokey%20This%20Fall.asp// \"Danny Gokey with Mandisa on Beating Hearts Tour\"] September 11, 2015. {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150911090802/http://www.jesusfreakhideout.com/news/2015/07/23.NewSongs%20Beating%20Hearts%20Tour%20Features%20Mandisa%20and%20Danny%20Gokey%20This%20Fall.asp/|date=September 11, 2015}}. Retrieved January 19, 2022.</ref> In December, Gokey joined the 2015 [[K-LOVE]] Christmas Tour as a special guest.<ref>{{Cite web |date=May 6, 2016 |title=2015 KLOVE Christmas Tour |url=http://klovechristmastour.com/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160901222425/http://klovechristmastour.com/ |archive-date=September 1, 2016 |access-date=2022-01-19 |website=K-LOVE Christmas Tour}}</ref>\n\nIn 2017, his fifth studio album, ''[[Rise (Danny Gokey album)|Rise]]'', was released.<ref>{{Cite web |date=January 13, 2017 |title=''Rise'' - Apple Music |url=https://music.apple.com/us/album/rise/1174317441 |access-date=September 27, 2022 |website=Apple Music |archive-date=September 28, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220928024139/https://music.apple.com/us/album/rise/1174317441 |url-status=dead }}</ref> The album performed well commercially on the charts and on the success for some of its songs.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Sculley |first=Alan |date=October 24, 2017 |title=Life of faith, inner strength on 'Rise' for Danny Gokey |url=https://www.montgomeryadvertiser.com/story/entertainment/2017/10/24/life-faith-inner-strength-rise-danny-gokey/794553001/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200925075534/https://www.montgomeryadvertiser.com/story/entertainment/2017/10/24/life-faith-inner-strength-rise-danny-gokey/794553001/ |archive-date=September 25, 2020 |access-date=September 27, 2022 |website=Montgomery Advertiser}}</ref> It received multiple award nominations, including in the [[60th Annual Grammy Awards]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=January 28, 2018 |title=60th Annual GRAMMY Awards - Winners |url=https://www.grammy.com/awards/60th-annual-grammy-awards-2017 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220129152250/https://www.grammy.com/awards/60th-annual-grammy-awards-2017 |archive-date=January 29, 2022 |access-date=September 27, 2022 |publisher=Grammy Awards}}</ref><ref name=\"DOVEAWARDS2017\">{{Cite web |date=August 9, 2017 |title=2017 Nominees {{!}} The 49th Annual GMA Dove Awards |url=http://doveawards.com/awards/2017-nominees/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171225132324/http://doveawards.com/awards/2017-nominees/ |archive-date=December 25, 2017 |access-date=September 27, 2022 |website=GMA Dove Awards}}</ref>\n\n===2019-present: ''Haven't Seen It Yet'' and ''Jesus People''===\n[[File:Danny Gokey 2023.jpg|thumb|right|250px|Gokey performing at the 2023 Pastors Summit at Nashville, Tennessee]]\nGokey released \"[[Haven't Seen It Yet]]\" as a single, which has been a huge commercial success, peaking at the top three on the ''Billboard'' Christian charts and at number four in ''[[Cross Rhythms]]''.<ref>{{Cite magazine |title=Danny Gokey (Chart History) |url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/danny-gokey/ |url-status=live |magazine=Billboard |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211120153642/https://www.billboard.com/artist/danny-gokey/ |archive-date=November 20, 2021 |access-date=September 27, 2022}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=March 24, 2019 |title=Cross Rhythms Weekly Charts |url=https://www.crossrhythms.co.uk//chart/?date=20190324 |access-date=September 27, 2022 |website=Cross Rhythms}}</ref> His sixth album, ''Haven't Seen It Yet,'' was released on April 19, 2019.<ref>{{cite news |last=Longs |first=Herb |date=April 24, 2019 |title=Danny Gokey's new album Haven't Seen It Yet available now |work=The Christian Beat |url=https://www.thechristianbeat.org/danny-gokey-s-new-album-haven-t-seen-it-yet-available-now/ |access-date=2022-01-20}}</ref> The album peaked at number two on the Billboard Top Christian Albums chart and number one at Christian Airplay chart.<ref>{{cite magazine |date=April 24, 2019 |title=Billboard Top Christian Albums (24 April, 2019) |url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/christian-albums/2019-04-27/ |magazine=Billboard |access-date=2022-01-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Martin-Brown |first=Becca |date=November 10, 2019 |title=From Idol to Evangelist, Danny Gokey |url=https://www.nwaonline.com/news/2019/nov/10/from-idol-to-evangelist-danny-gokey-fin/ |access-date=2022-01-20 |website=Northwest Arkansas}}</ref> The releases were nominated for two categories at the [[62nd Annual Grammy Awards]] and the song was the winner of a Dove Award for Short Form Music Video of the Year.<ref name=\"GRAMMY2020\">{{cite web |date=November 20, 2019 |title=2020 Grammy Awards |url=https://www.grammy.com/grammys/news/2020-grammy-awards-nominations-complete-winners-list |access-date=2022-01-20 |website=Grammy Awards }}</ref><ref name=\"DOVEAWARDS2019\">{{cite web |title=2019 Winners - The 50th Annual GMA Dove Awards |url=https://doveawards.com/awards/2019-winners/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191022121645/https://doveawards.com/awards/2019-winners/ |archive-date=October 22, 2019 |access-date=2020-01-20 |website=GMA Dove Awards}}</ref> He also released radio and Spanish versions of some of the songs on the album in 2020.<ref>{{cite web |last=Clarks |first=Jessie |date=January 8, 2021 |title=Danny Gokey Premieres Radio Version Of \"New Day\" |url=https://www.thechristianbeat.org/danny-gokey-drops-radio-version-of-new-day/ |access-date=2022-01-20 |website=The Christian Beat}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Longs |first=Herb |date=August 8, 2020 |title=Danny Gokey Drops Spanish Version Of \"Love God Love People\" |url=https://www.thechristianbeat.org/danny-gokey-drops-spanish-version-of-love-god-love-people/ |access-date=2022-01-20 |website=The Christian Beat}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Clarks |first=Jessie |date=October 10, 2020 |title=Danny Gokey \"No Lo Has Visto A\u00fan\" Music Video |url=https://www.thechristianbeat.org/danny-gokey-no-lo-has-visto-aun-music-video/ |access-date=2022-01-20 |website=The Christian Beat}}</ref>\n\nIn 2021, Gokey's eighth album, ''Jesus People'', was released on August 20, 2022, which he experimented with singing with various genres, such as [[Latin pop]], [[classical music]] and [[dance-pop]].<ref>{{cite web |last=Scott |first=Jason |date=August 20, 2021 |title=Danny Gokey Toys Around with Genre On 'Jesus People' |url=https://americansongwriter.com/danny-gokey-jesus-people-album-interview/ |access-date=2022-01-20 |website=American Songwriter}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Hollabaugh |first=Lorie |date=July 2, 2021 |title=Danny Gokey crosses genre borders on upcoming album \"Jesus People\" |url=https://musicrow.com/2021/07/danny-gokey-crosses-genre-borders-on-upcoming-album-jesus-people/ |access-date=2022-01-20 |website=Music Row}}</ref> The album peaked at number one on the ''Billboard'' Top Christian Albums chart and at number 99 on the ''Billboard'' 200 chart.<ref>{{cite magazine |last=Asker |first=Jim |date=September 1, 2021 |title=Danny Gokey's 'Jesus People' Debuts at No. 1 on Top Christian Albums Chart |url=https://www.billboard.com/pro/danny-gokey-jesus-people-debuts-atop-christian-albums-chart/ |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |access-date=2022-01-20}}</ref><ref>{{Cite magazine |date=September 4, 2021 |title=''Billboard'' 200 |url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/billboard-200/2021-09-04/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210913204113/https://www.billboard.com/charts/billboard-200/2021-09-04/ |archive-date=September 13, 2021 |access-date=September 27, 2022 |magazine=Billboard}}</ref> The album consists of five singles that achieved commercial success, which were \"We All Need Jesus\",<ref>{{cite web |last=Clarks |first=Jessie |date=April 9, 2021 |title=Danny Gokey Drops New Single Featuring Koryn Hawthorne |url=https://www.thechristianbeat.org/danny-gokey-drops-new-single-featuring-koryn-hawthorne/ |access-date=2022-01-20 |website=The Christian Beat}}</ref> \"Stand in Faith\",<ref>{{cite web |last=Clarks |first=Jessie |date=May 21, 2021 |title=Danny Gokey Releases Stand In Faith |url=https://www.thechristianbeat.org/danny-gokey-releases-stand-in-faith/ |access-date=2022-01-20 |website=The Christian Beat}}</ref> \"He Believes in You\",<ref>{{cite web |last=Gibbs |first=Aubrey |date=July 3, 2021 |title=Danny Gokey announces new album \"Jesus People\" will drop August 20 |url=https://americansongwriter.com/danny-gokey-announces-new-album-jesus-people-will-drop-august-20/ |access-date=2022-01-20 |website=American Songwriter}}</ref> \"Agradecido\"<ref>{{cite web |last=Longs |first=Herb |date=July 17, 2021 |title=Danny Gokey Debuts New Song Agradecido |url=https://www.thechristianbeat.org/danny-gokey-debuts-new-song-agradecido/ |access-date=2022-01-20 |website=The Christian Beat}}</ref> and \"Do for Love\".<ref>{{cite web |last=Clarks |first=Jessie |date=August 6, 2021 |title=Danny Gokey Debuts \"Do For Love\" Single & Music Video Ft. Angie Rose |url=https://www.thechristianbeat.org/danny-gokey-angie-rose-do-for-love-single-music-video/ |access-date=2022-01-20 |website=The Christian Beat}}</ref> In August, he released the \"Stand in Faith\" and \"Do for Love\" music videos.<ref>{{cite web |last=Brock Saturday |first=Taylor |date=August 7, 2021 |title=Danny Gokey unveils 2 new music videos in 1 week |url=https://www.chvnradio.com/articles/danny-gokey-unveils-2-new-music-videos-in-1-week |access-date=2022-01-20 |website=Cvhn Radio}}</ref> He also embarked on many concert tours and appeared in Stand Together Tour with [[Mac Powell]] and [[Newsboys]].<ref>{{cite web |author=Joshua Maloni |date=October 13, 2021 |title=Danny Gokey returns to road Buffalo with \"Stand In Faith\" Tour |url=https://www.wnypapers.com/news/article/featured/2021/10/13/148234/danny-gokey-returns-to-road-buffalo-with-stand-in-faith-tour |access-date=2022-01-20 |website=Niagara Frontier Publications}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=September 20, 2022 |title=Jordan Feliz Hit Single \"Beloved\" Inspires Children's Book |url=https://gospelmusic.org/jordan-feliz-hit-single-beloved-inspires-childrens-book/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220921013701/https://gospelmusic.org/jordan-feliz-hit-single-beloved-inspires-childrens-book/ |archive-date=September 21, 2022 |access-date=September 27, 2022 |publisher=Gospel Music Association}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=March 4, 2022 |title=Newsboys brings Stand Together Tour to Bartlesville |url=https://www.examiner-enterprise.com/story/entertainment/2022/03/04/newsboys-brings-stand-together-tour-bartlesville/6795962001/ |access-date=September 27, 2022 |website=Examiner-Enterprise |publisher=Staff Reports}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Longs |first=Herb |date=July 27, 2023 |title=Danny Gokey Announces Fall 2023 'Stay Strong Tour' |url=https://www.thechristianbeat.org/danny-gokey-announces-fall-2023-stay-strong-tour/ |access-date=September 12, 2023 |website=The Christian Beat}}</ref> Subsequently, he released \"Live Up to Your Name\" and his second EP, ''Brave'', where he expresses his patriotic feeling for the United States from a religious perspective.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Clarks |first=Jessie |date=October 14, 2022 |title=Danny Gokey Debuts New Single 'Live Up To Your Name' |url=https://www.thechristianbeat.org/danny-gokey-drops-live-up-to-your-name/ |access-date=September 12, 2023 |website=The Christian Beat}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=Mayer |first=Marissa |date=September 7, 2023 |title='Speak truth to power \u2026 to people': Danny Gokey's powerful message to Americans through new songs |newspaper=[[The Washington Post]] |url=https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2023/sep/7/speak-truth-power-people-danny-gokeys-powerful-mes/ |access-date=September 12, 2023}}</ref>\n\n==Personal life==\nGokey is a Christian.<ref>Lexington Herald-Leader, Sept 15, 2017. [https://www.newspapers.com/image/665945661/?terms=%22Danny%20Gokey%22%20Christian&match=1//] Retrieved Mar 28, 2023.</ref> He married his high school sweetheart, Sophia Martinez, on May 15, 2004.<ref>{{cite news |last=Lamb |first=Bill |year=2009 |title=Danny Gokey |work=[[Dotdash Meredith]] |url=http://top40.about.com/od/l/p/dannygokey.htm |access-date=December 28, 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120122002255/http://top40.about.com/od/l/p/dannygokey.htm |archive-date=January 22, 2012}}</ref> The two had been together since 1997.\n\nOn July 9, 2008, four weeks before he auditioned for ''American Idol'', Gokey's wife died from complications during her third surgery to treat her [[congenital heart disease]].<ref>[http://obit.churchandchapel.com/obitdisplay.html?task=Print&id=559976 \"'Sophia Linnette Gokey Obituary'\"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120426075846/http://obit.churchandchapel.com/obitdisplay.html?task=Print&id=559976|date=April 26, 2012}} Church and Chapel Funeral Services, July 2004. Retrieved January 19, 2022.</ref><ref name=\"MJS\">Tim Cuprisin (February 13, 2009) [http://www.jsonline.com/entertainment/tvradio/39602397.html \"Milwaukee man says he's prepared to give his all to make 'Idol' finals\"]. ''Milwaukee Journal Sentinel''. Archivied from [https://web.archive.org/web/20090216140432/http://www.jsonline.com/entertainment/tvradio/39602397.html the original] on February 16, 2009. Retrieved January 20, 2022.</ref><ref>Jill Serjeant (February 19, 2009) [https://web.archive.org/web/20090223085301/http://uk.reuters.com/article/peopleNews/idUKTRE51I7LZ20090219 \"Idol's grieving Danny Gokey hopes to lighten up\"]. ''Reuters''. Retrieved January 20, 2022.</ref> The couple had been together for 12 years, and Gokey credited her for his success.<ref>[http://www.accesshollywood.com/news/idols-danny-gokey-my-wife-is-the-reason-for-my-success_article_14674 \"'Idol's' Danny Gokey: My Wife 'Is The Reason For My Success'\"] ''Access Hollywood''. February 20, 2009. Archivied from [https://web.archive.org/web/20090225141032/http://www.accesshollywood.com/news/idols-danny-gokey-my-wife-is-the-reason-for-my-success_article_14674 the original] on February 25, 2009. Retrieved September 12, 2023.</ref> Sophia was a fan of ''American Idol'' and encouraged Gokey to be a contestant, and Danny started a foundation in her name, Sophia's Heart Foundation, with some of her family members who are also musicians.<ref name=\"MJS\"/><ref>[http://www.fox6now.com/witi-090218-danny-gokey-pg,0,5453026.photogallery?index=witi-090218-danny-gokey-p8 \"Danny Gokey Photo Gallery\"] [[WITI (TV)|WITI]] February 18, 2009  {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090512163533/http://www.fox6now.com/witi-090218-danny-gokey-pg%2C0%2C5453026.photogallery?index=witi-090218-danny-gokey-p8|date=May 12, 2009}}. Retrieved January 19, 2022.</ref><ref name=\"SOPHIASHEART\">{{cite web |title=Sophia's Heart Foundation |url=http://www.sophiasheart.org/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090225010932/http://www.sophiasheart.org/ |archive-date=February 25, 2009 |access-date=May 21, 2011}}</ref> With branches in [[Milwaukee]], [[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]], and [[Sacramento, California|Sacramento]], the organization's goals are to provide hope and help to homeless families, provide scholarships to deserving students and operate a thriving inner-city music and arts program.<ref name=\"SOPHIASHEART\"/>\n\nIn 2011, Gokey began dating Leyicet Peralta. The two announced their engagement on December 25, 2011, on the Sophia's Heart website.<ref>[http://www.sophiasheart.org/news.php?city=Nashville \"'Latest News: Danny & Leyicet Engagement Announcement'\"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120105113830/http://www.sophiasheart.org/news.php?city=Nashville|date=January 5, 2012}} Sophia's Heart, December 25, 2011. Retrieved January 5, 2012.</ref> They were married on January 29, 2012.<ref>{{cite web |last=O'Donnell |first=Kevin |date=January 29, 2012 |title=American Idol's Danny Gokey Is Married |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20564226,00.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120130105507/http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20564226,00.html |archive-date=January 30, 2012 |access-date=January 19, 2022 |work=People}}</ref> Their son was born on January 20, 2013.<ref>{{cite news |last=O'Donnell |first=Kevin |date=January 21, 2013 |title=Danny Gokey Welcomes Son Daniel Emanuel |work=[[People (magazine)|People]] |url=http://celebritybabies.people.com/2013/01/21/american-idol-danny-gokey-welcomes-son-daniel-emanuel/ |access-date=January 21, 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130121111418/http://celebritybabies.people.com/2013/01/21/american-idol-danny-gokey-welcomes-son-daniel-emanuel/ |archive-date=January 21, 2013}}</ref> Their daughter was born on November 28, 2014.<ref>{{cite news |last=Thompson |first=Gayle |date=December 4, 2014 |title=Danny Gokey Welcomes Second Child |work=The Boot |url=http://theboot.com/danny-gokey-second-child/ |access-date=December 4, 2014}}</ref> Their second son was born on August 29, 2017.<ref>{{Cite web |date=August 29, 2017 |title=Danny Gokey Welcomes Third Child |url=http://www.newreleasetoday.com/news_detail.php?newsid=2588 |access-date=2017-09-05 |website=New Release Today}}</ref> On August 16, 2019, their fourth child was born on the birthday of Gokey's first wife.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Juneau |first=Jen |date=February 18, 2019 |title=A Quartet! Fourth Child on the Way for American Idol Alum Danny Gokey and Wife Leyicet |url=https://people.com/parents/danny-gokey-expecting-fourth-child-wife-leyicet-pregnant/ |access-date=January 19, 2022 |website=[[People (magazine)|People]]}}</ref>\n\n=== Politics ===\nGokey was raised in a Republican household and has publicly supported Republican politicians since 2012.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2012-09-02 |title=Singer Danny Gokey Says 'It Could Be Time for a Change' in the White House |url=https://patch.com/wisconsin/waukesha/singer-danny-gokey-says-it-could-be-time-for-a-changee75c03d3fb |access-date=2022-02-16 |website=Patch |language=en |location=Waukesha, Wisc.}}</ref> He supported [[Donald Trump]] during his first [[Impeachment of Donald Trump|impeachment trial]] and in the [[2020 United States presidential election|2020 presidential election]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=2019-12-23 |title=200 Evangelical Leaders Have Signed an Open Letter Slamming That 'Christianity Today' Piece |url=https://relevantmagazine.com/current/200-evangelical-leaders-have-signed-an-open-letter-slamming-that-christianity-today-piece/ |access-date=2022-02-16 |website=Relevant |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Fea |first=John |date=2021-06-18 |title=Evangelical Trumpers gather in Orlando |url=https://currentpub.com/2021/06/18/evangelical-trumpers-gather-in-orlando/ |access-date=2022-02-16 |website=Current |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2020-11-02 |title=Fighting for the Faith Vote: Top Christian Leaders Rally Prayer for Trump as Others Rally 'Souls to the Polls' for Biden |url=https://www1.cbn.com/cbnnews/politics/2020/november/fighting-for-the-faith-vote-top-christian-leaders-hold-prayer-call-for-trump-as-other-pastors-rally-souls-to-the-polls-for-biden |access-date=2022-02-16 |website=CBN News |language=en}}</ref> In January 2022, Gokey appeared at the event announcing [[Doug Mastriano]]'s entry into the Pennsylvania gubernatorial race.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Shuham |first=Matt |date=February 18, 2019 |title=A Devout Christian Conservative Kicked Off His Campaign For Governor With\u2026 A Shofar? |url=https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/politics/a-devout-christian-conservative-kicked-off-his-campaign-for-governor-with-e2-80-a6-a-shofar/ar-AASFCdr |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220216190617/https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/politics/a-devout-christian-conservative-kicked-off-his-campaign-for-governor-with-e2-80-a6-a-shofar/ar-AASFCdr |archive-date=February 16, 2022 |access-date=2022-02-16 |website=MSN |language=en-US}}</ref>\n\nGokey, who is not vaccinated against [[COVID-19]], has stated that he believes the vaccine may be part of a prophecy in the [[Book of Revelation]] that \"emphasizes how the whole world will be deceived by Pharmakeia.\"<ref>{{Cite web |last=Shellnut |first=Kate |date=December 2, 2021 |title=Vaccine Debates Define 2021's Biggest Bible Search Term: Sorcery |url=https://www.christianitytoday.com/news/2021/december/bible-gateway-search-covid-vaccine-debate-mask-sorcery.html |access-date=2022-02-16 |website=Christianity Today |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2022-02-15 |title=Tennessee preacher Greg Locke says demons told him names of witches in his church |url=https://religionnews.com/2022/02/15/tennessee-preacher-greg-locke-says-demons-told-him-names-of-witches-in-his-church/ |access-date=2022-02-16 |publisher=Religion News Service |language=en-US}}</ref> He also believes that vaccine mandates could lead to the [[Number of the beast|Mark of the Beast]], an [[Eschatology|end-times]] belief about the [[Antichrist]] espoused by many [[Evangelicalism|evangelical Christians]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Gibson |first=Charity |date=2021-09-03 |title=Danny Gokey opposes vaccination mandates, says world faces 'birthing point' for mark of the beast |url=https://www.christianpost.com/news/christian-singer-danny-gokey-opposes-vaccination-mandates.html |access-date=2022-02-16 |website=The Christian Post |language=en-US}}</ref>\n\n== do not add to this list without first discussing your proposal on the talk page. -->\n| website         = {{URL|beyonce.com}}\n}}\n| signature          = Beyonc\u00e9's signature (2013).png\n| signature_size     = 150px\n}}\n\n'''Beyonc\u00e9 Giselle Knowles-Carter''' ({{IPAc-en|b|i|\u02c8|\u0252|n|s|e\u026a|audio=En-us-Beyonce.ogg}} {{respell|bee|ON|say}};<ref>{{cite web|last=Wells|first=John C.|author-link=John C. Wells|date=December 19, 2008|url=https://www.phon.ucl.ac.uk/home/wells/blog0812b.htm|title=Beyonc\u00e9|work=John Wells's phonetic blog|access-date=August 22, 2022|archive-date=August 10, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220810182211/https://www.phon.ucl.ac.uk/home/wells/blog0812b.htm|url-status=live}}</ref> {{n\u00e9e}} '''Knowles'''; born September 4, 1981)<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.boston.com/ae/celebrity/articles/2009/12/23/beyonce_knowles_name_change/|title=Beyonc\u00e9 Knowles' name change|newspaper=[[The Boston Globe]]|date=December 23, 2009|access-date=March 8, 2013|archive-date=March 21, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130321085731/http://www.boston.com/ae/celebrity/articles/2009/12/23/beyonce_knowles_name_change/|url-status=live}}</ref> is an American singer, songwriter, and businesswoman.<!-- DO NOT CHANGE. When Beyonce is introduced in an article, the majority describe her as a singer and a businesswoman. Other aspects of her career shall be in the infobox. The main, notable descriptors shall remain here. Please head to talk page if you have any query. --> Nicknamed \"'''Queen Bey'''\", she is regarded as a prominent [[Cultural impact of Beyonc\u00e9|cultural figure]] of the 21st century. Throughout her two-decade career, Beyonc\u00e9 has been recognized for her distinctive vocal range and [[List of Beyonc\u00e9 live performances|live concert performances]].<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Murphy |first=Chris |date=November 29, 2023 |title=The 25 Best Performances of 2023 |url=https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2023/11/best-performances-2023 |access-date=May 7, 2024 |magazine=Vanity Fair |language=en-US}}</ref> ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' named her the world's greatest living entertainer in 2022, and one of the greatest vocalists of all time in 2023.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last= |first= |date=April 1, 2024 |title=The 70 Greatest Beyonc\u00e9 Songs |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-lists/best-beyonce-songs-1378620/ |access-date=May 7, 2024 |magazine=Rolling Stone |language=en-US}}</ref> <!-- DO NOT CHANGE. Beyonce is widely known for her artistry, videos, and her concert performances. These are the key items she is recognized for. Start a discussion on the talk page before any modification. -->\n\nAs a child, Beyonc\u00e9 started performing in various singing and dancing competitions. She rose to fame in the late 1990s as a member of the R&B girl group [[Destiny's Child]], one of the [[List of best-selling girl groups|best-selling girl groups of all time]]. Their hiatus saw the release of Beyonc\u00e9's debut album, ''[[Dangerously in Love]]'' (2003). She then followed with the U.S. number-one solo albums ''[[B'Day (Beyonc\u00e9 album)|B'Day]]'' (2006), ''[[I Am... Sasha Fierce]]'' (2008), and ''[[4 (Beyonc\u00e9 album)|4]]'' (2011). After creating her own management company [[Parkwood Entertainment]], Beyonc\u00e9 achieved critical acclaim for the experimental [[visual album]]s ''[[Beyonc\u00e9 (album)|Beyonc\u00e9]]'' (2013) and ''[[Lemonade (album)|Lemonade]]'' (2016), which explored themes such as [[feminism]] and [[womanism]]. With her Black [[Diva house|queer]]-inspired [[Dance music|dance]] album ''[[Renaissance (Beyonc\u00e9 album)|Renaissance]]'' (2022) and [[Country music|country]] album ''[[Cowboy Carter]]'' (2024) from her trilogy project, she became the only female artist to have all of her first eight solo studio albums debut at number one on the ''[[Billboard 200]]''.\n\nBeyonc\u00e9's most successful songs on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] include \"[[Crazy in Love]]\", \"[[Baby Boy (Beyonc\u00e9 song)|Baby Boy]]\", \"[[Check On It]]\", \"[[Irreplaceable]]\", \"[[If I Were a Boy]]\", \"[[Halo (Beyonc\u00e9 song)|Halo]]\", \"[[Single Ladies (Put a Ring on It)]]\", \"[[Drunk in Love]]\", \"[[Break My Soul]]\", \"[[Cuff It]]\" and \"[[Texas Hold 'Em (song)|Texas Hold 'Em]]\". She is the only woman in history to achieve at least 20 top 10 songs as a solo artist and 10 as a member of a group.<ref name=\"Billboard July 5\" /> Her collaborative music ventures include ''[[Everything Is Love]]'' (2018), an album with her husband, rapper [[Jay-Z]], released as [[the Carters]], and the [[musical film]] ''[[Black Is King]]'' (2020), inspired by the music of the film soundtrack ''[[The Lion King: The Gift]]'' (2019). Self-directed concert films, including ''[[Homecoming: A Film by Beyonc\u00e9]]'' (2019) and ''[[Renaissance: A Film by Beyonc\u00e9]]'' (2023), document some of her most acclaimed onstage performances. Outside of music, she has starred as an actress in films such as ''[[Austin Powers in Goldmember]]'' (2002), ''[[The Pink Panther (2006 film)|The Pink Panther]]'' (2006), ''[[Dreamgirls (film)|Dreamgirls]]'' (2006), ''[[Cadillac Records]]'' (2008), ''[[Obsessed (2009 film)|Obsessed]]'' (2009), and ''[[The Lion King (2019 film)|The Lion King]]'' (2019).\n\nHaving sold 200 million records worldwide,<ref>{{Cite web |last=Angerhausen |first=Anna |date=April 3, 2024 |title=Beyonc\u00e9's \"COWBOY CARTER\" breaks Spotify record |url=https://www.sonymusic.eu/beyonce-breaks-spotify-record-with-cowboy-carter/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240426163739/https://www.sonymusic.eu/beyonce-breaks-spotify-record-with-cowboy-carter/ |archive-date=April 26, 2024 |access-date=June 30, 2024 |publisher=Sony Music Entertainment Europe}}</ref><ref>{{Cite magazine |last1=Dailey |first1=Jenny Regan,Hannah |last2=Regan |first2=Jenny |last3=Dailey |first3=Hannah |date=24 June 2022 |title=Beyonc\u00e9's Style Evolution: See Photos |url=https://www.billboard.com/photos/beyonces-style-evolution-see-photos-1235105288/ |access-date=July 3, 2024 |magazine=Billboard }}</ref> Beyonc\u00e9 is one of the [[List of best-selling music artists#200 million to 249 million records|best-selling music artists of all time]]. [[List of awards and nominations received by Beyonc\u00e9|Her accolades]] include [[Grammy Award milestones#Awards|a record 32]] [[Grammy Awards]], as well as 26 [[MTV Video Music Awards]] (including the 2014 [[Michael Jackson Video Vanguard Award]]), 24 [[NAACP Image Awards]], 35 [[BET Awards]], and 17 [[Soul Train Music Awards]] \u2013 all of which are more than any other artist in the music industry. Her success during the 2000s earned her recognition as the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA)'s Top Certified Artist of the Decade and ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''{{'s}} Top Female Artist and Top [[Radio Songs (chart)|Radio Songs]] Artist of the Decade.<ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/266420/artists-of-the-decade| url-status=live | archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/archive/20211027/https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/266420/artists-of-the-decade| archive-date=October 27, 2021 |title=Artist of the Decade |magazine=Billboard|date=March 12, 2013}}{{cbignore}}</ref> She is the most successful black touring act in history and received the [[Pollstar|''Pollstar'' Touring Artist of the Decade]] award in 2021.<ref>{{Cite magazine |date=February 26, 2021 |title=Boxoffice Insider: Top Grossing Black Touring Artists - Pollstar News |url=https://news.pollstar.com/2021/02/26/boxoffice-insider-top-grossing-black-touring-artists/ |access-date=May 25, 2023 |magazine=Pollstar |archive-date=May 7, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230507184959/https://news.pollstar.com/2021/02/26/boxoffice-insider-top-grossing-black-touring-artists/ |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{Cite magazine |date=June 16, 2021 |title=Beyonc\u00e9, Troubadour, Forum, Coachella, Billy Strings, Bert Kreischer Among Pollstar Awards Winners |url=https://news.pollstar.com/2021/06/16/beyonce-troubadour-forum-coachella-billy-strings-bert-kreischer-among-pollstar-awards-winners/ |access-date=October 15, 2023 |magazine=Pollstar |archive-date=October 31, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231031095215/https://news.pollstar.com/2021/06/16/beyonce-troubadour-forum-coachella-billy-strings-bert-kreischer-among-pollstar-awards-winners/ |url-status=live }}</ref> [[Time (magazine)|''Time'']] included her as one of the 100 women who has so far defined the 21st century.<ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://time.com/5793791/beyonce-100-women-of-the-year/| url-status=live | archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/archive/20211027/https://time.com/5793791/beyonce-100-women-of-the-year/| archive-date=October 27, 2021 |title=Beyonc\u00e9: Time 100 Women of the Year \u2013 2014: Beyonc\u00e9 Knowles-Carter |last=Cooper |first=Brittney |magazine=Time |access-date=March 5, 2020}}{{cbignore}}</ref>\n\n== Early life==\nBeyonce<!--Please do not replace the last \"e\" in \"Beyonce\" with the accented \"\u00e9\". Texas birth certificates don't allow accented letters. -->  Giselle Knowles{{efn|name=Naminglaws}} was born on September 4, 1981, at the Park Plaza Hospital<ref>{{Cite book |last=Taraborrelli |first=J. Randy |author-link=J. Randy Taraborrelli |title=Becoming Beyonc\u00e9: The Untold Story |date=October 27, 2015 |publisher=[[Grand Central Publishing]] |isbn=9781455590346 |edition= |page=28 |language=English}}</ref> in [[Houston, Texas]] to [[Tina Knowles|Celestine \"Tina\" Knowles]] (''n\u00e9e'' Beyonce), a hairdresser and salon owner, and [[Mathew Knowles]], a [[Xerox]] sales manager.<ref>{{cite news|title=The Family Business|url=http://www.mtv.com/bands/p/parent_managers_041115/index3.jhtml|publisher=MTV News|access-date=June 6, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140907214159/http://www.mtv.com/bands/p/parent_managers_041115/index3.jhtml|archive-date=September 7, 2014}}</ref> Tina is [[Louisiana Creole people|Louisiana Creole]] and Mathew is [[African American]].<ref name=\"FOX\">{{cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,204978,00.html?sPage=fnc/entertainment/beyonce|title=Beyonc\u00e9 Knowles' Biography|publisher=[[Fox News Channel]]|date=April 15, 2008|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080307175108/http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,204978,00.html?sPage=fnc%2Fentertainment%2Fbeyonce|archive-date=March 7, 2008 |access-date=November 6, 2018}}</ref><ref name=smol1>{{cite news|last=Smolenyak|first=Megan|url=https://huffingtonpost.com/megan-smolenyak-smolenyak/a-peek-into-blue-ivy-cart_b_1200346.html| url-status=live | archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/archive/20211027/https://huffingtonpost.com/megan-smolenyak-smolenyak/a-peek-into-blue-ivy-cart_b_1200346.html| archive-date=October 27, 2021|title=A Peek into Blue Ivy Carter's Past|work=HuffPost|date=January 12, 2012|access-date=January 30, 2012}}{{cbignore}}</ref><ref name=\"nanews\">{{cite news|title=Beyonce Touts L'Oreal Cosmetics That 'Match' Your Native American Shade|url=https://newsmaven.io/indiancountrytoday/archive/beyonce-touts-l-oreal-cosmetics-that-match-your-native-american-shade-6e1XWfaJnkie2VOZIFeamw/|newspaper=[[Indian Country Today]]|access-date=January 27, 2019|date=January 19, 2012|archive-date=January 27, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190127152928/https://newsmaven.io/indiancountrytoday/archive/beyonce-touts-l-oreal-cosmetics-that-match-your-native-american-shade-6e1XWfaJnkie2VOZIFeamw/}}</ref><ref>Mathew is African American; Tina is Louisiana Creole:\n* {{cite book|title=Crazy in Love: The Beyonc\u00e9 Knowles Biography|author=Daryl Easlea|year=2011|page=4}}\n* {{cite book|author=Cherese Cartlidge|title=Beyonc\u00e9|date=May 17, 2012|publisher=Greenhaven Publishing LLC|isbn=978-1-4205-0966-3|page=14}}\n* {{cite book|author=Janice Arenofsky|title=Beyonc\u00e9 Knowles: A Biography|year=2009|publisher=ABC-CLIO|isbn=978-0-313-35914-9|page=2}}</ref> Beyonc\u00e9's younger sister, [[Solange Knowles]], is also a singer and a former backup dancer for [[Destiny's Child]]. Solange and Beyonc\u00e9 are the first sisters to have both had number one solo albums.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.etonline.com/music/199983_beyonce_and_solange_knowles_become_first_sisters_to_have_number_1_albums/| url-status=live | archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/archive/20211027/http://www.etonline.com/music/199983_beyonce_and_solange_knowles_become_first_sisters_to_have_number_1_albums/| archive-date=October 27, 2021|title=Beyonc\u00e9 and Solange Knowles Become First Sisters to Land No. 1 Albums|work=Entertainment Tonight|access-date=October 12, 2016}}{{cbignore}}</ref>\n\nBeyonc\u00e9's maternal grandparents, Lumis Albert Beyinc\u00e9 and Agn\u00e9z Der\u00e9on (daughter of Odilia Broussard and Eug\u00e8ne DeRouen),<ref name=\"KreolMag\">{{cite magazine |last=Dhillon |first=Georgina |date=October 3, 2012 |title=Beyonc\u00e9 Knowles: A Creole Queen |url=https://kreolmagazine.com/culture/features/beyonce-knowles-a-creole-queen/ |url-status=live |magazine=Kreol International Magazine |publisher=Rila Publications |archive-url=https://archive.today/20211016145343/https://kreolmagazine.com/culture/features/beyonce-knowles-a-creole-queen/ |archive-date=October 16, 2021 |access-date=October 16, 2021}}</ref> were [[Louisiana French|French-speaking]] Louisiana [[Creole people|Creole]]s, with roots in [[New Iberia, Louisiana|New Iberia]];<ref name=\"IrishCentral\">{{cite news |last=Drohan |first=Freya |date=July 2, 2018 |title=Celebrating Beyonc\u00e9's Irish roots on her birthday |url=https://www.irishcentral.com/roots/is-beyonce-irish |url-status=live |work=IrishCentral |archive-url=https://archive.today/20211016003505/https://www.irishcentral.com/roots/is-beyonce-irish |archive-date=October 16, 2021 |access-date=October 16, 2021}}</ref><ref name=\"KreolMag\" /><ref>{{cite book |last=Khanna |first=Nikki |date=2011 |title=Biracial in America: Forming and Performing Racial Identity |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=HonAzBvHOnwC&pg=PA63 |location=[[Vermont]] |publisher=[[Rowman & Littlefield|Lexington Books]] |page=63 |isbn=978-0-7391-4574-6 |archive-date=March 4, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240304074546/https://books.google.com/books?id=HonAzBvHOnwC&pg=PA63#v=onepage&q&f=false |url-status=live }}</ref> She is a descendant of [[Acadians|Acadian]] militia officer [[Joseph Broussard]], who was exiled to [[Louisiana (New France)|French Louisiana]] after the [[expulsion of the Acadians]], and of the French military officer and [[Abenaki]] chief [[Jean-Vincent d'Abbadie de Saint-Castin|Jean-Vincent d'Abbadie, Baron de Saint-Castin]].<ref name=smol1 /><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/megan-smolenyak-smolenyak/a-peek-into-blue-ivy-cart_b_1200346.html |title=A Peek into Blue Ivy Carter's Past |first=Megan |last=Smolenyak |publisher=The Huffington Post (AOL) |date=January 12, 2012 |access-date=January 14, 2012 |archive-date=June 14, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150614075239/http://www.huffingtonpost.com/megan-smolenyak-smolenyak/a-peek-into-blue-ivy-cart_b_1200346.html |url-status=live }}</ref> She has additional [[Bretons|Breton]] heritage. Beyonc\u00e9's fourth great-grandmother, Marie-Fran\u00e7oise Trahan, was born in 1774 in [[Bangor, Morbihan|Bangor]], located on [[Belle \u00cele]], [[France]]. Trahan was a daughter of Acadians who had taken refuge on Belle \u00cele after the Acadian expulsion. The [[Estates of Brittany|Estates]] of [[Brittany]] had divided the lands of Belle \u00cele to distribute them among [[Expulsion of the Acadians#France and Britain|78 other Acadian families]] and the already settled inhabitants. The Trahan family lived on Belle \u00cele for over ten years before [[Capture of Belle \u00cele#Aftermath|migrating to]] Louisiana, where she married a Broussard descendant.<ref name=\":4\">Beyonc\u00e9 has roots in Brittany:\n*{{cite news |date=August 31, 2013 |title=Belle-Ile-en-Mer. Beyonc\u00e9 serait une cousine! |trans-title=Belle-Ile-en-Mer. Beyonc\u00e9 would be a cousin! |url=https://www.letelegramme.fr/ig/generales/regions/cotesarmor/belle-ile-en-mer-beyonce-serait-une-cousine-31-08-2013-2217594.php |url-status=live |language=fr |newspaper=[[Le T\u00e9l\u00e9gramme]] |archive-url=https://archive.today/20211015233626/https://www.letelegramme.fr/ig/generales/regions/cotesarmor/belle-ile-en-mer-beyonce-serait-une-cousine-31-08-2013-2217594.php |archive-date=October 15, 2021 |access-date=October 16, 2021}}\n*{{cite magazine |date=September 2, 2013 |title=Beyonc\u00e9 et ses origines bretonnes |trans-title=Beyonc\u00e9 and her Breton origins |url=https://www.parismatch.com/People/Beyonce-et-ses-origines-bretonnes-526253 |url-status=live |language=fr |magazine=[[Paris Match]] |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211015233710/https://www.parismatch.com/People/Beyonce-et-ses-origines-bretonnes-526253 |archive-date=October 15, 2021 |access-date=October 16, 2021}}\n*{{cite news |date=September 1, 2013 |title=Beyonc\u00e9 aurait une anc\u00eatre bretonne |trans-title=Beyonc\u00e9 would have a Breton ancestor |url=https://www.leparisien.fr/laparisienne/people/beyonce-aurait-une-ancetre-bretonne-01-09-2013-3097869.php |url-status=live |language=fr |newspaper=[[Le Parisien]] |archive-url=https://archive.today/20211015234206/https://www.leparisien.fr/laparisienne/people/beyonce-aurait-une-ancetre-bretonne-01-09-2013-3097869.php |archive-date=October 15, 2021 |access-date=October 16, 2021}}</ref> Beyonc\u00e9 researched her ancestry and discovered that she is descended from [[History of slavery in Louisiana|a slave]] owner who married his slave.<ref>{{cite magazine|title= Beyonc\u00e9 in Her Own Words: Her Life, Her Body, Her Heritage|url=https://www.vogue.com/article/beyonce-september-issue-2018| url-status=live | archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/archive/20211027/https://www.vogue.com/article/beyonce-september-issue-2018| archive-date=October 27, 2021|magazine=[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]]|date=August 6, 2018|quote=I researched my ancestry recently and learned that I come from a slave owner who fell in love with and married a slave.}}{{cbignore}}</ref> Her mother is also of distant Irish, Jewish, Spanish, Chinese and Indonesian ancestry.<ref>{{cite book|title=Crazy in Love: The Beyonc\u00e9 Knowles Biography|author=Daryl Easlea|year=2011|page=4}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|author=Cherese Cartlidge|title=Beyonc\u00e9|date=May 17, 2012|publisher=Greenhaven Publishing LLC|isbn=978-1-4205-0966-3|page=14}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|author=Janice Arenofsky|title=Beyonc\u00e9 Knowles: A Biography|year=2009|publisher=ABC-CLIO|isbn=978-0-313-35914-9|page=2}}</ref><ref name=\"IrishCentral\" /> Beyonc\u00e9 also has Belgian ancestry from [[Hainaut Province]], Wallonia and is related to a former mayor of [[Froidchapelle]], Belgium.<ref>{{cite web|title=Selon cette historienne, Beyonc\u00e9 viendrait de Belgique (une fois) |trans-title=According to this historian, Beyonc\u00e9 once came from Belgium |url=https://jack.canalplus.com/articles/lire/une-historienne-a-trouve-que-beyonce-avait-des-origines-belges| date=May 22, 2023|language=fr |publisher=[[Canal+ (French TV channel)|Canal Plus]] |access-date=June 26, 2024}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Queen B aurait-elle des origines belges ? Nous avons retrouv\u00e9 le cousin de Beyonc\u00e9 |trans-title=Does Queen B have Belgian origins? We found Beyonc\u00e9's cousin in Belgium |url=https://www.rtbf.be/article/queen-b-aurait-elle-des-origines-belges-nous-avons-retrouve-le-cousin-de-beyonce-11185946 |last=Warland|first=Ma\u00eft\u00e9|date=April 21, 2023 |language=fr |publisher=[[RTBF]] |access-date=June 26, 2024}}</ref>\n\nBeyonc\u00e9 was raised [[Methodist]] and attended St. John's United Methodist Church in Houston.<ref name=\"NBC2017\">{{cite news |last1=Quinn |first1=Gwendolyn |title=Beyonc\u00e9 Teams Up With Houston Pastor to Help Harvey Survivors |url=https://www.nbcnews.com/news/nbcblk/houston-pastor-beyonc-team-help-harvey-survivors-n799006 |agency=NBC News |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220815071747/https://www.nbcnews.com/news/nbcblk/houston-pastor-beyonc-team-help-harvey-survivors-n799006 |archive-date=August 15, 2022 |date=September 9, 2017 |quote=Beyonc\u00e9 returned home to Houston on Friday and joined the survivors of Hurricane Harvey at her home church, St. John's United Methodist Church, with Senior Pastor, Rudy Rasmus - affectionately known to the global community as Pastor Rudy ... 'I'm home, this church is my home. I was maybe nine or ten years old the first time I sat there where my daughter [Blue Ivy] is sitting. I sang my first solo here,' she said.|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Welch |first1=Monique |title=Timeline: How Beyonc\u00e9 has given back to her hometown of Houston through the years |url=https://www.houstonchronicle.com/projects/timeline/beyonce-houston-charity/ |newspaper=Houston Chronicle |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230512044927/https://www.houstonchronicle.com/projects/timeline/beyonce-houston-charity/ |archive-date=May 12, 2023 |date=July 28, 2022 |url-status=live}}</ref> As her mother's family was [[Roman Catholicism|Catholic]], her family attended [[Midnight mass|Midnight Mass]] at St. Mary of the Purification Catholic Church on [[Christmas Eve]].<ref>{{cite news| url = https://www.beaumontenterprise.com/entertainment/music/article/a-knowles-family-christmas-5475839.php| title = A Knowles family Christmas| last = Laird| first = Cheryl| date = November 11, 1990| newspaper = [[Houston Chronicle]]| via = [[Beaumont Enterprise]]| access-date = April 2, 2024| archive-date = April 2, 2024| archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20240402135241/https://www.beaumontenterprise.com/entertainment/music/article/a-knowles-family-christmas-5475839.php| url-status = live}}</ref> She went to St. Mary's Catholic Montessori School in Houston and enrolled in dance classes there.<ref>{{cite news|last=Laird|first=Cheryl|date=November 11, 1990|title=A Knowles family Christmas|url=https://www.houstonchronicle.com/entertainment/music/article/A-Knowles-family-Christmas-5475839.php| url-status=live | archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/archive/20211027/https://www.houstonchronicle.com/entertainment/music/article/A-Knowles-family-Christmas-5475839.php| archive-date=October 27, 2021|access-date=March 15, 2021|newspaper=Houston Chronicle}}{{cbignore}}</ref> Her singing ability was discovered when dance instructor Darlette Johnson began humming a song and Beyonc\u00e9 finished it, able to hit the high-pitched notes.<ref name=\"danceclasses\">{{cite web|title=Beyonc\u00e9 Thrilled By First Dance Teacher|url=http://www.contactmusic.com/news/beyonce-thrilled-by-first-dance-teacher_1007391| url-status=live | archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/archive/20211027/http://www.contactmusic.com/news/beyonce-thrilled-by-first-dance-teacher_1007391| archive-date=October 27, 2021|publisher=Contact Music|access-date=August 28, 2013|date=September 6, 2006}}{{cbignore}}</ref> Beyonc\u00e9's interest in music and performing continued after winning a school talent show at age seven, singing [[John Lennon]]'s \"[[Imagine (John Lennon song)|Imagine]]\" to beat 15/16-year-olds.<ref name=\"Biography Today\">{{cite book|title=Biography Today|year=2010|page=[https://archive.org/details/biographytodayge0000unse_h7i3/page/10 10]|publisher=Omnigraphics|isbn=978-0-7808-1058-7|url-access=registration|url=https://archive.org/details/biographytodayge0000unse_h7i3/page/10}}</ref><ref name=\"People\">{{cite magazine|title=Beyonc\u00e9 Knowles: Biography \u2013 Part 1|url=http://www.people.com/people/beyonce_knowles/biography|magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070426055053/http://www.people.com/people/beyonce_knowles/biography|archive-date=April 26, 2007|url-status=live}}</ref> In the fall of 1990, Beyonc\u00e9 enrolled in Parker Elementary School, a music [[magnet school]] in Houston, where she performed with the school's choir.<ref name=\"contactbio\">{{cite web|title=Beyonc\u00e9 Knowles Biography|url=http://www.contactmusic.com/info/beyonce_knowles| url-status=live | archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/archive/20211027/http://www.contactmusic.com/info/beyonce_knowles| archive-date=October 27, 2021|publisher=Contact Music|access-date=August 28, 2013}}{{cbignore}}</ref> She also attended the [[High School for the Performing and Visual Arts]]<ref>{{cite web|last=Maughan|first=Jennifer|url=http://www.life123.com/arts-culture/pop-stars/beyonce/beyonce-knowles-childhood.shtml|title=Beyonc\u00e9 Knowles Childhood|publisher=Life123|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110713204458/http://www.life123.com/arts-culture/pop-stars/beyonce/beyonce-knowles-childhood.shtml|archive-date=July 13, 2011}}</ref> and later [[Alief Elsik High School]].<ref name=\"FOX\" /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://elsikalumni.com/FamousAlumni.asp|title=Famous Alumni|publisher=Elsik High School|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20040814182317/http://www.elsikalumni.com/FamousAlumni.asp|archive-date=August 14, 2004|url-status=live}}</ref> Beyonc\u00e9 was also a member of the choir at St. John's United Methodist Church where she sang her first [[Solo (music)|solo]] and was a [[solo (music)|soloist]] for two years.<ref name=\"NBC2017\" /><ref>{{cite news|title=Cameo: Fat Joe Interviews Beyonc\u00e9 and Mike Epps|url=http://www.mtv.com/onair/moviehouse/cameo/16/index.jhtml|publisher=MTV News|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080224081629/http://www.mtv.com/onair/moviehouse/cameo/16/index.jhtml|archive-date=February 24, 2008}}</ref>\n\n==Career==\n===Career beginnings===\nWhen Beyonc\u00e9 was eight, she met [[LaTavia Roberson]] at an audition for an all-girl entertainment group.<ref name=\"Kaufman\">{{cite news |last=Kaufman |first=Gil |date=June 13, 2005 |title=Destiny's Child's Long Road To Fame (The Song Isn't Called \"Survivor\" For Nothing) |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1504044/20050613/destinys_child.jhtml |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110624084104/http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1504044/destinys-childs-long-road-fame.jhtml |archive-date=June 24, 2011 |publisher=MTV News}}</ref> They were placed into a group called [[Girl's Tyme]] with three other girls, and rapped and danced on the talent show circuit in Houston.<ref>{{cite news|title=Kelly Rowland|url=https://edition.cnn.com/2006/TRAVEL/02/27/houston.kellyrowland/|work=CNN|date=February 27, 2006|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130227180947/http://articles.cnn.com/2006-02-27/travel/houston.kellyrowland_1_kelly-rowland-destiny-s-child-second-album?_s=PM:TRAVEL|archive-date=February 27, 2013|url-status=live|access-date=February 1, 2012}}</ref> After seeing the group, [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]] producer Arne Frager brought them to his [[Northern California]] studio and placed them in ''[[Star Search]]'', the largest talent show on national TV at the time. Girl's Tyme failed to win, and Beyonc\u00e9 later said the song they performed was not good.<ref name=\"Farley\">{{cite magazine|last=Farley|first=Christopher John|title=Music: Call Of The Child|url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,998976,00.html|magazine=Time|date=January 15, 2001|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071130020409/http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,998976,00.html|archive-date=November 30, 2007}}</ref><ref name=\"J.R.\">{{cite news|last=Reynolds|first=J.R.|title=All Grown Up|url=http://music.yahoo.com/read/interview/12027658|publisher=[[Yahoo! Music]]|date=March 3, 1998|access-date=January 12, 2007|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081216031102/http://music.yahoo.com/read/interview/12027658|archive-date=December 16, 2008}}</ref> In 1995, Beyonc\u00e9's father, Matthew, resigned from his job to manage the group.<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Tyrangiel|first=Josh|title=Destiny's Adult|url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,1005114,00.html|magazine=Time|date=June 13, 2003|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081216031053/http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,1005114,00.html|archive-date=December 16, 2008}}</ref> The move reduced the family's income by half, and Beyonc\u00e9's parents were forced to sell their house and cars and move into separated apartments.<ref name=\"FOX\" /><ref>{{Cite web |title=Destiny's Child \u2013 VH1 Driven Documentary (Part II) | date=3 January 2013 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NRtqzsijcUs |via=YouTube |access-date=March 24, 2022 |archive-date=March 24, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220324082527/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NRtqzsijcUs |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\nMathew cut the original line-up to four and the group continued performing as an opening act for other established R&B girl groups.<ref name=\"Kaufman\" /> The girls auditioned before record labels and were finally signed to [[Elektra Records]], moving to [[Atlanta record labels|Atlanta Records]] briefly to work on their first recording, only to be cut by the company.<ref name=\"FOX\" /> This put further strain on the family, and Beyonc\u00e9's parents separated. On October 5, 1995, [[Dwayne Wiggins]]'s Grass Roots Entertainment signed the group. In 1996, the girls began recording their debut album under an agreement with Sony Music, the Knowles family reunited, and shortly after, the group got a contract with [[Columbia Records]] with the assistance of Columbia talent scout [[Teresa LaBarbera Whites]].<ref name=\"Biography Today\" />\n\n=== 1997\u20132002: Destiny's Child ===\n{{Main|Destiny's Child}}\n[[File:Destiny's Child Tour.jpg|thumb|Beyonc\u00e9 (center) at the final line-up of Destiny's Child, performing during their 2005 [[Destiny Fulfilled... and Lovin' It]] concert tour]]\n\nThe group changed their name to Destiny's Child in 1996, based upon a passage in the [[Book of Isaiah]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Dekel-Daks |first=Tal |date=January 29, 2013 |title=Ten Things About&nbsp;... Destiny's Child |work=[[Digital Spy]] |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/showbiz/news/a454691/ten-things-about-destinys-child.html |url-status=deviated |access-date=March 22, 2013 |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/archive/20211027/http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/showbiz/news/a454691/ten-things-about-destinys-child.html |archive-date=October 27, 2021}}{{cbignore}}</ref> In 1997, Destiny's Child released their major label debut song \"Killing Time\" on the soundtrack to the 1997 film ''[[Men in Black (1997 film)|Men in Black]]''.<ref name=\"J.R.\" /> In November, the group released their debut single and first major hit, \"[[No, No, No (Destiny's Child song)|No, No, No]]\". They released their [[Destiny's Child (album)|self-titled debut album]] in February 1998, which established the group as a viable act in the music industry.<ref name=\"Kaufman\" /> The group released their Multi-Platinum second album ''[[The Writing's on the Wall]]'' in 1999.
