|url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151208110312/http://mmva.muchmusic.com/check-out-the-full-list-of-mmva-winners-now/?theme=mobile |archive-date=8 December 2015 }}</ref> On 27 June, Sheeran performed as the opening act for [[The Rolling Stones]] in their [[Zip Code Tour]] date in Kansas City's [[Arrowhead Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Kreps|first=Daniel|date=28 June 2015|title=See Rolling Stones Perform 'Beast of Burden' With Ed Sheeran|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/see-rolling-stones-perform-beast-of-burden-with-ed-sheeran-20150628|magazine=Rolling Stone|access-date=15 November 2015|archive-date=22 November 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151122051756/http://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/see-rolling-stones-perform-beast-of-burden-with-ed-sheeran-20150628|url-status=live}}</ref> On 10\u201312 July 2015, Sheeran performed sold-out shows at London's [[Wembley Stadium]]. The shows, which were announced in November 2014, were part of his world tour.<ref>{{cite news |date=17 November 2014 |title=Ed Sheeran to play biggest solo show to date at Wembley |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/30079487 |work=[[BBC News]] |access-date=29 November 2014 |archive-date=6 March 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150306105732/http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/30079487 |url-status=live }}</ref> The concert was documented and aired on 16 August 2015 on [[NBC]]; the one-hour special ''Ed Sheeran \u2013 Live at Wembley Stadium'' also included behind-the-scenes footage.<ref>{{cite news |last=Spanos |first=Brittany |date=24 July 2015 |title=Ed Sheeran Announces 'Live at Wembley Stadium' TV Special |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/ed-sheeran-announces-live-at-wembley-stadium-tv-special-20150724 |magazine=[[Rolling Stone]] |access-date=12 December 2017 |archive-date=10 October 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171010005048/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/ed-sheeran-announces-live-at-wembley-stadium-tv-special-20150724 |url-status=live }}</ref> In November 2015 Sheeran released the DVD ''[[Jumpers for Goalposts: Live at Wembley Stadium]]''; the title is a nod to playing concerts at Wembley Stadium, the home of [[English football]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Watch the trailer for Ed Sheeran's exuberant concert film 'Jumpers for Goalposts' |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/entertainthis/2015/09/17/ed-sheeran-concert-film-jumpers-for-goalposts-trailer/77544832/ |date=17 September 2015 |newspaper=[[USA Today]] |access-date=28 March 2018 |archive-date=28 March 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180328232532/https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/entertainthis/2015/09/17/ed-sheeran-concert-film-jumpers-for-goalposts-trailer/77544832/ |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\nIn 2015, Sheeran wrote \"[[Love Yourself]]\" for [[Justin Bieber]]'s fourth album.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran Wrote Song for Justin Bieber's New Album, but Not One Direction's |url=http://abcnewsradioonline.com/music-news/2015/10/1/ed-sheeran-wrote-song-for-justin-biebers-new-album-but-not-o.html |work=[[ABC News (United States)|ABC News]] |date=1 October 2015 |access-date=22 March 2017 |archive-date=11 February 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170211113709/http://abcnewsradioonline.com/music-news/2015/10/1/ed-sheeran-wrote-song-for-justin-biebers-new-album-but-not-o.html |url-status=live }}</ref> Sheeran had initially planned to put the song on his third album \u00f7 and added that the track would have been scrapped before Bieber took the song.<ref>{{cite magazine |title=Ed Sheeran Reveals 'Love Yourself' Was Originally Written For His New Album 'Divide' |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/7647997/ed-sheeran-love-yourself-justin-bieber-divide-interview |access-date=22 March 2017 |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |date=9 January 2017 |archive-date=15 March 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170315032836/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/7647997/ed-sheeran-love-yourself-justin-bieber-divide-interview |url-status=live }}</ref> In August 2015, he sang along with [[Macklemore]] on the track \"Growing Up\".<ref>{{cite news | last=Denham | first=Jess | title=Macklemore and Ed Sheeran just dropped a surprise new song | website=The Independent | date=5 August 2015 | url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/news/macklemore-and-ed-sheeran-drop-surprise-song-growing-up-about-becoming-a-dad-10441024.html | access-date=6 September 2018 | archive-date=6 September 2018 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180906130012/https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/news/macklemore-and-ed-sheeran-drop-surprise-song-growing-up-about-becoming-a-dad-10441024.html | url-status=live }}</ref> On 26 September, Sheeran performed at the 2015 [[Global Citizen Festival]] in [[Central Park]]'s Great Lawn in New York, an event organised by [[Coldplay]] lead singer, [[Chris Martin]], that advocates an end to extreme global poverty. Sheeran headlined the festival along with [[Beyonc\u00e9]], Coldplay and [[Pearl Jam]]. The festival was broadcast on NBC in the US on 27 September and the [[BBC]] in the UK on 28 September.<ref name=\"Festival\">{{cite magazine |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/music-festivals/6620421/beyonce-coldplay-pearl-jam-new-york-2015-global-citizen-festival |title=Beyonc\u00e9, Coldplay, Pearl Jam to Headline New York's 2015 Global Citizen Festival |last=Hampp |first=Andrew |date=9 July 2015 |magazine=Billboard |access-date=5 August 2015 |archive-date=31 July 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150731005100/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/music-festivals/6620421/beyonce-coldplay-pearl-jam-new-york-2015-global-citizen-festival |url-status=live }}</ref> Sheeran co-hosted the [[2015 MTV Europe Music Awards]] on 25 October in [[Milan]], Italy. He won the awards for Best Live Act and Best Live Stage;<ref>{{cite news|last=Vincent|first=Alice|date=26 October 2015|title=MTV EMAs 2015: Five things we learned|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/music/news/mtv-emas-2015-justin-bieber-ed-sheeran/ |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/archive/20220110/https://www.telegraph.co.uk/music/news/mtv-emas-2015-justin-bieber-ed-sheeran/ |archive-date=10 January 2022 |url-access=subscription |url-status=live|work=The Telegraph|access-date=15 November 2015}}{{cbignore}}</ref> the latter was in recognition for his performance at the 2014 [[V Festival]] in England.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/music/music-festivals/10675886/Justin-Timberlake-and-the-Killers-to-headline-V-Festival-2014.html |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/archive/20220110/https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/music/music-festivals/10675886/Justin-Timberlake-and-the-Killers-to-headline-V-Festival-2014.html |archive-date=10 January 2022 |url-access=subscription |url-status=live|title=Justin Timberlake and the Killers to headline V Festival 2014|last=Waters|first=Lowenna|date=4 March 2014|work=The Telegraph|access-date=15 November 2015}}{{cbignore}}</ref> Sheeran won the Breakthrough award at the 2015 [[Billboard Touring Awards|''Billboard'' Touring Awards]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Angermiller|first=Michele Amabile|date=20 November 2015|title=One Direction, Ed Sheeran, & The Grateful Dead Big Winners at Billboard Touring Awards|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/6770115/billboard-touring-conference-winners-one-direction-ed-sheeran|magazine=Billboard|access-date=21 November 2015|archive-date=10 April 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200410212433/https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/6770115/billboard-touring-conference-winners-one-direction-ed-sheeran|url-status=live}}</ref> His single from ''\u00d7'', \"Thinking Out Loud\", earned him two [[Grammy Award]]s at the [[58th Annual Grammy Awards|2016 ceremony]]: [[Grammy Award for Song of the Year|Song of the Year]] and [[Grammy Award for Best Pop Solo Performance|Best Pop Solo Performance]].<ref name=\"Grammys 2016\">{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/live/2016/feb/15/grammy-awards-2016-live-adele-taylor-swift-kendrick-lamar|title=Grammy Awards 2016: performances and winners \u2013 as it happened|date=15 January 2016|work=Guardian|access-date=28 August 2019|archive-date=24 July 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170724092441/https://www.theguardian.com/music/live/2016/feb/15/grammy-awards-2016-live-adele-taylor-swift-kendrick-lamar|url-status=live}}</ref> In May 2016, ''\u00d7'' was named the second-best-selling album worldwide in 2015, behind ''[[25 (Adele album)|25]]'' by [[Adele]].<ref>{{cite news|title=One in six albums sold worldwide is by a UK star|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-36332019|publisher=BBC|date=20 May 2016|access-date=27 August 2022|archive-date=12 August 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220812185044/https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-36332019|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n===2016\u20132018: ''\u00f7'' (\"''Divide''\") ===\n\nOn 13 December 2016, after a year long hiatus and social media break, Sheeran tweeted a picture and changed his Twitter, Facebook and Instagram to a light blue, implying the release of a new album\u2014each of Sheeran's previous albums were a single-coloured background with a solid mathematical symbol.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ed Sheeran teases new music with return to social media|url=https://www.nme.com/news/music/ed-sheeran-teases-new-music-return-social-media-1911605|work=NME|date=13 December 2016|access-date=13 December 2016|archive-date=13 December 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161213185131/http://www.nme.com/news/music/ed-sheeran-teases-new-music-return-social-media-1911605|url-status=live}}</ref> On 2 January, he posted a 10-second video on Twitter and other social media platforms, revealing the tracklist and cover art of his fourth studio album, ''[[\u00f7 (album)|\u00f7]]'' (\"Divide\"), which was released on 3 March 2017.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.complex.com/music/2017/01/ed-sheeran-tracklist-cover-art-release-date-divide-album|title=Ed Sheeran Shares Tracklist, Cover Art, and Release Date for New Album '\u00f7'|work=[[Complex (magazine)|Complex]]|access-date=12 January 2017|archive-date=16 January 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170116180920/http://www.complex.com/music/2017/01/ed-sheeran-tracklist-cover-art-release-date-divide-album|url-status=live}}</ref> The album debuted at number one in the UK, the US, Germany, Australia, Canada and other major markets.<ref name=\"Fastest selling UK\">{{cite news|url=http://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/ed-sheeran-smashes-official-chart-records-as-is-the-fastest-selling-album-by-a-male-artist-ever__18447/|title=Ed Sheeran smashes Official Chart records as \u00f7 is the fastest-selling album by a male artist ever|publisher=[[Official Charts Company]]|date=10 March 2017|access-date=10 March 2017|archive-date=28 April 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170428075832/http://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/ed-sheeran-smashes-official-chart-records-as-is-the-fastest-selling-album-by-a-male-artist-ever__18447/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=\"Biggest selling US\">{{cite news|first=Keith|last=Caulfield|title=Ed Sheeran's 'Divide' Bows at No. 1 on Billboard 200 Chart With 2017's Biggest Debut|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/7718243/ed-sheerans-divide-bows-at-no-1-on-billboard-200-chart-with|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=12 March 2017|access-date=13 March 2017|archive-date=13 March 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170313023817/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/7718243/ed-sheerans-divide-bows-at-no-1-on-billboard-200-chart-with|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Australian Charts: Ed Sheeran 'Divide' Debuts At No 1|url=http://www.noise11.com/news/australian-charts-ed-sheeran-divide-debuts-at-no-1-20170312|publisher=Noise 11|date=12 March 2017|access-date=12 March 2017|archive-date=12 March 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170312125950/http://www.noise11.com/news/australian-charts-ed-sheeran-divide-debuts-at-no-1-20170312|url-status=live}}</ref> With first week sales of 672,000 it is the fastest-selling album by a male solo artist in the UK, and [[Lists of fastest-selling albums|third fastest in UK chart history]] behind ''[[25 (Adele album)|25]]'' by [[Adele]] and ''[[Be Here Now (album)|Be Here Now]]'' by [[Oasis (band)|Oasis]].<ref name=\"Fastest selling UK\"/> It had the biggest first-week sales of 2017 in the US, until it was surpassed by Taylor Swift's ''[[Reputation (Taylor Swift album)|Reputation]]''.<ref name=\"Biggest selling US\"/>\n\nOn 6 January, Sheeran released two singles, \"[[Shape of You]]\" and \"[[Castle on the Hill]]\"; the theme of the latter single Sheeran's upbringing in his home town of [[Framlingham]] in Suffolk, with the [[castle]] referring to [[Framlingham Castle]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Ed Sheeran Returns With Two New Tracks 'Castle on the Hill' and \"Shape of You\"|url=http://www.complex.com/music/2017/01/ed-sheeran-castle-on-hill-shape-of-you-divide|website=Complex|access-date=6 January 2017|archive-date=7 January 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170107170909/http://www.complex.com/music/2017/01/ed-sheeran-castle-on-hill-shape-of-you-divide|url-status=live}}</ref> Following the release of these singles, Sheeran co-hosted the [[BBC Radio 1 Breakfast Show]] with Scott Mills where it was implied that he would possibly make an appearance at the [[Glastonbury Festival]] in 2017.<ref>{{cite web|last=BBC Radio 1|title=Ed Sheeran's Back! 10 minutes 47 seconds of his best bits!|website=[[YouTube]]|date=6 January 2017|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_1xHMQGDo78|access-date=6 January 2017|archive-date=6 January 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170106235303/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_1xHMQGDo78&gl=US&hl=en|url-status=live}}</ref> It was also during this show that Sheeran used a new [[Martin Guitars|Martin guitar]] that featured the \u00f7 logo (of his new album) on both the headstock and body of the acoustic guitar.<ref>{{cite web|title=Ed Sheeran \u2013 Castle on the Hill (Live)|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ytb7J0ciBcE|via=YouTube|publisher=BBC Radio 1|access-date=11 January 2017|date=6 January 2017|archive-date=12 January 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170112074747/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ytb7J0ciBcE|url-status=live}}</ref> Both singles went on to break the [[Spotify]] day one streaming record, with a combined total of over 13 million streams in 24 hours.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://uk.news.yahoo.com/ed-sheeran-broken-spotifys-day-154304017.html|title=Ed Sheeran has broken Spotify's 'day one' streaming record|date=9 January 2017|publisher=[[Yahoo!]]|access-date=11 January 2017|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170110022334/https://uk.news.yahoo.com/ed-sheeran-broken-spotifys-day-154304017.html|archive-date=10 January 2017}}</ref>\n\nOn 13 January, \"Shape of You\" and \"Castle on the Hill\" entered the [[UK Singles Chart]] at number one and number two, the first time in history an artist has taken the top two UK chart positions with new songs.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ed Sheeran takes top two chart positions|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-38609564|publisher=BBC|date=13 January 2017|access-date=27 August 2022|archive-date=15 August 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220815234929/https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-38609564|url-status=live}}</ref> The same day he also became the first artist to debut at number one and number two on the [[GfK Entertainment Charts|German Single Charts]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.gfk-entertainment.com/news/historischer-rekord-ed-sheeran-startet-als-erster-kuenstler-auf-1-und-2-der-single-charts.html | access-date=17 January 2017 | quote=(translated from German) | title=Historical record: Ed Sheeran starts as the first artist on 1 and 2 of the Official German single charts | archive-date=18 January 2017 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170118051453/http://www.gfk-entertainment.com/news/historischer-rekord-ed-sheeran-startet-als-erster-kuenstler-auf-1-und-2-der-single-charts.html | url-status=live }}</ref> On 15 January, the songs debuted at number one and number two on the [[ARIA Singles Chart]], the first time this has been achieved in the history of the Australian chart.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ed Sheeran Creates Chart History Down Under|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/7655311/ed-sheeran-chart-history-down-under|magazine=Billboard|date=16 January 2017|access-date=27 August 2022|archive-date=20 August 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210820091928/https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/7655311/ed-sheeran-chart-history-down-under|url-status=live}}</ref> On 17 January, \"Shape of You\" debuted at number one on the US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]], while \"Castle on the Hill\" entered at number six; this made Sheeran the first artist ever to have two songs simultaneously debut in the US top 10.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ed Sheeran Debuts Atop Hot 100 With 'Shape of You' & in Top 10 With 'Castle on the Hill'|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/7655347/hot-100-ed-sheeran-shape-of-you-debuts-number-one|magazine=Billboard|date=17 January 2017|access-date=27 August 2022|archive-date=22 October 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201022112917/https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/7655347/hot-100-ed-sheeran-shape-of-you-debuts-number-one|url-status=live}}</ref> The team behind [[TLC (group)|TLC]]'s song \"[[No Scrubs]]\" were given writing credits on \"Shape of You\" after fans and critics found similarities between elements of the two songs.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/7735550/ed-sheeran-tlc-no-scrubs-writers-shape-of-you-credits|magazine=Billboard|title=Ed Sheeran Adds TLC's 'No Scrubs' Songwriters to 'Shape of You' Credits|date=21 March 2017|access-date=27 August 2022|archive-date=1 June 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180601162619/https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/7735550/ed-sheeran-tlc-no-scrubs-writers-shape-of-you-credits|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n[[File:Ed Sheehan - Divide Tour.jpg|thumb|upright|left|Sheeran performing in Miami during his Divide Tour, August 2017. It became the most attended, and [[List of highest-grossing concert tours|highest-grossing tour of all time]] in August 2019.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran breaks U2's tour record |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-49203859 |work=[[BBC News]] |access-date=2 August 2019 |archive-date=2 August 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190802154415/https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-49203859 |url-status=live }}</ref>]]\nOn 26 January, Sheeran announced dates for the beginning of the Divide Tour with shows in Europe, South America and North America from 17 March until 14 June 2017.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nme.com/blogs/nme-blogs/ed-sheeran-new-album-release-date-1942763|title=Ed Sheeran new album '\u00f7' \u2013 release date, tour dates, new songs & more|date=26 January 2017|work=[[NME]]|access-date=26 January 2017|archive-date=25 January 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170125155636/http://www.nme.com/blogs/nme-blogs/ed-sheeran-new-album-release-date-1942763|url-status=live}}</ref> On 17 February, Sheeran released \"[[How Would You Feel (Paean)]]\". Though not an official single, the song peaked at number two in the UK.<ref>{{cite news |last=O'Connor |first=Roisin |title=Ed Sheeran has three songs in the top five |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/news/ed-sheeran-how-would-you-feel-single-no-1-shape-of-you-rag-n-bone-man-human-uk-charts-a7590996.html |date=21 February 2017 |newspaper=[[The Independent]] |location=London |access-date=22 February 2017 |archive-date=22 February 2017 |url-status=live }}</ref> By 11 March 2017, Sheeran had accumulated ten top-10 singles from ''\u00f7'' on the UK Singles Chart, breaking Scottish DJ [[Calvin Harris]]'s record of nine top-10 singles from one album.<ref name=\"Album record\">{{cite news|title=Calvin Harris has some mixed feelings about Ed Sheeran beating his UK chart record|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/music/uk-album-chart/news/a823229/calvin-harris-ed-sheeran-chart-record-mixed-feelings/|work=Digital Spy|date=22 October 2017|access-date=27 August 2022|archive-date=8 November 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181108105411/http://www.digitalspy.com/music/uk-album-chart/news/a823229/calvin-harris-ed-sheeran-chart-record-mixed-feelings/|url-status=live}}</ref> On 25 June, Sheeran headlined the final night of [[Glastonbury Festival|Glastonbury]], performing in front of 135,000 people.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.glastonburyfestivals.co.uk/ed-sheeran-confirmed-as-sunday-night-headliner/|title=Ed Sheeran Confirmed as Sunday Night Headliner|website=Glastonbury Festival|date=16 March 2017 |access-date=16 March 2017|archive-date=17 March 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170317143357/http://www.glastonburyfestivals.co.uk/ed-sheeran-confirmed-as-sunday-night-headliner/|url-status=live}}</ref> At the [[2017 MTV Video Music Awards]] Sheeran was named Artist of the Year.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtvpress.com/press-releases/2017/08/28/2017-vma-winners-and-performances|author=MTV Press|date=27 August 2017|access-date=26 May 2018|title=2017 \"VMA\" Winners and Performances|archive-date=28 August ''\u00f7'', \"[[Perfect (Ed Sheeran song)|Perfect]]\", reached number one in the UK and Australia, and a stripped-down acoustic version of the song titled \"Perfect Duet\", a collaboration with [[Beyonc\u00e9]], reached number one in the US and the UK,<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8063597/ed-sheeran-beyonce-perfect-billboard-hot-100-number-one|title=Ed Sheeran & Beyonce's 'Perfect' Tops Billboard Hot [[List of UK Singles Chart Christmas number ones|UK Christmas number one]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Beaumont-Thomas|first=Ben|title=Ed Sheeran scores first Christmas No 1 with Perfect|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2017/dec/22/ed-sheeran-first-christmas-no-1-perfect-beyonce-andrea-bocelli|website=[[The Guardian]]|access-date=22 December 2017|date=22 December November, Taylor Swift revealed that Sheeran collaborated on the song \"[[End Game (Taylor Swift song)|End Game]]\" for her sixth studio album ''[[Reputation (Taylor Swift album)|Reputation]]''.<ref>{{cite news|title=Taylor Swift Reputation Track List|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/8030087/taylor-swift-reputation-tracklist-ed-sheeran-future-end-game|magazine=Billboard|date=7 November 2017|access-date=27 August 2022|archive-date=8 The song, which also features rapper [[Future (rapper)|Future]], was released on 10 November.<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Renner Brown|first=Eric|title=Taylor Swift unites with Ed Sheeran and Future on 'End Game'|url=https://ew.com/music/2017/11/10/taylor-swift-ed-sheeran-future-end-game/|magazine=Entertainment Weekly|access-date=14 November 2017|archive-date=13 November 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171113211437/http://ew.com/music/2017/11/10/taylor-swift-ed-sheeran-future-end-game/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nOn 4 December, Sheeran was named Spotify's most-streamed artist of 2017 with 6.3&nbsp;billion streams. He has Spotify's biggest album of the year with ''\u00f7'' streamed 3.1&nbsp;billion times, and the top song with \"Shape of You\" with 1.4&nbsp;billion streams.<ref>{{cite magazine |title=Ed Sheeran Tops Spotify's 2017 Most-Streamed List |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/8055138/ed-sheeran-tops-spotify-2017-most-streamed-list |magazine=Billboard |date=5 December 2017 |access-date=5 December 2017 |archive-date=26 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180426093533/https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/8055138/ed-sheeran-tops-spotify-2017-most-streamed-list |url-status=live }}</ref> On 5 December 2017, hip-hop artist [[Eminem]] announced that Sheeran had collaborated on the song \"[[River (Eminem song)|River]]\" for his ninth studio album ''[[Revival (Eminem album)|Revival]]''.<ref name=\"Eminem album\">{{cite news |title=Eminem's new album 'Revival' features Ed Sheeran on one song |url=http://entertainment.ie/music/news/Eminems-new-album-Revival-features-Ed-Sheeran-on-one-song-yes-really/399935.htm |work=Entertainment.ie. |date=6 December 2017 |access-date=27 August 2022 working with Eminem, Sheeran stated, \"He is one of the reasons I started writing songs, and was such a pleasure to work with him.\"<ref name=\"Eminem album\"/> In December 2017, Sheeran appeared on [[BBC Radio 1]]'s [[Live Lounge]], performing his song \"Perfect\" and a duet of [[The Pogues]]' festive classic \"[[Fairytale of New York]]\" with [[Anne-Marie (singer)|Anne-Marie]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran and Anne-Marie Cover 'Fairytale Of New York' |url=https://www.mtv.co.uk/news/1xgnt2/ed-sheeran-and-annemarie-cover-fairytale-of-new-york |work=MTV |access-date=20 December 2018 }}</ref> [[File:Ed Sheeran and Don McLean as they perform backstage.jpg|thumb|right|Sheeran backstage in Los Angeles with [[Don McLean]] in August 2018]]\n\nOn 3 January 2018, \"Shape of You\" was named the [[List of UK top-ten singles in 2017|best-selling single of 2017]] in the UK,<ref>{{cite news|title=The Top 40 biggest songs of 2017 on the Official Chart|url=http://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/the-top-40-biggest-songs-of-2017-on-the-official-chart__21327/|work=Official Charts Company|date=11 January 2018|access-date=27 August 2022|archive-date=3 January [[List of Billboard Hot 100 number ones of 2017|best-selling single of 2017 on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100]] in the US.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/year-end/2017/hot-100-songs|title=Hot 100 Songs \u2013 Year-End 2017|year=2017|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]]|access-date=3 January 2018|archive-date=16 December album of 2017 in the UK,<ref>{{cite news|title=Top 40 biggest albums of 2017 on the Official Chart|url=http://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/the-top-40-biggest-albums-of-2017-on-the-official-chart__21316/|work=Official Charts Company|issue=3 January 2018|date=10 January 2018|access-date=27 US.<ref>{{cite magazine |title=Ed Sheeran's 'Divide' Is Nielsen Music's Top Album of 2017 in U.S. |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8085932/ed-sheeran-divide-nielsen-music-top-album-2017 |magazine=Billboard |issue=3 January 2018 |date=10 January 2018 |access-date=27 August |url-status=live }}</ref> As the best-selling artist worldwide for 2017, the [[International Federation of the Phonographic Industry]] (IFPI) named him the [[Global Recording Artist of the Year]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran officially named the best-selling global recording artist of 2017 |url=http://www.ifpi.org/news/Ed-Sheeran-officially-named-the-best-selling-global-recording-artist-of-2017 |website=[[International Federation of the Phonographic Industry]] (IFPI) |date=26 February 2018 |access-date=12 March 2020 |archive-date=25 October 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191025113053/https://www.ifpi.org/news/Ed-Sheeran-officially-named-the-best-selling-global-recording-artist-of-2017 |url-status=live }}</ref> At the [[2018 Brit Awards]] held at [[The O2 Arena|the O<sub>2</sub> Arena]] in London on 21 February, Sheeran performed \"[[Supermarket Flowers]]\", and received the Global Success Award from Elton John and Rolling Stones guitarist [[Ronnie Wood]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.brits.co.uk/winners|title=Winners|website=BRIT Awards|access-date=23 February 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180222224456/http://www.brits.co.uk/winners|archive-date=22 February 2018|url-status=dead}}</ref> Sheeran played to over 950,000 people in Australia and New Zealand in March and April, making it the biggest concert tour in Australasian music history, overtaking the previous record set by [[Dire Straits]] in 1986.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran adds final Australian shows; breaking all records |url=http://www.news.com.au/entertainment/music/ed-sheeran-adds-final-australian-shows-breaking-all-records/news-story/ac81a728476a08c7d59e1c2a1fd79ef7 |work=News.com.au |issue=26 May 2017 |date=15 December 2017 |access-date=27 August 2022 |archive-date=12 December 2021 |url-status=live }}</ref> In April, the IFPI named ''\u00f7'' the [[List of best-selling albums#Best-selling album by year worldwide|best-selling album worldwide]] of 2017.<ref>{{citation|contribution=Global Top 10 Albums of 2017|page=9|title=IFPI Global Music Report 2018|publisher=International Federation of the Phonographic Industry|access-date=24 April 20 May, Sheeran performed \"[[Galway Girl (Ed Sheeran song)|Galway Girl]]\" from [[Phoenix Park]] in [[Dublin]], Ireland, and picked up six awards, including [[Billboard Music Award for Top Artist|Top Artist]] and [[Billboard Music Award for Top Hot 100 Artist|Top Hot 100 Artist]].<ref name=\"Billboard 2018\">{{cite magazine |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/bbma/8456842/billboard-music-awards-2018-winners-list-bbmas |title=Here Are All the Winners From the 2018 Billboard Music Awards |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |date=20 May 2018 |access-date=21 May 2018 |archive-date=24 May 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180524084717/https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/bbma/8456842/billboard-music-awards-2018-winners-list-bbmas |url-status=live }}</ref> In 2018 Sheeran wrote songs for boy bands. \"[[Trust Fund Baby]]\", by [[Why Don't We]], was released on 1 February 2018,<ref>{{cite magazine |title=Rising Pop Group Why Don't We Drops New Song 'Trust Fund Baby,' Written by Ed Sheeran |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/8097673/why-dont-we-new-song-trust-fund-baby-ed-sheeran |access-date=13 February 2020 |magazine=Billboard |date=26 February |url-status=live }}</ref> and \"Summer On You\", by [[PrettyMuch]], was released on 21 June 2018.<ref>{{cite magazine |title=PRETTYMUCH Drops Sunny Ed Sheeran-Penned Single 'Summer on You': Listen |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/8462126/prettymuch-summer-on-you |magazine=Billboard |date=26 February 2018 |access-date=13 February 2020 |archive-date=27 August 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190827042121/https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/8462126/prettymuch-summer-on-you |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\n===2019\u20132022: ''No.6 Collaborations Project'' and ''='' (\"''Equals''\")===\n[[File:Promotion message from Ed Sheeran in 2019.webm|thumb|Sheeran speaking at a promotional event in New Zealand in 2019]]\nOn 10 May 2019, Sheeran released the single \"[[I Don't Care (Ed Sheeran and Justin Bieber song)|I Don't Care]]\", a duet with [[Justin Bieber]], from his fourth studio album ''[[No.6 Collaborations Project]]''. On [[Spotify]], \"I Don't Care\" debuted with 10.977 million daily global streams, breaking the platform's [[List of most-streamed songs on Spotify#Most-streamed songs in a single day|single-day streaming record]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://hitsdailydouble.com/news%26id%3D316107%26title%3DSPOTIFY-U.S.-TOP-25%3A-ED-%26-BIEBER-HEAT-UP%26redirect%3Dmobile|title=HITS Daily Double : Rumor Mill \u2013 Spotify U.S. Top 25: Ed & Bieber Heat Up|website=HITS Daily Double|access-date=15 May 2019|archive-date=5 June web|url=https://headlineplanet.com/home/2019/05/11/ed-sheeran-justin-biebers-i-dont-care-breaks-single-day-spotify-streaming-record/|title=Ed Sheeran & Justin Bieber's \"I Don't Care\" Breaks Single-Day Spotify Streaming Record|website=Headline Planet|date=11 May 2019|access-date=15 May 2019|archive-date=13 May The song debuted at number one in the UK, Australia and other markets, and number two in the US.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ariacharts.com.au/charts/singles-chart|title=ARIA Australian Top 50 Singles|publisher=[[Australian Recording Industry Association]]|date=20 May 2019|access-date=18 May 2019|archive-date=21 March 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200321235817/https://www.ariacharts.com.au/charts/singles-chart|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8512166/lil-nas-x-old-town-road-number-one-seventh-week-hot-100|title=Lil Nas X's 'Old Town Road' Tops Billboard Hot 100 for Seventh On 31 May, \"[[Cross Me]]\" featuring [[Chance the Rapper]] and [[PnB Rock]], debuted at number 9 in the UK.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran and Justin Bieber's I Don't Care clings on to the UK's Official Singles Chart Number 1 for a third week |url=https://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/ed-sheeran-and-justin-biebers-i-dont-care-clings-on-to-the-uks-official-singles-chart-number-1-for-a-third-week__26458/ |access-date=31 May 2019 |url-status=live }}</ref> Released on 28 June 2019, \"[[Beautiful People (Ed Sheeran song)|Beautiful People]]\" featuring [[Khalid (singer)|Khalid]] debuted at number 3 in the UK and number 4 in Australia.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ariacharts.com.au/charts/singles-chart|title=ARIA Australian Top 50 Singles|publisher=[[Australian Recording Industry Association]]|date=8 July Sheeran released two new songs, \"[[Best Part of Me]]\" featuring [[Yebba]], and \"[[Blow (Ed Sheeran, Chris Stapleton and Bruno Mars song)|Blow]]\" with [[Bruno Mars]] and [[Chris Stapleton]]. On 12 July, he released the album, along with \"[[Antisocial (Ed Sheeran and Travis Scott song)|Antisocial]]\" with [[Travis Scott]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://pitchfork.com/news/ed-sheeran-and-travis-scott-share-video-for-new-song-antisocial-watch/|title=Ed Sheeran and Travis Scott Share Video for New Song \"Antisocial\": Watch|website=Pitchfork|date=12 July 2019|access-date=12 July 2019|archive-date=23 October 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201023003235/https://pitchfork.com/news/ed-sheeran-and-travis-scott-share-video-for-new-song-antisocial-watch/|url-status=live}}</ref> The album debuted at number one in the UK, the US, Australia and other markets.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8523132/ed-sheeran-no-6-is-no-1-star-studded-collaborations-project-debuts-no-1-billboard-albums-chart|title=Ed Sheeran's 'No. 6 260-show Divide Tour with the last of four homecoming gigs in [[Ipswich]], Suffolk;<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran's Ipswich show 'might be the last loop pedal gig' |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-suffolk-49454009 |date=27 August 2019 |work=[[BBC News]] |access-date=27 August 2019 |archive-date=27 August 2019 100,000 people at [[Malmi Airport]] in [[Helsinki]], Finland on 24 July.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://yle.fi/uutiset/osasto/news/police_fine_two_drone_operators_at_ed_sheeran_concert/10893023 seventh single from the album, \"[[Take Me Back to London]]\" featuring [[Stormzy]], reached number one in the UK.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran and Stormzy's Take Me Back To London lands second }}</ref>\n\nIn 2019, Sheeran co-wrote country music singer [[Kenny Chesney]]'s single \"[[Tip of My Tongue (Kenny Chesney song)|Tip of My Tongue]]\".<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.nashcountrydaily.com/2019/07/12/kenny-chesney-releases-savory-new-single-tip-of-my-tongue-listen/ | title=Kenny Chesney to Release New Single, \"Tip of My Tongue\" | work=Nash Country December 2019, Sheeran was named artist of the decade by the [[Official Charts Company]] for being the most successful performer in the UK album and singles charts of the 2010s.<ref name=\"Decade\"/> Eight of his songs featured in the Official Chart Company's chart of the decade with three songs inside the top 5\u2014\"[[Shape of You]]\" was named number one.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/the-uks-official-top-100-biggest-songs-of-the-decade-2010-2019__27936/ |title=The UK's Official Top 100 biggest songs of the decade 2010 \u2013 2019 |website=Official Charts Company |access-date=11 December 2019 |archive-date=11 December 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191211082710/https://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/the-uks-official-top-100-biggest-songs-of-the-decade-2010-2019__27936/ |url-status=live }}</ref> His four albums spent a combined 41 weeks at number one in the UK, the [[List of UK Albums Chart number ones of the 2010s#Artists with the most weeks at number one|most weeks at number one in the 2010s]], and five weeks more than Adele in second.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/radio1/chart/albums|title=The Official UK Top 40 Albums Chart|publisher=[[BBC Radio 1]]|access-date=6 August 2019|archive-date=8 May 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110508213226/http://www.bbc.co.uk/radio1/chart/albums|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.officialcharts.com/charts/albums-chart/|title=The Official UK Top 40 Albums Chart|publisher=[[Official Charts Company]]|access-date=6 August 2019|archive-date=29 November 2015|archive-url=https://archive.today/20151129140104/http://www.officialcharts.com/charts/albums-chart/|url-status=live}}</ref> He had the third and fourth [[List of best-selling albums of the 2010s in the United Kingdom|best-selling album of the 2010s]] in the UK, with only Adele's two albums selling more.<ref name=\"Decade\"/> Globally, [[Spotify]] named him the second [[List of most-streamed artists on Spotify#By decade|most streamed artist]] of the decade behind [[Drake (musician)|Drake]].<ref name=\"Decade\"/> On 21 December 2020, after being on hiatus after having his first child with Cherry Seaborn in August, he released the surprise single, \"[[Afterglow (Ed Sheeran song)|Afterglow]]\".<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nme.com/news/music/ed-sheeran-make-return-christmas-present-tomorrow-the-afterglow-2842855 |title=Ed Sheeran returns with new single 'Afterglow' |last=Daly |first=Rhian |website=[[NME }}</ref>\n\n[[File:Coldplay and Ed Sheeran (2021).jpg|thumb|left|Sheeran (right) on stage with [[Coldplay]] at the [[Shepherd's Bush Empire|O<sub>2</sub> Shepherd's Bush Empire]], west London in October 2021]]\nOn 25 June 2021, Sheeran released \"[[Bad Habits (Ed Sheeran song)|Bad Habits]]\", the lead single from his upcoming fifth studio album.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/9585940/ed-sheeran-bad-habits-single|title=Ed Sheeran Announces 'Bad Habits' Single: 'Feels Great to Be Back!'|last=Kaufman|first=Gil|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=11 June 2021|access-date=11 June 2021|archive-date=6 July 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210706205710/https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/9585940/ed-sheeran-bad-habits-single/|url-status=live}}</ref> His 10th UK number one single, the song spent eleven consecutive weeks at the top of the [[UK Singles Chart]] and [[Irish Singles Chart]], topped the charts in Australia, Canada and Germany among others, and peaked at number two on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] in the US.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran scores 10th UK Number 1 single with Bad Habits: \"This is an amazing thing\" |url=https://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/ed-sheeran-scores-10th-uk-number-1-single-with-bad-habits-this-is-an-amazing-thing__33511/ |access-date=27 September 2021 |work=Official Charts Company |date=2 July 2021 |archive-date=11 July 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210711212523/https://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/ed-sheeran-scores-10th-uk-number-1-single-with-bad-habits-this-is-an-amazing-thing__33511/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran's 'Bad Habits' Tops Global Charts |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/9606390/ed-sheeran-bad-habits-no-1-global-charts/ |access-date=27 September 2021 |magazine=Billboard |date=26 July 2021 |archive-date=25 September 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210925065501/https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/9606390/ed-sheeran-bad-habits-no-1-global-charts/ |url-status=live }}</ref> His eleventh week at number one in the UK saw him become the first British solo artist to notch up 52 weeks at Number 1 across his catalogue, with only Elvis Presley (80 weeks) and The Beatles (69 weeks) achieving more weeks at the summit.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran claims record-breaking 52 weeks \u2013 a full year \u2013 at Number 1 on Official Singles Chart |url=https://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/ed-sheeran-claims-record-breaking-52-weeks-a-full-year-at-number-1-on-official-singles-chart__34033/ |access-date=27 September 2021 |work=Official Charts Company |date=15 September 2021 |archive-date=27 September 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210927095334/https://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/ed-sheeran-claims-record-breaking-52-weeks-a-full-year-at-number-1-on-official-singles-chart__34033/ |url-status=live }}</ref> On 19 August, Sheeran announced that his fifth studio album, ''[[= (album)|=]]'' (\"Equals\"), would be released on 29 October 2021. The cover was painted by him during the first [[COVID-19 lockdowns|COVID-19 lockdown]], and is based on the changes his life had during the last four years, including marriage, having a child and losing friends. The promotional single \"[[Visiting Hours (song)|Visiting Hours]]\" was released alongside the announcement.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.complex.com/music/ed-sheeran-announces-equals-album-visiting-hours|title=Ed Sheeran Announces Album and Shares New Song \"Visiting Hours\"|last=Price|first=Joe|website=[[Complex (magazine)|Complex]]|date=19 August 2021|access-date=19 August 2021|archive-date=19 August 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210819141350/https://www.complex.com/music/ed-sheeran-announces-equals-album-visiting-hours|url-status=live}}</ref> On 9 September, he was part of the 2021 Kickoff Experience ahead of the American NFL season opening game.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/9611621/ed-sheeran-performance-nfl-2021-kickoff-experience-tampa/|title=Ed Sheeran to Perform at NFL 2021 Kickoff Experience in Tampa|first=Gil|last=Kaufman|magazine=Billboard|date=6 August 2021|access-date=6 August 2021|archive-date=6 August Released on 10 September, \"[[Shivers (Ed Sheeran song)|Shivers]]\" dethroned \"Bad Habits\" at the top of the UK and Irish singles charts.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran replaces himself at Number 1 on the Official Singles Chart with Shivers |url=https://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/ed-sheeran-replaces-himself-at-number-1-on-the-official-singles-chart-with-shivers__34060/ |access-date=27 |url-status=live }}</ref> Topping the charts in most major markets, ''='' became his fifth UK number-one album, and fourth US number one.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran scores fifth Number 1 on Official Albums Chart with Equals: \"Thank you for listening\" II|Platinum Jubilee]] in June 2022]] \nOn 29 November 2021, Sheeran and [[Elton John]] released \"[[Merry Christmas (song)|Merry Christmas]]\", a duet single for charity. Inspired by a scene from the 2003 romantic-comedy film ''[[Love Actually]]'', the song's music video sees the duo pay homage to scenes from past British Christmas hits, including \"[[Last Christmas]]\", \"[[Walking in the Air]]\", \"[[Merry Christmas Everyone]]\", and \"[[Stay Another Day]]\".<ref>{{cite news |title=Elton John, Ed Sheeran Pay Tribute to Holiday Hits in 'Merry Christmas' Video |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/elton-john-ed-sheeran-merry-christmas-1266233/ |access-date=3 December 2021 |magazine=Rolling Stone |archive-date=3 December 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211203205354/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/elton-john-ed-sheeran-merry-christmas-1266233/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name=\"Love Actually\"/> All of the UK profits from the song went to the Ed Sheeran Suffolk Music Foundation and the Elton John AIDS Foundation.<ref name=\"Love Actually\">{{cite magazine|last=Bowenbank|first=Starr|title=Ed Sheeran & Elton John Reveal 'Merry Christmas' Duet Release Date With 'Love Actually' Spoof|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/elton-john-ed-sheeran-merry-christmas-duet-release-date-charity-1235003496/|date=29 November 2021|access-date=29 November 2021|magazine=Billboard|archive-date=30 November 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211130210647/https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/elton-john-ed-sheeran-merry-christmas-duet-release-date-charity-1235003496/|url-status=live}}</ref> Debuting at number one in the UK Singles Chart on 10 December, it was Sheeran's 12th hit single.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran & Elton John's Merry Christmas debuts at Number 1 on the Official Singles Chart |url=https://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/ed-sheeran-elton-johns-merry-christmas-debuts-at-number-1-on-the-official-singles-chart__34653/ |access-date=11 December 2021 |work=Official Charts Company |archive-date=10 December 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211210193825/https://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/ed-sheeran-elton-johns-merry-christmas-debuts-at-number-1-on-the-official-singles-chart__34653/ |url-status=live }}</ref> On 23 December, Sheeran featured on the remix of [[Fireboy DML]]'s song \"[[Peru (song)|Peru]]\".<ref>{{cite magazine|title=Ed Sheeran Hops on Remix of Fireboy DML's Hit Single 'Peru'|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/ed-sheeran-fireboy-dml-peru-remix-1276009/|access-date=25 December 2021|magazine=Rolling Stone|archive-date=16 August 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220816094523/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/ed-sheeran-fireboy-dml-peru-remix-1276009/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nOn 11 February 2022, Sheeran released a duet version of \"[[The Joker and the Queen]]\" featuring [[Taylor Swift]].<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/ed-sheeran-confirms-the-joker-and-the-queen-remix-taylor-swift-1235029027/|title=Ed Sheeran Confirms 'The Joker and the Queen' Remix With 'Good Friend' March, he featured in \"[[Bam Bam (Camila Cabello song)|Bam Bam]]\", collaborating for the second time with [[Camila Cabello]]. Later that month he collaborated with Colombian singer [[J Balvin]] in the singles \"[[Sigue]]\" and \"[[Forever My Love]]\". Sheeran commenced his +\u2013=\u00f7x Tour (Mathematics Tour) on 21 March.<ref>{{cite web|date=17 September 2021|title=Ed Sheeran Announces The Mathematics Tour Of UK, Europe For 2022|url=https://www.thisisdig.com/ed-sheeran-mathematics-tour-2022/|access-date=14 August 2022|website=Dig!|archive-date=23 June 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220623201606/https://www.thisisdig.com/ed-sheeran-mathematics-tour-2022/|url-status=live}}</ref> He played warm-up shows at the [[Electric Ballroom]] in Camden Town, London before the main tour began with two concerts at [[Croke Park]] in Dublin.<ref>{{cite web|date=22 September 2021|title=Surprise! Ed Sheeran to open his 2022 tour in Dublin, not Cork|url=https://www.irishcentral.com/culture/entertainment/ed-sheeran-dublin|access-date=15 August 2022|website=IrishCentral.com|archive-date=18 August 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220818073012/https://www.irishcentral.com/culture/entertainment/ed-sheeran-dublin|url-status=live}}</ref> On 22 April, Sheeran released the fifth single from ''='', \"[[2step (song)|2step]]\" featuring [[Lil Baby]], before releasing a version of the song featuring Ukrainian pop-rock band [[Antytila]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nme.com/news/music/ed-sheeran-teams-up-with-ukrainian-band-antytila-for-reworked-2step-3216770?utm_source%3Drss%26utm_medium%3Drss%26utm_campaign%3Ded-sheeran-teams-up-with-ukrainian-band-antytila-for-reworked-2step|title=Ed 2022 also saw Sheeran venture into heavier styles of music, releasing a new version of \"Bad Habits\" with the [[pop metal]] group [[Bring Me the Horizon]] in February.<ref>{{cite magazine |last=Daw |first=Stephen |date=8 February 2022 |title=Ed Sheeran & Bring Me the Horizon Open Up the 2022 Brit Awards With Rollicking 'Bad Habits' |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/awards/ed-sheeran-bring-me-the-horizon-bad-habits-2022-brit-awards-1235028729/ |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |access-date=9 February 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220209163933/https://www.billboard.com/music/awards/ed-sheeran-bring-me-the-horizon-bad-habits-2022-brit-awards-1235028729/ |archive-date=9 February 2022 |url-status=live}}</ref> Later that year it was reported that he was in contact with Suffolk [[extreme metal]] group [[Cradle of Filth]] over a possible project, with frontman [[Dani Filth]] confirming progress on the collaboration in August.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.loudersound.com/news/a-cradle-of-filthed-sheeran-collaboration-is-actually-really-happening|title=A Cradle Of Filth/Ed Sheeran collaboration is actually, really happening|work=Metal Hammer|first=Liz|last=Scarlett|date=31 August 2022|access-date=17 September 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220920170528/https://www.loudersound.com/news/a-cradle-of-filthed-sheeran-collaboration-is-actually-really-happening|archive-date=20 September 2022|url-status=live}}</ref> In July, he launched a collaboration with clothing brand [[Lucy & Yak]] which was inspired by the artwork of =.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Lester |first=Daisy |date=14 July 2022 |title=Ed Sheeran launches sustainable clothing collection with Lucy & Yak |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/extras/indybest/fashion-beauty/womens-clothing/ed-sheeran-lucy-yak-clothing-collection-b2123009.html |access-date=12 October 2023 |website=[[The Independent]] |language=en |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220715065619/https://www.independent.co.uk/extras/indybest/fashion-beauty/womens-clothing/ed-sheeran-lucy-yak-clothing-collection-b2123009.html |archive-date=15 July 2022 |url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nOn 29 September, Sheeran released the single \"[[Celestial (Ed Sheeran song)|Celestial]]\", a collaboration with Japanese media franchise [[Pok\u00e9mon]]. On November, \"Shivers\" became Sheeran's 11th song to reach 1 billion streams on [[Spotify]]. He celebrated via an [[Instagram]] post, saying that he was currently filming a music video for his next album, scheduled to be released the following year.<ref>{{cite web |title=Ed Sheeran on Instagram: \"Shivers has hit a billion streams on Spotify ! My 11th as an artist and 15th as a writer, thank you so so much for streaming it. See you next year for a new album x\" |url=https://www.instagram.com/reel/CkdGjonI08u/ |access-date=4 November 2022 |website=Instagram |archive-date=4 November 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221104003200/https://www.instagram.com/reel/CkdGjonI08u/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Sheeran was spotted at a beach in the coastal Suffolk town of [[Lowestoft]].<ref>{{cite web |last=Boggis |first=Mark |date=3 November 2022 |title=Teen all smiles after capturing selfie with superstar Ed Sheeran |url=https://www.lowestoftjournal.co.uk/news/ed-sheeran-lowestoft-new-music-video-filming-9354312 |access-date=4 November 2022 |website=Lowestoft Journal |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221103060416/https://www.lowestoftjournal.co.uk/news/ed-sheeran-lowestoft-new-music-video-filming-9354312 |archive-date=3 November 2022 |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |date=3 November 2022 |title=Ed Sheeran: Singer films music video on Lowestoft beach |work=BBC News |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-beds-bucks-herts-63438430 |access-date=4 November 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221104194805/https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-beds-bucks-herts-63438430 |archive-date=4 November 2022 |url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n===2023\u2013present: ''-'' (\"''Subtract''\") and ''Autumn Variations'' ===\nOn 1 March 2023, Sheeran officially announced on all social media platforms that his sixth studio album, ''[[- (album)|-]]'' (\"Subtract\"), would be released on 5 May 2023.<ref>{{cite web |last=Sheeran |first=Ed |title= Ed Sheeran - I had been working on Subtract for a decade, trying... {{!}} Facebook |date=1 March 2023 |url= https://www.facebook.com/EdSheeranMusic/posts/743281280497779/ |access-date=1 March 2023 |website=Facebook |archive-date=1 March 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230301091947/https://www.facebook.com/EdSheeranMusic/posts/pfbid0btSmHkTqANcE37hTkvu5gRjE8TDZt4uuXNTDgguYavtqzkVuRusGh8FZKgpakJd2l |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Beaumont-Thomas|first=Ben|title=New Ed Sheeran album, Subtract, informed by 'fear, depression and anxiety' |url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2023/mar/01/new-ed-sheeran-album-subtract-informed-by-fear-depression-and-anxiety|work=The Guardian|date=1 March 2023|access-date=1 March 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230302065048/https://www.theguardian.com/music/2023/mar/01/new-ed-sheeran-album-subtract-informed-by-fear-depression-and-anxiety|archive-date=2 March 2023|url-status=live}}</ref> Sheeran released the album's lead single, \"[[Eyes Closed (Ed Sheeran song)|Eyes Closed]]\" with its accompanying music video on 24 March 2023.<ref>{{cite magazine |last=Mier |first=Tom\u00e1s |date=24 March 2023 |title=Ed Sheeran's Sadness Manifests as a Giant Blue Monster in Video for 'Eyes Closed' |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/ed-sheeran-eyes-closed-music-video-1234702677/ |access-date=27 March 2023 |magazine=Rolling Stone |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230327185221/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/ed-sheeran-eyes-closed-music-video-1234702677/ |archive-date=27 March 2023 |url-status=live}}</ref> \"[[Boat (song)|Boat]]\" was released as the second single off the record on 21 April 2023.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/ed-sheeran-boat-stream-it-now-1235311931/|title=Ed Sheeran Captures Life's Dark Moments With New Single 'Boat': Stream It Now|last=Aniftos|first=Rania|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=21 April 2023|access-date=26 April 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230422144110/https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/ed-sheeran-boat-stream-it-now-1235311931/|archive-date=22 April 2023|url-status=live}}</ref> The third single, \"[[Life Goes On (Ed Sheeran song)|Life Goes On]]\", was released on 5 May 2023.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.nme.com/news/music/ed-sheeran-transition-country-music-3442579|title=Ed Sheeran eyes \"transition into country\" music, shares new version of 'Life Goes On' with Luke Combs|last=Singh|first=Surej|magazine=[[NME]]|date=12 May 2023|access-date=12 May 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230523185451/https://www.nme.com/news/music/ed-sheeran-transition-country-music-3442579|archive-date=23 May 2023|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nIn August 2023, Sheeran announced his second album of the year, ''[[Autumn Variations]]'', released on 29 September 2023.<ref>{{cite web |last=Willman |first=Chris |date=24 August 2023 |title=Ed Sheeran Announces Second Album of 2023, 'Autumn Variations,' Reteaming With Aaron Dessner |url=https://variety.com/2023/music/news/ed-sheeran-autumn-variations-album-announce-aaron-dessner-1235703487/ |access-date=24 August 2023 |website=Variety |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230825140732/https://variety.com/2023/music/news/ed-sheeran-autumn-variations-album-announce-aaron-dessner-1235703487/ |archive-date=25 August 2023 |url-status=live}}</ref> It is his first studio album for which he owns the copyright, and also his first to be released through [[Gingerbread Man Records]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Autumn Variations [Explicit] by Ed Sheeran on Amazon Music |date=29 September 2023 |access-date=1 September 2023 |url=https://www.amazon.co.uk/Autumn-Variations-Explicit-Ed-Sheeran/dp/B0CG9NMDPF |via=[[Amazon Music]] |publisher=[[Gingerbread Man Records]] |archive-date=1 September 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230901072924/https://www.amazon.co.uk/Autumn-Variations-Explicit-Ed-Sheeran/dp/B0CG9NMDPF |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\n==Musical style and influences==\n[[File:Eric Clapton 1.jpg|thumb|right|Sheeran appeared on stage with one of his idols [[Eric Clapton]] ''(pictured)'' at the [[Nippon Budokan]] Arena in Tokyo, Japan on 13 April 2016 performing Clapton's \"I Will Be There\"]]\nSheeran's musical style has been described as [[Pop music|pop]],<ref name=allmusicbio/><ref name=\"thisisdig\">{{cite web|first=Luke|last=Edwards|url=https://www.thisisdig.com/feature/best-ed-sheeran-songs/|title=Best Ed Sheeran Songs: 20 Great Tracks From The Folk-Pop Sensation|website=thisisdig.com|date=1 August 2021|access-date=10 February 2022|archive-date=10 February 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220210073255/https://www.thisisdig.com/feature/best-ed-sheeran-songs/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|first=Brittany|last=Spanos|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/drakes-more-life-playlist-is-redefining-pop-borders-w472780|title=Drake's 'More Life' Playlist Is Redefining Borders of Blackness in Pop|magazine=Rolling Stone|date=20 March 2017|access-date=10 February 2022|archive-date=14 June 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180614195212/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/drakes-more-life-playlist-is-redefining-pop-borders-w472780|url-status=live}}</ref> [[folk-pop]],<ref name=\"thisisdig\"/><ref>{{cite magazine|first=Maura|last=Johnston|author-link=Maura Johnston |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/albumreviews/review-ed-sheerans-divide-w470271|title=Review: Ed Sheeran's 'Divide'|magazine=Rolling Stone|date=6 March 2017|access-date=10 February 2022|quote=Our take on the folk-pop troubadour's third album|archive-date=7 January 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180107021647/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/albumreviews/review-ed-sheerans-divide-w470271|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://startribune.com/gallery-british-folk-pop-star-ed-sheeran-plays-the-xcel/327796431/|title=British folk pop star Ed Sheeran plays the Xcel|work=Star Tribune|date=15 September 2015|access-date=10 February 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190530185941/http://www.startribune.com/gallery-british-folk-pop-star-ed-sheeran-plays-the-xcel/327796431/|archive-date=30 May 2019|url-status=dead}}</ref> and [[soft rock]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.news24.com/channel/Music/News/watch-ed-sheeran-is-making-a-comeback-with-some-new-tunes-20170102|title=Watch: Ed Sheeran is making a comeback with some new tunes|website=[[News24 (website)|News24]]|date=2 January 2017|access-date=10 February 2022|archive-date=3 October 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211003032613/https://www.news24.com/channel/music/news/watch-ed-sheeran-is-making-a-comeback-with-some-new-tunes-20170102|url-status=live}}</ref> Sheeran also incorporates [[Rapping|rap]] into his music.<ref name=\"thisisdig\"/> Sheeran's earliest memories include listening to the records of [[Joni Mitchell]], [[Bob Dylan]] and [[Elton John]]'s ''[[Greatest Hits (Elton John album)|Greatest Hits]]''.<ref name=\"Telegraph 2017\"/> According to Sheeran, the album that introduced him to music was [[Van Morrison]]'s ''[[Irish Heartbeat]]''.{{sfn|Nolan|2012|pp=1\u20136}} During his childhood his father took him to live concerts that would inspire his musical creations. These included seeing [[Eric Clapton]] at the [[Royal Albert Hall]], [[Paul McCartney]] in [[Birmingham]], and Bob Dylan.<ref>{{cite book |title=''Ed Sheeran: A Visual Journey'' |date=2014 |publisher=Running Press |isbn=9780762456963 |location=[S.l.] |page=27}}</ref> On the influence of Clapton, Sheeran states, \"He's the reason I started playing guitar\".<ref name=\"Clapton\">{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran Opens Up About His A-List Pals, from His Clapton Collab to Taking Shots with Beyonc\u00e9 |url=http://people.com/music/ed-sheeran-famous-friends-eric-clapton-collaboration-beyonce-taylor-swift/ |website=People.com |date=6 December 2017 |access-date=27 August 2022 |archive-date=23 June 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180623193935/https://people.com/music/ed-sheeran-famous-friends-eric-clapton-collaboration-beyonce-taylor-swift/ |url-status=live }}</ref> He singled out Clapton's performance at the [[Party at the Palace]] in the [[Buckingham Palace Garden|grounds of Buckingham Palace]], \"I was eleven when I saw Eric Clapton play at the [[Golden Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth II|Queen's Golden Jubilee]] concert in June 2002. I remember him walking on stage with this rainbow-coloured [[Stratocaster]] and playing the first riff of '[[Layla]]'. I was hooked. Two days later I bought a black Stratocaster copy for \u00a330 that came with an [[Amplifier|amp]]. All I did for the next month was try to play that 'Layla' riff.\"<ref>{{cite book |last=Butah |first=Philip |title=''Ed Sheeran: A Visual Journey'' |date=2014 |publisher=Hachette UK}}</ref>\n\n{{blockquote|In a complicated world, Sheeran's musical ''[[modus operandi]]'' is straightforward; to create well-crafted, expertly vague songs that unite people. His songs are vessels broad enough to soundtrack both a first dance and a funeral procession, a gut-punch break-up and a trawl around a harshly lit shopping centre. They're for life's big moments, with all the cinematic edge of a [[Richard Curtis]] film. He's also malleable \u2013 when he's done with [[Hip hop music|hip-hop]], for example, he doesn't need an image overhaul to then revert to balladry. If one genre isn't to your tastes, then fear not, another will be along soon.|Michael Cragg in ''[[The Guardian]]'' on Sheeran's style of music and mass appeal.<ref>{{cite news |title=Music for general societal exhaustion: why Ed Sheeran can't lose |url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2022/jun/22/music-ed-sheeran-musician-2021 |access-date=23 October 2022 |work=The Guardian |first=Michael |last=Cragg |date=22 June 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221023180252/https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2022/jun/22/music-ed-sheeran-musician-2021 |archive-date=23 October 2022 |url-status=live}}</ref>}}\n\nSheeran has also cited [[the Beatles]], [[Nizlopi]] and [[Eminem]] as his biggest musical influences.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mtv.co.uk/music/urban/253058-ed-sheeran-the-interview |title=Ed Sheeran \u2013 The Interview |website=[[MTV]] |access-date=29 November 2014 |archive-date=17 July 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180717183636/http://www.mtv.co.uk/music/urban/253058-ed-sheeran-the-interview |url-status=dead }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.axs.com/news/interview-with-uk-pop-sensation-ed-sheeran-14282 |title=Interview with UK Pop Sensation Ed Sheeran |website=axs.com |date=20 January 2012 |access-date=29 November 2014 |archive-date=17 July 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180717212809/https://www.axs.com/news/interview-with-uk-pop-sensation-ed-sheeran-14282 |url-status=live }}</ref> He is also a fan of heavier music and cites bands such as [[Cradle of Filth]], [[Slipknot (band)|Slipknot]], [[Korn]], [[Marilyn Manson (band)|Marilyn Manson]] and [[Bring Me the Horizon]] as other influences.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nme.com/news/music/ed-sheeran-says-he-would-not-be-opposed-to-creating-a-death-metal-album-2992978 |title=Dani Filth responds to Ed Sheeran saying he \"would not be opposed to creating\" a death metal album |website=[[NME]] |last=Robinson |first=Ellie |date=14 July 2021 |access-date=28 May 2022 |archive-date=28 May 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220528021003/https://www.nme.com/news/music/ed-sheeran-says-he-would-not-be-opposed-to-creating-a-death-metal-album-2992978 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.kerrang.com/ed-sheeran-korn-photo|title=Here's A Photo Of Ed Sheeran Hanging Out With Korn's Head|website=[[Kerrang!]]|date=24 October 2018|access-date=28 May 2022|archive-date=28 May 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220528021003/https://www.kerrang.com/ed-sheeran-korn-photo|url-status=live}}</ref> As a teenager, he also had a ''[[Kerrang!]]'' subscription.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.kerrang.com/bring-me-the-horizon-and-ed-sheeran-are-going-to-write-a-song-together|title=Bring Me The Horizon and Ed Sheeran are going to write a song together|website=[[Kerrang!]]|last=Carter|first=Emily|date=10 February 2022|access-date=28 May 2022|archive-date=28 May 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220528021004/https://www.kerrang.com/bring-me-the-horizon-and-ed-sheeran-are-going-to-write-a-song-together|url-status=live}}</ref> According to Sheeran, he had a stutter in his speech when he was younger, and he credited rapping along to Eminem's ''[[The Marshall Mathers LP]]'' for helping him stammer less.<ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/features/ed-sheeran-on-hard-drinking-nights-taylor-swift-true-love-w470599 |title=Ed Sheeran: Up All Night With Pop's Hardcore Troubadour |first=Patrick |last=Doyle |date=7 March 2017 |magazine=Rolling Stone |access-date=27 August 2022 |archive-date=5 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180405183447/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/features/ed-sheeran-on-hard-drinking-nights-taylor-swift-true-love-w470599 |url-status=live }}</ref> He was also inspired by \"[[Cannonball (Damien Rice song)|Cannonball]]\" singer-songwriter [[Damien Rice]] in 2002, with Sheeran stating, \"seeing him play this small club in Ireland, I was able to meet him, and he was unbelievably cool. I went straight home and started writing songs. I would not be doing what I'm doing now if he'd been a jerk.\"<ref>{{cite news|title=Ed Sheeran: The Music That Made Me|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/features/ed-sheeran-the-music-that-made-me-20150508|magazine=Rolling Stone|date=19 December 2017|access-date=27 August 2022|archive-date=22 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171222053135/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/features/ed-sheeran-the-music-that-made-me-20150508|url-status=live}}</ref> He also played the guitar to [[Westlife]]'s ''[[Unbreakable \u2013 The Greatest Hits Volume 1|Greatest Hits]]'' album when he was ten, citing them as one of his influences.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.metro.news/a-list-fan-ed-sheerans-role-in-the-reforming-of-westlife/1282542/|title=A-list fan Ed Sheeran's role in the reforming of Westlife|publisher=metro.news|date=24 October 2018|access-date=25 October 2018|archive-date=25 October 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181025071341/https://www.metro.news/a-list-fan-ed-sheerans-role-in-the-reforming-of-westlife/1282542/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://evoke.ie/2018/10/23/showbiz/gossip/ed-sheeran-wrote-westlife-songs|title=Ed Sheeran wrote Westlife songs two years BEFORE the band decided to reunite|publisher=evoke.ie|date=23 October 2018|access-date=24 October 2018|archive-date=24 October 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181024113348/https://evoke.ie/2018/10/23/showbiz/gossip/ed-sheeran-wrote-westlife-songs|url-status=live}}</ref> Sheeran collaborated with his idol Eric Clapton in April 2016, with Sheeran stating to ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'' magazine, \"I sang on Eric Clapton's album ''[[I Still Do]]''. It's one thing having him on mine, but being on his, that's an honour that you can't ever pinpoint on how great that is. I did something for his record, and I was credited as 'Angelo Mysterioso', appearing as a guest on Clapton's 'I Will Be There', in addition to performing the song with Clapton on stage, and he did something for my record performing a guitar solo on '[[Dive (Ed Sheeran song)|Dive]]' on Sheeran's album ''\u00f7'' and was credited as 'Angelo Mysterioso'.\"<ref name=\"Clapton\"/> Sheeran also cited [[Taylor Swift]] as one of his influences, suggesting in 2015 their respective success drives each other on.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.seventeen.com/celebrity/music/news/a31012/ed-sheeran-says-hes-inspired-by-taylor-swift-and-beyonce/|title=Ed Sheeran Says Taylor Swift's Mega Success Inspires Him|date=21 May 2015|access-date=13 May 2020|archive-date=21 May 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200521233537/https://www.seventeen.com/celebrity/music/news/a31012/ed-sheeran-says-hes-inspired-by-taylor-swift-and-beyonce/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n==Other ventures==\n===Gingerbread Man Records===\nIn March 2015, Sheeran announced he was setting up a record label, Gingerbread Man Records, which is a deal with [[Warner Music Group]].<ref>{{cite news|author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.-->|date=23 March 2015|title=Ed Sheeran announces new record label 'Gingerbread'|url=https://www.nme.com/news/ed-sheeran/83813|work=NME|access-date=15 November 2015|archive-date=17 November 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151117022115/http://www.nme.com/news/ed-sheeran/83813|url-status=live}}</ref> The label was launched in August 2015 alongside its accompanying YouTube channel.<ref>{{cite news|last=Strecker|first=Erin|date=25 August 2015|title=Ed Sheeran Talks About His Label Gingerbread Man Records in New Video|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/6677590/ed-sheeran-gingerbread-man-records-label-video|magazine=Billboard|access-date=15 November 2015|archive-date=31 October 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151031142735/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/6677590/ed-sheeran-gingerbread-man-records-label-video|url-status=live}}</ref> [[Jamie Lawson (musician)|Jamie Lawson]], the label's first signee, met Sheeran while they were both in London's folk circuit.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/entertainment/sydney-confidential/jamie-lawson-a-mystery-despite-big-hit-and-spot-on-ed-sheerans-label-oh-and-hes-not-irish/story-fni0cvc9-1227303922365|title=Jamie Lawson a mystery despite big hit and spot on Ed Sheeran's label \u2013 oh, and he's not Irish|last=Moran|first=Jonathon|date=14 April 2015|work=The Telegraph|location=Australia|access-date=15 November 2015|archive-url=https://archive.today/20150418012738/http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/entertainment/sydney-confidential/jamie-lawson-a-mystery-despite-big-hit-and-spot-on-ed-sheerans-label-oh-and-hes-not-irish/story-fni0cvc9-1227303922365|archive-date=18 April 2015|url-status=dead}}</ref> Lawson released his [[Jamie Lawson (album)|self-titled debut album]] on 9 October 2015, which has earned him a number one in the UK Albums Chart.<ref>{{cite news|last=Myers|first=Justin|date=23 October 2015|title=Jamie Lawson tops Official Albums Chart: \"I'm really over the moon\"|url=http://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/jamie-lawson-tops-official-albums-chart-i-m-really-over-the-moon-__11118/|publisher=Official Charts Company|access-date=15 November 2015|archive-date=26 October 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151026001143/http://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/jamie-lawson-tops-official-albums-chart-i-m-really-over-the-moon-__11118/|url-status=live}}</ref> Sheeran signed his second artist, [[Foy Vance]], in November 2015.<ref>{{cite news|last=Katz|first=Jessie|date=30 November 2015|title=Ed Sheeran Signs Foy Vance As Second Artist to His Gingerbread Man Label|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/6777952/ed-sheeran-foy-vance-second-artist-gingerbread-man-label|magazine=Billboard|access-date=5 December 2015|archive-date=2 December 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151202214317/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/6777952/ed-sheeran-foy-vance-second-artist-gingerbread-man-label|url-status=live}}</ref> [[Maisie Peters]] also signed with the label in 2021.<ref>{{cite news|last=Savage|first=Mark|date=15 June 2021|title=Maisie Peters: Meet the singer who's been snapped up by Ed Sheeran|work=BBC News|access-date=15 June 2021|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-57468169|archive-date=15 June 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210615092127/https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-57468169|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n===Bertie Blossoms===\nOn 29 September 2019, Sheeran announced he was teaming up with his manager Stuart Camp to open a bar located on Portobello Road in [[Notting Hill]]. The bar is called \"Bertie Blossoms\", and named after his wife Cherry Seaborn.<ref>{{cite news|last=Lothian-McLean|first=Moya|date=1 October 2019|title=Ed Sheeran opens pub in London|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/ed-sheeran-pub-london-notting-hill-launch-bertie-blossoms-bar-a9128156.html|work=Independent|access-date=13 November 2020|archive-date=20 November 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201120031756/https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/ed-sheeran-pub-london-notting-hill-launch-bertie-blossoms-bar-a9128156.html|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n===Charity work===\nSheeran performed a gig in Bristol, which raised \u00a340,000 for a charity that reaches out to [[prostitution|street sex workers]]. \"It's good to show insight that these people are real people with real emotions and they deserve the same charity work as anyone else,\" Sheeran said. \"There's a lot more popular charities that get a lot of attention. And with certain subjects like this they're often washed over and people don't necessarily give them the attention they deserve.\" Tickets were available to those taking part in the charity's Give it up for One25 campaign by giving something up for 125 hours and hitting the \u00a340,000 fundraising mark.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-bristol-18163708|title=Ed Sheeran gig in Bristol raises \u00a340,000 for One25|date=22 May 2012|work=BBC News|access-date=6 December 2012|archive-date=30 April 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130430085345/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-bristol-18163708|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n[[File:Ed Sheeran, V Festival 2014, Chelmsford (14788797777).jpg|thumb|left|Sheeran often wears hoodies or [[tartan]] shirts, and frequently donates his clothes to charity shops in Suffolk.]]\nSheeran frequently gives away his clothes to charity shops around Suffolk, his home county.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ed Sheeran donates clothes to Suffolk charity shops|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-suffolk-26718523|publisher=BBC|date=25 August 2015|access-date=27 August 2022|archive-date=8 April 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220408154233/https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-suffolk-26718523|url-status=live}}</ref> An ambassador for [[East Anglia]]'s Children's Hospice, he has donated clothes to the St Elizabeth Hospice charity shop in his home town Framlingham, including eight bags of clothes to the shop in February 2014.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran's clothes given to three Suffolk charity shops |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-suffolk-26748425 |work=[[BBC News]] |date=26 March 2014 |access-date=3 January 2019 |archive-date=4 January 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190104034917/https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-suffolk-26748425 |url-status=live }}</ref> In 2016, he donated 13 bags of clothes to the shop.<ref name=\"Clothes\">{{cite news|title=Ed Sheeran donates shirt worn in Bridget Jones film to charity|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-suffolk-37422315|work=[[BBC News]]|date=9 January 2018|access-date=27 August 2022|archive-date=16 August 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220816203654/https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-suffolk-37422315|url-status=live}}</ref> The tartan shirt worn by Sheeran when he met Renee Zellweger's character, Bridget, in ''[[Bridget Jones's Baby]]'', was auctioned online to raise further funds for the hospice.<ref name=\"Clothes\"/>\n\nOn 15 November 2014, Sheeran joined the charity supergroup [[Band Aid 30]] along with other British and Irish pop acts, recording the latest version of the track \"[[Do They Know It's Christmas?]]\" at [[Sarm West Studios]] in [[Notting Hill]], London, to raise money for the [[West African Ebola virus epidemic]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Band Aid 30: One Direction among celebrity line-up|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph|date=11 November 2014 |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/music/music-news/11220735/Band-Aid-30-line-up-revealed.html |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/archive/20220110/https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/music/music-news/11220735/Band-Aid-30-line-up-revealed.html |archive-date=10 January 2022 |url-access=subscription |url-status=live |access-date=6 December 2014}}{{cbignore}}</ref>\n\nIn November 2015, Sheeran supported the No Cold Homes campaign by the UK charity, [[Turn2us]].<ref>{{cite magazine |url=http://www.heatworld.com/2015/10/ed-sheeran-is-selling-his-actual-clothes-for-charity |title=Ed Sheeran is selling his ACTUAL clothes for charity |first=Sophie |last=Bronstein |date=22 October 2015 |magazine=[[Heat (magazine)|Heatworld.com]] |access-date=1 December 2015 |archive-date=8 December 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151208173159/http://www.heatworld.com/2015/10/ed-sheeran-is-selling-his-actual-clothes-for-charity |url-status=live }}</ref> Sheeran was one of nearly thirty celebrities, which included [[Helen Mirren]], [[Jeremy Irons]] and [[Hugh Laurie]], to donate items of winter clothing to the campaign, with the proceeds used to help people in the country struggling to keep their home warm in winter.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.turn2us.org.uk/About-Us/Our-campaigns/No-Cold-Homes/Auction/Ed-Sheeran |title=About us: Our campaign. Ed Sheeran |website=Turn2us.org |access-date=1 December 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151208094235/https://www.turn2us.org.uk/About-Us/Our-campaigns/No-Cold-Homes/Auction/Ed-Sheeran |archive-date= 8 December 2015}}</ref>\n\nSheeran teamed up with the cast of the BBC3 mockumentary sitcom ''[[People Just Do Nothing]]'' to perform a charity single for the BBC's biennial telethon [[Comic Relief]] which aired in March 2017.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran and People Just Do Nothing team up for \"epic\" Comic Relief charity single |url=https://www.radiotimes.com/news/2017-03-12/ed-sheeran-and-people-just-do-nothing-team-up-for-epic-comic-relief-charity-single/ |access-date=31 July 2019 |work=[[Radio Times]] |archive-date=31 July 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190731233120/https://www.radiotimes.com/news/2017-03-12/ed-sheeran-and-people-just-do-nothing-team-up-for-epic-comic-relief-charity-single/ |url-status=live }}</ref> He appeared in a November 2017 episode of ''[[Gogglebox]]'' along with other UK celebrities such as [[Ozzy Osbourne]], former [[Oasis (band)|Oasis]] frontman [[Liam Gallagher]], and Labour Party leader [[Jeremy Corbyn]] as part of Channel 4 and [[Cancer Research UK]]'s [[Stand Up to Cancer UK|''Stand Up to Cancer'']] fundraising campaign.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nme.com/news/tv/gogglebox-jeremy-corbyn-liam-gallagher-ed-sheeran-more-2155280#wO61TUIdQSuPbSKz.99 |title=Watch first preview of Liam Gallagher, Jeremy Corbyn, Ed Sheeran on 'Gogglebox' |work=[[NME]] |date=November 2017 |access-date=10 December 2017 |archive-date=11 December 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171211053659/http://www.nme.com/news/tv/gogglebox-jeremy-corbyn-liam-gallagher-ed-sheeran-more-2155280#wO61TUIdQSuPbSKz.99 |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\nIn December 2019, he launched his own music foundation, Ed Sheeran Suffolk Music Foundation (ESSMF).
