In the statement, Sheeran stated it will help artists aged under 18 with \"small but hopefully useful grants\".<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran launches foundation to help young Suffolk musicians |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-suffolk-50897377 |access-date=13 November 2020 |work=[[BBC News]] |archive-date=13 November 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201113173021/https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-suffolk-50897377 |url-status=live }}</ref> In May 2020, Sheeran donated \u00a3170,000 to his former school [[Thomas Mills High School]] in Framlingham, Suffolk. The donations, which have been made over a two-year period via the Ed Sheeran Suffolk Music Foundation, helped the school to purchase items such as MacBooks, cameras and a photography darkroom.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran donates \u00a3170,000 to provide equipment for his former school |url=https://www.nme.com/news/music/ed-sheeran-donates-170000-to-provide-equipment-for-former-school-2671657 |access-date=13 November 2020 |work=[[NME]] |archive-date=13 November 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201113173022/https://www.nme.com/news/music/ed-sheeran-donates-170000-to-provide-equipment-for-former-school-2671657 |url-status=live }}</ref> The same month, Sheeran made a donation to [[Ipswich Hospital]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Ed Sheeran makes 'significant' donation to Ipswich Hospital|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-suffolk-52298499|access-date=13 November 2020|work=BBC|archive-date=1 November 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201101155051/https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-suffolk-52298499|url-status=live}}</ref> In June 2020, Sheeran made a \"founding gift\" to launch Suffolk Community Foundation's \"Rebuilding Local Lives Appeal\" in response to the [[COVID-19 pandemic]] on the celebration day of the county, \"Suffolk Day\". Sheeran has donated over \u00a31 million to local charities in [[Suffolk]] amid the COVID-19 pandemic, including to a children's hospital ward.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran 'Donates Over \u00a31Million To Local Charities In Suffolk' Amid Coronavirus Pandemic |url=https://www.capitalfm.com/artists/ed-sheeran/ed-sheeran-donates-million-pound-charity/ |access-date=13 November 2020 |work=[[Capital (radio network)|Capitalfm]] |place=London |archive-date=20 November 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201120072438/https://www.capitalfm.com/artists/ed-sheeran/ed-sheeran-donates-million-pound-charity/ |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\nSheeran's parents organised ''The Ed Sheeran Made in Suffolk Legacy Auction'' on 23 October 2020 which ran until 8 November. The auction had 220 lots, including items donated by other celebrities such as [[David Beckham]], [[Kylie Minogue]] and [[Usain Bolt]]. Sheeran has donated some of his personal items including handwritten lyrics from his song \"Perfect\", lego bricks he played with as a kid, handmade ''You Need Me'' EP from 2009 and a \u00a33 ticket to his first gig at the British Legion in Framlingham. The auction was made to raise money for Suffolk charities such as GeeWizz and Zest who both support children and young adults in the county, including redeveloping a playground for kids with special educational needs and disabilities in Ipswich. In November Sheeran sold one of his paintings, marking the first and only time his art has been made available for sale, which he titled \"Dab 2 2020\", to the same auction.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ed Sheeran to sell abstract artwork for charity auction|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/art/news/ed-sheeran-art-painting-auction-b1528823.html|access-date=13 November 2020|work=Independent|archive-date=2 November 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201102124920/https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/art/news/ed-sheeran-art-painting-auction-b1528823.html|url-status=live}}</ref> Later that month, Sheeran backed footballer [[Marcus Rashford]]'s free school meals campaign and opened his own breakfast club at his [[Notting Hill]] restaurant, Bertie Blossoms. He announced on his Instagram that he provided hot breakfasts for \"anyone who is normally entitled to a free school meal or who is struggling in these strange times\".<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.capitalfm.com/news/ed-sheeran-free-breakfast-school-meals-marcus-rashford/ |title=Ed Sheeran Throws Support Behind Marcus Rashford's Free School Meals Campaign & Opens Breakfast Club |work=[[Capital (radio network)|Capital FM]] |access-date=13 November 2020 |archive-date=3 November 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201103200226/https://www.capitalfm.com/news/ed-sheeran-free-breakfast-school-meals-marcus-rashford/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Sheeran's charity, the Framlingham Foundation Trust, is reported to have donated money to give a primary school teacher to take an imperative course to help children create songs with untraditional instruments which will benefit children with learning difficulties.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran's heartwarming gesture to school teacher and kids with learning disabilities |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/ed-sheerans-heartwarming-gesture-school-22940473 |first=Susan |last=Knox |orig-date=1 November 2020 |date=2 November 2020 |newspaper=[[Daily Mirror]] |access-date=13 November 2020 |archive-date=15 November 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201115003413/https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/ed-sheerans-heartwarming-gesture-school-22940473 |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\n===Acting===\nSheeran made his acting debut in 2014, a cameo role as himself on New Zealand soap opera ''[[Shortland Street]]'', filmed while he was in the country for a one-off performance.<ref name=shortland/> In May 2015, he appeared as himself and performed on a live episode of the [[NBC]] sitcom ''[[Undateable]]''.<ref name=undateable/> Later that year, while in Australia, he recorded scenes for the soap ''[[Home and Away]]'', as a character based on himself.<ref name=\"HomeAway\">{{cite news |title=Meet 'Teddy': Ed Sheeran appears in Home and Away |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/music/what-to-listen-to/ed-sheeran-appears-in-home-and-away/ |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/archive/20220110/https://www.telegraph.co.uk/music/what-to-listen-to/ed-sheeran-appears-in-home-and-away/ |archive-date=10 January 2022 |url-access=subscription |url-status=live |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |date=28 October 2015 |access-date=9 January 2018}}{{cbignore}}</ref>\n\nAfter recording a cover version of [[Foy Vance]]'s \"[[Make It Rain (Foy Vance song)|Make It Rain]]\" for ''[[Sons of Anarchy]]'', Sheeran was cast by creator [[Kurt Sutter]] to play Sir Cormac in the medieval drama ''[[The Bastard Executioner]]'' on [[FX (TV channel)|FX]].<ref name=\"Execute\">{{cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/ed-sheeran-joins-bastard-executioner-811150|title=Ed Sheeran to Recur on Kurt Sutter's 'The Bastard Executioner' (Exclusive)|work=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=9 October 2017|archive-date=17 November 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171117132119/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/ed-sheeran-joins-bastard-executioner-811150|url-status=live}}</ref> Sheeran also appeared as himself in the 2016 film ''[[Bridget Jones's Baby]]'' in a scene where [[Bridget Jones]], played by [[Ren\u00e9e Zellweger]], encounters the singer at the [[Glastonbury Festival]].<ref>{{cite web |last=Young |first=Sage |title=The Ed Sheeran Cameo in Bridget Jones's Diary Proves He Doesn't Take Himself Too Seriously |url=https://www.bustle.com/articles/183894-the-ed-sheeran-cameo-in-bridget-joness-diary-proves-he-doesnt-take-himself-too-seriously |website=Bustle |date=14 September 2016 |access-date=23 September 2017 |archive-date=24 September 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170924093913/https://www.bustle.com/articles/183894-the-ed-sheeran-cameo-in-bridget-joness-diary-proves-he-doesnt-take-himself-too-seriously |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\nIn July 2017, Sheeran appeared in a scene on ''[[Game of Thrones season 7|Game of Thrones]]'' opposite [[Maisie Williams]], who plays [[Arya Stark]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://people.com/tv/game-of-thrones-musician-cameo-shocks-fans/ |title=Ed Sheeran Makes a Surprise Cameo in Game of Thrones Premiere \u2013 and Fans Are Going Nuts |date=17 July 2017 |work=People.com |access-date=10 August 2017 |archive-date=10 August 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170810170909/http://people.com/tv/game-of-thrones-musician-cameo-shocks-fans/ |url-status=live }}</ref> [[David Benioff]] explained that since Williams was a big fan of the singer, they wanted to have Sheeran appear on the show to surprise Williams, and that they had tried to get him on for years.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/tv/news/game-of-thrones-season-7-episode-1-ed-sheeran-cameo-s07e01-dragonstone-a7844406.html |title=Game of Thrones fans angry as Ed Sheeran makes painfully unsubtle cameo |date=17 July 2017 |newspaper=[[The Independent]] |location=London |access-date=17 July 2017 |archive-date=17 July 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170717234545/http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/tv/news/game-of-thrones-season-7-episode-1-ed-sheeran-cameo-s07e01-dragonstone-a7844406.html |url-status=live }}</ref> It received a mix of positive and very negative reviews.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/7866309/ed-sheeran-deletes-twitter-account-game-of-thrones |title=Ed Sheeran Deletes Twitter Account |last=Stutz |first=Colin |date=17 July 2017 |magazine=Billboard |access-date=17 July 2017 |archive-date=18 July 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170718035316/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/7866309/ed-sheeran-deletes-twitter-account-game-of-thrones |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/insertcoin/2017/07/17/yes-ed-sheerans-game-of-thrones-cameo-was-a-mistake/ |title=Yes, Ed Sheeran's 'Game of Thrones' Cameo Was A Mistake |last=Tassi |first=Paul |work=Forbes |access-date=14 August 2017 |archive-date=14 August 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170814230224/https://www.forbes.com/sites/insertcoin/2017/07/17/yes-ed-sheerans-game-of-thrones-cameo-was-a-mistake/ |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\nIn June 2019, Sheeran made his debut appearance in an advertisement for [[Heinz Tomato Ketchup]].<ref name=\"Heinz\">{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran makes his debut in Heinz Ketchup advert and it's not as cringe as you'd expect |url=https://metro.co.uk/2019/06/17/ed-sheeran-makes-debut-heinz-ketchup-not-cringe-expect-9991604/ |access-date=7 July 2019 |work=Metro |archive-date=7 July 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190707160233/https://metro.co.uk/2019/06/17/ed-sheeran-makes-debut-heinz-ketchup-not-cringe-expect-9991604/ |url-status=live }}</ref> A lifelong fan of the product\u2014he has it with everything from [[fish and chips]] to his morning [[Sausage sandwich#United Kingdom|sausage \"butty\"]] to upmarket dinners, carries a bottle on tour, and has a Heinz Ketchup tattoo on his arm\u2014he put forward an idea he had written for their next TV campaign, and the company responded.<ref name=\"Heinz\"/><ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran: Reiventing Pop music |url=http://restlessnationradio.com/ed-sheeran-reinventing-pop-music/ |access-date=10 July 2019 |work=Restless Nation Radio |archive-date=10 July 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190710083649/http://restlessnationradio.com/ed-sheeran-reinventing-pop-music/ |url-status=live }}</ref> A representative from Heinz stated that \"1/3 of @HEINZ Instagram posts include people mentioning or tagging Ed, dating all the way back to 2014.\"<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran Teams Up with Heinz Ketchup to Create 'Edchup' |url=https://people.com/food/ed-sheeran-heinz-ketchup-edchup/ |access-date=7 July 2019 |work=People.com |archive-date=7 July 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190707161413/https://people.com/food/ed-sheeran-heinz-ketchup-edchup/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Poking fun at people who turn their nose up at those who ask for ketchup in fancy restaurants, the advert sees him walking into a \"super posh\" restaurant while narrating the message he had sent to the company. As the other wealthy diners look on in horror at the sight of a ketchup bottle, he flips the bottle, bangs it against his hand to budge the ketchup and smothers it all over his food. The company released a limited edition ketchup product known as Ed Sheeran X Heinz ketchup, also known as \"Heinz Edchup\".<ref name=\"Heinz\"/>\n\nReleased in June 2019, Sheeran appeared as himself in a supporting role in the [[Richard Curtis]]/[[Danny Boyle]] film ''[[Yesterday (2019 film)|Yesterday]]'', a film about a struggling singer-songwriter who wakes up to find that no one but he remembers [[the Beatles]].<ref>{{cite web |last=Thompson |first=Anne |title='Yesterday': Ed Sheeran's Smart Casting Advice Saved Danny Boyle's Beatles Rom-Com |url=https://www.indiewire.com/2019/07/yesterday-ed-sheeran-danny-boyle-beatles-1202153594/ |website=[[IndieWire]] |access-date=2 July 2019 |date=2 July 2019 |archive-date=3 July 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190703130425/https://www.indiewire.com/2019/07/yesterday-ed-sheeran-danny-boyle-beatles-1202153594/ |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\n==Impact==\n[[File:Ed Sheeran Helsinki 2022 06.jpg|thumb|upright=1.2|Sheeran concert in Helsinki, August 2022. He had the [[List of highest-grossing concert tours#2010s|highest-grossing tour of the 2010s]], while his current tour, +\u2013=\u00f7x Tour, ranks among the [[List of highest-grossing concert tours#2020s|highest-grossing of the 2020s]].]]\nMusic journalist [[Alexis Petridis]] has stated that Ed Sheeran \"brought pop back down to earth\" with his music style, introducing himself \"touting an even more austere version of [[Coldplay]]'s dressed-down authenticity: one unassuming man, his guitar and a [[Live looping|loop pedal]]\". Noting him as \"one of the most influential\" artists of his generation, as he spawned \"endless imitators\", Petridis remarked that the music charts were \"packed with Sheeran-alikes\" after ''[[x (Ed Sheeran album)|\u00d7]]'', describing it as \"the wave of earnest, dressed-down, boy-next-door [[troubadour]]s\" that reached critical mass.<ref>{{cite web|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20210302060726/https://www.theguardian.com/music/2019/nov/18/how-ed-sheeran-brought-pop-back-down-to-earth|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2019/nov/18/how-ed-sheeran-brought-pop-back-down-to-earth|title=Grounded: how Ed Sheeran brought pop back down to earth|work=The Guardian|first=Alex|last=Petridis|archivedate=2 March 2021|date=18 November 2019|accessdate=5 March 2022}}</ref> Similarly, ''[[The Guardian]]'' writer Laura Snapes cited him as \"the godfather of the current crop of singer-songwriters\" in 2019, stating that Sheeran inspired \"troubadours\" to enter the music charts, and marked \"the calcification of the everyman male pop star\", and the end of record labels marketing them \"exclusively to teenage girls and their mums.\"<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2019/mar/15/ordinary-boys-ed-sheeran-inspired-troubadours-swept-charts|title=The ordinary boys: how Ed Sheeran-inspired troubadours swept the charts|work=The Guardian|first=Snapes|last=Laura|date=15 March 2019|accessdate=5 March 2022|archive-date=5 March 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220305084126/https://www.theguardian.com/music/2019/mar/15/ordinary-boys-ed-sheeran-inspired-troubadours-swept-charts|url-status=live}}</ref> ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' writer Jason Lipshutz noticed that his appeal and performance style had influenced up-and-coming soloists, impacting \"a significant number of pop artists who crave his type of singular success.\"<ref name=\"bb\">{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/ed-sheeran-influencing-pop-shawn-mendes-cody-simpson-6473105/|title=The Sheeran Effect: Observing The Beginnings of Ed Sheeran's Influence on Pop|magazine=Billboard|first=Jason|last=Lipshutz|date=17 February 2015|accessdate=5 March 2022|archive-date=4 March 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304090457/https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/ed-sheeran-influencing-pop-shawn-mendes-cody-simpson-6473105/|url-status=live}}</ref> The ''[[Financial Times]]'' considered that the scale of Sheeran's commercial accomplishments has \"broken through to such a wide and lucrative extent, far beyond the achievements of any of the other singer-songwriters in the market\" in the UK.<ref name=\"financial times\">{{cite web|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20201030183655/https://www.ft.com/content/0b124842-856a-11e4-ab4e-00144feabdc0|url=https://www.ft.com/content/0b124842-856a-11e4-ab4e-00144feabdc0|title=The business of being Ed Sheeran|work=Financial Times|first=Craig|last=McLean|archivedate=30 October 2020|date=19 December 2014|accessdate=5 March 2022}}</ref>\n\n[[iHeartMedia]] senior executive Sharon Dastur declared that Sheeran's success has allowed newer artists to be given an opportunity in the mainstream scene with quieter material at the forefront, instead of dance music.<ref name=\"bb\"/> ''[[GQ]]''{{'}}s George Chesterton deemed Sheeran \"the de facto voice of a generation\" as a consequence of his music reflecting his personality and \"the defining characteristics of his audience\", with such recurring qualities of his discography corresponding \"with those that his own generation, the [[millennials]], most value: authenticity, realness, earnestness, sincerity.\"<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.gq-magazine.co.uk/article/ed-sheeran-new-album-divide|title=How Ed Sheeran became the biggest male popstar on the planet|work=GQ|first=George|last=Chesterton|date=2 February 2017|accessdate=5 March 2022|archive-date=24 January 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220124024832/https://www.gq-magazine.co.uk/article/ed-sheeran-new-album-divide|url-status=live}}</ref> [[BBC Radio 1]] executive George Ergatoudis has stated that his \"lyrical candour\" and his \"professional hunger\" resonated with younger listeners, giving him a \"very clear edge\" to breakthrough in a music industry that is \"saturated with singer-songwriters\", while Sheeran's \"niche combination\" has made him able to perform at hip-hop, grime and underground events and \"convince the urban crowd that he was authentic\".<ref name=\"financial times\"/> According to ''[[Vox (website)|Vox]]'', Sheeran has reached \"global pop culture ubiquity\".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.vox.com/culture/2017/5/1/15050000/ed-sheeran-superstar-explained|title=How Ed Sheeran perfected the art of being a mainstream misfit|work=Vox|first=Annie|last=Zaleski|date=1 May 2017|accessdate=5 March 2022|archive-date=4 March 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304090820/https://www.vox.com/culture/2017/5/1/15050000/ed-sheeran-superstar-explained|url-status=live}}</ref> In 2017, the [[BBC]] named him the second-best performing artist of the decade, after [[Adele]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/articles/5dNKlNvjbkPPFZffRprwDtH/9-songs-you-probably-didnt-know-ed-sheeran-had-written-for-other-people|title=9 songs you probably didn't know Ed Sheeran had written for other people|work=BBC|date=17 December 2017|accessdate=5 March 2022|archive-date=5 March 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220305085628/https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/articles/5dNKlNvjbkPPFZffRprwDtH/9-songs-you-probably-didnt-know-ed-sheeran-had-written-for-other-people|url-status=live}}</ref> while in 2021, ''[[The Independent]]'' said he had \"one of the biggest pop careers of this generation.\"<ref>{{cite news|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20211102121535/https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/features/ed-sheeran-equals-album-b1947159.html|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/features/ed-sheeran-equals-album-b1947159.html|title=Divide and conquer: how Ed Sheeran took over the world|work=The Independent|first=Anabel|last=Nungent|archivedate=2 November 2021|date=29 October 2021|accessdate=5 March 2022}}</ref> ''Billboard'',<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/ed-sheeran-elton-john-documentary-clip-8095459/|title=Ed Sheeran 'Eternally Jealous' of Elton John's 'Lion King' Music: Watch a Clip From 'The Nation's Favorite Song'|magazine=Billboard|first=Julia|last=Marzovilla|date=22 January 2018|accessdate=5 March 2022|archive-date=4 March 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304093807/https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/ed-sheeran-elton-john-documentary-clip-8095459/|url-status=live}}</ref> ''[[The Financial Express (India)|The Financial Express]]'',<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.financialexpress.com/entertainment/game-of-thrones-season-7-ed-sheeran-debut-got-premiere-maisie-williams-arya-stark-shape-of-you/767290/|title=Game of Thrones season 7: Music icon Ed Sheeran makes delightful debut in premiere|work=[[The Financial Express (India)|The Financial Express]]|date=17 July 2017|accessdate=5 March 2022|archive-date=4 March 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304093809/https://www.financialexpress.com/entertainment/game-of-thrones-season-7-ed-sheeran-debut-got-premiere-maisie-williams-arya-stark-shape-of-you/767290/|url-status=live}}</ref> ''[[The Brandon Sun]]''<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.brandonsun.com/local/six-year-old-thrilled-to-meet-ed-sheeran-499599941.html|title=Six-year-old thrilled to meet Ed Sheeran|work=[[Brandon Sun]]|first=Melissa|last=Verge|date=5 November 2018|accessdate=5 March 2022|archive-date=4 March 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304101754/https://www.brandonsun.com/local/six-year-old-thrilled-to-meet-ed-sheeran-499599941.html|url-status=live}}</ref> and ''[[Arab News]]''<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.arabnews.com/node/1727861/lifestyle|title=British pop icon Ed Sheeran welcomes first child|work=[[Arab News]]|date=1 September 2020|accessdate=5 March 2022|archive-date=4 March 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304093809/https://www.arabnews.com/node/1727861/lifestyle|url-status=live}}</ref> have cited him as a \"British music icon\". In a 2023 poll conducted by the [[O2 (UK)|O<sub>2</sub>]] Priority Tickets platform on what musical acts, past and present, music fans would most want to see live, Sheeran ranked third, after [[Queen (band)|Queen]] and the Beatles.<ref>{{cite news |title=Queen tops poll of artists Brits would love to see live |url=https://virginradio.co.uk/music/104340/queen-tops-poll-of-artists-brits-would-love-to-see-live |access-date=24 November 2023 |publisher=Virgin Radio |archive-date=24 November 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231124030926/https://virginradio.co.uk/music/104340/queen-tops-poll-of-artists-brits-would-love-to-see-live |url-status=live }}</ref> Sheeran and his work have influenced various recording artists, including [[Shawn Mendes]],<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.mtv.co.uk/news/f6l01u/mtv-meets-shawn-mendes|work=MTV|title=MTV Meets: Shawn Mendes|first=Jennifer|last=Lynn|date=2 September 2014|access-date=27 September 2015|archive-date=5 May 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150505042109/http://www.mtv.co.uk/shawn-mendes/news/mtv-meets-shawn-mendes|url-status=live}}</ref> [[Louis Tomlinson]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/music/news/a345784/one-direction-name-debut-album-up-all-night-reveal-cover.html |title=One Direction name debut album 'Up All Night', reveal cover |work=[[Digital Spy]] |date=16 October 2011 |access-date=21 March 2012 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120218110917/http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/music/news/a345784/one-direction-name-debut-album-up-all-night-reveal-cover.html |archive-date=18 February 2012}}</ref> [[Camila Cabello]]<ref name=\"the new york times\">{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/11/arts/music/camila-cabello-fifth-harmony-solo-album.html |title=How Camila Cabello Lost Some Friends and Found Her Voice |last=Ugwu |first=Reggie |date=11 January 2018 |work=The New York Times |access-date=13 January 2018 |archive-date=15 December 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201215121638/https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/11/arts/music/camila-cabello-fifth-harmony-solo-album.html |url-status=live }}</ref> and [[Cody Simpson]].<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/6473105/ed-sheeran-influencing-pop-shawn-mendes-cody-simpson|title=The Sheeran Effect: Observing The Beginnings of Ed Sheeran's Influence on Pop|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=17 February 2015|access-date=14 November 2020|archive-date=13 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210413200135/https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/6473105/ed-sheeran-influencing-pop-shawn-mendes-cody-simpson|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n==Accolades==\n{{main|List of awards and nominations received by Ed Sheeran}}\nOn 19 October 2015, Sheeran received an honorary degree from the [[University of Suffolk]] in Ipswich for his \"outstanding contribution to music\".<ref name=\"degree\"/> Sheeran commented: \"Suffolk is very much where I call home. Receiving this recognition is a real privilege.\"<ref name=\"degree\">{{cite news|title=Ed Sheeran returns home for honorary degree|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-suffolk-34573628|work=[[BBC News]]|date=20 September 2015|access-date=27 August 2022|archive-date=8 April 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220408154101/https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-suffolk-34573628|url-status=live}}</ref> He was appointed [[Member of the Order of the British Empire]] (MBE) in the [[2017 Birthday Honours]] for \"services to music and charity\".<ref>{{London Gazette|issue=61962|supp=y|page=B22|date=17 June 2017}}</ref> Sheeran received the award from [[Prince Charles]] at [[Buckingham Palace]] on 7 December 2017.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran picks up MBE from Prince Charles at Buckingham Palace |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-42267515 |work=[[BBC News]] |date=7 December 2017 |access-date=27 August 2022 |archive-date=15 August 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220815103554/https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-42267515 |url-status=live }}</ref> In 2012, he was named a [[baron]] of [[Principality of Sealand|Sealand]].<ref>{{cite web |last=Amos |first=Thomas |title=How To Become A Baron Or Baroness \u2013 Principality Of Sealand |url=https://sealandgov.org/become-a-baron-or-baroness/ |access-date=25 June 2020 |website=Sealand.gov.org |archive-date=27 June 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200627024820/https://sealandgov.org/become-a-baron-or-baroness/ |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\nIn addition to having the [[List of highest-grossing concert tours|highest-grossing concert tour]] and being one of the [[List of best-selling music artists|world's best-selling music artists]] with more than 150 million records sold, Sheeran has received a number of awards. As of 2019, he has received four [[Grammy Awards]] (including [[Grammy Award for Song of the Year|Song of the Year]] in 2016 for \"Thinking Out Loud\"), five [[Brit Awards]] (including [[Brit Award for British Male Solo Artist|British Male Solo Artist]] in 2015), and six [[Billboard Music Award|''Billboard'' Music Awards]] (including [[Billboard Music Award for Top Artist|Top Artist]] in 2018).<ref name=\"Brits 2015\"/><ref name=\"Grammys 2016\"/><ref name=\"Billboard 2018\"/> In 2015 and 2018, he received the [[Ivor Novello Awards|Ivor Novello Award]] for Songwriter of the Year from the [[British Academy of Songwriters, Composers, and Authors]].<ref name=\"Novello\"/><ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran Named Songwriter of the Year at U.K.'s Ivor Novello Awards |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/8458811/ed-sheeran-songwriter-of-the-year-uk-ivor-novello-awards |access-date=28 August 2019 |magazine=Billboard |archive-date=28 August 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190828085511/https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/8458811/ed-sheeran-songwriter-of-the-year-uk-ivor-novello-awards |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\nAlthough he regards Suffolk as home having moved to the county as a young child, Sheeran was recognised by his county of birth in a 2018 poll when he was ranked the fourth-greatest Yorkshireman ever behind [[Monty Python]] comedian [[Michael Palin]], and actors [[Sean Bean]] and [[Patrick Stewart]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Michael Palin named greatest ever Yorkshireman, according to poll|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/michael-palin-yorkshire-greatest-poll-yorkshireman-yorkshire-britons-a8471641.html|access-date=23 October 2022|work=The Independent|archive-date=23 October 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221023164450/https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/michael-palin-yorkshire-greatest-poll-yorkshireman-yorkshire-britons-a8471641.html|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nIn 2024 he won a [[Primetime Creative Arts Emmy Awards|Primetime Creative Arts Emmy]] for [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Original Music and Lyrics|Outstanding Original Music and Lyrics]] for \"A Beautiful Game\" from ''[[Ted Lasso]]''.\n\n==Personal life==\n[[File:Ed Sheeran (8507714431).jpg|thumb|upright|right|Sheeran's tattoos are either connected to his family, achievements, or memories.]]\nIn early 2011, after securing recording and publishing deals, Sheeran purchased and renovated a farm near [[Framlingham]], Suffolk, where he was raised. He has stated that he hopes to raise a family there.<ref name=\"Telegraph-McLean\"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.entertainmentwise.com/news/114582/Ed-Sheeran-Is-Renovating-A-House-For-His-Future-Family |title=Ed Sheeran Is Renovating A House For His Future Family |publisher=Entertainmentwise |date=13 May 2013 |access-date=8 June 2013 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130618003537/http://www.entertainmentwise.com/news/114582/Ed-Sheeran-Is-Renovating-A-House-For-His-Future-Family |archive-date=18 June 2013 }}</ref> During 2013, he lived between [[Hendersonville, Tennessee]]<ref>{{cite magazine |first=Adam |last=Gold |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/ed-sheeran-im-hoping-to-release-three-albums-in-three-years-84093/ |title=Ed Sheeran: 'I'm hoping to Release Three Albums in Three Years' |magazine=[[Rolling Stone]] |date=6 September 2013 |access-date=12 August 2020 |archive-date=12 November 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201112013427/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/ed-sheeran-im-hoping-to-release-three-albums-in-three-years-84093/ |url-status=live }}</ref> and Los Angeles, California.<ref name=\"elvisduran1\">{{cite web|url=http://www.elvisduran.com/pages/whatwetalkedabout.html?feed=136656&article=10747382 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130204011046/http://www.elvisduran.com/pages/whatwetalkedabout.html?feed=136656&article=10747382 |url-status=dead |archive-date=4 February 2013 |title=Ed Sheeran Live In-Studio [PHOTOS + VIDEO + LIVE PERFORMANCE&#93; \u2013 Elvis Duran and the Morning Show |publisher=Elvisduran.com |date=30 January 2013 |access-date=8 June 2013 }}</ref> In 2014, he bought a house in [[South London]].<ref name=\"Telegraph-McLean\"/>\n\nSheeran was in a relationship with Scottish singer-songwriter [[Nina Nesbitt]] (who was in his music video for \"[[Drunk (Ed Sheeran song)|Drunk]]\") in 2012, before breaking up.<ref name=\"Nesbitt\">{{cite news|url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/whats-on/music-nightlife-news/nina-nesbitt-ed-sheeran-wrote-3845502|title=Nina Nesbitt: Ed Sheeran wrote a song about our love life and I'm giving him a miss at T in the Park|work=Daily Record|date=11 July 2014|access-date=16 October 2015|archive-date=8 October 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181008194557/https://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/whats-on/music-nightlife-news/nina-nesbitt-ed-sheeran-wrote-3845502|url-status=live}}</ref> Nesbitt is the subject of Sheeran's songs \"Nina\" and \"[[Photograph (Ed Sheeran song)|Photograph]]\", while most of Nesbitt's album, ''[[Peroxide (Nina Nesbitt album)|Peroxide]]'', is about Sheeran.<ref name=\"Nesbitt\"/> In 2014, Sheeran was in a relationship with Athina Andrelos, who works for chef [[Jamie Oliver]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Why Did Ed Sheeran & Athina Andrelos Break Up? |url=https://www.bustle.com/articles/72320-why-did-ed-sheeran-athina-andrelos-break-up-there-are-a-couple-theories-out-there |access-date=27 September 2021 |work=Bustle |archive-date=27 September 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210927132215/https://www.bustle.com/articles/72320-why-did-ed-sheeran-athina-andrelos-break-up-there-are-a-couple-theories-out-there |url-status=live }}</ref> She is the inspiration of Sheeran's song \"[[Thinking Out Loud]]\".<ref name=\"IBT News\">{{cite news |url=http://www.ibtimes.com.au/ed-sheeran-confirms-split-girlfriend-who-inspired-thinking-out-loud-athina-andrelos-1433690 |title=Ed Sheeran Confirms Split With Girlfriend Who Inspired 'Thinking Out Loud' Athina Andrelos |work=IBT News |date=27 March 2015 |access-date=20 November 2015 |archive-date=21 November 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151121062343/http://www.ibtimes.com.au/ed-sheeran-confirms-split-girlfriend-who-inspired-thinking-out-loud-athina-andrelos-1433690 |url-status=live }}</ref> They broke up in February 2015.<ref name=\"IBT News\"/> He is also close friends with singer-songwriter [[Taylor Swift]]; the pair collaborated on her albums [[Red (Taylor Swift album)|''Red'']] (original and [[Red (Taylor's Version)|re-recorded]] versions) and [[Reputation (Taylor Swift album)|''Reputation'']], as well as on a remix of the song \"[[The Joker and the Queen]]\" from Sheeran's album [[= (album)|''='']].<ref name=\"Clapton\"/><ref>{{cite web |date=26 February 2022 |title=\"The \"Joker and the Queen\" feat. Taylor Swift is, no-joke, an incredible love song |url=https://georgetownvoice.com/2022/02/26/the-joker-and-the-queen-feat-taylor-swift-is-no-joke-an-incredible-love-song/ |access-date=6 March 2022 |website=The Georgetown Voice |archive-date=6 March 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220306090610/https://georgetownvoice.com/2022/02/26/the-joker-and-the-queen-feat-taylor-swift-is-no-joke-an-incredible-love-song/ |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\nIn July 2015, Sheeran began a relationship with childhood friend and former secondary school classmate Cherry Seaborn.<ref name=\"Relationship\">{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/newsbeat-45329646 |title=Ed Sheeran strongly hints that he got married in secret |work=[[BBC News]] |date=28 August 2018 |access-date=16 September 2018 |archive-date=29 August 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180829223302/https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/newsbeat-45329646 |url-status=live }}</ref> They announced their engagement in January 2018 and were married a year later.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/article/42759062/ed-sheeran-engaged-to-long-time-girlfriend-cherry-seaborn |title=Ed Sheeran engaged to long-time girlfriend Cherry Seaborn |date=20 January 2018 |website=BBC Newsbeat |access-date=27 August 2022 |archive-date=20 January 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180120143216/http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/article/42759062/ed-sheeran-engaged-to-long-time-girlfriend-cherry-seaborn |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://news.sky.com/story/ed-sheeran-reveals-date-of-secret-wedding-in-video-featuring-wife-11893798|title=Ed Sheeran reveals date of secret wedding in video featuring wife|publisher=Sky News|date=23 December 2019|access-date=23 December 2019|archive-date=23 December 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191223152037/https://news.sky.com/story/ed-sheeran-reveals-date-of-secret-wedding-in-video-featuring-wife-11893798|url-status=live}}</ref> She is the inspiration of the song \"[[Perfect (Ed Sheeran song)|Perfect]]\".<ref>{{cite web |url=https://agreeagain.com/celebrity/edsheeran-cherry-perfect/ |title=How Ed Sheeran wrote \"Perfect\" for fianc\u00e9e Cherry Seaborn |date=23 June 2018 |website=Agreeagain |access-date=27 August 2022 |archive-date=21 June 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220621155031/https://agreeagain.com/celebrity/edsheeran-cherry-perfect/ |url-status=live }}</ref> It was reported on 12 August 2020 that the couple were expecting their first child.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.express.co.uk/celebrity-news/1321660/ed-sheeran-wife-cherry-seaborn-baby-marriage-children-lockdown-news-latest-updates |title=Ed Sheeran and wife Cherry Seaborn 'expecting first baby' in lockdown announcement |first=Michelle |last=Marshall |date=11 August 2020 |newspaper=[[Daily Express]] |access-date=15 August 2020 |archive-date=14 August 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200814215822/https://www.express.co.uk/celebrity-news/1321660/ed-sheeran-wife-cherry-seaborn-baby-marriage-children-lockdown-news-latest-updates |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://www.ok.co.uk/celebrity-news/breaking-ed-sheeran-wife-pregnant-22506398 |title=Ed Sheeran and wife Cherry Seaborn are 'expecting first child together' |first=Amy |last=Denman |date=11 August 2020 |magazine=OK! |access-date=15 August 2020 |archive-date=12 August 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200812162335/https://www.ok.co.uk/celebrity-news/breaking-ed-sheeran-wife-pregnant-22506398 |url-status=live }}</ref> On 1 September, Sheeran announced on Instagram that Seaborn had given birth to a baby girl the previous week.<ref>{{cite web|title=Ed Sheeran on Instagram: \"Ello! A quick message from me as I have some personal news that I wanted to share with you... Last week, with the help of an amazing\u2026\"|url=https://www.instagram.com/p/CEliNEOBw3O/ |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/iarchive/instagram/teddysphotos/2388465608854801870 |archive-date=23 December 2021 |url-access=subscription|access-date=1 September 2020|website=Instagram}}{{cbignore}}</ref> On 19 May 2022, it was announced that the couple's second child, a girl, was born.<ref>{{cite magazine |last=Aniftos |first=Rania |date=19 May 2022 |title=Ed Sheeran & Cherry Seaborn Welcome Baby Girl: 'We Are Both So in Love With Her' |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/ed-sheeran-cherry-seaborn-welcome-daughter-2-1235073504/ |access-date=19 May 2022 |magazine=Billboard |archive-date=19 May 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220519221725/https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/ed-sheeran-cherry-seaborn-welcome-daughter-2-1235073504/ |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\nSheeran is a supporter of his local football club [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]],<ref>{{cite news |title=Ipswich fan Ed Sheeran swearily photobombing Norwich City legends at East Anglia derby will make your day |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/row-zed/ipswich-fan-ed-sheerans-swearily-9926539 |access-date=16 September 2018 |work=The Mirror |archive-date=16 September 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180916164255/https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/row-zed/ipswich-fan-ed-sheerans-swearily-9926539 |url-status=live }}</ref> and his [[+\u2013=\u00f7x Tour]] kit sponsored their [[2021\u201322 Ipswich Town F.C. season|2021\u201322 season]].<ref>{{cite web|date=6 May 2021|title=Ipswich shirts to be sponsored by Ed Sheeran next season|url=http://www.theguardian.com/football/2021/may/06/ed-sheeran-to-sponsor-ipswich-shirts-next-season|access-date=10 May 2021|website=The Guardian|archive-date=10 May 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210510062203/https://www.theguardian.com/football/2021/may/06/ed-sheeran-to-sponsor-ipswich-shirts-next-season|url-status=live}}</ref> Additionally, Sheeran was named in the club's squad list and given the squad number of 17.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-suffolk-58121177 |title=Ed Sheeran named in Ipswich Town squad list and given number 17 |date=6 August 2021 |work=[[BBC News]] |access-date=8 August 2021 |archive-date=8 August 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210808003934/https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-suffolk-58121177 |url-status=live }}</ref> His [[+\u2013=\u00f7x Tour]] kit sponsorship deal with Ipswich Town was renewed for the [[2022\u201323 Ipswich Town F.C. season|2022\u201323 season]].<ref>{{cite news |date=9 June 2022 |title=Ed Sheeran renews Ipswich Town Football Club sponsorship deal |work=BBC News |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-suffolk-61744993 |access-date=28 August 2022 |archive-date=28 August 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220828010308/https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-suffolk-61744993 |url-status=live }}</ref> A collector of [[Panini Group|Panini]]'s [[FIFA World Cup]] [[sticker album]], he completed the 2014 World Cup album.<ref>{{cite news |title=Watch: Got, Got, Need! The Story of Panini Stickers \u2013 a FourFourTwo Films exclusive |url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/watch-got-got-need-story-panini-stickers-a-fourfourtwo-films-exclusive |access-date=16 September 2018 |work=FourFourTwo |archive-date=16 September 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180916164227/https://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/watch-got-got-need-story-panini-stickers-a-fourfourtwo-films-exclusive |url-status=live }}</ref> Appearing as a guest on [[BBC Radio 4]]'s ''[[Desert Island Discs]]'' on 7 May 2017, Sheeran chose ''[[His Dark Materials]]'' by [[Philip Pullman]] as his book of choice, and a lifetime supply of [[ketchup]] as the one inanimate [[Luxury goods|luxury item]] that he would take with him on a desert island.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b08pddvs |title=Ed Sheeran, Desert Island Discs |publisher=[[BBC Radio 4]] |date=7 May 2017 |access-date=21 March 2020 |archive-date=22 March 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200322071554/https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b08pddvs |url-status=live }}</ref> On August 2024 Sheeran acquired a minority stake in the club, amounting to 1.4%.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Singer Ed Sheeran has bought a stake in a Premier League club. |url=https://bookmaker-ratings.ru/news/pevets-e-d-shiran-kupil-dolyu-v-klube-apl/ |access-date=August 16, 2024 |website=[[The Bookmaker Ratings]]}}</ref>\n\nIn June 2015, ''[[Forbes]]'' listed his earnings at $57&nbsp;million for the previous 12 months, and ranked him the 27th-highest-earning celebrity in the world.<ref name=\"Forbes\">{{cite news |title=The World's Highest-Paid Celebrities |url=https://www.forbes.com/celebrities/list/#tab:overall |work=Forbes |date=22 November 2015 |access-date=27 August 2022 |archive-date=18 May 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120518033904/http://www.forbes.com/celebrities/list/#tab:overall |url-status=live }}</ref> In July 2018, ''Forbes'' named Sheeran ninth on their list of the highest-paid celebrities.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.msn.com/en-us/entertainment/celebrity/george-clooney-and-kylie-jenner-among-top-10-highest-earning-celebrities/ar-AAAaFFG|title=George Clooney and Kylie Jenner Among Top 10 Highest-Earning Celebrities|website=msn.com|access-date=17 July 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190510160635/https://www.msn.com/en-us/entertainment/celebrity/george-clooney-and-kylie-jenner-among-top-10-highest-earning-celebrities/ar-AAAaFFG|archive-date=10 May 2019|url-status=dead}}</ref> One of the [[List of music artists by net worth|wealthiest musicians]], according to ''[[The Sunday Times (UK)|The Sunday Times]]'' [[Sunday Times Rich List|Rich List]] of 2019, Sheeran was worth \u00a3160 million (US$207 million) as the 17th-richest musician in the UK.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-48204955 |title=Ed Sheeran tops Adele as Stormzy joins Sunday Times Rich List |work=[[BBC News]] |date=9 May 2019 |access-date=9 May 2019 |archive-date=11 June 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190611175234/https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-48204955 |url-status=live }}</ref> Sheeran's net worth is estimated at \u00a3300 million in 2023.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.thetimes.com/culture/music/article/ed-sheeran-net-worth-sunday-times-rich-list-9rnnlm8hb |title=Ed Sheeran net worth \u2014 Sunday Times Rich List 2023|work=[[The Times]] |date=26 January 2024|access-date=8 June 2024}}</ref>\n\nOn 24 October 2021, Sheeran tested positive for [[COVID-19]] less than a week before the release of his [[= (album)|fifth album]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://news.sky.com/story/covid-19-ed-sheeran-tests-positive-for-coronavirus-but-says-he-will-gig-from-home-12443608 |title=COVID-19: Ed Sheeran tests positive for coronavirus \u2013 but says he will gig from home |publisher=[[Sky News]] |date=24 October 2021 |access-date=24 October 2021 |archive-date=24 October 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211024162935/http://news.sky.com/story/covid-19-ed-sheeran-tests-positive-for-coronavirus-but-says-he-will-gig-from-home-12443608 |url-status=live }}</ref> On 1 March 2023, he revealed that his wife, while pregnant, had developed a [[neoplasm|tumour]] with \"no route to treatment until after the birth\".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/entertainment-arts-64809475|title=Ed Sheeran says wife developed tumour in pregnancy, as he announces new album|publisher=BBC|date=1 March 2023|access-date=2 March 2023|archive-date=2 March 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230302001008/https://www.bbc.com/news/entertainment-arts-64809475|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n==Legal issues==\nSheeran has faced accusations of [[plagiarism]] with regards to [[chord progression]] and other elements of his music. However, [[tort]] actions which have reached a jury have all been decided decisively in Sheeran's favour.\n\nIn 2017, Sheeran settled out of court over claims his song \"Photograph\" was a \"note-for-note\" copy of the chorus in the song \"[[Amazing (Matt Cardle song)|Amazing]]\" by ''[[X Factor]]'' UK winner [[Matt Cardle]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2017/apr/11/ed-sheeran-20m-dollar-copyright-claim-matt-cardle-x-factor|title=Ed Sheeran may regret Photograph that led to $20m copyright case|date=11 April 2017|access-date=27 August 2022|archive-date=13 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210413195924/https://www.theguardian.com/music/2017/apr/11/ed-sheeran-20m-dollar-copyright-claim-matt-cardle-x-factor|url-status=live}}</ref> Sheeran later regretted the decision to settle, saying that it was done on the advice of his lawyers who thought the case was \"more trouble than it was worth.\"<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran denies Shape of You copyright claim at High Court trial |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-60648263 |access-date=8 March 2022 |work=BBC News |date=7 March 2022 |archive-date=8 March 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220308021108/https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-60648263 |url-status=live }}</ref> He said he regretted settling the claim not because of the money involved, but because it changed his relationship with the song. He said: \"I didn't play 'Photograph' for ages after that. I just stopped playing it. I felt weird about it, it kind of made me feel dirty.\" He also thought that settling the case opened a floodgate of claims, including the \"Shape of You\" lawsuit.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/news/ed-sheeran-shape-of-you-lawsuit-win-b2053945.html |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/archive/20220526/https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/news/ed-sheeran-shape-of-you-lawsuit-win-b2053945.html |archive-date=26 May 2022 |url-access=subscription |url-status=live |title=Ed Sheeran says he now regrets settling \u00a314m 'Photograph' lawsuit in wake of 'Shape of You' trial win |first=Tom|last=Murray|work=The Independent |date=8 April 2022 }}</ref>\n\nIn 2018, legal action was brought against Sheeran, [[Sony Music Publishing|Sony/ATV Music Publishing]] and [[Atlantic Records]] by the estate and heirs of the late producer [[Ed Townsend]], who co-wrote the song \"[[Let's Get It On (song)|Let's Get It On]]\" with [[Marvin Gaye]]. [[United States district court|US District Judge]] Louis Stanton rejected Sheeran's call in 2019 for dismissal of a legal case accusing him of copying parts of the song in \"Thinking Out Loud\". Stanton said that a jury should decide but that he found \"substantial similarities between several of the two works' musical elements\".<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.abc.net.au/news/2019-01-04/ed-sheeran-margin-gaye-plagiarism-case-going-to-jury/10685922|work=Australian Broadcasting Commission news|title=Jury to decide whether Ed Sheeran copied Marvin Gaye's Let's Get It On for his 2014 song Thinking Out Loud|date=4 January 2019|access-date=27 August 2022|archive-date=1 May 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220501034840/https://www.abc.net.au/news/2019-01-04/ed-sheeran-margin-gaye-plagiarism-case-going-to-jury/10685922|url-status=live}}</ref> A previous case by Townsend's estate was dismissed [[without prejudice]] in February 2017.<ref>{{cite web|last=Kenneally|first=Tim|title=Ed Sheeran Off the Hook in Marvin Gaye Copyright Case (for Now)|url=https://www.thewrap.com/ed-sheeran-off-the-hook-in-marvin-gaye-copyright-case-for-now/|website=The Wrap|access-date=28 June 2018|date=3 February 2017|archive-date=28 June 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180628233614/https://www.thewrap.com/ed-sheeran-off-the-hook-in-marvin-gaye-copyright-case-for-now/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nThe case, closely followed by those in music and legal circles, went to trial on in New York in April 2023. Sheeran's lawyers argued that while the two songs have similar \"building blocks\" and a specific [[chord progression]], such features are true for many pop songs, and the jury found in favour of Sheeran with a unanimous verdict.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.ft.com/content/02cb9be3-3335-4cad-841a-de89b9fe9cbb |title=Ed Sheeran wins 'Let's Get It On' copyright infringement trial |first1=Joe |last1=Miller |first2= Anna|last2= Nicolaou |work=Financial Times |date=4 May 2023 }}</ref> After winning the trial, Sheeran said: \"These chords are common building blocks which were used to create music long before 'Let's Get It On' was written and will be used to create music long after we are all gone.\"<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/article/ed-sheeran-marvin-gaye-copyright-trial.html |title=Ed Sheeran Won His Copyright Trial. Here's What to Know |work=The New York Times |date=4 May 2023 |first=Ben|last=Sisario }}</ref>\n\nSheeran was taken also to court in March 2022 for a copyright lawsuit over \"Shape of You\". Musicians Sami Chokri and Ross O'Donoghue alleged that the song infringed \"particular lines and phrases\" of their 2015 composition \"Oh Why\".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2022/mar/04/ed-sheeran-is-a-magpie-who-borrows-ideas-copyright-trial-hears|title=Ed Sheeran is a 'magpie' who 'borrows' ideas, copyright trial hears|website=The Guardian|last=Komami|first=Nadia|date=4 March 2022|access-date=5 March 2022|archive-date=4 March 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220304230631/https://www.theguardian.com/music/2022/mar/04/ed-sheeran-is-a-magpie-who-borrows-ideas-copyright-trial-hears|url-status=live}}</ref> Sheeran won the case, with [[Antony Zacaroli|Mr Justice Zacaroli]] ruling he \"neither deliberately nor subconsciously\" copied a phrase from \"Oh Why\" when writing \"Shape of You\".<ref>{{cite news |date=6 April 2022 |title=Ed Sheeran wins Shape of You copyright case |work=BBC News |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/entertainment-arts-61006984 |access-date=6 April 2022 |archive-date=6 April 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220406085712/https://www.bbc.com/news/entertainment-arts-61006984 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |date=6 April 2022 |title=Ed Sheeran wins court battle over Shape of You plagiarism accusation |url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2022/apr/06/ed-sheeran-wins-court-battle-over-shape-of-you-plagiarism-accusation |access-date=6 April 2022 |website=The Guardian |archive-date=6 April 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220406092538/https://www.theguardian.com/music/2022/apr/06/ed-sheeran-wins-court-battle-over-shape-of-you-plagiarism-accusation |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\n==Political views==\nSheeran publicly opposed [[Brexit]] (the [[United Kingdom]] leaving the [[European Union]]), and supported \"remain\". Following the [[2016 United Kingdom European Union membership referendum|June 2016 referendum result]] where the British public voted to leave, Sheeran was among a group of British musicians (which included [[Sting (musician)|Sting]], [[Queen (band)|Queen]] drummer [[Roger Taylor (Queen drummer)|Roger Taylor]], [[Pink Floyd]] drummer [[Nick Mason]] and [[Damon Albarn]] of [[Blur (band)|Blur]] and [[Gorillaz]]) who signed a letter to then Prime Minister [[Theresa May]], drafted by [[Bob Geldof]] in October 2018, calling for \"[[Proposed referendum on the Brexit withdrawal agreement|a 2nd vote]]\". Stating that Brexit will \"impact every aspect of the music industry. From touring to sales, to copyright legislation to royalty collation\", the letter adds: \"We dominate the market and our bands, singers, musicians, writers, producers and engineers work all over Europe and the world and in turn, Europe and the world come to us. Why? Because we are brilliant at it ... [Our music] reaches out, all inclusive, and embraces anyone and everyone. And that truly is what Britain is.\"<ref>{{cite news |title=UK music stars rail against Brexit in open letter to Theresa May |url=https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2018/oct/06/uk-musician-warn-botched-brexit |access-date=30 May 2019 |work=The Guardian |archive-date=30 May 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190530104206/https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2018/oct/06/uk-musician-warn-botched-brexit |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\nIn 2017, Sheeran publicly endorsed the [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour Party]] and then-leader [[Jeremy Corbyn]], while adding that \"I'm not Mr Political. I vote the way I feel I should, but won't tell somebody else what to do.\"<ref>{{cite news |title=Ed Sheeran says he is a fan of Jeremy Corbyn: 'He cares about other people' |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/news/ed-sheeran-jeremy-corbyn-politics-music-labour-party-general-election-grammy-awards-nominations-a8103091.html |access-date=15 November 2020 |work=The Independent |archive-date=13 November 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201113231438/https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/news/ed-sheeran-jeremy-corbyn-politics-music-labour-party-general-election-grammy-awards-nominations-a8103091.html |url-status=live }}</ref> In 2024, Sheeran endorsed the Labour Party and leader [[Keir Starmer]].\n\nIn 2021, Sheeran, along with several other celebrities, urged the [[United States Congress]] to pass the proposed [[Equality Act (United States)|Equality Act]], which would expand the [[Civil Rights Act of 1964|Civil Rights Act]] in order to outlaw discrimination against [[LGBT]] people. Sheeran stated in the open letter that the Act is \"essential to protect [...] the most marginalized communities.\"<ref>{{cite news |last=Meyers |first=Dave |title=Ariana Grande, Pink, Halsey, Taylor Swift, Ed Sheeran, Lady Gaga & more urge Congress to pass the Equality Act |url=https://www.wrmf.com/ariana-grande-pink-halsey-taylor-swift-ed-sheeran-lady-gaga-more-urge-congress-to-pass-the-equality-act/ |access-date=22 June 2021 |work=[[WRMF|WRMF FM]] |date=22 June 2021 |archive-date=8 April 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220408154115/https://www.wrmf.com/ariana-grande-pink-halsey-taylor-swift-ed-sheeran-lady-gaga-more-urge-congress-to-pass-the-equality-act/ |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\nIn 2022, during the [[Russian invasion of Ukraine]], Sheeran expressed support for [[Ukraine]] and participated in the [[Concert for Ukraine]] held at the [[Resorts World Arena]] in [[Birmingham]], England.<ref>{{cite news |date=21 March 2022 |title=Ed Sheeran and Camila Cabello join Ukraine concert line-up |work=BBC News |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/entertainment-arts-60822865 |access-date=28 March 2022 |archive-date=26 March 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220326200104/https://www.bbc.com/news/entertainment-arts-60822865 |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\n==Discography==\n{{main|Ed Sheeran discography}}\n* ''[[+ (album)|+]]'' (2011)\n* ''[[x (Ed Sheeran album)|\u00d7]]'' (2014)\n* ''[[\u00f7 (album)|\u00f7]]'' (2017)\n* ''[[No.6 Collaborations Project]]'' (2019)\n* ''[[= (album)|=]]'' (2021)\n* ''[[\u2212 (album)|\u2212]]'' (2023)\n* ''[[Autumn Variations]]'' (2023)\n\n==Filmography==\n=== Film ===\n{| class=\"wikitable plainrowheaders sortable\"\n|-\n! Movie|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|first=Andreas|last=Wiseman|date=15 April 2018|access-date=28 July 2018|archive-date=10 July Love (TV series)|''Modern Love'']]\n|Mick\n|Episode: \"Hers was a World of One\"\n| style=\"text-align:center\" |<ref>{{cite Notice (film)|Red Notice]]''\n|Himself\n|Cameo\n| style=\"text-align:center\" |<ref>{{cite magazine Use [[Special:ApiFeatureUsage]] to see usage of deprecated features by your application."},"revisions":{"*":"Because \"rvslots\" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"Alisan_Porter","to":"Alisan Porter"}],"pages":{"3884628":{"pageid":3884628,"ns":0,"title":"Alisan Porter","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{short description|American singer, actress and dancer (born 1981)}}\n{{Use mdy dates|date=July 2018}}\n{{Infobox person\n| name            = Alisan Porter\n| image           = Alisan Porter.jpg\n| caption         = Porter in 2015\n| birth_date      = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1981|6|20}}\n| birth_place     = {{Nowrap|[[Worcester, Massachusetts|Worcester]], [[Massachusetts]], U.S.}}\n| education       = [[Staples High School (Connecticut)|Staples High School]], [[Connecticut]]\n| occupation      = {{hlist|Actress|singer}}\n| years_active    = 1987\u2013present: Actress <br>2009\u2013present: Singer, songwriter\n| spouse          = {{plainlist|\n* {{marriage|Brian Autenrieth<br>|2012|2017|end=div}}\n* {{marriage|Justin de Vera<br>|2023}}\n}}\n| children        = 3\n| website         = {{URL|alisanporter.com}}\n| module          = {{Infobox musical artist\n| embed           = yes\n| genre           = {{hlist|[[Pop music|Pop]]|[[Rock music|rock]]|[[Country music|country]]}}\n| associated_acts = Alisan & Ilsey, The Canyons, Adam Lambert, Christina Aguilera\n}}\n}}<!-- Do NOT add any other artist unless he/she has collaborated with Porter on MULTIPLE occasions. Thanks. -->\n'''Alisan Leigh Porter''' (born June 20, 1981)<ref name=AMbio>{{cite web|last=Donelson|first=Marcy|url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/alisan-porter-mn0001946898/biography|title=Alisan Porter \u2013 Biography by Marcy Donelson|website=[[AllMusic]]|access-date=June 6, 2016}}</ref> is an American [[Pop music|pop]], [[Rock music|rock]] & [[Country music|country]] singer, actress, and dancer. As a child, Porter made acting appearances in ''[[Parenthood (film)|Parenthood]]'', ''[[Stella (1990 film)|Stella]]'' and ''[[I Love You to Death]]''. Her breakout role came in 1991, when she played the lead in the film ''[[Curly Sue]]'' opposite [[Jim Belushi]].\n\nAs an adult, Porter pursued roles in musical theatre, including a run in ''[[The Ten Commandments: The Musical]]'' and as an original cast member of the Broadway revival of ''[[A Chorus Line]]''. A solo album followed in 2009. In 2016, she auditioned for the [[The Voice (American TV series) season 10|tenth season]] of [[NBC]]'s ''[[The Voice (American TV series)|The Voice]]'', earning a spot on Team [[Christina Aguilera|Christina]]. In May of that same year, Porter was named the winner of the show.\n\n==Life and career==\nBorn to [[American Jews|Jewish]] parents in [[Worcester, Massachusetts]], Porter is the great-granddaughter of prominent Worcester rabbi [[Temple Emanuel Sinai (Worcester, Massachusetts)#Temple Emanuel history|Joseph Klein]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Gold|first=Sylviane|url=http://www.thefreelibrary.com/On+the+rise:+Alisan+Porter+born+to+play+Chorus+Line's+Bebe-a0152433195|title=On the rise: Alisan Porter born to play Chorus Line's Bebe|work=[[Dance Magazine]]|via=[[The Free Library]]|date=October 1, 2006|access-date=June 6, 2016}}</ref> Her grandmother ran the Charlotte Klein Dance Center.<ref>{{cite web|last=Duckett|first=Richard|url=http://www.telegram.com/article/20060608/news/606080450|title=Following in mother's dance-steps|work=[[Telegram & Gazette]]|location=[[Worcester, Massachusetts]]|date=June 8, 2006|access-date=June 6, 2016}}</ref> Porter's father, Ric Porter, was co-founder, lead singer, and songwriter of the Worcester-based band Zonkaraz.<ref>{{cite web|last=Williamson|first=Dianne|url=http://www.telegram.com/article/20130530/COLUMN01/105309875?_ga=1.24358073.2067001835.1465261530|title=Zonkaraz still feels the love|work=[[Telegram & Gazette]]|location=[[Worcester, Massachusetts]]|date=June 5, 2016|access-date=June 6, 2016}}</ref> Her mother, Laura Klein, also taught dance, coaching [[Klimaszewski Twins|Diane and Elaine Klimaszewski]], who appeared on ''[[Star Search]]'' in 1987 in the junior dance category before they became known as the Coors Light Twins. While in Los Angeles for the twins' appearance on ''Star Search'', the show's producer heard Porter singing in the hotel lobby and booked her to appear on the next episode. Porter has been singing and performing since age three; at age five, she became the youngest ''Star Search'' participant ever to win the competition. That same year, she also appeared on [[Pee Wee's Playhouse]] as one of the playhouse gang in Season 2.\n\nPorter acted in several films as a child; she became known for playing the title role in the 1991 movie ''[[Curly Sue]]'' opposite [[Jim Belushi]]. On television, she played the youngest daughter of [[Lynn Redgrave]] on the short-lived ABC sitcom ''[[Chicken Soup (TV series)|Chicken Soup]]'' in 1989. The following year, she was slated to be a new regular cast member on ''[[Perfect Strangers (TV series)|Perfect Strangers]]'', but her character was dropped after only one episode.\n\nPorter continued acting at Staples High School in [[Westport, Connecticut]], where she joined a theater group and participated in various shows. While a freshman, Porter portrayed Anita in ''[[West Side Story]]'', and as a senior played the lead in ''Cinderella''. After Porter won ''The Voice'' in 2016, her former high school drama teacher said she was not surprised by the result. \"She blew everybody away\" with her performance in ''West Side Story'', and \"really seemed to get the best out of everybody else. Her energy rubbed off on everybody. She inspired others.\"<ref name=\"QCOnline\">{{cite web|url=http://www.qconline.com/news/local/retired-moline-teacher-recalls-the-voice-winner/article_c30de1c7-5198-5c87-a9d1-2b6741ec5617.html|title=Retired Moline teacher recalls ''The Voice'' winner|work=[[The Dispatch / The Rock Island Argus]]|via=QCOnline|location=[[Moline, Illinois]]|date=May 25, 2016|access-date=May 26, 2016|last=Turner|first=Jonathan}}</ref>\n\nWhen she was 18 years old, Porter moved to [[New York City|New York]] to audition for Broadway shows. She was cast as Urleen in the show ''[[Footloose (musical)|Footloose]]''. Following her move to [[Los Angeles]],<ref name=\"kids\">{{cite web|url=http://www.earnthenecklace.com/the-voice-2016-winner-alisan-porter-5-facts-to-know-about-her/|title=''The Voice'' 2016 Winner Alisan Porter: 5 Facts to Know about Her|last=Wynter|first=Dontei|date=May 25, 2016|work=EarnTheNecklace.com|access-date=June 6, 2016}}{{Dead link|date=August 2023 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> Porter starred as Miriam in ''[[The Ten Commandments: The Musical]]'' at the [[Kodak Theatre]] alongside [[Val Kilmer]], [[Adam Lambert]] and Broadway star [[Lauren Kennedy]]. ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' rated her performance of the song \"Light of a New Day\" as \"superb\".<ref>{{cite news|last=Hirschhorn|first=Joel|url=https://variety.com/2004/legit/markets-festivals/the-ten-commandments-4-1200530665/|title=Review: ''The Ten Commandments''|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=September 28, 2004|access-date=June 6, 2016}}</ref>\n\nIn 2003, the band The Raz was formed, with Porter as the vocalist and main songwriter. The Raz split up in 2004. In March 2005, she announced the birth of her new band, The Alisan Porter Project. During 2006, she performed in the revival of ''[[A Chorus Line]]'' as Bebe Benzenheimer at the [[Gerald Schoenfeld Theatre]] in [[New York City]]. On October 9, 2009, her independent debut album ''Alisan Porter'' was released.<ref name=BBchart/>\n\nPorter sang the [[The Star-Spangled Banner|National Anthem]] at the ''2016 A Capitol Fourth'' special on July 3 at the U.S. Capitol West Lawn in Washington, D.C. The special was broadcast on [[PBS]]. She also sang the anthem prior to the nationally televised Sunday Night Football game in Oakland, CA on November 6, 2016.\n\nIn 2017, Porter, alongside Matt McAndrew, Mary Sarah, Chris Mann, Matthew Schuler, Michael Sanchez and Chloe Kohanski headlined the new Las Vegas show called The Voice: Neon Dreams.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://deadline.com/2017/10/the-voice-neon-dreams-las-vegas-nbc-hard-rock-cafe-casino-alisan-porter-1202199010/|title='The Voice: Neon Dreams' Set To Open In Las Vegas With Former Contestants|last=Ramos|first=Dino-Ray|date=November 1, 2017|work=Deadline|access-date=December 21, 2017|language=en-US}}</ref>\n\n===The Voice (2016)===\nOn February 29, 2016, she became a contestant on [[The Voice (American TV series) season 10|season 10]] of ''[[The Voice (American TV series)|The Voice]]'' and sang \"[[Blue Bayou]]\" for her blind audition performance. All four coaches{{snd}}[[Christina Aguilera]], [[Adam Levine]], [[Blake Shelton]], and [[Pharrell Williams]]{{snd}}turned their chairs for her and she chose Aguilera as her coach.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Norwin|first1=Alyssa|title=''The Voice'' Recap: Christina Aguilera Is Back With A Vengeance As Season 10 Begins|url=http://hollywoodlife.com/2016/02/29/the-voice-premiere-season-10-live-blog/|work=[[Hollywoodlife.com]]|access-date=March 6, 2016|date=March 6, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Bentley|first=Jean|title=''The Voice''{{'}}s Tenth Season Kicks Off With Some Truly Outstanding Blind Auditions|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/744730/the-voice-s-tenth-season-kicks-off-with-some-truly-outstanding-blind-auditions|work=[[E! Online]]|access-date=February 29, 2016|date=February 29, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Mizoguchi|first=Karen|title=''Curly Sue''{{'}}s Alisan Porter Nails Her ''Voice'' Blind Audition, Joins Team Xtina|url=http://www.people.com/article/curly-sue-alisan-porter-the-voice-blind-audition?xid=socialflow_facebook_peoplemag|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|access-date=March 1, 2016|date=March 1, 2016}}</ref> In the battle rounds, Porter was up against Lacy Mandigo with the song \"[[California Dreamin']]\" by [[The Mamas & the Papas]] as a rock version. In the knockout rounds, Porter beat [[Daniel Passino]]. Porter went on to sing through the live shows, advancing via public vote every week up to the finals, where she performed her original song \"[[Down That Road (Alisan Porter song)|Down That Road]]\". On May 24, 2016, Porter was crowned the season 10 winner of ''The Voice''. She also helped make ''The Voice US'' history as the first artist to win the show with a female coach, giving Aguilera her first win as a coach.\n\n:{{Color box|gold|border=darkgray}}\u2190 Studio version reached the top 10 on iTunes.\n{| class=\"wikitable\" style=\"text-align:center; font-size:99%; line-height:16px;\"\n|-\n! She says she has been sober since October 28, 2007.<ref>{{cite web|last=Nessif|first=Bruna|title=''Curly Sue'' Star Alisan Porter Reveals Past Alcohol and Drug Addiction|url=http://www.eonline.com/ca/news/578421/curly-sue-star-alisan-porter-reveals-past-alcohol-and-drug-addiction|website=[[E! Online]]|date=September 11, 2014|access-date=June 6, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Cosgrove Baylis|first=Sheila|title=''Curly Sue'' Actress Alisan Porter Admits to Being an Alcoholic|url=http://www.people.com/article/curly-sue-alisan-porter-alcoholic-mom-blog|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=September 11, 2014|access-date=June 6, 2016}}</ref>\n\nSince December 2008, Porter is a contributing columnist for ''[[movmnt]]'' magazine.<ref>{{cite web|last=Porter|first=Alisan|url=http://www.movmnt.com/alisan-porter_001823.html|title=The Truth about Alisan Porter|work=[[movmnt]]|date=December 2008|access-date=April 5, 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090412062859/http://www.movmnt.com/alisan-porter_001823.html|archive-date=April 12, 2009|url-status=dead}}</ref> Porter created a closed [[Facebook]] page for mothers called Lil' Mamas and then, in 2012, a related [[blog]] website of the same name that she runs with her business partner, Celia Behar.<ref>{{cite web|title=About Us|url=http://thelilmamas.com/about-us/|website=Lil' Mamas|access-date=March 1, 2016|archive-date=May 13, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200513100207/https://thelilmamas.com/about-us/|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=DiLuna|first=Amy|title=Moms commit random acts of kindness in honor of San Bernardino victim|url=http://www.today.com/kindness/moms-commit-random-acts-kindness-honor-san-bernardino-victim-t62871|access-date=March 1, 2016|work=[[Today (U.S. TV program)|Today]]|date=December 21, 2016}}</ref>\n\nOn March 10, 2012, Porter married Brian Autenrieth, a fruit exporter and former child soap opera actor, in [[California]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20576998,00.html|title=''Curly Sue'' Star Alisan Porter Gets Married|last=Garcia|first=Jennifer|date=March 11, 2012|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|access-date=March 12, 2012}}</ref> The couple have two children: son Mason Blaise (b. July 17, 2012) and daughter Aria Sage Autenrieth (b. May 8, 2014).  On December 18, 2017, Porter announced on Twitter that the couple had separated in March. She said, \"In a sad and honest note Brian and I ended our relationship in March. We remain close friends and are committed to always doing our best for our amazing kids.\"<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/alisanporter/status/942840493238403072|title=In a sad and honest note Brian and I ended our relationship in March. We remain close friends and are committed to always doing our best for our amazing kids. Thank you for the support and have a beautiful holiday. Xo A|last=Porter|first=Alisan|date=<!--11:34 AM - -->December 18, 2017|website=@alisanporter|access-date=December 19, 2017}}</ref>\n\nOn October 20, 2021, Porter gave birth to her third child, daughter Shilo Bee with her childhood friend, professional dancer Justin de Vera.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://people.com/parents/the-voice-winner-alisan-porter-welcomes-third-baby-exclusive|title=''The Voice'' Winner Alisan Porter Welcomes Third Baby, Daughter Shilo Bee: 'Our Missing Puzzle Piece'|last=Slater, Leon|first=Georgia, Anya|date=October 29, 2021|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|access-date=October 29, 2021}}</ref> On April 16, 2023, Porter and de Vera married at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas<ref>{{Cite web |title=Singer and Curly Sue Star Alisan Porter Marries Childhood Pal Justin de Vera (Exclusive) |url=https://people.com/music/alisan-porter-marries-justin-de-vera-wedding-photos-exclusive/ |access-date=2023-04-19 |website=Peoplemag |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last= |title=Just Married! All the Celebrity Weddings of 2023 |url=https://people.com/celebrity-weddings-of-2023-7098893 |access-date=2023-07-03 |website=Peoplemag |language=en}}</ref>\n\n==Filmography==\n=== Film ===\n{| class=\"wikitable sortable\"\n|-\n! Year\n! Title\n! Role\n! class=\"unsortable\" | Notes\n|-\n| 1988\n| ''Homesick''\n| Maggie\n|\n|-\n| 1989\n| ''[[Parenthood (film)|Parenthood]]''\n| Taylor Buckman\n|\n|-\n| 1990\n| ''[[Stella (1990 film)|Stella]]''\n| Jenny Claire (age 8)\n|\n|-\n| 1990\n| ''[[I Love You to Death]]''\n| Carla Boca\n|\n|-\n| 1991\n| ''[[Curly Sue]]''\n| Curly Sue\n|\n|-\n| 2003\n| ''Shrink Rap''\n| Brandi\n|\n|-\n| 2006\n| ''[[The Ten Commandments: The Musical]]''\n| Miriam\n|\n|-\n| 2008\n| ''[[Meet Dave]]''\n| A Chorus Line Dancer\n|\n|-\n| 2008\n| ''[[Every Little Step (film)|Every Little Step]]''\n| Herself\n|\n|}\n\n=== Television ===\n{| class=\"wikitable sortable\"\n|-\n! Year\n! Title\n! [[Folk Albums|US<br>Folk]]<br /><ref name=BBchart>{{cite magazine|url={{BillboardURLbyName|artist=alisan porter|chart=Folk Albums}}|title=Alisan Porter Album & Song Chart History \u2013 Folk Albums|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|access-date=June 6, 2016}}</ref>\n|-\n! scope=\"row\"| ''Alisan Porter''\n|\n* Type: Debut album\n* Released: October 9, 2009<ref>{{cite web|title=Alisan Porter by Alisan Porter|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/alisan-porter/id338197824|website=[[iTunes]]|date=October 19, 2009 |access-date=June 6, 2016|ref=iTunes1}}</ref>\n| \u2014\n|-\n! scope=\"row\"| ''Who We Are''\n|\n* Type: Album\n* Released: November 24, 2014<ref>{{cite web|title=Who We Are by Alisan Porter|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/who-we-are/id934247204|website=[[iTunes]]|date=November 24, 2014 |access-date=June 6, 2016|ref=iTunes2}}</ref>\n| 20\n|-\n! scope=\"row\"| ''Pink Cloud''\n|\n* Type: Album\n* Released: September 13, 2019\n| \u2014\n|}\n\n===EP's===\n{| class=\"wikitable plainrowheaders\" style=\"text-align:center;\"\n|-\n! style=\"width:12em;\" rowspan=\"2\" | Title\n! style=\"width:18em;\" rowspan=\"2\" | Details\n! style=\"width:6em;\" | Peak chart positions\n|- style=\"font-size:smaller;\"\n! scope=\"row\"| \"Deep Water\"\n| \u2014\n| \u2014\n| \u2014\n| \u2014\n| \u2014\n|\n|-\n| colspan=\"8\" style=\"font-size:8pt\"| \"\u2014\" denotes releases that did not chart\n|}\n\n===Other works===\n{{BLP unreferenced section|date=April 2016}}\nPorter co-wrote the following songs:\n* [[Adam Lambert]] \u2013 ''[[For Your Entertainment (album)|For Your Entertainment (2009)]]''\n** \"[[Aftermath (Adam Lambert song)|Aftermath]]\" (Adam Lambert, Alisan Porter, Ferras, Ely Rise)\n* Scarlett Cherry \u2013 ''Labor of Love (2011)''\n** Angel (Alisan Porter, Ely Rise, Scarlett Cherry, Lee Cherry, Guy Baruch)\n** Sleep Until You Dream (Alisan Porter, IIsey Juber, Jordan Lawhead, Scarlett Cherry, Lee Cherry)\n** Never Knew Love (Alisan Porter, Ely Rise, Scarlett Cherry, Lee Cherry)\n\nPorter appears on the 2006 Revival Cast Recording of [[A Chorus Line]], portraying Bebe Benzenheimer, whom she also portrayed on Broadway.<ref>https://www.discogs.com/Marvin-Hamlisch-Edward-Kleban-A-Chorus-Line-The-New-Cast-Recording/release/7601259| A Chorus Line: The New Cast Recording on Discogs. Retrieved Oct. 6, 2020.</ref>\n\n==Awards and nominations==\n{{BLP unreferenced section|date=April 2016}}\n{| class=\"wikitable\"\n|- style=\"background:#b0c4de; text-align:center;\"\n!
