2008|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201014719/http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/bolt/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nIn March 2009, Cyrus released \"[[The Climb (Miley Cyrus song)|The Climb]]\" (2009) as a single from the soundtrack to the [[Hannah Montana: The Movie|Hannah Montana feature film]].<ref name=\"weekly\">{{cite journal|last=Paxman|first=Bob|date=September 14, 2009|title=Climb Every Mountain|journal=[[Country Weekly]]|volume=16|issue=31|issn=1074-3235}}</ref> It was met with a warm critical and commercial reaction, becoming a crossover hit in both pop and country music formats.<ref name=\"sales2014\">{{cite news |url=http://music.yahoo.com/blogs/music-news/chart-watch-pitbull-kesha-eminem-riri-230734884.html |title=Chart Watch: Pitbull & Kesha & Eminem & RiRi |first=Paul |last=Grein |date=January 8, 2013 |work=Yahoo Music |access-date=June 26, 2016 |archive-date=October 7, 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141007024430/https://music.yahoo.com/blogs/music-news/chart-watch-pitbull-kesha-eminem-riri-230734884.html |url-status=live }}</ref> The soundtrack, which features the single, went on to become Cyrus's fourth entry to top the ''Billboard'' 200; at age 16, she became the youngest artist in history to have four number-one albums on the chart.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nbc.com/news/2011/02/28/snl-roars-into-march-with-host-miley-cyrus-and-musical-guest-the-strokes-on-march-5/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131105113150/http://www.nbc.com/news/2011/02/28/snl-roars-into-march-with-host-miley-cyrus-and-musical-guest-the-strokes-on-march-5/|archive-date=November 5, 2013|title=SNL Roars into March with Host Miley Cyrus and Musical Guest the Strokes on March 5|date=February 28, 2011|publisher=[[NBCUniversal]]|access-date=April 4, 2011}}</ref> She released her [[Hannah Montana 3|fourth soundtrack as Hannah Montana]] in July 2009, which debuted at number two on the ''Billboard'' 200.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://content.usatoday.com/communities/idolchatter/post/2009/07/68494541/1#.UXwbhMrNS1c |title=What's Hannah Montana doing in the American Idol sales report? |website=USA Today |date=July 15, 2009 |access-date=April 29, 2013 |archive-date=November 29, 2010 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101129063956/http://content.usatoday.com/communities/idolchatter/post/2009/07/68494541/1#.UXwbhMrNS1c |url-status=live }}</ref> Cyrus later launched her first fashion line, Miley Cyrus and [[Max Azria]], through [[Walmart]].<ref>{{cite web|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180915211107/http://www.accessonline.com/articles/miley-cyrus-talks-walmart-clothing-line-gears-up-for-fall-tour-74464/|archive-date=September 15, 2018|url=https://www.accessonline.com/articles/miley-cyrus-talks-walmart-clothing-line-gears-up-for-fall-tour-74464|title=Miley Cyrus Talks Walmart Clothing Line, Gears Up For Fall Tour |website=Access Online|access-date=October 2, 2019}}</ref> It was promoted by the release of \"[[Party in the U.S.A.]]\" (2009) and the [[extended play|EP]] ''[[The Time of Our Lives (EP)|The Time of Our Lives]]'' (2009).<ref>{{cite web |url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/the-time-of-our-lives/id348638946 |title=iTunes \u2013 Music \u2013 The Time of Our Lives by Miley Cyrus |publisher=iTunes |date=August 31, 2009 |access-date=April 29, 2013 |archive-date=October 11, 2010 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101011042350/http://itunes.apple.com/us/album/the-time-of-our-lives/id348638946 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name=\"associatedpress\">{{cite news|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131002161449/http://www.foxnews.com/story/2009/09/24/miley-cyrus-says-has-no-plans-to-retire-hannah-montana-character-yet/|archive-date=October 2, 2013|url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/2009/09/24/miley-cyrus-says-has-no-plans-to-retire-hannah-montana-character-yet/|title=Miley Cyrus Says She Has No Plans to Retire 'Hannah Montana' Character \u2013 Yet|date=September 24, 2009|access-date=June 6, 2010|agency=Associated Press|publisher=[[Fox News Channel]]}}</ref> Cyrus said the record was \"a transitioning album [...] really to introduce people to what I want my next record to sound like and with time I will be able to do that a little more.\"<ref name=\"associatedpress\"/> \"Party in the U.S.A.\" became one of Cyrus's most successful singles to date and is considered to be one of her [[signature song]]s.<ref>{{cite press release|title=Miley Cyrus Catapults to No. 2 Debut on Billboard Hot 100 with 'Party in the USA;' Tied for Highest Debut of the Year|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/267653/miley-cyrus-jay-z-make-noise-on-hot-100|magazine=Billboard|date=August 20, 2009|access-date=August 21, 2009|last1=Ben-Yehuda|first1=Ayala|last2=Caulfield|first2=Keith|last3=Pietroluongo|first3=Silvio|archive-date=June 6, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130606110711/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/267653/miley-cyrus-jay-z-make-noise-on-hot-100|url-status=live}}</ref> She embarked on her first world tour, the [[Wonder World Tour (Miley Cyrus)|Wonder World Tour]] (2009) which was a critical and commercial success.<ref>{{cite news|last=Lawrence|first=Jesse|title=Miley Cyrus Bangerz Tour Could Learn A Thing Or Two From Lady Gaga's ArtPop Tour|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/jesselawrence/2014/01/24/miley-cyrus-bangerz-tour-could-learn-a-thing-or-two-from-lady-gagas-artpop-tour/|work=[[Forbes]]|date=January 24, 2014|access-date=August 22, 2017|archive-date=January 29, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140129144900/http://www.forbes.com/sites/jesselawrence/2014/01/24/miley-cyrus-bangerz-tour-could-learn-a-thing-or-two-from-lady-gagas-artpop-tour/|url-status=live}}</ref> On December 7, 2009, Cyrus performed for [[Elizabeth II|Queen Elizabeth II]] and other members of the [[British royal family]] at the [[Royal Variety Performance]] in [[Blackpool]], [[Lancashire]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/8320913.stm|title=Entertainment &#124; Kay to present Royal Variety show|work=BBC News|date=October 22, 2009|access-date=March 5, 2010|archive-date=February 24, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230224100806/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/8320913.stm|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n''Billboard'' [[List of awards and nominations received by Miley Cyrus|ranked]] her as the fourth best-selling female music artist of 2009.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/266426/taylor-swift-kanye-west-named-top-female-and-male-artists-of-2009|title=Taylor Swift, Kanye West Named Top Female and Male Artists of 2009|magazine=Billboard|date=September 14, 2009|access-date=March 8, 2010|archive-date=April 8, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190408092036/https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/266426/taylor-swift-kanye-west-named-top-female-and-male-artists-of-2009|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n===2010\u20132012: New image with ''Can't Be Tamed'' and focus on acting===\n[[File:Miley Cyrus Gypsi Tour Acer Arena Sydney (5872497845).jpg|thumb|upright|Cyrus performing on her [[Gypsy Heart Tour]] in [[S\u00e3o Paulo]], 2011|left]]\n\nHoping to foster a more mature image, Cyrus starred in the film ''[[The Last Song (2010 film)|The Last Song]]'' (2010), based on the [[Nicholas Sparks]] novel.<ref>{{cite news|last=Fleming |first=Michael |title=Miley Cyrus to star in Disney film |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=September 16, 2008 |url=https://www.variety.com/article/VR1117992306.html?categoryid=1236&cs=1 |access-date=June 18, 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100405111748/http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117992306.html?categoryid=1236&cs=1 |archive-date=April 5, 2010 |url-status=live }}</ref> It was met with negative critical reviews<ref>{{cite web|url=https://metacritic.com/movie/the-last-song|title=Last Song, the reviews at Metacritic.com|website=Metacritic|access-date=June 4, 2010|archive-date=August 21, 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100821143345/http://www.metacritic.com/movie/the-last-song|url-status=live}}</ref> but was a box office hit.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=lastsong.htm |title=The Last Song (2010)-Box Office Mojo |access-date=May 27, 2010 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100404072126/http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=lastsong.htm |archive-date=April 4, 2010 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Bible | first=Karie |url=http://www.ercboxoffice.com/index.php?section=news&subsection=show_news_details&news_id=283 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100521051759/http://ercboxoffice.com/index.php?section=news&subsection=show_news_details&news_id=283 |url-status=dead |archive-date=May 21, 2010 |title=Box Office Obits |publisher=Exhibitor Relations Co. Inc. |date=May 12, 2010 |access-date=June 4, 2010 }}</ref> Cyrus further attempted to shift her image with the release of her third studio album, ''[[Can't Be Tamed]]'' (2010).<ref>{{cite web |url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/cant-be-tamed/id375866638 |title=iTunes \u2013 Music \u2013 Can't Be Tamed by Miley Cyrus |publisher=iTunes |date=June 21, 2010 |access-date=April 29, 2013 |archive-date=January 17, 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140117053610/https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/cant-be-tamed/id375866638 |url-status=live }}</ref> The album featured a more dance-oriented sound than her prior releases and stirred a considerable amount of controversy over its lyrical content and Cyrus's live performances.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://huffingtonpost.com/2010/05/04/miley-cyrus-cant-be-tamed_n_563718.html|title=Miley Cyrus 'Can't Be Tamed' VIDEO: Too Sexy Or Age Appropriate? (PHOTOS)|date=July 4, 2010|access-date=July 31, 2016|newspaper=Huffington Post|archive-date=August 26, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160826114605/http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2010/05/04/miley-cyrus-cant-be-tamed_n_563718.html|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thaindian.com/newsportal/entertainment/is-miley-cyrus-new-video-cant-be-tamed-too-racy_100359572.html|title=Is Miley Cyrus' new video 'Can't Be Tamed' too racy?|website=Theindian.com|access-date=July 31, 2016|archive-date=August 15, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160815062349/http://www.thaindian.com/newsportal/entertainment/is-miley-cyrus-new-video-cant-be-tamed-too-racy_100359572.html|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://ew.com/article/2010/05/05/miley-cyrus-cant-be-tamed-video|title=Miley Cyrus' 'Can't Be Tamed' video: Has our little tween star flown the coop?|magazine=Entertainment Weekly|access-date=July 31, 2016|archive-date=November 7, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161107222718/http://www.ew.com/article/2010/05/05/miley-cyrus-cant-be-tamed-video|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/music-arts/miley-cyrus-tamed-music-video-singer-17-pole-dancing-plunging-s-m-style-corsets-article-1.178039|title=Miley's sexy new video is anything but 'Tame'|website=New York Daily News|date=May 5, 2010|access-date=July 31, 2016|archive-date=March 6, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160306232918/http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/music-arts/miley-cyrus-tamed-music-video-singer-17-pole-dancing-plunging-s-m-style-corsets-article-1.178039|url-status=live}}</ref> It sold 106,000 copies in its first week of release and became her first studio album not to top the ''Billboard'' 200 chart in the United States.<ref name=mstar>{{cite web |url=http://www.mstarz.com/articles/9365/20130306/miley-cyrus-breaks-up-twitter-signs-britney-spears-manager-larry.htm |last=Cortez |first=Lauren |title=Miley Cyrus Breaks Up from Twitter and Signs with Britney Spears Manager; Can Larry Rudolph Orchestrate Another Comeback? : News |publisher=Mstarz |date=March 6, 2013 |access-date=April 29, 2013 |archive-date=March 5, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160305192446/http://www.mstarz.com/articles/9365/20130306/miley-cyrus-breaks-up-twitter-signs-britney-spears-manager-larry.htm |url-status=live }}</ref> Cyrus released her [[Hannah Montana Forever (soundtrack)|final soundtrack as Hannah Montana]] that October; it was seen as a commercial failure due to its low position on the charts compared to her previous albums.<ref name=\"new.music.yahoo.com\">{{Cite web |title=Week Ending Oct. 24, 2010: Place Your Bets &#124; Chart Watch - Yahoo! Music |url=http://new.music.yahoo.com/blogs/chart_watch/68460/week-ending-oct-24-2010-place-your-bets/ |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121001171215/http://music.yahoo.com/blogs/chart-watch/week-ending-oct-24-2010-place-your-bets.html |archive-date=2012-10-01 |access-date=2010-10-28}}</ref>\n\nCyrus was the subject of further controversy when a video posted online in December 2010 showed her, then aged eighteen, smoking [[Salvia divinorum|salvia]] with a [[bong]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/life-style/health/salvia-miley-cyrus-caught-smoking-salvia-bong-plant-high-akin-marijuana-lsd-article-1.470512|title=What is salvia? Miley Cyrus caught smoking plant|website=New York Daily News|date=December 10, 2010|access-date=July 31, 2016|archive-date=April 11, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230411234558/https://www.nydailynews.com/life-style/health/salvia-miley-cyrus-caught-smoking-salvia-bong-plant-high-akin-marijuana-lsd-article-1.470512|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/473147/miley-cyrus-opens-up-about-salvia-bong-hit|title=Miley Cyrus Opens Up About Salvia Bong Hit|magazine=Billboard|access-date=July 31, 2016|archive-date=August 6, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160806160932/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/473147/miley-cyrus-opens-up-about-salvia-bong-hit|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://hollywoodlife.com/2011/02/09/miley-cyrus-marie-claire-bong-salvia/|title=Miley Cyrus Admits To Smoking Salvia: It Was A Huge Mistake!|first1=Chloe|last1=Melas|date=February 9, 2011|website=Hollywoodlife.com|access-date=July 31, 2016|archive-date=April 24, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190424083334/https://hollywoodlife.com/2011/02/09/miley-cyrus-marie-claire-bong-salvia/|url-status=live}}</ref> 2010 ended with her ranking at number thirteen on the [[Forbes Celebrity 100|''Forbes'' Celebrity 100]] list.<ref>{{cite news|title=#13 Miley Cyrus|url=https://www.forbes.com/lists/2010/53/celeb-100-10_Miley-Cyrus_EB0C.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100701031726/http://www.forbes.com/lists/2010/53/celeb-100-10_Miley-Cyrus_EB0C.html|url-status=dead|archive-date=July 1, 2010|work=[[Forbes]]|access-date=April 5, 2014|date=June 28, 2010}}</ref> She embarked on her worldwide [[Gypsy Heart Tour]] in April 2011 which had no North American dates;<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cambio.com/news/miley-cyrus-is-heading-back-to-music |title=Miley Cyrus Back to Music |publisher=Cambio |date=February 14, 2011 |access-date=August 7, 2011 |archive-date=November 17, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171117001427/http://www.cambio.com/news/miley-cyrus-is-heading-back-to-music/ |url-status=live }}</ref> she cited her various controversial moments as the reason, claiming that she only wanted to travel where she felt \"the most love\".<ref>{{cite web|last=Allin|first=Olivia|title=Miley Cyrus won't tour in U.S., says foreign fans show the 'most love'|url=http://www.ontheredcarpet.com/Miley-Cyrus-wont-tour-in-U-S---says-foreign-fans-show-the-most-love/8075657|publisher=On the Red Carpet|access-date=April 7, 2014|date=April 15, 2011|archive-date=July 11, 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110711173950/http://www.ontheredcarpet.com/Miley-Cyrus-wont-tour-in-U-S---says-foreign-fans-show-the-most-love/8075657|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.smh.com.au/entertainment/music/cant-be-tamed-singer-to-hit-perth-shores-20110330-1cfk7.html|title=Can't be Tamed singer to hit Perth shores|last=Gallo|first=Lee-Maree|date=March 30, 2011|newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]|access-date=April 16, 2011|archive-date=April 7, 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110407083157/http://www.smh.com.au/entertainment/music/cant-be-tamed-singer-to-hit-perth-shores-20110330-1cfk7.html|url-status=live}}</ref> Following the release of ''Can't Be Tamed'', Cyrus officially parted ways with Hollywood Records.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/1536344/miley-cyrus-signs-with-rca-will-work-with-dr-luke-on-new-lp|title=Miley Cyrus Signs With RCA, Will Work With Dr. Luke on New LP|magazine=Billboard|access-date=July 31, 2016|archive-date=June 17, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160617191421/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/1536344/miley-cyrus-signs-with-rca-will-work-with-dr-luke-on-new-lp|url-status=live}}</ref> With her obligations to ''Hannah Montana'' fulfilled, Cyrus announced her plans to take a hiatus from music so she could focus on her acting career.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pasadenastarnews.com/ci_14773276|title=Miley Cyrus ready to sing a new tune|work=Pasadena Star-News|date=March 28, 2010|access-date=April 3, 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100330192550/http://www.pasadenastarnews.com/ci_14773276|archive-date=March 30, 2010}}</ref> She confirmed she would not be going to college.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://marquee.blogs.cnn.com/2010/05/25/miley-cyrus-nothing-i-do-is-for-shock-value|title=Miley Cyrus: Nothing I do is for shock value|work=CNN|date=May 25, 2010|access-date=May 27, 2010|archive-date=May 27, 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100527034253/http://marquee.blogs.cnn.com/2010/05/25/miley-cyrus-nothing-i-do-is-for-shock-value/|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://voices.washingtonpost.com/celebritology/2010/05/miley_cyrus_opts_out_of_colleg.html|title=Miley Cyrus opts out of college|newspaper=[[The Washington Post]]|date=May 25, 2010|access-date=May 27, 2010|archive-date=October 24, 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111024234520/http://voices.washingtonpost.com/celebritology/2010/05/miley_cyrus_opts_out_of_colleg.html|url-status=dead}}</ref>\n\nCyrus hosted the March 5, 2011, episode of ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' where she poked fun at her recent controversies.<ref>{{cite web |last=McGee |first=Ryan |url=http://www.hitfix.com/blogs/monkeys-as-critics/posts/recap-saturday-night-live-miley-cyrus-and-the-strokes#~ojw2g1z3oxbKRa |title=Recap: Saturday Night Live \u2013 Miley Cyrus and The Strokes |publisher=Hitfix |date=March 6, 2011 |access-date=October 7, 2013 |archive-date=March 4, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304072735/http://www.hitfix.com/blogs/monkeys-as-critics/posts/recap-saturday-night-live-miley-cyrus-and-the-strokes#~ojw2g1z3oxbKRa |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name=\"EW2\">{{cite magazine |last=Tucker |first=Ken |url=https://ew.com/article/2011/03/06/saturday-night-live-miley-cyrus-strokes/ |title='Saturday Night Live' review: Miley Cyrus and a show better than 'pretty cool': It was pretty funny |magazine=Entertainment Weekly |date=March 6, 2011 |access-date=October 2, 2019 |archive-date=September 25, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190925182818/https://ew.com/article/2011/03/06/saturday-night-live-miley-cyrus-strokes/ |url-status=live }}</ref> That November it was announced that Cyrus would be the voice of Mavis in the animated film ''[[Hotel Transylvania (film)|Hotel Transylvania]]'';<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Vary|first=Adam B.|title=Miley Cyrus joins 'Hotel Transylvania'|url=https://ew.com/article/2011/11/04/miley-cyrus-adam-sandler-hotel-transylvania/|magazine=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|access-date=November 4, 2011|archive-date=October 6, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141006133444/http://insidemovies.ew.com/2011/11/04/miley-cyrus-adam-sandler-hotel-transylvania/|url-status=live}}</ref> however by February 2012 she was dropped from the project and replaced with [[Selena Gomez]]. At the time Cyrus said her reason for leaving the movie was wanting to work on her music;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.entertainmentwise.com/news/69288/Miley-Cyrus-Drops-Out-Of-Film-Role-To-Make-Pop-Comeback |title=Miley Cyrus Drops Out Of Film Role To Make Pop Comeback |first=Shaun |last=Kitchener |publisher=Entertainmentwise. [[Gigwise]] |date=February 10, 2012 |access-date=September 21, 2013 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150404070727/http://www.entertainmentwise.com/news/69288/miley-cyrus-drops-out-of-film-role-to-make-pop-comeback |archive-date=April 4, 2015}}</ref> later it was revealed the real reason behind her exit was because she bought her then-boyfriend Liam Hemsworth a birthday cake shaped like a penis and licked it.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://people.com/movies/miley-cyrus-kicked-off-hotel-transylvania-over-liam-hemsworth-penis-cake/|title=Miley Cyrus Says She Was 'Kicked Off' Hotel Transylvania After Licking Liam Hemsworth's Penis Cake|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=August 22, 2019|first=Ale|last=Russian|access-date=October 28, 2020|archive-date=November 11, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201111184832/https://people.com/movies/miley-cyrus-kicked-off-hotel-transylvania-over-liam-hemsworth-penis-cake/|url-status=live}}</ref> She made an appearance on the [[MTV]] television series ''[[Punk'd]]'' with [[Kelly Osbourne]] and [[Khlo\u00e9 Kardashian]].<ref>{{cite web |last=Kaufman |first=Gil |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1678777/punkd-premiere-justin-bieber-miley-cyrus.jhtml |title='Punk'd' Taps Justin Bieber, Miley Cyrus For Comeback&nbsp;\u2014 Music, Celebrity, Artist News |work=MTV News. Viacom |date=February 8, 2012 |access-date=February 13, 2012 |archive-date=December 13, 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131213105627/http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1678777/punkd-premiere-justin-bieber-miley-cyrus.jhtml |url-status=dead }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/283585/how-did-khloe-kardashian-odom-get-punk-d-by-miley-cyrus-hint-it-s-pretty-gross|title=How Did Khlo\u00e9 Kardashian Odom Get Punk'd by Miley Cyrus? (Hint: It's Pretty Gross)|publisher=[[E! Online]]|date=January 3, 2012|access-date=February 13, 2012|archive-date=February 21, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230221191451/https://www.eonline.com/news/283585/how-did-khloe-kardashian-odom-get-punk-d-by-miley-cyrus-hint-it-s-pretty-gross|url-status=live}}</ref> Cyrus starred alongside [[Demi Moore]] in the independent film ''[[LOL (2012 film)|LOL]]'' (2012).<ref>{{cite news|last=Gomez|first=Luis|title=Trailer for Chicago-based 'LOL' features Miley Cyrus, Edwardo's Pizza sign|url=https://www.chicagotribune.com/2012/04/11/trailer-for-chicago-based-lol-features-miley-cyrus-edwardos-pizza-sign/|work=[[Chicago Tribune]]|access-date=December 27, 2013|date=April 11, 2012|archive-date=December 28, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131228143248/http://articles.chicagotribune.com/2012-04-11/entertainment/chi-trailer-chicago-miley-cyrus-lol-web-20120411_1_film-lol-trailer|url-status=live}}</ref> The film had a limited release; it was a critical and commercial failure.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Fritz|first1=Ben|last2=Kaufman|first2=Amy|url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/entertainmentnewsbuzz/2012/04/lol-miley-cyrus-lionsgate.html|title=OMG! Miley Cyrus' 'LOL' gets no love from Lionsgate|website=Los Angeles Times|date=April 18, 2012|access-date=March 2, 2013|archive-date=July 15, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120715104742/http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/entertainmentnewsbuzz/2012/04/lol-miley-cyrus-lionsgate.html|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Fritz|first1=Ben|last2=Kaufman|first2=Amy|title=Miley Cyrus' 'LOL' is a box office flop \u2013 but how big a flop?|url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/entertainmentnewsbuzz/2012/05/miley-cyrus-lol-release-box-office.html|website=Los Angeles Times|access-date=December 27, 2013|date=May 7, 2012|archive-date=January 23, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140123221611/http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/entertainmentnewsbuzz/2012/05/miley-cyrus-lol-release-box-office.html|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://rottentomatoes.com/m/lol_2011/ |title=LOL |website=Rotten Tomatoes |access-date=April 29, 2013 |archive-date=June 23, 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130623054009/http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/lol_2011/ |url-status=live }}</ref> She starred in the comedy film ''[[So Undercover]]'' playing the role of an undercover FBI agent at a college sorority.<ref>{{cite news|title=So Undercover \u2013 the mystery of Miley Cyrus's film career|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/filmblog/2012/nov/08/so-undercover-miley-cyrus-trailer|work=[[The Guardian]]|access-date=May 2, 2014|last=Heritage|first=Stuart|date=November 8, 2012|archive-date=February 21, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230221191452/https://www.theguardian.com/film/filmblog/2012/nov/08/so-undercover-miley-cyrus-trailer|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nCyrus released a string of live performances known as the ''[[Backyard Sessions]]'' on YouTube during the spring and summer of 2012; the performances were of classic songs she personally liked.<ref>{{cite web |last=Lansky |first=Sam |url=http://idolator.com/7356722/miley-cyrus-covers-jolene-in-stunning-backyard-sessions-video-watch |title=Miley Cyrus Covers \"Jolene\" In Stunning 'Backyard Sessions' Video: Watch &#124; |publisher=Idolator |date=December 27, 2012 |access-date=April 29, 2013 |archive-date=June 4, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240604151055/https://www.idolator.com/7356722/miley-cyrus-covers-jolene-in-stunning-backyard-sessions-video-watch |url-status=live }}</ref> Having begun working on a failed fourth album the previous year, Cyrus resumed working on a new musical project in late 2012.<ref name=\"Entertainmentwise\">{{cite web|url=http://www.entertainmentwise.com/news/117838/I-Want-To-Erase-My-Past-Miley-Cyrus-Admits-Shes-Embarrassed-By-Hannah-Montana|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141226214357/http://www.entertainmentwise.com/news/117838/I-Want-To-Erase-My-Past-Miley-Cyrus-Admits-Shes-Embarrassed-By-Hannah-Montana|title='I Want To Erase My Past': Miley Cyrus Admits She's 'Embarrassed' By Hannah Montana|last=Chester|first=Jason|publisher=Entertainmentwise. [[Gigwise]]|date=June 14, 2013|archive-date=December 26, 2014|access-date=September 26, 2013}}</ref>{{Failed verification|date=April 2023}} She collaborated with producers [[Rock Mafia]] on their song \"Morning Sun\" (2012), which was made available for free download online.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://soundcloud.com/fredjpariona/miley-cyrus-morning-sun-prod|title=Miley Cyrus - Morning Sun (Prod. Diplo, Tiesto & Rock Mafia)|website=SoundCloud|access-date=July 31, 2016|archive-date=February 21, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230221191451/https://soundcloud.com/fredjpariona/miley-cyrus-morning-sun-prod|url-status=live}}</ref> She had previously appeared in the music video for their debut single, \"[[The Big Bang (song)|The Big Bang]]\" (2010).<ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/viral-videos/951945/rock-mafia-recruits-miley-cyrus-for-the-big-bang-video |title=Rock Mafia Recruits Miley Cyrus For 'The Big Bang' Video |magazine=Billboard |date=November 2, 2010 |access-date=April 8, 2014 |archive-date=September 7, 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140907130613/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/viral-videos/951945/rock-mafia-recruits-miley-cyrus-for-the-big-bang-video |url-status=live }}</ref> Cyrus later provided guest vocals on \"[[Decisions (song)|Decisions]]\" (2012) by [[Borgore]].<ref name=\"Secret\">{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/exclusive-borgore-on-secret-collaboration-with-miley-cyrus-20120823|title=Borgore on His Secret Dubstep Track With Miley Cyrus: 'She Likes Surprises'|first=Steve|last=Baltin|magazine=Rolling Stone|date=August 23, 2012|access-date=January 18, 2014|archive-date=March 31, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140331171533/http://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/exclusive-borgore-on-secret-collaboration-with-miley-cyrus-20120823|url-status=dead}}</ref> Both Cyrus and Hemsworth appeared in the song's music video.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ontheredcarpet.com/Miley-Cyrus--Liam-Hemsworth-make-out-in-Borgore-music-video---Watch/8870656|title=Miley Cyrus, Liam Hemsworth 'make out' in Borgore music video - Watch|first=Olivia|last=Allin|publisher=On the Red Carpet|date=November 1, 2012|access-date=January 18, 2014|archive-date=February 26, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140226073105/http://www.ontheredcarpet.com/Miley-Cyrus--Liam-Hemsworth-make-out-in-Borgore-music-video---Watch/8870656|url-status=live}}</ref> She went on to guest star as Missi in two episodes of the [[CBS]] sitcom ''[[Two and a Half Men]]''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.kpopstarz.com/articles/26062/20130427/two-and-a-half-men-angus-t-jones.htm |title=Two and a Half Men Returning for 11th Season, Fate of Angus T Jones To Be Determined |publisher=KpopStarz |date=April 25, 2013 |access-date=April 29, 2013 |archive-date=October 17, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211017215922/https://www.kpopstarz.com/articles/26062/20130427/two-and-a-half-men-angus-t-jones.htm |url-status=live }}</ref> Cyrus drew significant media attention when she cut her traditionally long, brown hair in favor of a blonde, [[pixie cut]]; she commented that she had \"never felt more [herself] in [her] whole life\" and that \"it really changed [her] life.\"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/337305/miley-cyrus-chops-off-her-hair-do-you-like|title=Miley Cyrus Chops Off Her Hair\u2014Do You Like?|last=Nessif|first=Bruna|publisher=[[E! Online]]|date=August 12, 2012|access-date=August 31, 2013|archive-date=April 11, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230411234647/https://www.eonline.com/news/337305/miley-cyrus-chops-off-her-hair-do-you-like|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.torontosun.com/2013/07/16/miley-cyrus-busy-making-music-having-fun|title=Miley Cyrus busy making music, having fun|last=Stevenson|first=Jane|newspaper=[[Toronto Sun]]|date=July 16, 2013|access-date=September 1, 2013|archive-date=May 13, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230513004625/https://torontosun.com/2013/07/16/miley-cyrus-busy-making-music-having-fun|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n===2013\u20132015: ''Bangerz'' and ''Miley Cyrus & Her Dead Petz''===\n[[File:93.3 FLZ Jingle Ball Tampa Florida IMG 6955 (11490119034) (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|left|Cyrus performing at the 2013 [[Jingle Ball]] in [[Tampa, Florida|Tampa]], [[Florida]]]]\n\nIn 2013, Cyrus hired [[Larry Rudolph]] to be her manager, although she is currently managed by [[Maverick Management|Maverick]]'s [[Adam Leber]]; Rudolph is best known for representing [[Britney Spears]].<ref>{{cite news|last=McKay|first=Hollie|title=Is Miley Cyrus' manager behind her sexed up transformation?|url=http://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/2013/09/11/is-miley-cyrus-manager-behind-her-sexed-up-transformation/|work=Fox News|date=September 11, 2013|access-date=April 7, 2014|archive-date=March 3, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303221740/http://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/2013/09/11/is-miley-cyrus-manager-behind-her-sexed-up-transformation/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://hitsdailydouble.com/news%26id%3D316286%26title+MAVERICK-IS-A-LEGEND-OF-COUNTRY-TRAP |title=MAVERICK IS A LEGEND OF COUNTRY TRAP |author=<!--Not stated--> |date=May 3, 2019 |website=Hits Daily Double |access-date=January 8, 2020 |archive-date=August 4, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200804012825/https://hitsdailydouble.com/news%26id%3D316286%26title+MAVERICK-IS-A-LEGEND-OF-COUNTRY-TRAP |url-status=live }}</ref> It was confirmed that Cyrus had signed with [[RCA Records]] for her future releases.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/5657600/miley-cyrus-reveals-bangerz-release-date|title=Miley Cyrus Reveals 'Bangerz' Release Date|last=Lipshutz|first=Jason|magazine=Billboard|date=August 15, 2013|access-date=September 1, 2013|archive-date=August 27, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130827001108/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/5657600/miley-cyrus-reveals-bangerz-release-date|url-status=live}}</ref> She worked with producers such as [[Pharrell Williams]] and [[Mike Will Made-It]] on her fourth studio album, resulting in a hip hop-influenced sound.<ref name=hiphop>{{cite web|url=http://blogs.phoenixnewtimes.com/uponsun/2013/10/miley-cyrus-hip-hop-list.php|title=5 Reasons Why Miley Cyrus Is Good for Hip-Hop|last=Escudero|first=Nicki|work=[[Phoenix New Times]]|date=October 14, 2013|access-date=November 30, 2013|archive-date=October 28, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131028034657/http://blogs.phoenixnewtimes.com/uponsun/2013/10/miley-cyrus-hip-hop-list.php|url-status=dead}}</ref> She collaborated with numerous hip hop artists releases<ref name=hiphop /> and appeared on the [[Snoop Dogg|Snoop Lion]] song \"[[Ashtrays and Heartbreaks]]\" (2013), released as the lead single from his twelfth studio album, ''[[Reincarnated (album)|Reincarnated]]''.<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Blistein|first=Jon|title=Snoop Lion's 'Ashtrays and Heartbreaks' Features Miley Cyrus|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/snoop-lions-ashtrays-and-heartbreaks-features-miley-cyrus-20130404|magazine=Rolling Stone|date=April 4, 2013|access-date=August 22, 2017|archive-date=August 23, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170823121055/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/snoop-lions-ashtrays-and-heartbreaks-features-miley-cyrus-20130404|url-status=dead}}</ref> She collaborated with [[will.i.am]] on the song \"[[Fall Down (will.i.am song)|Fall Down]]\" (2013), released as a promotional single that same month.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://music.ninemsn.com.au/blog.aspx?blogentryid=1112163&showcomments=true |title=Exclusive interview: Will.i.am believes Miley Cyrus will be the new Bjork! |last=Nelmes | first=Amy |publisher=[[MSN]] |date=April 2013 |access-date=January 3, 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131103030432/http://music.ninemsn.com.au/blog.aspx?blogentryid=1112163&showcomments=true |archive-date=November 3, 2013 }}</ref> The song entered the ''Billboard'' Hot 100 at number fifty-eight, marking her first appearance on the chart since \"[[Can't Be Tamed (song)|Can't Be Tamed]]\" (2010).<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/431547/william/chart?f=379|title=will.i.am \u2013 Chart history|magazine=Billboard|access-date=April 29, 2013|archive-date=June 22, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130622110135/http://www.billboard.com/artist/431547/william/chart?f=379|url-status=live}}</ref> She provided guest vocals on the [[Lil Twist]] song \"Twerk\", which also featured vocals by [[Justin Bieber]].<ref name=twist>{{cite magazine |url=http://www.rap-up.com/2013/07/06/lil-twist-enlists-justin-bieber-and-miley-cyrus-for-new-single-twerk/ |title=Lil Twist Enlists Justin Bieber and Miley Cyrus for New Single 'Twerk' |magazine=[[Rap-Up]] |access-date=September 10, 2013 |archive-date=February 24, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230224100829/https://www.rap-up.com/2013/07/06/lil-twist-enlists-justin-bieber-and-miley-cyrus-for-new-single-twerk/ |url-status=live }}</ref> The song was unreleased for unknown reasons but leaked online.<ref name=twist /> On May 23, 2013, it was confirmed that Cyrus would be featured on the [[Mike Will Made It]] single \"[[23 (Mike Will Made It song)|23]]\", with [[Wiz Khalifa]] and [[Juicy J]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://rapdose.com/2013/05/23/mike-will-made-it-wiz-khalifa-miley-cyrus-juicy-j-23-single |title=Mike Will Made It Teases Wiz Khalifa, Miley Cyrus & Juicy J Featured Single 23 |publisher=Rap Dose |date=May 23, 2013 |access-date=September 10, 2013 |archive-date=February 22, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230222215456/http://rapdose.com/2013/05/23/mike-will-made-it-wiz-khalifa-miley-cyrus-juicy-j-23-single |url-status=live }}</ref> The single went on to peak at number eleven on the Hot 100, and had sold over one{{nbsp}}million copies worldwide as of 2013.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/5747924/mike-will-made-it/chart|title=Mike Will Made-It - Chart history|magazine=Billboard|access-date=December 30, 2013|archive-date=March 19, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140319075607/http://www.billboard.com/artist/5747924/mike-will-made-it/chart|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nCyrus released her new single \"[[We Can't Stop]]\" on June 3.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/events/bbma-2013/1562889/miley-cyrus-we-cant-stop-single-due-june-3|title=Miley Cyrus' 'We Can't Stop' Single Due June 3|magazine=Billboard|date=May 19, 2013|access-date=September 10, 2013|archive-date=October 9, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131009052352/http://www.billboard.com/articles/events/bbma-2013/1562889/miley-cyrus-we-cant-stop-single-due-june-3|url-status=live}}</ref> Touted as her comeback single, it became a worldwide commercial success, topping charts in territories such as the United Kingdom.<ref>{{cite web |last=Hung |first=Steffen |url=https://charts.nz/showitem.asp?interpret=Miley+Cyrus&titel=We+Can%27t+Stop&cat=s |title=Miley Cyrus \u2013 We Can't Stop |publisher=charts.nz |access-date=September 10, 2013 |archive-date=May 18, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170518094027/http://charts.nz/showitem.asp?interpret=Miley+Cyrus&titel=We+Can%27t+Stop&cat=s |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/music/news/a505799/miley-cyrus-earns-first-uk-number-one-single-with-we-cant-stop.html |title=Miley Cyrus earns first UK number one single with 'We Can't Stop' \u2013 Music News |website=Digital Spy |date=August 11, 2013 |access-date=September 10, 2013 |archive-date=September 24, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924154636/http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/music/news/a505799/miley-cyrus-earns-first-uk-number-one-single-with-we-cant-stop.html |url-status=live }}</ref> The song's music video set the [[Vevo]] record for most views within twenty-four hours of release and became the first to reach 100{{nbsp}}million views on the site.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/5047747/miley-cyrus-we-cant-stop-video-breaks-vevo-record|title=Miley Cyrus' 'We Can't Stop' Video Breaks VEVO Record|magazine=Billboard|date=July 29, 2013|access-date=September 10, 2013|archive-date=September 17, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130917183555/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/5047747/miley-cyrus-we-cant-stop-video-breaks-vevo-record|url-status=live}}</ref> Cyrus performed with [[Robin Thicke]] at the [[2013 MTV Video Music Awards]], a performance that resulted in widespread media attention and public scrutiny. Her simulated sex acts with a foam finger were described as \"disturbing\" and the whole performance as \"cringe-worthy\".<ref name=\"Hollywood Reporter\">{{cite web|url=https://hollywoodreporter.com/earshot/note-miley-cyrus-please-stop-614407|title=Note to Miley Cyrus: Please Stop; Plus Other VMAs Ruminations|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=August 26, 2013|access-date=August 26, 2013|archive-date=August 26, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130826100256/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/earshot/note-miley-cyrus-please-stop-614407|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=\"auto\">{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/tv/news/miley-cyrus-robin-thicke-vma-performance-one-year-later-20140822|archive-date=May 13, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160513101122/http://www.rollingstone.com/tv/news/miley-cyrus-robin-thicke-vma-performance-one-year-later-20140822|title=Twerk It Out: Miley and Robin's VMA Performance, One Year Later|last=Kroll | first=Katy |magazine=Rolling Stone|date=August 22, 2014|access-date=January 29, 2015}}</ref> Cyrus released \"[[Wrecking Ball (Miley Cyrus song)|Wrecking Ball]]\" (2013) as the second single from ''Bangerz'' on the same day as the VMAs.<ref name=wbsingle>{{cite web|url=https://thewrap.com/miley-cyrus-wrecking-ball-breaks-vevo-record-for-most-first-day-views/|title=Miley Cyrus' 'Wrecking Ball' Smashes One Direction's VEVO Record|last=Gilman|first=Greg|publisher=The Wrap|date=September 10, 2013|access-date=September 14, 2013|archive-date=September 12, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130912235303/http://www.thewrap.com/miley-cyrus-wrecking-ball-breaks-vevo-record-for-most-first-day-views/|url-status=live}}</ref> The accompanying music video, which showed her swinging naked on a wrecking ball, was viewed over nineteen million times within 24 hours of its release, and drew criticism from some for allegedly [[Sexual objectification|objectifying]] Cyrus, including fellow singer [[Sin\u00e9ad O'Connor|Sin\u00e9ad O\u2019Connor]], who said that \"you will obscure your talent by allowing yourself to be pimped, whether it's the music business or yourself doing the pimping\".<ref name=wbsingle /><ref name=\"auto\"/><ref>{{Cite web |last=Garcia |first=Thania |date=August 25, 2023 |title=Miley Cyrus Addresses Sin\u00e9ad O'Connor Feud Over 'Wrecking Ball': 'I Had No Idea About the Fragile Mental State She Was In' |url=https://variety.com/2023/music/news/miley-cyrus-sinead-oconnor-feud-wrecking-ball-fragile-state-1235704732/ |access-date=September 6, 2023 |website=Variety|archive-date=September 6, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230906040029/https://variety.com/2023/music/news/miley-cyrus-sinead-oconnor-feud-wrecking-ball-fragile-state-1235704732/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Despite this, the single became Cyrus's first to top the Hot 100 in the US, and maintained the #1 spot for three weeks.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Trust |first=Gary |date=February 16, 2023 |title=Ask Billboard: Where Does 'Flowers' (Already) Rank Among Miley Cyrus' Biggest Hits? |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/chart-beat/miley-cyrus-top-songs-albums-ask-billboard-1235255167/ |access-date=September 6, 2023 |magazine=Billboard |archive-date=February 17, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230217210717/https://www.billboard.com/music/chart-beat/miley-cyrus-top-songs-albums-ask-billboard-1235255167/ |url-status=live }}</ref> It sold over two million copies.<ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5695590/miley-cyrus-wrecking-ball-swings-to-top-of-hot-100 |title=Miley Cyrus' 'Wrecking Ball' Swings Atop Hot 100 |last=Trust |first=Gary |magazine=Billboard |date=September 18, 2013 |access-date=September 18, 2013 |archive-date=September 20, 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130920000156/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5695590/miley-cyrus-wrecking-ball-swings-to-top-of-hot-100 |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\n[[File:CyrusBangerz.jpg|thumb|upright|Cyrus performing on her 2014 [[Bangerz Tour]]]]\n\nOn October 2, 2013, MTV aired the documentary ''[[Miley: The Movement]]'', that chronicled the recording of her fourth studio album ''[[Bangerz]]'',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2013/10/02/mtv-to-premiere-miley-the-movement-tonight-at-10pm-video/206431/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131002144143/http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2013/10/02/mtv-to-premiere-miley-the-movement-tonight-at-10pm-video/206431/ |url-status=dead |archive-date=October 2, 2013 |title=MTV to Premiere 'Miley: The Movement' Tonight at 10PM (Video) |publisher=TVbytheNumbers |date=October 2, 2013 |access-date=October 7, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/465684/miley-the-movement-sneak-peek-singer-says-mom-tish-cyrus-is-my-homie|title=Miley: The Movement Sneak Peek: Singer Says Mom Tish Cyrus Is My Homie|publisher=[[E! Online]]|date=October 2, 2013|access-date=October 7, 2013|archive-date=August 6, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230806033921/https://www.eonline.com/news/465684/miley-the-movement-sneak-peek-singer-says-mom-tish-cyrus-is-my-homie|url-status=live}}</ref> which was released on October 4.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/au/album/bangerz-deluxe-version/id691238659|title=iTunes \u2013 Music \u2013 Bangerz (Deluxe Version) by Miley Cyrus|publisher=iTunes Store (AU). Apple Inc|date=October 4, 2013|access-date=August 25, 2013|archive-date=October 12, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131012053819/https://itunes.apple.com/au/album/bangerz-deluxe-version/id691238659|url-status=live}}</ref> The album was a commercial success, debuting at number one on the ''Billboard'' 200 with first week sales of 270,000 copies.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5755773/miley-cyrus-bangerz-debuts-at-no-1-on-billboard-200|title=Miley Cyrus' 'Bangerz' Debuts At No. 1 On Billboard 200|last=Caulfield|first=Keith|magazine=Billboard|date=October 16, 2013|access-date=October 16, 2013|archive-date=July 1, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180701002314/https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5755773/miley-cyrus-bangerz-debuts-at-no-1-on-billboard-200|url-status=live}}</ref> On October 5, Cyrus hosted ''Saturday Night Live'' for the second time.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://guardianlv.com/2013/10/miley-cyrus-hosted-worst-snl-episode-in-recent-history/ |title=Miley Cyrus Hosted Worst SNL Episode in Recent History |publisher=Guardian Liberty Voice |date=August 13, 2013 |access-date=October 7, 2013 |archive-date=February 22, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230222215444/https://guardianlv.com/2013/10/miley-cyrus-hosted-worst-snl-episode-in-recent-history/ |url-status=live }}</ref> On November 5, Cyrus featured on rapper [[Future (rapper)|Future]]'s \"[[Real and True]]\" with [[Mr. Hudson]]; an accompanying music video premiered five days later on November 10, 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/news/2013/11/05/mtv-to-world-premiere-futures-new-music-video-real-and-true-featuring-miley-cyrus-immediately-before-2013-mtv-ema-telecast-sunday-november-10-at-655pm-et-pt-115310/20131105mtv02/|title=MTV to World Premiere Future's New Music Video \"Real & True\" Featuring Miley Cyrus Immediately Before \"2013 MTV EMA\" Telecast Sunday, November 10 at 6:55PM ET/PT|website=The Futon Critic|date=November 5, 2013|access-date=November 5, 2013|archive-date=September 12, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190912172455/http://www.thefutoncritic.com/news/2013/11/05/mtv-to-world-premiere-futures-new-music-video-real-and-true-featuring-miley-cyrus-immediately-before-2013-mtv-ema-telecast-sunday-november-10-at-655pm-et-pt-115310/20131105mtv02/|url-status=live}}</ref> In late 2013 she was declared Artist of the Year by MTV.<ref>{{cite news |agency=Associated Press |url=http://www.utsandiego.com/news/2013/dec/09/mtv-declares-miley-cyrus-its-artist-of-the-year/ |title=MTV declares Miley Cyrus its artist of the year |website=The San Diego Union-Tribune |date=December 9, 2013 |access-date=January 12, 2014 |archive-date=March 25, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150325130351/http://www.utsandiego.com/news/2013/dec/09/mtv-declares-miley-cyrus-its-artist-of-the-year/ |url-status=live }}</ref> \n\nOn January 29, 2014, she played an acoustic concert show on ''[[MTV Unplugged]]'', performing songs from ''Bangerz'' featuring a guest appearance by [[Madonna]].<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/miley-cyrus-unplugged-10-hilarious-twerkcentric-observations-20140130|title=Miley Cyrus 'Unplugged': 10 Hilarious, Twerkcentric Observations|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|access-date=January 29, 2014|date=January 29, 2014|archive-date=January 31, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140131071352/http://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/miley-cyrus-unplugged-10-hilarious-twerkcentric-observations-20140130|url-status=dead}}</ref> It became the highest-rated ''MTV Unplugged'' in the past decade, with over 1.7{{nbsp}}million streams.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://hollywoodreporter.com/earshot/miley-cyrus-uncensored-mtv-unplugged-677724|title=Miley Cyrus' Uncensored 'MTV Unplugged' Performance Released|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|access-date=February 6, 2014|date=February 6, 2014|first=Ashley|last=Lee|archive-date=June 4, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240604151100/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/music-news/miley-cyrus-uncensored-mtv-unplugged-677724/|url-status=live}}</ref> Cyrus was also featured in the [[Marc Jacobs]] Spring 2014 campaign along with [[Natalie Westling]] and Esmerelda Seay Reynolds.<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.wwd.com/media-news/fashion-memopad/marc-and-miley-7344293|access-date=April 5, 2014|date=January 9, 2014|title=Marc Jacobs Taps Miley Cyrus for Spring Campaign|first=Marc|last=Karimzadeh|journal=Women's Wear Daily|archive-date=December 17, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141217081710/http://www.wwd.com/media-news/fashion-memopad/marc-and-miley-7344293|url-status=live}}</ref> She launched her controversial [[Bangerz Tour]] (2014) that year, which was positively received by critics.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/music-arts/miley-meadowlands-show-surreal-lacks-substance-review-article-1.1745322|title=Bangerz Tour is Campy and Surreal|last=Farber|first=Jim|date=April 4, 2014|work=[[Daily News (New York)|New York Daily News]]|access-date=July 31, 2014|archive-date=April 11, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230411234558/https://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/music-arts/miley-meadowlands-show-surreal-lacks-substance-review-article-1.1745322|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://metro.co.uk/2014/02/15/miley-cyrus-bangerz-tour-kicks-off-in-canada-11-weird-moments-from-the-first-show-4305349/|title=Miley Cyrus Bangerz tour kicks off in Canada: 11 weird moments from the first show|last=Deen|first=Sarah|date=February 15, 2014|work=[[Metro International|Metro Canada]]|access-date=April 5, 2014|archive-date=April 6, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230406174429/https://metro.co.uk/2014/02/15/miley-cyrus-bangerz-tour-kicks-off-in-canada-11-weird-moments-from-the-first-show-4305349/|url-status=live}}</ref> Two months into her tour, Cyrus's [[Alaskan Klee Kai]] was found mauled to death at her home after fighting with a coyote. Two weeks later, Cyrus suffered an allergic reaction to the [[antibiotic]] [[cephalexin]], prescribed to treat a sinus infection,<ref>{{cite news|title=Miley Cyrus faces long recovery from 'extreme allergic reaction'|url=http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/17/showbiz/miley-cyrus-hospitalized/|work=CNN|last=Duke|first=Alan|date=April 18, 2014|access-date=April 29, 2014|archive-date=February 22, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230222215444/https://www.cnn.com/2014/04/17/showbiz/miley-cyrus-hospitalized/|url-status=live}}</ref> resulting in her hospitalization in [[Kansas City, Missouri|Kansas City]]. Though she rescheduled some of her US tour dates, she resumed the tour two weeks later, beginning with the European leg.<ref>{{cite web|title=Miley Cyrus leaves Kansas City for undisclosed location, still hospitalized |url=http://www.kansascity.com/2014/04/21/4974128/miley-cyrus-leaves-kansas-city.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140423222219/http://www.kansascity.com/2014/04/21/4974128/miley-cyrus-leaves-kansas-city.html |url-status=dead |archive-date=April 23, 2014 |work=The Kansas City Star |last=Gutierrez | first=Lisa |date=April 21, 2014 }}</ref>\n\nWhile collaborating with [[the Flaming Lips]] on their remake of the Beatles' ''[[Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band]]'', ''[[With a Little Help from My Fwends]]'',<ref name=\"Flaming1\">{{cite magazine |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/flaming-lips-sgt-peppers-tribute-album-out-this-fall-20140515 |title=Flaming Lips' 'Sgt. Peppers' Tribute Album Out this Fall |date=May 16, 2014 |access-date=May 16, 2014 |magazine=Rolling Stone |archive-date=May 15, 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140515155125/http://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/flaming-lips-sgt-peppers-tribute-album-out-this-fall-20140515 |url-status=dead }}</ref><ref name=\"flaming2\">{{cite news | url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2014/oct/30/flaming-lips-with-a-little-help-fwends-review | title=The Flaming Lips: With a Little Help from My Fwends review \u2013 predictable Beatles cover album | newspaper=[[The Guardian]] | date=October 30, 2014 | access-date=May 7, 2015 | last=Dennis | first=Jon | archive-date=February 22, 2023 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230222215442/https://www.theguardian.com/music/2014/oct/30/flaming-lips-with-a-little-help-fwends-review | url-status=live }}</ref> Cyrus began working with [[Wayne Coyne]] on her fifth studio album.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.etonline.com/music/156740_miley_cyrus_thought_grammy_nomination_was_a_joke_works_on_new_album_every_day/|title=Miley Cyrus Works on New Album 'Every Day,' Thought Grammy Nom Was a 'Joke'|last=Krause|first=Katie|work=Entertainment Tonight|date=January 26, 2015|access-date=February 17, 2015|archive-date=February 22, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150222011835/http://www.etonline.com/music/156740_miley_cyrus_thought_grammy_nomination_was_a_joke_works_on_new_album_every_day/|url-status=live}}</ref> She said that she was taking her time to focus on the music, and that the album would not be released until she felt it was ready.<ref name=\"Retwired\">{{cite web|url=https://people.com/tv/vmas-2014-miley-cyrus-teases-new-music-its-not-about-twerking/|title=Miley Cyrus Teases Her New Music: 'It's Not About Twerking'|last=Margaret|first=Mary|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=August 24, 2014|access-date=March 7, 2019|archive-date=April 4, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190404171527/https://people.com/tv/vmas-2014-miley-cyrus-teases-new-music-its-not-about-twerking/|url-status=live}}</ref> Coyne compared his collaborative material with Cyrus to the catalogs of [[Pink Floyd]] and [[Portishead (band)|Portishead]] and described their sound as being \"a slightly wiser, sadder, more true version\" of Cyrus's pop music output.<ref name=\"flaming3\">{{cite magazine | url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/the-flaming-lips-miley-cyrus-plot-trippy-collaborative-lp-20150504 | title=The Flaming Lips, Miley Cyrus Plot Trippy Collaborative LP | magazine=[[Rolling Stone]] | date=May 4, 2015 | access-date=May 6, 2015 | last=Reed | first=Ryan | archive-date=May 6, 2015 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150506210330/http://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/the-flaming-lips-miley-cyrus-plot-trippy-collaborative-lp-20150504 | url-status=dead }}</ref> Cyrus also worked on the films ''[[The Night Before (2015 film)|The Night Before]]'' (2015) and ''[[A Very Murray Christmas]]'' (2015) during this period; both roles were cameos.<ref>{{cite news|title=The Untitled X-Mas Project, starring Seth Rogen & Joseph Gordon Levitt, is filming at Rockefeller Center today|url=http://www.onlocationvacations.com/2015/01/05/the-untitled-x-mas-project-starring-seth-rogen-joseph-gordon-levitt-is-filming-at-rockefeller-center-today/|access-date=January 9, 2015|work=onlocationvacations.com|date=January 5, 2015|archive-date=October 22, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211022072805/https://onlocationvacations.com/2015/01/05/the-untitled-x-mas-project-starring-seth-rogen-joseph-gordon-levitt-is-filming-at-rockefeller-center-today/|url-status=live}}</ref> \n\nReports began to surface in 2015 that Cyrus was working on two albums simultaneously, one of which she hoped to release at no charge.<ref name=freealbum>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/6671437/miley-cyrus-next-album-not-a-miley-record|title=Miley Cyrus' Next Album is 'Not a Miley Record'|last=Aswad|first=Jem|magazine=Billboard|date=August 24, 2015|access-date=September 1, 2015|archive-date=August 28, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150828022321/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/6671437/miley-cyrus-next-album-not-a-miley-record|url-status=live}}</ref> This was confirmed by her manager who claimed she was willing to end her contract with RCA Records if they refused to let her release a free album.<ref name=freealbum /> Cyrus was the host of the [[2015 MTV Video Music Awards]], making her its first openly [[pansexual]] host, and gave a surprise performance of a new song \"[[Dooo It!]]\" (2015) during the show's finale.<ref>{{cite web |last=Ermac |first=Raffy |url=https://www.advocate.com/arts-entertainment/2015/08/30/young-stars-give-good-face-miley-cyrus-vmas-first-pansexual-host |title=Young Stars Give Good Face for Miley Cyrus, VMAs' First Pansexual Host |work=[[The Advocate (LGBT magazine)|The Advocate]] |date=August 30, 2015 |access-date=June 6, 2018 |archive-date=June 12, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180612145314/https://www.advocate.com/arts-entertainment/2015/08/30/young-stars-give-good-face-miley-cyrus-vmas-first-pansexual-host |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name=\"MusicalVision\">{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/09/01/arts/music/miley-cyrus-and-her-dead-petz.html|title=Inside the Making of 'Dead Petz,' Miley Cyrus's Surprise Album|last=Coscarelli|first=Joe|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=August 31, 2015|access-date=August 31, 2015|archive-date=July 26, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190726214750/https://www.nytimes.com/2015/09/01/arts/music/miley-cyrus-and-her-dead-petz.html|url-status=live}}</ref> Immediately following the performance, Cyrus announced that her fifth studio album, ''[[Miley Cyrus & Her Dead Petz]]'' (2015), was available for free streaming on [[SoundCloud]].<ref name=\"MusicalVision\" /> The album was written and produced primarily by Cyrus, and has been called [[Experimental music|experimental]] and [[psychedelic music|psychedelic]],<ref name=\"LA Times review\">{{cite web | url=https://latimes.com/entertainment/music/posts/la-et-ms-review-miley-cyrus-her-dead-petz-20150901-story.html | title='Miley Cyrus & Her Dead Petz': a wrecking ball in need of a target | website=[[Los Angeles Times]] | date=September 1, 2015 | access-date=September 3, 2015 | last=Wood | first=Mikael | archive-date=September 3, 2015 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150903222359/http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/music/posts/la-et-ms-review-miley-cyrus-her-dead-petz-20150901-story.html | url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://mashable.com/2015/09/02/miley-cyrus-dead-petz-album-review/|title=Sex, death and sadness: A look inside Miley's free 'Dead Petz' album|date=September 2, 2015|website=Mashable|access-date=September 3, 2015|archive-date=September 4, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150904093204/http://mashable.com/2015/09/02/miley-cyrus-dead-petz-album-review/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/2015-the-year-teen-pop-grew-up-20151214|title=2015: The Year Teen Pop Grew Up|magazine=Rolling Stone|access-date=January 14, 2016|date=December 14, 2015|archive-date=January 16, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160116125900/http://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/2015-the-year-teen-pop-grew-up-20151214|url-status=dead}}</ref> with elements of [[psychedelic pop]],<ref name=\"NME review\">{{cite web|url=https://www.nme.com/reviews/miley-cyrus/16231|title=NME Reviews \u2013 Miley Cyrus \u2013 'Miley Cyrus And Her Dead Petz'|last=Levine|first=Nick|work=NME|date=September 1, 2015|access-date=September 2, 2015|archive-date=September 3, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150903222815/http://www.nme.com/reviews/miley-cyrus/16231|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=\"NY Daily News review\">{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/music/miley-cyrus-dead-petz-album-review-article-1.2342757|title='Miley Cyrus & Her Dead Petz' : Album Review|last=Farber|first=Jim|work=New York Daily News|date=August 31, 2015|access-date=August 31, 2015|archive-date=September 2, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150902155447/http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/music/miley-cyrus-dead-petz-album-review-article-1.2342757|url-status=live}}</ref> [[psychedelic rock]],<ref name=\"Billboard review\">{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/review/6678826/miley-cyrus-her-dead-petz-album-review|title=Miley Cyrus Leaves Pop Behind (For Now) on
