pop]].<ref name=\"Entertainment Weekly review\">{{cite web|url=https://ew.com/article/2015/09/01/miley-cyrus-and-her-dead-petz-review|title='Miley Cyrus and Her Dead Petz' review|last=Anderson|first=Kyle|work=Entertainment Weekly.|date=September 1, 2015|access-date=September 2, 2015|archive-date=September 3, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150903181636/http://www.ew.com/article/2015/09/01/miley-cyrus-and-her-dead-petz-review|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n===2016\u20132017: ''The Voice'' and ''Younger Now''===\n[[File:170526-N-EO381-052 Miley Cyrus on Today show.jpg|thumb|upright|left|Cyrus performing on ''[[Today (American TV program)|The Today Show]]'' in 2017]]\n\nIn 2016, following the release of her fifth studio album the previous year, Cyrus resumed working on her sixth studio effort.<ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/6693000/miley-cyrus-next-album-mtv-vmas|title=What's Next for Miley Cyrus?|last=Halperin|first=Shirley|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=September 10, 2015|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150912153957/https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/6693000/miley-cyrus-next-album-mtv-vmas|archive-date=September 12, 2015|access-date=March 5, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.youthhealthmag.com/articles/32726/20160117/miley-cyrus-new-album-2016.htm|title=Miley Cyrus New Album For 2016 Confirmed? Singer Engaged Again To Liam Hemsworth?|date=January 17, 2016|work=Youth Health Magazine|access-date=July 31, 2016|archive-date=May 6, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170506083103/http://www.youthhealthmag.com/articles/32726/20160117/miley-cyrus-new-album-2016.htm|url-status=live}}</ref> She was a key advisor during the [[The Voice (U.S. season 10)|tenth season]] of the reality singing competition ''[[The Voice (American TV series)|The Voice]]''.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/7311482/miley-cyrus-the-voice-coach|title=Miley Cyrus Joining 'The Voice' as a Coach|last=Stanhope|first=Kate|magazine=Billboard|date=March 25, 2016|access-date=March 25, 2016|archive-date=April 3, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190403090616/https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/7311482/miley-cyrus-the-voice-coach|url-status=live}}</ref> In March, Cyrus had signed on as a coach for the [[The Voice (U.S. season 11)|eleventh season]] of ''The Voice'' as a replacement for [[Gwen Stefani]]; Cyrus became the youngest coach to appear in any incarnation of the series.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Iannucci|first1=Rebecca|title=''The Voice'': Miley Cyrus, Alicia Keys Confirmed as Season 11 Coaches|url=http://tvline.com/2016/03/25/the-voice-miley-cyrus-season-11-judge/|website=[[TVLine]]|access-date=March 25, 2016|location=United States|date=March 25, 2016|archive-date=August 12, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160812084823/https://tvline.com/2016/03/25/the-voice-miley-cyrus-season-11-judge/|url-status=live}}</ref> In September 2016, Cyrus co-starred in ''[[Crisis in Six Scenes]]'', a television series [[Woody Allen]] created for [[Amazon Studios]]. She played a radical activist who causes chaos in a conservative 1960s household while hiding from the police.<ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2016/09/miley-cyrus-woody-allen-amazon |title=Miley Cyrus Explains Why She's in Awe of Woody Allen: 'He's Never Fake' |magazine=Vanity Fair |date=September 16, 2016 |last=Chi |first=Paul |access-date=July 15, 2021 |archive-date=September 19, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200919133644/https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2016/09/miley-cyrus-woody-allen-amazon |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/tv/news/watch-first-clip-from-woody-allens-crisis-in-six-scenes-tv-show-w433176 |title=Watch First Clip From Woody Allen's 'Crisis in Six Scenes' TV Show |magazine=Rolling Stone |date=August 8, 2016 |last=Kreps |first=Daniel |access-date=July 15, 2021 |archive-date=September 23, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170923032103/http://www.rollingstone.com/tv/news/watch-first-clip-from-woody-allens-crisis-in-six-scenes-tv-show-w433176 |url-status=dead }}</ref> On September 17, 2016, she appeared on ''[[The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon]]'' and covered [[Bob Dylan]]'s \"Baby, I'm In the Mood for You\".<ref>{{cite web |url=https://huffingtonpost.com/entry/miley-cyrus-jimmy-fallon-donald-trump-controversy_us_57ddb5eee4b0071a6e07bf77 |title=Miley Cyrus Pauses Performance To Comment On Fallon's Trump Controversy |last=Bradley |first=Bill |website=The Huffington Post |date=September 17, 2016 |access-date=July 15, 2021 |archive-date=May 17, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170517071429/http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/miley-cyrus-jimmy-fallon-donald-trump-controversy_us_57ddb5eee4b0071a6e07bf77 |url-status=live }}</ref> Cyrus also had an uncredited voice cameo as [[Mainframe (comics)|Mainframe]] in the superhero film ''[[Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2]]'', released in May 2017.\n\nOn May 11, 2017, Cyrus released \"[[Malibu (Miley Cyrus song)|Malibu]]\" as the lead single from her sixth album.<ref>{{cite magazine|last1=Norris|first1=John|author-link1=John Norris (reporter)|title=Miley Cyrus Breaks Silence on Rootsy New Music, Fiance Liam Hemsworth & America: 'Unity Is What We Need'|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/magazine-feature/7783997/miley-cyrus-cover-story-new-music-malibu|access-date=May 4, 2017|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=May 3, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170504130342/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/magazine-feature/7783997/miley-cyrus-cover-story-new-music-malibu|archive-date=May 4, 2017|location=United States}}</ref> The single debuted at No. 64 on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100 and peaked at No. 10 on the chart on its second week.<ref>{{cite magazine|first=Gary|last=Trust|title=Hot 100 Chart Moves: Miley Cyrus Makes Waves With 'Malibu'|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/7800256/miley-cyrus-malibu-hot-100-chart-moves|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=May 18, 2017|location=United States|access-date=April 20, 2020|archive-date=March 30, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190330215428/https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/7800256/miley-cyrus-malibu-hot-100-chart-moves|url-status=live}}</ref> On June 9, Cyrus released \"[[Inspired (Miley Cyrus song)|Inspired]]\" after performing the song at the [[One Love Manchester]] benefit concert.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://pitchfork.com/news/74085-listen-to-miley-cyrus-new-song-inspired |title=Listen to Miley Cyrus' New Song \"Inspired\" |website=Pitchfork |date=June 9, 2017 |last=Strauss |first=Matthew |access-date=July 15, 2021 |archive-date=May 17, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210517031320/https://pitchfork.com/news/74085-listen-to-miley-cyrus-new-song-inspired/ |url-status=live }}</ref> It served as a promotional single from the album. On August 8, Cyrus announced that her sixth studio album would be titled ''[[Younger Now]]'' and would be released on September 29, 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mileycyrus.com/|title=Miley Cyrus|website=Miley Cyrus|access-date=August 23, 2017|archive-date=October 9, 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091009113132/http://www.mileycyrus.com/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eska.pl/news/miley_cyrus_wraca_z_younger_now_data_premiery_i_okladka_nowej_plyty_2017/144774|title=Miley Cyrus wraca z Younger Now: data premiery i ok\u0142adka nowej p\u0142yty 2017|website=Eska.pl|access-date=August 23, 2017|archive-date=June 16, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180616030726/http://www.eska.pl/news/miley_cyrus_wraca_z_younger_now_data_premiery_i_okladka_nowej_plyty_2017/144774|url-status=live}}</ref> The album's title track was released as the second single from the album on August 18 and debuted and peaked at No. 79 on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]].<ref>{{Cite magazine |url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/miley-cyrus/chart-history/hsi/ |title=Miley Cyrus - Billboard Hot 100 |magazine=Billboard |access-date=November 24, 2021 |archive-date=August 1, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180801012540/https://www.billboard.com/music/miley-cyrus/chart-history/hot-100 |url-status=live }}</ref> On August 27, Cyrus performed the track at the [[2017 MTV Video Music Awards]].<ref>{{cite magazine|first=Joyce|last=Chen|title=VMAs 2017: Watch Miley Cyrus Go Retro in 'Younger Now' Performance|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/vmas-2017-miley-cyrus-goes-retro-in-younger-now-performance-w499120|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=August 27, 2017|location=United States|access-date=September 5, 2017|archive-date=June 16, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180616030811/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/vmas-2017-miley-cyrus-goes-retro-in-younger-now-performance-w499120|url-status=dead}}</ref> On September 15, she performed \"Malibu\", \"[[Younger Now (song)|Younger Now]]\", \"[[See You Again (Miley Cyrus song)|See You Again]]\", \"[[Party in the U.S.A.]]\" and a cover of the [[Roberta Flack]] hit \"[[The First Time Ever I Saw Your Face]]\" (written by [[Ewan McColl]]) for the [[BBC Radio 1]] [[Live Lounge]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.mtv.co.uk/news/6xjg3p/miley-cyrus-returned-to-live-lounge-and-performed-see-you-again-in-the-year-2017|title=Miley Cyrus Returned To Live Lounge And Performed 'See You Again' In The Year 2017|date=September 15, 2017|work=[[MTV News]]|access-date=September 15, 2017|archive-date=March 30, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190330143454/http://www.mtv.co.uk/miley-cyrus/news/miley-cyrus-returned-to-live-lounge-and-performed-see-you-again-in-the-year-2017|url-status=live}}</ref> On October 2, as part of her one-week regular musical appearances on ''[[The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon]]'', Cyrus sang her 2009 hit single \"The Climb\" for the first time since 2011 alongside a cover of \"[[No Freedom]]\" by [[Dido (singer)|Dido]] to honor the victims of the [[2017 Las Vegas shooting|Las Vegas shooting]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Farley|first=Rebecca|title=Miley Cyrus Performed \"The Climb\" For The First Time In Years \u2014 & It Was Chilling|url=https://www.refinery29.com/en-us/2017/10/174938/miley-cyrus-fallon-las-vegas-no-freedom-the-climb|access-date=June 23, 2021|website=Refinery29|archive-date=June 24, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210624202958/https://www.refinery29.com/en-us/2017/10/174938/miley-cyrus-fallon-las-vegas-no-freedom-the-climb|url-status=live}}</ref> The former song has since been performed at multiple charity events, protests, and marches, including at the [[March for Our Lives|March For Our Lives]] demonstrations in [[Washington, D.C.]]<ref>{{Cite news|title=March For Our Lives: Miley Cyrus, Kim Kardashian & More Show Support In and Beyond D.C.|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/8258915/miley-cyrus-kim-kardashian-march-for-our-lives-tweets/|access-date=June 23, 2021|magazine=Billboard|archive-date=June 26, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210626120005/https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/8258915/miley-cyrus-kim-kardashian-march-for-our-lives-tweets/|url-status=live}}</ref> That same year, Cyrus returned as a coach in the [[The Voice (U.S. season 13)|thirteenth season]] of ''The Voice'' after taking a one-season hiatus.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2016/tv/news/the-voice-renewed-season-12-13-gwen-stefani-miley-cyrus-1201891741/|title='The Voice' Renewed Through Season 13 \u2014 Which Coaches Are Returning?|first=Elizabeth|last=Wagmeister|date=October 18, 2016|website=Variety|access-date=August 23, 2017|archive-date=March 30, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190330143504/https://variety.com/2016/tv/news/the-voice-renewed-season-12-13-gwen-stefani-miley-cyrus-1201891741/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goldderby.com/article/2017/the-voice-jennifer-hudson-miley-cyrus-coach-season-13/|title='The Voice': Jennifer Hudson, Miley Cyrus to coach in season 13|first=Paul|last=Sheehan|date=May 11, 2017|website=Goldderby.com|access-date=August 23, 2017|archive-date=February 24, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230224100847/https://www.goldderby.com/article/2017/the-voice-jennifer-hudson-miley-cyrus-coach-season-13/|url-status=live}}</ref> On October 5, 2017, Cyrus confirmed that she would not be returning to ''The Voice'' for season fourteen.<ref name=\"Miley Cyrus Leaving\">{{cite web|url=https://www.inquisitr.com/4537728/miley-cyrus-done-leaving-the-voice-wont-return-season-14/|title=Miley Cyrus Confirms She's 'Done' With 'The Voice', Won't Return For Season 14|date=October 5, 2017|access-date=November 24, 2017|archive-date=March 30, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190330154631/https://www.inquisitr.com/4537728/miley-cyrus-done-leaving-the-voice-wont-return-season-14/|url-status=live}}</ref> On October 30, 2017, Cyrus revealed she would not release any further singles from ''Younger Now'', nor would she tour for it.<ref name=mtvoct30>{{cite web|url=https://www.mtv.co.uk/news/334bo7/miley-cyrus-isnt-releasing-any-more-younger-now-singles|title=Miley Cyrus Isn't Releasing Any More 'Younger Now' Singles|work=MTV|date=October 30, 2017|access-date=November 4, 2017|archive-date=December 6, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181206172050/http://www.mtv.co.uk/miley-cyrus/news/miley-cyrus-isnt-releasing-any-more-younger-now-singles|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n===2018\u20132019: ''She Is Coming'' and ''Black Mirror''===\nBefore the release of ''Younger Now'' in September 2017, Cyrus expressed she was \"already two songs deep on the next [album].\"<ref>{{cite web|url=https://people.com/music/miley-cyrus-already-over-new-album/|title=Miley Cyrus Is Already 'Over' Her New Album: 'I Want To Figure Out What I Want to Do Next'|last=Quinn|first=Dave|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|date=September 17, 2017|access-date=November 29, 2018|archive-date=November 30, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181130030315/https://people.com/music/miley-cyrus-already-over-new-album/|url-status=live}}</ref> Producers attached to her seventh studio album included previous collaborator [[Mike Will Made It]] and new collaborators [[Mark Ronson]] and [[Andrew Wyatt]].<ref>{{cite magazine| url=https://www.billboard.com/amp/articles/news/dance/8463046/miley-cyrus-mark-ronson-wrote-song-together| title=Miley Cyrus and Mark Ronson Have a Song 'Coming Soon'| magazine=Billboard| date=June 27, 2018| access-date=August 11, 2018| archive-date=September 6, 2018| archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180906111115/https://www.billboard.com/amp/articles/news/dance/8463046/miley-cyrus-mark-ronson-wrote-song-together| url-status=live}}</ref> Her first collaboration with Ronson, \"[[Nothing Breaks Like a Heart]]\" from his 2019 album ''[[Late Night Feelings]]'', was released on November 29, 2018, to great commercial reception, especially in Europe, where it peaked at number two on the [[UK Singles Chart]] as well as in [[Ireland]] and topped the charts in several [[Eastern Europe]]an countries including [[Hungary]] or [[Croatia]].<ref>{{cite web| url=https://consequence.net/2018/11/miley-cyrus-new-single-nothing-breaks-like-a-heart/| title=Miley Cyrus to release new single \"Nothing Breaks Like a Heart\"| website=Consequence Of Sound.net| date=November 26, 2018| access-date=January 17, 2023| archive-date=January 17, 2023| archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230117015419/https://consequence.net/2018/11/miley-cyrus-new-single-nothing-breaks-like-a-heart/| url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web| url=https://www.idolator.com/7688637/miley-cyrus-release-date-nothing-breaks-like-a-heart?edge=1| title=Miley Cyrus Confirms a Release Date for \"Nothing Breaks Like a Heart\"| website=Idolator.com| date=November 26, 2018| access-date=November 29, 2018| archive-date=June 4, 2024| archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240604151248/https://www.idolator.com/7688637/miley-cyrus-release-date-nothing-breaks-like-a-heart?edge=1| url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | url=http://time.com/5338162/miley-cyrus-instagram/ | title=Miley Cyrus Just Deleted All of Her Instagram Posts | website=Time.com | access-date=November 13, 2018 | archive-date=April 11, 2023 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230411234558/https://time.com/5338162/miley-cyrus-instagram/ | url-status=live }}</ref>\n\nDuring the first quarter of 2019, Cyrus became quite notable for her cover songs.<ref>{{cite web|last=Cubit|first=Brea|date=October 19, 2020|title=19 Times Miley Cyrus Honoured Other Artists With Applause-Worthy Song Covers|url=https://www.popsugar.co.uk/node/47592839|access-date=June 23, 2021|website=POPSUGAR Entertainment UK}}</ref> Having already taken part in [[MusiCares Person of the Year]] in 2018 celebrating [[Fleetwood Mac]], she returned the year after to honor the career of her godmother [[Dolly Parton]] by performing \"[[Islands in the Stream (song)|Islands in the Stream]]\" alongside Canadian singer-songwriter [[Shawn Mendes]], with who she also performed \"[[In My Blood (Shawn Mendes song)|In My Blood]]\" a couple days later at the [[61st Grammy Awards]].<ref>{{Cite news|title=Miley Cyrus sings Dolly Parton's hit duet Islands In the Stream as tribute to the legend|url=https://www.thenews.com.pk/latest/817449-miley-cyrus-pays-tribute-to-dolly-parton-in-a-show-streamed-by-netflix|access-date=June 23, 2021|newspaper=The News International|archive-date=June 24, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210624204218/https://www.thenews.com.pk/latest/817449-miley-cyrus-pays-tribute-to-dolly-parton-in-a-show-streamed-by-netflix|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{Cite magazine|title=Miley Cyrus Joins Shawn Mendes for 'In My Blood' at 2019 Grammys|url=https://www.billboard.com/video/bbnews021019mendesgrammy-8497605|access-date=June 23, 2021|magazine=Billboard|archive-date=June 26, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210626151535/https://www.billboard.com/video/bbnews021019mendesgrammy-8497605|url-status=live}}</ref> Cyrus's other covers include her version of [[Ariana Grande]]'s \"[[No Tears Left to Cry]]\" for [[BBC Radio]]'s [[Live Lounge]], her participation at the [[Chris Cornell]] tribute concert I Am The Highway, where she sang \"As Hope & Promise Fade\" as well as her cover record of [[Elton John]]'s \"[[Don't Let the Sun Go Down on Me|Don't Let The Sun Go Down On Me]]\", included in the tribute album ''[[Revamp: Reimagining the Songs of Elton John & Bernie Taupin]].''<ref>{{Cite news|date=March 15, 2018|title=Elton John Announces Two Cover Albums Featuring Miley Cyrus, Lady Gaga and Ed Sheeran|url=https://www.eonline.com/news/920883/elton-john-announces-two-cover-albums-featuring-miley-cyrus-lady-gaga-and-ed-sheeran|access-date=June 23, 2021|agency=E!|archive-date=June 24, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210624203356/https://www.eonline.com/news/920883/elton-john-announces-two-cover-albums-featuring-miley-cyrus-lady-gaga-and-ed-sheeran|url-status=live}}</ref> Cyrus also honored John at the I'm Still Standing: A Grammy Salute to Elton John tribute concert in 2018, where she covered \"[[The Bitch Is Back]]\".<ref>{{cite web|title=Miley Cyrus version of Elton John's 'The Bitch is Back' could not be a more appropriate choice for her|publisher=Leosigh.com|date=April 6, 2018|url=https://leosigh.com/miley-cyrus-version-of-elton-johns-the-bitch-is-back-could-not-be-a-more-appropriate-choice-for-her/|access-date=June 23, 2021|archive-date=June 24, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210624203324/https://leosigh.com/miley-cyrus-version-of-elton-johns-the-bitch-is-back-could-not-be-a-more-appropriate-choice-for-her/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\n[[File:Miley Cyrus Primavera19 -231 (48986108626) (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Cyrus performing ''[[She Is Coming]]'' at [[Primavera Sound]]]]\n\nOn May 31, 2019, Cyrus tweeted that her seventh studio album would be titled ''She Is Miley Cyrus'' and would comprise three six-song EPs, which would be released before the full-length album: ''[[She Is Coming]]'' on May 31, ''She Is Here'' in the summer, and ''She Is Everything'' in the fall.<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Blistein|first=Jon|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/miley-cyrus-new-music-she-is-coming-840693/|title=Miley Cyrus Plots New Project 'She Is Coming'|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=May 27, 2019|access-date=May 27, 2019|archive-date=June 4, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190604111240/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/miley-cyrus-new-music-she-is-coming-840693/|url-status=live}}</ref> ''She Is Coming'', which also included vocal collaborations with [[RuPaul]], [[Swae Lee]], [[Mike Will Made It]] and [[Ghostface Killah]], debuted at number five on the US ''Billboard'' 200 with 36,000 album-equivalent units,<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8515077/thomas-rhett-no-1-billboard-200-albums-chart-center-point-road|title=Thomas Rhett Scores Second No. 1 on Billboard 200 Albums Chart With 'Center Point Road'|last=Caulfield|first=Keith|magazine=Billboard|date=June 9, 2019|access-date=June 10, 2019|archive-date=October 22, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191022044916/https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8515077/thomas-rhett-no-1-billboard-200-albums-chart-center-point-road|url-status=live}}</ref> while the lead single \"[[Mother's Daughter (song)|Mother's Daughter]]\" entered at number 54 on the US ''Billboard'' Hot 100.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/hughmcintyre/2019/06/15/x---katy-perry-cardi-b-and-miley-cyrus-five-important-moves-on-this-weeks-hot-100/#4ad73e7f2673|title=Katy Perry, Cardi B And Miley Cyrus: Five Important Moves On This Week's Hot 100|last=McIntyre|first=Hugh|work=Forbes|date=June 15, 2019|access-date=June 15, 2019|archive-date=July 6, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190706185529/https://www.forbes.com/sites/hughmcintyre/2019/06/15/x---katy-perry-cardi-b-and-miley-cyrus-five-important-moves-on-this-weeks-hot-100/#4ad73e7f2673|url-status=live}}</ref> The [[Wuki]] remix of \"Mother's Daughter\" received a nomination for [[Grammy Award for Best Remixed Recording, Non-Classical|Best Remixed Recording]] at the [[62nd Annual Grammy Awards]] while the original music video won two [[MTV Video Music Awards]].<ref>{{cite web|title=MTV VMAs 2020: Best Editing award goes to Miley Cyrus's 'Mother's Daughter', Internet bows to 'the queen'|url=https://meaww.com/mtv-vma-2020-best-editing-award-winner-mylie-cyrus-mothers-daughter-activists-models-women-power|access-date=June 23, 2021|website=meaww|date=August 31, 2020 |archive-date=September 30, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210930003946/https://meaww.com/mtv-vma-2020-best-editing-award-winner-mylie-cyrus-mothers-daughter-activists-models-women-power|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|date=November 23, 2020|title=Wuki|url=https://www.grammy.com/grammys/artists/wuki/252063|access-date=June 23, 2021|agency=Grammy Awards|archive-date=September 26, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210926102620/https://www.grammy.com/grammys/artists/wuki/252063|url-status=live}}</ref> Cyrus promoted the EP with a summer European tour that visited A-list festivals like [[Glastonbury Festival|Glastonbury]] and [[Primavera Sound]].<ref>{{Cite magazine|title=Miley Cyrus Performs as Ashley O, Brings Out Her Dad & Lil Nas X at Glastonbury: Watch|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/8518135/miley-cyrus-glastonbury-performance-videos/|access-date=June 23, 2021|magazine=Billboard|archive-date=June 27, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210627004955/https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/8518135/miley-cyrus-glastonbury-performance-videos/|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nCyrus starred in \"[[Rachel, Jack and Ashley Too]]\", an episode of the [[Netflix]] sci-fi series ''[[Black Mirror]]'', which was filmed in South Africa in November 2018. It was released on Netflix on June 5, 2019.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.iheart.com/content/2019-05-15-black-mirror-season-5-trailer-stars-miley-cyrus-unveils-release-date/|title='Black Mirror' Season 5 Trailer Stars Miley Cyrus, Unveils Release Date|last=Brooks|first=Hayden|publisher=iHeartRadio|date=May 15, 2019|access-date=June 15, 2019|archive-date=February 23, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230223190053/https://www.iheart.com/content/2019-05-15-black-mirror-season-5-trailer-stars-miley-cyrus-unveils-release-date/|url-status=live}}</ref> In the episode, she played fictional pop star Ashley O and voiced her [[Artificial intelligence|AI]] doll extension, Ashley Too. The plot was compared to [[Britney Spears]]'s [[conservatorship]] and the [[Free Britney|Free Britney movement]], which Cyrus has been an advocate for.<ref>{{Cite magazine|date=June 6, 2019|title=Is Miley Cyrus' 'Black Mirror' Episode Part of #FreeBritney?|url=https://www.papermag.com/miley-cyrus-black-mirror-britney-spears-2638714814.html?rebelltitem=12#rebelltitem12?rebelltitem=12|access-date=June 23, 2021|magazine=Paper|archive-date=February 23, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230223190052/https://www.papermag.com/miley-cyrus-black-mirror-britney-spears-2638714814.html?rebelltitem=12#rebelltitem12?rebelltitem=12|url-status=live}}</ref> The music video for the song \"[[On a Roll]]\" from the episode was released on June 13;<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/8516049/miley-cyrus-black-mirror-right-where-it-belongs-ashley-o-listen|title=Ashley O Is Back: Listen to New Miley Cyrus 'Black Mirror' Song 'Right Where I Belong'|last=Spruch|first=Kirsten|magazine=Billboard|date=June 13, 2019|access-date=June 15, 2019|archive-date=October 3, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211003075943/https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/8516049/miley-cyrus-black-mirror-right-where-it-belongs-ashley-o-listen/|url-status=live}}</ref> the song itself and the B-side \"Right Where I Belong\" were released to digital platforms the next day.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://music.apple.com/us/album/on-a-roll-single/1468372211|title=On a Roll &ndash; Single by Ashley O on Apple Music|publisher=Apple Inc.|date=June 14, 2019|access-date=June 15, 2019|archive-date=February 5, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230205153911/https://music.apple.com/us/album/on-a-roll-single/1468372211|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nOn June 27, it was revealed that Cyrus had collaborated with [[Ariana Grande]] and [[Lana Del Rey]] on \"[[Don't Call Me Angel]]\", the lead single of the soundtrack to the 2019 film ''[[Charlie's Angels (2019 film)|Charlie's Angels]].''<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://ew.com/music/2019/06/27/miley-cyrus-ariana-grande-lana-del-rey-charlies-angels-song/|title=Miley Cyrus, Ariana Grande, Lana Del Rey team up for Charlie's Angels theme song|magazine=Entertainment Weekly|date=June 27, 2019|access-date=July 24, 2019|archive-date=November 8, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191108023841/https://ew.com/music/2019/06/27/miley-cyrus-ariana-grande-lana-del-rey-charlies-angels-song/|url-status=live}}</ref> It was released on September 13, 2019.<ref>{{cite news |last=Garvey |first=Marianne |url=https://www.cnn.com/2019/09/13/entertainment/ariana-grande-miley-cyrus-lana-del-rey-charlies-angels/index.html |title=Ariana Grande, Miley Cyrus and Lana Del Rey release 'Don't Call Me Angel' video |work=CNN |date=September 13, 2019 |access-date=September 25, 2019 |archive-date=September 25, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190925022929/https://www.cnn.com/2019/09/13/entertainment/ariana-grande-miley-cyrus-lana-del-rey-charlies-angels/index.html |url-status=live }}</ref> In August 2019, Cyrus released \"[[Slide Away (Miley Cyrus song)|Slide Away]]\", her first song since announcing her separation from then-husband Hemsworth. The song hinted at their breakup and contained lyrics such as \"Move on, we're not 17, I'm not who I used to be\".<ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://ew.com/music/2019/08/16/miley-cyrus-releases-breakup-song-slide-away-liam-hemsworth-split/ |title=Miley Cyrus releases emotional breakup song 'Slide Away' after Liam Hemsworth split |last=Yang |first=Rachel |date=August 16, 2019 |magazine=Entertainment Weekly |access-date=August 16, 2019 |archive-date=May 28, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230528181835/https://ew.com/music/2019/08/16/miley-cyrus-releases-breakup-song-slide-away-liam-hemsworth-split/ |url-status=live }}</ref> A music video was released in September 2019 that contained further references, including a [[Standard 52-card deck|ten of hearts playing card]] at the bottom of a pool to represent the end of her decade-long relationship with Hemsworth.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.cosmopolitan.com/entertainment/celebs/a28941032/miley-cyrus-slide-away-music-video-liam-hemsworth-references-easter-eggs-fan-reactions/ |title=Fans Are Freaking Out About Miley Cyrus's \"Slide Away\" Music Video and All the Liam Hemsworth Easter Eggs |last=Barbour |first=Shannon |date=September 6, 2019 |website=Cosmopolitan |access-date=September 13, 2019 |archive-date=September 11, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190911063612/https://www.cosmopolitan.com/entertainment/celebs/a28941032/miley-cyrus-slide-away-music-video-liam-hemsworth-references-easter-eggs-fan-reactions/ |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\n===2020\u20132022: ''Plastic Hearts'' and television projects===\nOn August 14, 2020, Cyrus released the lead single from her seventh studio album, \"[[Midnight Sky]]\" and confirmed the cancellation of the EPs ''She Is Here'' and ''She Is Everything'' due to major recent changes in her life that did not fit the essence of the project, including her divorce from Hemsworth, and the burning of the couple's house during the [[Woolsey Fire]] in [[California]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Copsey|first=Rob|date=August 14, 2020|title=Miley Cyrus isn't planning to release an album any time soon: 'It doesn't make sense for me'|url=https://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/miley-cyrus-isnt-planning-to-release-an-album-any-time-soon-it-doesnt-make-sense-for-me__30761/|access-date=August 14, 2020|archive-date=September 18, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200918163101/https://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/miley-cyrus-isnt-planning-to-release-an-album-any-time-soon-it-doesnt-make-sense-for-me__30761/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Cyrus |first=Miley |date=November 12, 2018 |title=Completely devastated by the fires affecting my family. I am one of the lucky ones. My animals and... |url=https://www.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=10156917914262147&id=5845317146 |access-date=July 17, 2022 |website=Miley Cyrus on [[Facebook]] |archive-date=November 7, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231107192008/https://www.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=10156917914262147&id=5845317146 |url-status=live }}</ref> \"Midnight Sky\" became her highest-charting solo single since \"[[Malibu (Miley Cyrus song)|Malibu]]\" in 2017, peaking at number 14 on the US ''Billboard'' Hot 100. Internationally, in the United Kingdom the song has thus far peaked at number five on the [[UK Singles Chart]]. The track was later [[Mashup (music)|mashed up]] with [[Stevie Nicks]]' \"[[Edge of Seventeen]]\".<ref>{{cite web|date=November 6, 2020|title=Miley Cyrus and Stevie Nicks join forces for 'Midnight Sky/Edge of Seventeen' mash-up|url=https://www.nme.com/news/music/miley-cyrus-and-stevie-nicks-join-forces-for-midnight-sky-edge-of-seventeen-mash-up-2810466|access-date=June 23, 2021|website=NME|archive-date=June 24, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210624204519/https://www.nme.com/news/music/miley-cyrus-and-stevie-nicks-join-forces-for-midnight-sky-edge-of-seventeen-mash-up-2810466|url-status=live}}</ref> \n\nIn October, Cyrus had a third [[Backyard Sessions|Backyard Session]] on [[MTV]] and announced via Instagram that her seventh studio album ''[[Plastic Hearts]]'' would be released on November 27, 2020.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/miley-cyrus-new-album-plastic-hearts-1076491/ |title=Miley Cyrus Announces Seventh Album 'Plastic Hearts' |date=October 23, 2020 |last=Spanos |first=Brittany |access-date=October 23, 2020 |archive-date=October 25, 2020 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20201025111337/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/miley-cyrus-new-album-plastic-hearts-1076491/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Curto|first=Justin|date=October 16, 2020|title=Here's What Happened in Miley Cyrus's MTV Unplugged 'Backyard Sessions' Special|url=https://www.vulture.com/2020/10/miley-cyrus-backyard-sessions-mtv-2020.html|access-date=June 23, 2021|website=Vulture|archive-date=June 4, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230604081739/https://www.vulture.com/2020/10/miley-cyrus-backyard-sessions-mtv-2020.html|url-status=live}}</ref> It was previously intended to be called ''She Is Miley Cyrus'', completing the EP series once finalized.<ref>{{cite web|title=\"She is Miley Cyrus\", todo lo que debes saber del \u00e1lbum|url=https://www.grupolegado.com.mx/legado/MUS/She_is_Miley_Cyrus_todo_lo_que_debes_saber_del_album|access-date=June 23, 2021|website=Grupo Legado|language=es|archive-date=June 24, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210624202730/https://www.grupolegado.com.mx/legado/MUS/She_is_Miley_Cyrus_todo_lo_que_debes_saber_del_album|url-status=live}}</ref> The album was released to positive reviews from critics and performed well, debuting at number two on the Billboard 200, with 60,000 units, becoming her twelfth top ten entry on the chart. With that entry, Cyrus broke the record for attaining the most US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] top-five albums in the 21st century by a female music artist. ''Plastic Hearts'' marked a step of Cyrus into [[Rock music|rock]] and [[glam rock]] music and spawned two other singles: \"[[Prisoner (Miley Cyrus song)|Prisoner]]\" featuring English singer [[Dua Lipa]] and \"[[Angels like You]]\", which peaked at 8 and 66 respectively in the United Kingdom.<ref>{{cite web|last=Buksbaum|first=Sydney|date=November 20, 2020|title=Miley Cyrus and Dua Lipa Take a Sexy, Bloody Road Trip in 'Prisoner' Music Video|url=https://people.com/music/miley-cyrus-dua-lipa-prisoner-music-video/|access-date=November 26, 2020|website=People|archive-date=December 10, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201210053237/https://people.com/music/miley-cyrus-dua-lipa-prisoner-music-video/|url-status=live}}</ref> The album also included vocal collaborations with [[Billy Idol]] and [[Joan Jett]]. Due to popular demand and social media virality, Cyrus included the live covers of [[Blondie (band)|Blondie]]'s \"[[Heart of Glass (song)|Heart of Glass]]\" and [[The Cranberries]]' \"[[Zombie (The Cranberries song)|Zombie]]\".<ref>{{cite web|date=November 27, 2020|title=''Plastic Hearts'' by Miley Cyrus|url=https://open.spotify.com/album/5BRhg6NSEZOj0BR6Iz56fR?si=7Trihb9_QE6GQgPAGav1kA|access-date=November 27, 2020|publisher=[[Spotify]]|archive-date=August 20, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210820093704/https://open.spotify.com/album/5BRhg6NSEZOj0BR6Iz56fR?si=7Trihb9_QE6GQgPAGav1kA|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nCyrus won a [[2020 Webby Awards|2020 Webby Special Achievement Award]].<ref name=\"Kastrenakes\">{{cite web|last1=Kastrenakes|first1=Jacob|date=May 20, 2020|title=Here are all the winners of the 2020 Webby Awards|url=https://www.theverge.com/2020/5/20/21263445/2020-webby-awards-winners-lil-nas-x-nasa-jon-krasinski|access-date=May 22, 2020|website=The Verge|archive-date=October 2, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201002020426/https://www.theverge.com/2020/5/20/21263445/2020-webby-awards-winners-lil-nas-x-nasa-jon-krasinski|url-status=live}}</ref> In February 2021, Cyrus performed at the first TikTok Tailgate show in [[Tampa, Florida|Tampa]], for 7,500 [[COVID-19 vaccine|vaccinated]] healthcare workers. It served as a pre-show before [[Super Bowl LV]]. It aired on [[TikTok]] and [[CBS]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Sahadeo|first=Andy|date=January 25, 2021|title=What is the TikTok Tailgate? Everything you need to know|url=https://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/tiktok-tailgate-need-to-know|access-date=January 30, 2021|website=Fox News|archive-date=June 23, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230623171458/https://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/tiktok-tailgate-need-to-know|url-status=live}}</ref> The performance was featured in the music video for \"[[Angels like You]]\".<ref>{{cite web|last=Tuccillo|first=Andrea|date=March 9, 2021|title=Miley Cyrus releases 'Angels Like You' video with message encouraging COVID-19 vaccination|url=https://abcnews.go.com/GMA/Culture/miley-cyrus-releases-angels-video-message-encouraging-covid/story?id=76340051|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210316074558/https://abcnews.go.com/GMA/Culture/miley-cyrus-releases-angels-video-message-encouraging-covid/story?id=76340051|archive-date=March 16, 2021|access-date=April 2, 2021|publisher=[[ABC News (United States)|ABC News]]}}</ref> In March 2021, Cyrus departed RCA and signed with [[Columbia Records]], a sister label of RCA under the [[Sony Music Entertainment|Sony Music]] umbrella.<ref>{{Cite magazine|date=March 4, 2021|title=Miley Cyrus Signs With Columbia Records: Exclusive|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/9534313/miley-cyrus-columbia-records-deal/|access-date=March 4, 2021|magazine=Billboard|archive-date=August 14, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210814053846/https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/9534313/miley-cyrus-columbia-records-deal/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Aswad|first=Jem|date=March 4, 2021|title=Miley Cyrus Signs With Columbia Records|url=https://variety.com/2021/music/news/miley-cyrus-columbia-records-1234921757/|access-date=March 4, 2021|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|archive-date=March 4, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210304154310/https://variety.com/2021/music/news/miley-cyrus-columbia-records-1234921757/|url-status=live}}</ref> That same month Cyrus embraced her days as Hannah Montana and wrote an open letter to the character on social media for the show's 15th anniversary, despite all statements that her days as Montana gave Cyrus an [[identity crisis]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Miley Cyrus's Letter to Hannah Montana Is Making Us Emotional|url=https://www.teenvogue.com/story/miley-cyrus-letter-to-hannah-montana-15th-anniversary|access-date=June 23, 2021|website=Teen Vogue|date=March 25, 2021|archive-date=June 24, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210624202849/https://www.teenvogue.com/story/miley-cyrus-letter-to-hannah-montana-15th-anniversary|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Weaver|first=Hilary|date=March 6, 2021|title=Miley Cyrus Says That 'Hannah Montana' Gave Her an 'Identity Crisis'|url=https://www.elle.com/culture/celebrities/a35751744/miley-cyrus-hannah-montana-identity-crisis/|access-date=June 23, 2021|website=Elle|archive-date=June 24, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210624205354/https://www.elle.com/culture/celebrities/a35751744/miley-cyrus-hannah-montana-identity-crisis/|url-status=live}}</ref> Rumors about a possible revival of the show have been around ever since.<ref>{{cite web|last=Presley|first=James Kenneth|date=March 25, 2021|title='Hannah Montana' cast reunion: Will there be a revival of the Disney classic?|url=https://filmdaily.co/news/hannah-montana-reunion/|access-date=June 23, 2021|website=Film Daily|archive-date=June 24, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210624204434/https://filmdaily.co/news/hannah-montana-reunion/|url-status=live}}</ref> On April 23, 2021, [[The Kid Laroi]] released a remix of his single \"[[Without You (The Kid Laroi song)|Without You]]\" featuring Cyrus, her first release under Columbia Records.<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Kaufman|first=Gil|date=April 23, 2021|title=Miley Cyrus Finally Reveals When Her Kid Laroi Remix Will Drop|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/9561781/miley-cyrus-release-date-kid-laroi-remix/|magazine=Billboard|access-date=April 25, 2021|archive-date=April 25, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210425013900/https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/9561781/miley-cyrus-release-date-kid-laroi-remix/|url-status=live}}</ref> On April 3, 2021, Cyrus performed at the [[NCAA Final Four Tournament|NCAA March Madness Final Four]] in Indianapolis with the frontline health care workers in the audience.<ref>{{cite web|last=Jaipuriar|first=Rashika|title=Miley Cyrus coming to Indianapolis, NCAA Final Four to perform tribute to frontline workers|url=https://www.indystar.com/story/sports/basketball/2021/03/26/miley-cyrus-perform-march-madness-final-four/7011880002/|access-date=April 3, 2021|website=The Indianapolis Star|archive-date=April 13, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210413093951/https://www.indystar.com/story/sports/basketball/2021/03/26/miley-cyrus-perform-march-madness-final-four/7011880002/|url-status=live}}</ref> \n\nIn May 2021, Cyrus signed an overall deal with [[NBCUniversal]], including a first-look deal with her studio Hopetown Entertainment, as part of which she will develop projects for the company's outlets and star in three specials; with the first project off the deal being the ''Stand By You'' [[Pride parade|Pride]] concert special, which was released the following month on [[Peacock (streaming service)|Peacock]].<ref>{{Cite news|date=June 9, 2021|title=At Miley Cyrus' Intimate Pride Concert in Nashville, Love and Rainbows Were in the Air|url=https://consequence.net/2021/06/miley-cyrus-nashville-concert-recap-pride/|access-date=June 23, 2021|website=Consequence|archive-date=February 24, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230224100801/https://consequence.net/2021/06/miley-cyrus-nashville-concert-recap-pride/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Evans|first1=Greg|date=May 14, 2021|title=Miley Cyrus Teams With NBCUniversal For Overall Deal; Pride Concert Special Named First Project|url=https://deadline.com/2021/05/miley-cyrus-nbcuniversal-overall-deal-pride-concert-special-first-project-1234756661/|access-date=May 15, 2021|website=Deadline|archive-date=February 24, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230224100803/https://deadline.com/2021/05/miley-cyrus-nbcuniversal-overall-deal-pride-concert-special-first-project-1234756661/|url-status=live}}</ref> In June, Cyrus released a studio cover version of [[Metallica]]'s \"[[Nothing Else Matters]]\", which was included in ''[[The Metallica Blacklist]]'', a [[tribute album]] to the band's [[Metallica (album)|homonymous record]], featuring renditions recorded by various artists and released in conjunction to the original album's 30th anniversary.<ref>{{cite web|title=Metallica Covers Album to Feature Phoebe Bridgers, Moses Sumney, St. Vincent, Mac DeMarco, and More|url=https://pitchfork.com/news/metallica-covers-album-to-feature-phoebe-bridgers-moses-sumney-st-vincent-mac-demarco-and-more/|access-date=June 23, 2021|website=Pitchfork|date=June 22, 2021|archive-date=June 29, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210629162228/https://pitchfork.com/news/metallica-covers-album-to-feature-phoebe-bridgers-moses-sumney-st-vincent-mac-demarco-and-more/|url-status=live}}</ref> The track also features [[Elton John]] on the piano, [[Yo-Yo Ma]] and [[Red Hot Chili Peppers]]' [[Chad Smith]].<ref name=\"capitalfm.com\">{{cite web|title=WATCH: Miley Cyrus teases Elton John, Red Hot Chili Peppers, Metallica collaboration|url=https://www.capitalfm.com/news/miley-cyrus-collaboration-elton-john-chad-smith-metallica/|access-date=June 23, 2021|website=Capital|archive-date=June 17, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210617212532/https://www.capitalfm.com/news/miley-cyrus-collaboration-elton-john-chad-smith-metallica/|url-status=live}}</ref> The singer initially teased a Metallica cover album in October 2020 and had already performed the track live during her set at [[Glastonbury Festival 2019|Glastonbury]].<ref>{{cite web|date=October 19, 2020|title=Rick Owens and Miley Cyrus on Rock Stars, Recklessness, and Life on the Road|url=https://www.interviewmagazine.com/fashion/rick-owens-and-miley-cyrus-discuss-ufos-rock-stars-tour-bus-moncler|access-date=October 22, 2020|website=[[Interview (magazine)|Interview]]|archive-date=October 22, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201022021726/https://www.interviewmagazine.com/fashion/rick-owens-and-miley-cyrus-discuss-ufos-rock-stars-tour-bus-moncler|url-status=live}}</ref>\n\nTo promote ''Plastic Hearts'', Cyrus teased a concert tour around the album's release.<ref name=\"capitalfm.com\"/> The tour was postponed due to the pandemic but Cyrus was able to headline several music festivals in the country during summer 2021, including [[Austin City Limits Music Festival|Austin City Limits]], [[Lollapalooza]], and [[Music Midtown]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Wang|first=Jessica|date=June 16, 2021|title=Miley Cyrus Reveals Her Lower Back Tattoo, Along With New Tour Dates, With New String Bikini Pic|url=https://hollywoodlife.com/2021/06/16/miley-cyrus-back-tattoo-bikini-tour-dates-photo/|access-date=June 23, 2021|website=Hollywood Life|archive-date=June 24, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210624203204/https://hollywoodlife.com/2021/06/16/miley-cyrus-back-tattoo-bikini-tour-dates-photo/|url-status=live}}</ref> Later that year, she revealed she would tour South America [[Gypsy Heart Tour|for the first time in seven years]] in early 2022.<ref>{{cite news|date=October 28, 2021|title=Lollapalooza bringing Foo Fighters, The Strokes, Miley Cyrus & more to South America in 2022|url=https://consequence.net/2021/10/lollapalooza-argentina-and-brasil-2022-lineups/|access-date=October 30, 2021|website=Consequence|archive-date=February 24, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230224100804/https://consequence.net/2021/10/lollapalooza-argentina-and-brasil-2022-lineups/|url-status=live}}</ref> The second special off her deal with NBCUniversal was ''[[Miley's New Year's Eve Party]]'', which Cyrus co-hosted from Miami with ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' cast member [[Pete Davidson]] and also co-executive produced under her production company Hopetown Entertainment,<ref>{{cite web|last=Schneider|first=Michael|date=November 29, 2021|title=Miley Cyrus and Pete Davidson to Host New Year's Eve Special for NBC, From Exec Producer Lorne Michaels|url=https://variety.com/2021/tv/news/miley-cyrus-pete-davidson-nbc-new-years-eve-1235121419/|access-date=November 30, 2021|website=Variety|archive-date=November 29, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211129234923/https://variety.com/2021/tv/news/miley-cyrus-pete-davidson-nbc-new-years-eve-1235121419/|url-status=live}}</ref> featuring performances by Cyrus, [[24kGoldn]], [[Anitta (singer)|Anitta]], [[Billie Joe Armstrong]], [[Brandi Carlile]], [[Jack Harlow]], Kitty Cash, and [[Saweetie]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Pedersen |first=Erik |date=December 20, 2021 |title=Performers Set For NBC's Miley Cyrus-Pete Davidson New Year's Eve Special \u2013 Watch The Promo |url=https://deadline.com/2021/12/miley-cyrus-new-years-eve-performers-pete-davidson-nbc-performers-set-for-nbcs-miley-cyrus-pete-davidson-nbc-1234899932/ |access-date=December 21, 2021 |website=Deadline|archive-date=December 20, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211220235658/https://deadline.com/2021/12/miley-cyrus-new-years-eve-performers-pete-davidson-nbc-performers-set-for-nbcs-miley-cyrus-pete-davidson-nbc-1234899932/ |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\nIn February 2022, Cyrus embarked on her music festival concert tour, [[Attention Tour]], in support of ''Plastic Hearts'', which took place in [[North America|North]], [[South America|South]], and [[Central America]]. This marked her first tour to South America since her Gypsy Heart Tour in 2011. The tour concluded on March 26, 2022.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Iasimone |first=Ashley |date=March 27, 2022 |title=Miley Cyrus Tearfully Dedicates 'Angels Like You' to Taylor Hawkins at Lollapalooza Brazil |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/miley-cyrus-taylor-hawkins-angels-like-you-lollapalooza-brazil-1235049642/ |access-date=June 8, 2022 |magazine=Billboard |archive-date=May 30, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230530151602/https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/miley-cyrus-taylor-hawkins-angels-like-you-lollapalooza-brazil-1235049642/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Arena |first=Crypto com |title=Bud Light Super Bowl Music Fest: Green Day & Miley Cyrus|url=https://www.cryptoarena.com/events/detail/superbowlnusicfest-3-22 |access-date=June 8, 2022 |website=Crypto.com Arena|archive-date=May 22, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220522170911/https://www.cryptoarena.com/events/detail/superbowlnusicfest-3-22 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Miley Cyrus recovering from COVID after Latin American tour: 'It was worth it' |url=https://www.hola.com/us/celebrities/20220404331019/miley-cyrus-covid-latin-american-tour/?viewas=amp |access-date=June 8, 2022 |website=www.hola.com | date=April 4, 2022 |archive-date=May 28, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220528051145/https://www.hola.com/us/celebrities/20220404331019/miley-cyrus-covid-latin-american-tour/?viewas=amp |url-status=live }}</ref> On April 1, 2022, Cyrus released her third live album, ''[[Attention: Miley Live]]''.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Kreps |first=Daniel |date=March 27, 2022 |title=Miley Cyrus Announces First-Ever New Live Album 'Attention: Miley Live' |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/miley-cyrus-new-live-album-attention-1328145/ |magazine=Rolling Stone |access-date=June 10, 2022 |archive-date=May 29, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220529042103/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/miley-cyrus-new-live-album-attention-1328145/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Most of the album was recorded during her concert as part of the Super Bowl Music Fest at the [[Crypto.com Arena]] in Los Angeles on February 12, 2022, with the set list including songs from her albums ''Plastic Hearts'', ''Miley Cyrus & Her Dead Petz'', ''Bangerz'', ''The Time of Our Lives'', ''Breakout'', and ''Meet Miley Cyrus'', along with multiple cover songs. The album also includes two unreleased tracks\u2014\"Attention\" and \"You\". She said the album was \"curated by the fans for the fans\".<ref>{{cite web |last=Major |first=Michael |title=VIDEO: Miley Cyrus Releases 'Never Be Me' From 'ATTENTION: MILEY LIVE' Album |url=https://www.broadwayworld.com/bwwmusic/article/VIDEO-Miley-Cyrus-Releases-Never-Be-Me-From-ATTENTION-MILEY-LIVE-Album-20220330 |access-date=June 10, 2022 |website=Broadway World|archive-date=February 24, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230224100803/https://www.broadwayworld.com/bwwmusic/article/VIDEO-Miley-Cyrus-Releases-Never-Be-Me-From-ATTENTION-MILEY-LIVE-Album-20220330 |url-status=live }}</ref> Emily Swingle of ''[[Clash (magazine)|Clash]]'' gave acclaim to Cyrus's versatile vocals, saying her \"voice is truly a force to be reckoned with, seamlessly fitting whatever genre she chooses to tackle. From the playful, [[Country rap|country-hip-hop]] banger that is '4x4', to [[Hip hop music|rap]]-heavy '[[23 (Mike Will Made It song)|23]]', to the [[blues]]y, rich cover of [[Janis Joplin]]'s '[[Maybe (The Chantels song)|Maybe]]', it seems like Cyrus can fit into just about any genre she gets her paws on.\"<ref>{{cite web |title=Miley Cyrus - ATTENTION: MILEY LIVE |url=https://www.clashmusic.com/reviews/miley-cyrus-attention-miley-live |access-date=June 10, 2022 |website=Clash Magazine |date=April 7, 2022 |archive-date=June 2, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220602221549/https://www.clashmusic.com/reviews/miley-cyrus-attention-miley-live |url-status=live }}</ref> By the end of that month, Cyrus released the deluxe version of the album, which includes six additional songs including a mashup of \"Mother's Daughter\" and \"Boys Don't Cry\" featuring [[Anitta (singer)|Anitta]], that are mostly part of her time at the Lollapalooza festival in Brazil and other shows in Latin America; she commented on the addition of her single \"Angels Like You\" at her concert in Colombia in gratitude due to the song reaching the number one spot on iTunes in that country and because her fans sang the song all night outside the hotel where she was staying in Bogot\u00e1.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Rowley |first=Glenn |date=April 25, 2022 |title=Miley Cyrus Announces Deluxe Version of 'Attention: Miley Live' |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/miley-cyrus-attention-live-deluxe-album-1235063242/ |access-date=June 10, 2022 |magazine=Billboard |archive-date=April 25, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220425210103/https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/miley-cyrus-attention-live-deluxe-album-1235063242/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite tweet|number=1519744596267483139|user=MileyCyrus|title=On 4/29 I'm adding MORE songs to the #ATTENTION live album! Including Angels Like You which was added into the set the night before inspired by the fans below my hotel room in Bogota singing it ALL NIGHT LONG! Woke up to Angels being #1 in Colombia!|first=Miley|last=Cyrus}}</ref> The following month, NBC announced that ''Miley's New Year's Eve Party'' had been renewed for a second iteration set to be aired on New Year's Eve 2022\u201323.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Del Rosario |first1=Alexandra |date=May 16, 2022 |title=Miley Cyrus Returning To Host NBC's New Year's Eve Special \u2013 Upfronts August 2022, it was announced that Cyrus was set to star in a [[Christmas film|Christmas]] [[television film]] ''Dolly Parton's Mountain Magic Christmas'', produced by [[Dolly Parton]] for [[NBC]].<ref>{{cite web |last1=Porter |first1=Rick |date=August 29, 2022 |title=Dolly Parton NBC Holiday Movie Sets Cast |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\nIn December 2022, [[Morrissey]] announced that Cyrus wanted her backing vocals taken off from his upcoming record that was recorded two years earlier, but not yet released.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Willman |first=Chris |date=December 25, 2022 |title=Morrissey Says Miley Cyrus Wants Off His Next Album, and He's Split With Label and Management, Too }}</ref>\n\n===2023\u2013present: ''Endless Summer Vacation''===\nIn late 2022, Cyrus and her longtime collaborator [[Mike Will Made It]] teased new music to be released in 2023, on the latter's social media.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Garner |first=Glenn |date=November 21, 2022 |title=Miley Cyrus Is Making New Music with 'Bangerz' Producer Mike WiLL Made-It to Debut in 2023 Cyrus continued to tease a new musical era through a cryptic promotional campaign\u2014which included posters in cities around the world, countdowns on her website, and video previews\u2014with the 13, 2023, accompanied by a music video directed by [[Jacob Bixenman]].<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Mier |first=Tom\u00e1s |date=January 12, 2023 |title=Miley Cyrus Doesn't Need a Man on New Single
