|url-status=live }}</ref> In June, she guest-voiced Van in the second season of the Netflix [[adult animated]] sitcom, ''[[Human Resources (TV series)|Human Resources]]''.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Stern |first=Marlow |date=June 8, 2023 |title=See Miley Cyrus Like You've Never Seen Her Before |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/tv-movies/tv-movie-news/human-resources-netflix-miley-cyrus-never-seen-her-animation-1234766200/ |access-date=June 10, 2023 |magazine=Rolling Stone |archive-date=June 9, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230609172522/https://www.rollingstone.com/tv-movies/tv-movie-news/human-resources-netflix-miley-cyrus-never-seen-her-animation-1234766200/ |url-status=live }}</ref> An updated version of the Disney+ special, titled ''Endless Summer Vacation: Continued (Backyard Sessions)'', premiered on [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] on August 24, 2023. The day after, Cyrus released the single \"[[Used to Be Young]]\", which was included in the digital reissue of ''Endless Summer Vacation''.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Petski |first=Denise |date=August 17, 2023 |title=Miley Cyrus To Release New Song \"Used To Be Young\" With ABC Special |url=https://deadline.com/2023/08/miley-cyrus-song-used-to-be-young-release-abc-special-1235521683/ |magazine=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |access-date=August 17, 2023 |archive-date=August 24, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230824064055/https://deadline.com/2023/08/miley-cyrus-song-used-to-be-young-release-abc-special-1235521683/ |url-status=live}}</ref> The track debuted at number eight in the US.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Trust |first=Gary |date=September 5, 2023 |title=Zach Bryan & Kacey Musgraves' 'I Remember Everything' Debuts at No. 1 on Billboard Hot 100 |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/chart-beat/zach-bryan-i-remember-everything-hot-100-number-one-debut-1235405939/ |access-date=February 7, 2024 |magazine=Billboard |archive-date=September 5, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230905144226/https://www.billboard.com/music/chart-beat/zach-bryan-i-remember-everything-hot-100-number-one-debut-1235405939/ |url-status=live }}</ref> On October 20, [[Dolly Parton]] released a rock re-recording of \"Wrecking Ball\" featuring Cyrus as a guest vocalist, as the final single off her studio album ''[[Rockstar (Dolly Parton album)|Rockstar]]'' (2023).<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Aniftos |first=Rania |date=October 20, 2023 |title=Dolly Parton Reveals Why She Included 'Wrecking Ball' on Upcoming 'Rockstar' Album: 'I Love My Miley' |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/dolly-parton-miley-cyrus-wrecking-ball-rockstar-album-1235449764/ |magazine=Billboard |access-date=February 7, 2024 |archive-date=November 2, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231102205556/https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/dolly-parton-miley-cyrus-wrecking-ball-rockstar-album-1235449764/ |url-status=live }}</ref> ''Billboard'' ranked Cyrus as the ninth-best-selling musician of 2023.<ref>{{Cite magazine |date= |title=2023 Year-End Charts: Top Artists |url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/year-end/top-artists/ |access-date=March 1, 2024 |magazine=Billboard |archive-date=February 3, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240203043206/https://www.billboard.com/charts/year-end/top-artists/ |url-status=live }}</ref>\n\nAt the [[66th Annual Grammy Awards]], Cyrus received six nominations, including [[Grammy Award for Album of the Year|Album of the Year]] and [[Grammy Award for Best Pop Vocal Album|Best Pop Vocal Album]] for ''Endless Summer Vacation'', and won [[Grammy Award for Record of the Year|Record of the Year]] and [[Grammy Award for Best Pop Solo Performance|Best Pop Solo Performance]] for \"Flowers\"\u2014her first set of wins.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last1=Garcia |first1=Thania |last2=Murphy |first2=J. Kim |date=February 4, 2024 |title=Miley Cyrus Wins Her First Grammys Ever for 'Flowers' |url=https://variety.com/2024/music/news/miley-cyrus-wins-first-grammy-flowers-1235892230/ |access-date=February 9, 2024 |magazine=Variety |archive-date=February 6, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240206192337/https://variety.com/2024/music/news/miley-cyrus-wins-first-grammy-flowers-1235892230/ |url-status=live }}</ref> She appeared in a cameo role as Tiffany Plastercaster\u2014inspired by [[Cynthia Plaster Caster]]\u2014in the [[Ethan Coen]]-directed comedy road film ''[[Drive-Away Dolls]]'', released later that month.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Saperstein |first=Pat |date=February 23, 2024 |title=Who Was Cynthia Plaster Caster, Who Inspired Miley Cyrus' Character in Ethan Coen's 'Drive Away Dolls'? |url=https://variety.com/2024/film/news/who-was-cynthia-plaster-caster-miley-cyrus-drive-away-dolls-1235920770/ |access-date=February 25, 2024 |magazine=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |archive-date=February 26, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240226044606/https://variety.com/2024/film/news/who-was-cynthia-plaster-caster-miley-cyrus-drive-away-dolls-1235920770/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Her first release of 2024 was as a feature on \"[[Doctor (Work It Out)]]\" by [[Pharrell Williams]]. The song is an outtake from her fourth album ''[[Bangerz]]'' (2013); it was leaked online in 2017 and was reworked and re-recorded before being released on March 1, 2024.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Paul |first=Larisha |date=March 1, 2024 |title=Miley Cyrus and Pharrell Reunite For First Time in a Decade on 'Doctor (Work It Out)' |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/miley-cyrus-pharrell-williams-doctor-work-it-out-1234978403/ |access-date=March 1, 2024 |magazine=Rolling Stone |archive-date=March 1, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240301065418/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/miley-cyrus-pharrell-williams-doctor-work-it-out-1234978403/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Cyrus was also featured on the duet \"[[II Most Wanted]]\" from [[Beyonc\u00e9]]'s album ''[[Cowboy Carter]]''.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Viswanath |first=Jake |date=March 28, 2024 |title=Beyonc\u00e9 & Miley Cyrus' Duet \"II Most Wanted\" Is A True Ride-Or-Die Anthem |url=https://www.bustle.com/entertainment/beyonce-miley-cyrus-ii-most-wanted-lyrics-meaning-explained |access-date=March 28, 2024 |magazine=[[Bustle (magazine)|Bustle]] |archive-date=March 29, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240329062653/https://www.bustle.com/entertainment/beyonce-miley-cyrus-ii-most-wanted-lyrics-meaning-explained |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Brathwaite |first=Lester Fabian |date=March 28, 2024 |title=Beyonc\u00e9's Cowboy Carter features a Miley duet, a Beatles cover, and cameos from Dolly Parton and Willie Nelson|url=https://ew.com/beyonce-cowboy-carter-has-dolly-parton-willie-nelson-miley-cyrus-beatles-remake-8621612 |access-date=March 28, 2024 |magazine=Entertainment Weekly}}</ref> The song was released as the album's third single in April 2024,<ref>{{Cite magazine |date=April 2, 2024 |title=A Recap of Radio Add Recaps |url=https://hitsdailydouble.com/news&id=340537&title=A-RECAP-OF-RADIO-ADD-RECAPS |access-date=April 19, 2024 |magazine=[[Hits (magazine)|Hits]]}}</ref><ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Farrell |first=David |date=April 8, 2024 |title=Hozier, Beyonc\u00e9 & Miley Cyrus, The Beaches Have This Week's Hot New Radio Tracks in Canada |url=https://ca.billboard.com/business/radio/hozier-beyonce-miley-cyrus-the-beaches-have-this-week-s-hot-new-radio-tracks |access-date=April 19, 2024 |magazine=[[Billboard Canada]]}}</ref> and reached the top ten in the US, the UK, and on the Global 200.<ref>\n* {{Cite magazine |last=Trust |first=Gary |date=April 8, 2024 |title=Future, Metro Boomin & Kendrick Lamar Hold Atop Hot 100, Beyonc\u00e9 Boasts Three in Top 10 |url=https://www.billboard.com/lists/future-metro-boomin-kendrick-lamar-like-that-hot-100-number-one-second-week/ |access-date=April 19, 2024 |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]}}\n* {{Cite magazine |last=Trust |first=Gary |date=April 8, 2024 |title=Benson Boone's 'Beautiful Things' Leads Global Charts, Beyonc\u00e9, Artemas & ILLIT Hit Top 10 |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/chart-beat/benson-boone-beyonce-artemas-illit-global-charts-1235651713/ |access-date=April 19, 2024 |magazine=Billboard}}\n* {{Cite magazine |last=Brandle |first=Lars |date=April 8, 2024 |title=Beyonce's 'Texas Hold 'Em' Rebounds to No. 1 In U.K. |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/chart-beat/beyonce-texas-hold-em-rebounds-no-1-uk-1235651215/ |access-date=April 19, 2024 |magazine=Billboard}}</ref> As one of 16 acts featured on the [[Talking Heads]] tribute album ''[[Everyone's Getting Involved: A Tribute to Talking Heads' Stop Making Sense]]'', Cyrus provided a synth-driven dance-pop rendition of the band's \"[[Psycho Killer]]\". The album was released on May 17, 2024, by [[A24 Music]].<ref>{{Cite magazine |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/miley-cyrus-talking-heads-psycho-killer-cover-1235022798/|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|title=Hear Miley Cyrus' Edgy Cover of Talking Heads' 'Psycho Killer'|date=May 17, 2024|access-date=May 23, 2024|first=Emily|last=Zembler}}</ref>\n==Artistry==\n===Musical style and influence===\n{{multiple image\n| footer            = Cyrus credits singers [[Elvis Presley]] ''(left)'' and [[Britney Spears]] ''(right)'' as influences.\n| image1            = PresleyPromo1954PhotoOnly.jpg\n| alt1              = Elvis Presley\n| width1            = 143\n| image2            = Britney Spears 2013 (Straighten Crop).jpg\n| alt2              = Britney Spears\n| width2            = 110\n| align             = right\n}}\n\nMiley Cyrus has been described mainly as a [[Pop music|pop]] singer<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/miley-cyrus-mn0000551762|title=Miley Cyrus|work=[[AllMusic]]|access-date=March 12, 2023|archive-date=March 12, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230312233814/https://www.allmusic.com/artist/miley-cyrus-mn0000551762|url-status=live}}</ref> who has also developed a [[Rock music|rock]] style.<ref name=\"statenews genres\">{{cite web|first=Liz|last=Nass|url=https://statenews.com/article/2022/01/miley-cyrus-tops-the-itunes-charts?ct=content_open&cv=cbox_latest|title=Miley Cyrus trailblazes on the iTunes charts|magazine=State News|date=January 14, 2022|access-date=March 21, 2022|archive-date=March 18, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220318195232/https://statenews.com/article/2022/01/miley-cyrus-tops-the-itunes-charts?ct=content_open&cv=cbox_latest|url-status=live}}</ref> Her music has also spanned many other different genres including [[teen pop]],<ref name=\"statenews genres\"/> [[Country music|country]],<ref name=\"nytimes genres\">{{cite news|first=Lindsay|last=Zoladz|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/01/arts/music/miley-cyrus-plastic-hearts-review.html|title=Miley Cyrus Finally Embraces Her Rock 'n' Roll Heart|magazine=[[The New York Times]]|date=December 1, 2020|access-date=March 21, 2022|archive-date=December 21, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221221081401/https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/01/arts/music/miley-cyrus-plastic-hearts-review.html|url-status=live}}</ref> [[Hip hop music|hip hop]],<ref name=\"nytimes genres\"/> and [[Psychedelic music|psychedelic]].<ref name=\"nytimes genres\"/> Cyrus has cited [[Elvis Presley]] as her biggest inspiration.<ref>{{Cite video |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CV1YDqQn1WQ  |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211213/CV1YDqQn1WQ |archive-date=December 13, 2021 |url-status=live|title=Miley Cyrus Talks Malibu, Sobriety & Liam Hemsworth |publisher=Zach Sang}}{{cbignore}}</ref> She has also cited artists such as [[Madonna]], [[Lana Del Rey]], [[Dolly Parton]], [[Timbaland]], [[Whitney Houston]], [[Christina Aguilera]], [[Joan Jett]], [[Lil Kim]], [[Shania Twain]], [[Hanson (band)|Hanson]], [[OneRepublic]], and [[Britney Spears]] as influences.<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Diehl|first=Matt|title=Miley Cyrus 2.0: The Billboard Cover Story|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/1567023/miley-cyrus-20-the-billboard-cover-story|magazine=Billboard|access-date=October 3, 2013|date=June 14, 2013|archive-date=September 26, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130926015739/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/1567023/miley-cyrus-20-the-billboard-cover-story?|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|last=Ganz|first=Caryn|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/albumreviews/ultraviolence-20140620|title=Lana Del Rey: Ultraviolence|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=June 20, 2014|access-date=June 20, 2014|archive-date=June 23, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140623133054/http://www.rollingstone.com/music/albumreviews/ultraviolence-20140620|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=\"Cyrus\">{{Cite news|url=http://www.entertainmentwise.com/news/43649/miley-cyrus-aims-to-be-the-next-madonna |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080707030240/http://www.entertainmentwise.com/news/43649/miley-cyrus-aims-to-be-the-next-madonna |url-status=dead |archive-date=July 7, 2008 |title=Miley Cyrus Wants To Be The Next Madonna |date=July 4, 2008 |access-date=April 18, 2013 |last=Mander |first=Harjeet |work=Entertainment Wise }}</ref><ref name=\"Cyrus2\">{{Cite news|url=http://www.adnmundo.com/contenidos/adncool/miley_cyrus_quiere_ser_nueva_madonna_co04078.html|title=Miley Cyrus: Quiere ser la nueva Madonna|date=July 8, 2008|access-date=April 18, 2013|publisher=ADNMundo.com|language=es|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://archive.today/20130628092420/http://www.adnmundo.com/contenidos/adncool/miley_cyrus_quiere_ser_nueva_madonna_co04078.html|archive-date=June 28, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=UzitDwAAQBAJ&dq=miley+cyrus+influenced+by+whitney+houston&pg=PT119|title=She Can't Stop - Miley Cyrus: The Biography|isbn=978-1-78418-197-0|last1=Oliver|first1=Sarah|date=September 4, 2014|publisher=Kings Road|access-date=April 15, 2022|archive-date=February 6, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240206171300/https://books.google.com/books?id=UzitDwAAQBAJ&dq=miley+cyrus+influenced+by+whitney+houston&pg=PT119#v=onepage&q=miley%20cyrus%20influenced%20by%20whitney%20houston&f=false|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=\"Miley Cyrus2\">{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/showbiz/news/a107641/miley-cyrus-hopes-to-emulate-madonna.html|title=Miley Cyrus hopes to emulate Madonna|date=July 5, 2008|access-date=April 18, 2013|work=Digital Spy|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|archive-date=February 25, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150225160006/http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/showbiz/news/a107641/miley-cyrus-hopes-to-emulate-madonna.html|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200317232413/https://www.oanow.com/corner/miley-cyrus-lists-her-top-female-influences/article_793f619f-1cf1-59e6-9c50-1eda36c332ab.html|archive-date=March 17, 2020|url-status=dead|url=http://www.thecornernews.com/blogs/news_to_me/article_21a47238-e7c8-11e2-9eb9-001a4bcf6878.html|title=Miley Cyrus lists her top 5 female influences|website=Thecornernews.com|access-date=July 31, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Artists Following Miley Cyrus|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140313033803/http://www.mtv.com/artists/miley-cyrus/related-artists/?filter=influencedBy|archive-date=March 13, 2014|url-status=dead|url=http://www.mtv.com/artists/miley-cyrus/related-artists/?filter=influencedBy |website= [[MTV]]|access-date=July 8, 2016}}</ref> Since the beginning of her music career, Cyrus has been described as being predominantly a pop artist.<ref name=\"debutalbum\">{{cite web|url=http://www.commonsensemedia.org/music-reviews/hannah-montana-soundtrack |title=Hannah Montana Soundtrack \u2013 Music Review |publisher=Common Sense Media|access-date=April 29, 2013|date=June 29, 2007 }}</ref> Her ''Hannah Montana 2: Meet Miley Cyrus'' debut studio effort was characterized as sounding similar to her releases as \"Hannah Montana\" featuring a [[pop-rock]] and [[bubblegum pop]] sound.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://cinemablend.com/music/CD-Review-Hannah-Montana-2-Meet-Miley-Cyrus-4945.html |title=CD Review: Hannah Montana 2 \u2013 Meet Miley Cyrus |publisher=Cinema Blend |date=June 27, 2007 |access-date=April 29, 2013 |archive-date=July 2, 2007 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070702030255/https://cinemablend.com/music/CD-Review-Hannah-Montana-2-Meet-Miley-Cyrus-4945.html |url-status=dead }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.commonsensemedia.org/music-reviews/hannah-montana-2-meet-miley-cyrus |title=Hannah Montana 2: Meet Miley Cyrus \u2013 Music Review |publisher=Common Sense Media|access-date=April 29, 2013|date=June 29, 2007 }}</ref> Cyrus hoped that the release of ''Breakout'' (2008) would help distance her from this sound; the record featured Cyrus experimenting with various genres.<ref>{{cite news|last=Wood |first=Mikael |url=https://latimes.com/entertainment/news/music/la-et-miley-cyrus-breakout-review22-jul200822,0,7262817.story |title=Miley Cyrus' 'Breakout': A long way from Montana |website=Los Angeles Times|date=July 21, 2008 |access-date=April 29, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Phares |first=Heather |url=https://www.allmusic.com/album/breakout-mw0000790148|title=Breakout \u2013 Miley Cyrus : Songs, Reviews, Credits, Awards |website=AllMusic |date=July 22, 2008 |access-date=April 29, 2013}}</ref> Cyrus co-wrote eight songs for the album and was quoted as saying: \"I just hope this record showcases that, more than anything, I'm a [song]writer.\"<ref name=\"Serjeant, Jill\"/> The songs on her early releases feature lyrics on the topics of love and relationships.<ref name=debutalbum />\n\nCyrus possesses a [[mezzo-soprano]] [[Voice type|vocal range]],<ref>{{cite web|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151006215548/http://www.vh1.com/news/54763/snl-40-miley-cyrus-paul-simon-cover/|archive-date=October 6, 2015|url-status=live|url=https://www.vh1.com/news/01vbvr/snl-40-miley-cyrus-paul-simon-cover|title=Miley Cyrus Reminds Us She Can Seriously Sing With Paul Simon Cover On 'SNL 40'|publisher=vh1.com|access-date=February 15, 2015}}</ref> although her vocals were once described as [[alto]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/2556726/miley-cyrus-hotel-transylvania/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160331144155/http://www.mtv.com/news/2556726/miley-cyrus-hotel-transylvania/|url-status=dead|archive-date=March 31, 2016|title=Miley Cyrus Joins The Ranks Of The Be-Fanged In 'Hotel Transylvania'|website=Mtv.com|access-date=July 31, 2016}}</ref> with a \"Nashville [[Guttural vocals|twang]]\" in both her spoken and singing voice. Her voice has a distinctive raspy sound to it, similar in vein to that of [[Pink (singer)|Pink]] and [[Amy Winehouse]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Coetzee|first=Nikita|url=https://www.news24.com/channel/music/news/watch-miley-cyrus-incredible-performance-with-her-sister-for-mtv-unplugged-will-give-you-chills-20201019|title=Miley Cyrus' incredible performance with her sister for MTV Unplugged will give you chills|work=[[News24 (website)|News24]]|date=October 19, 2020|access-date=November 26, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://georgetownvoice.com/2020/11/20/miley-cyrus-tiktok-covers/|title=Miley Cyrus proves she has a voice for rock with viral TikTok covers|work=[[The Georgetown Voice]]|date=November 20, 2020|access-date=November 26, 2020}}</ref><ref name=\"EW2\" /> On \"Party in the U.S.A.\" (2009), her vocals feature [[Belt (music)|belter]] [[refrain]]s,<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/blogs/chartblog/2009/10/miley_cyrus_party_in_the_usa.shtml|title=Miley Cyrus \u2013 Party in the U.S.A.|first=Vicki|last=Lutas|work=BBC News|access-date=August 28, 2010}}</ref> while those on the song \"Obsessed\" (2009) are described as \"husky\".<ref name=\"digitalspy\">{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/music/review/a187431/miley-cyrus-the-time-of-our-lives.html|title=Miley Cyrus: 'The Time Of Our Lives'|first=Nick|last=Levine|date=November 9, 2009|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]. [[Hearst Corporation]]|access-date=October 8, 2010}}</ref> Releases such as \"The Climb\" (2009) and \"These Four Walls\" (2008) feature elements of [[country music]] and showcase Cyrus's \"twangy vocals\".<ref>{{cite web|work=The Gazette  |url=http://www.canada.com/montrealgazette/news/arts/story.html?id=488ae70a-b05d-4bce-aa26-0f3c14f2510e |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080729010848/http://www.canada.com/montrealgazette/news/arts/story.html?id=488ae70a-b05d-4bce-aa26-0f3c14f2510e |url-status=dead |archive-date=July 29, 2008 |title=CD review: Breakout, Miley Cyrus |publisher=Canada |date=July 23, 2008 |access-date=April 29, 2013 }}</ref> Cyrus experimented with an [[electropop]] sound on \"[[Fly on the Wall (song)|Fly on the Wall]]\" (2008), a genre that she would explore further with the release of ''Can't Be Tamed'' (2010), her third studio album.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/958051/miley-cyrus-summer-album-preview-2010 |title=Miley Cyrus: Summer Album Preview 2010|magazine=Billboard|date=May 26, 2010|access-date=April 29, 2013}}</ref> It was initially intended to feature [[Rock music|rock]] elements prior to its completion,<ref name=\"billboardcoverstory3\">{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/957988/miley-cyrus-the-billboard-cover-story?page=0%2C2|title=Miley Cyrus: The Billboard Cover Story|pages=3\u20134|first=Anne | last=Donahue |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=May 28, 2010|access-date=February 9, 2014}}</ref> and Cyrus claimed after its release that it could be her final pop album.<ref name=\"Hiatus\">{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1627962/miley-cyrus-covers-poisons-every-rose-has-its-thorn/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140813003140/http://www.mtv.com/news/1627962/miley-cyrus-covers-poisons-every-rose-has-its-thorn/|url-status=dead|archive-date=August 13, 2014|title=Miley Cyrus Covers Poison's 'Every Rose Has Its Thorn'|first=James | last=Dinh |publisher=[[MTV News]]. [[Viacom (2005\u2013present)|Viacom]]|date=December 9, 2009|access-date=February 9, 2014}}</ref> The album's songs speak of Cyrus's desire to achieve freedom in both her personal and professional life.<ref name=\"Hiatus\" /> She began working on ''Bangerz'' (2013) during a musical hiatus, and described the record as having a \"dirty south feel\" prior to its release.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://fistintheair.com/2012/11/10/miley-cyrus-to-make-dirty-south-hip-hop-album/ |title=Miley Cyrus to make \"Dirty South Hip Hop Album\" |publisher=Fist in the Air |date=November 10, 2012 |access-date=April 29, 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130404023936/http://fistintheair.com/2012/11/10/miley-cyrus-to-make-dirty-south-hip-hop-album/ |archive-date=April 4, 2013 |url-status=dead }}</ref> Critics noted the use of [[Hip hop music|hip hop]] and [[synthpop]] on the album.<ref name=\"BillboardReview\">{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/review/5740707/miley-cyrus-bangerz-track-by-track-review|title=Miley Cyrus, 'Bangerz': Track-By-Track Review|last=Lipshutz|first=Jason|magazine=Billboard|date=October 1, 2013|access-date=October 1, 2013}}</ref> The album's songs are placed in chronological order telling the story of her failed relationship with Liam Hemsworth.<ref>{{cite AV media|people=[[Ellen DeGeneres]], Miley Cyrus|year=2013|title=Miley Discusses Her Relationship with Liam Hemsworth|medium=[[YouTube]]|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mH3HQg5UoC0 |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211213/mH3HQg5UoC0 |archive-date=December 13, 2021 |url-status=live|access-date=October 12, 2013|time=1:06 minutes|publisher=[[The Ellen DeGeneres Show]]|location=Burbank, California}}{{cbignore}}</ref> Cyrus described ''Miley Cyrus & Her Dead Petz'' (2015) as \"a little psychedelic, but still in that [[Pop music|pop]] world\".<ref name=\"Retwired\"/> For her rock-influenced album, ''Plastic Hearts'', Cyrus cited Britney Spears and [[Metallica]] as major influences.<ref>{{cite web |title=Miley Cyrus says new album is inspired by Britney Spears and Metallica|publisher=UK Official Charts |date=September 10, 2020 |access-date=December 7, 2020|url=https://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/miley-cyrus-says-new-album-is-inspired-by-britney-spears-and-metallica__30961/}}</ref> Inspired by pop and dance-pop, ''Endless Summer Vacation'' (2023) \"feels like a recap of her career's 15-plus years, with Cyrus breezing through genres with the ease of a well-seasoned tourist.\"<ref name=\"rollingstonereview2\">{{Cite magazine |last=Johnston |first=Maura |authorlink=Maura Johnston |date=March 11, 2023 |title=Miley Cyrus Sums Up Everything She's Great At On 'Endless Summer Vacation' |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-album-reviews/miley-cyrus-sendless-summer-vacation-1234692905/ |access-date=March 11, 2023 |magazine=[[Rolling Stone]] |archive-date=March 11, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230311173548/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-album-reviews/miley-cyrus-sendless-summer-vacation-1234692905/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Cyrus related its overall concept to her affection for Los Angeles.\n\n===Stage performances===\n{{update|section|date=July 2023}}\nCyrus has become known for her controversial musical performances, including on her [[Bangerz Tour]] (2014) and [[Milky Milky Milk Tour]] (2015).<ref name=\"shock\">{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/2015/11/22/miley-cyrus-dons-yet-another-risque-outfit/|title=Miley Cyrus dons yet another risque outfit|website=[[Fox News]]|access-date=February 20, 2020}}</ref> Her performance of \"Party in the U.S.A.\" at the [[2009 Teen Choice Awards]] sparked a \"national uproar\" because of her outfit and perceived pole dancing.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/videos/news/426175/miley-cyrus-performs-party-in-the-usa.jhtml#id=1617967|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090814114057/http://www.mtv.com/videos/news/426175/miley-cyrus-performs-party-in-the-usa.jhtml#id=1617967|url-status=dead|archive-date=August 14, 2009|title=Miley Cyrus Performs 'Party in the U.S.A.'|work=MTV News. Viacom|date=August 10, 2009|access-date=August 10, 2009}}</ref><ref name=newsday>{{cite web|last=Kahn | first=Robert |url=http://www.newsday.com/entertainment/celebrities/miley-cyrus-pole-dancing-performance-sparks-criticism-1.1360720|title=Miley Cyrus' pole-dancing performance sparks criticism|work=[[Newsday]]|date=August 10, 2009|access-date=June 4, 2010}}</ref> She faced similar controversy over her performance of \"Can't Be Tamed\" (2010) on ''[[Britain's Got Talent]]'', where the singer pretended to kiss one of her female backup dancers onstage;<ref name=bgt>{{cite web|url=https://www.accessonline.com/articles/miley-cyrus-on-her-racy-britains-got-talent-performance-get-over-it-86391|title=Miley Cyrus on Her Racy 'Britain's Got Talent' Performance: 'Get Over It!'|date=June 5, 2010|website=Access Online|access-date=October 2, 2019}}</ref> she defended the performance, arguing that she did nothing wrong.<ref name=bgt /> \n\nCyrus became the subject of media and public scrutiny following her performance of \"We Can't Stop\" (2013) and \"[[Blurred Lines]]\" (2013) with Robin Thicke at the 2013 MTV Video Music Awards. Clad in a flesh-colored latex two-piece, she touched Thicke's [[crotch]] area with a giant foam finger and [[Twerking|twerked]] against his crotch.<ref>{{cite news|last=Wyatt | first=Daisy |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/news/the-tongue-the-twerking-the-teddy-outfit-should-someone-have-stopped-miley-cyrus-vma-performance-8785494.html |title=The tongue, the twerking, the teddy outfit: Should someone have stopped Miley Cyrus' VMA performance? |work=[[The Independent]]|date=August 28, 2013 |access-date=September 10, 2013 |location=London|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170305160652/http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/news/the-tongue-the-twerking-the-teddy-outfit-should-someone-have-stopped-miley-cyrus-vma-performance-8785494.html|archive-date=March 5, 2017}}</ref> The performance resulted in a media frenzy; one reviewer likened the performance to a \"bad acid trip\",<ref name=\"Hollywood Reporter\"/> while another described it as a \"trainwreck in the classic sense of the word as the audience reaction seemed to be a mix of confusion, dismay and horror in a cocktail of embarrassment\".<ref>{{cite news|title=The Most Awkward Hip-Hop Moments at MTV's 2013 Video Music Awards|last=Steiner | first=B. J. |url=http://www.xxlmag.com/news/2013/08/the-most-awkward-hip-hop-moments-at-mtvs-2013-video-music-awards/|newspaper=XXL Magazine|date=August 26, 2013|access-date=August 26, 2013}}</ref> Cyrus entered the stage of her Bangerz Tour by sliding down a slide in the shape of a tongue, and draw media attention during the tour for her unique outfits and racy performances.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/danielpapalia/2014/08/21/miley-cyrus-banned-from-performing-in-dominican-republic-ssas/|title=Miley Cyrus Banned From Performing in Dominican Republic|last=Papalia | first=Daniel |date=August 21, 2014|work=[[Forbes]]|access-date=August 22, 2014}}</ref>\n\n==Public image==\n[[File:Miley Cyrus 38th People's Choice Awards (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Cyrus at the [[38th People's Choice Awards|2012 People's Choice Awards]]]]\n\nIn the early years of her career, Cyrus had a generally wholesome image as a teen idol.<ref name=teenidol>{{cite news|last=Abramowitz | first=Rachel |url=https://www.latimes.com/archives/la-xpm-2008-may-28-et-brief28-story.html|title=All lenses are on Miley|newspaper=Los Angeles Times|date=May 28, 2008|access-date=June 4, 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120201123251/https://articles.latimes.com/2008/may/28/entertainment/et-brief28|archive-date=February 1, 2012|url-status=live}}</ref> Her fame increased dramatically in the wake of the ''Vanity Fair'' photo scandal in 2008, and it was reported that photographs of Cyrus could be sold to photo agencies for up to $2,000 per photo.<ref name=teenidol /> In subsequent years, her image continued to shift dramatically from her teen idol status.<ref name=teenidol /> In 2008, [[Donny Osmond]] wrote of Cyrus's imminent transition to adulthood: \"Miley will have to face adulthood... As she does, she'll want to change her image, and that change will be met with adversity.\"<ref>{{cite magazine|author-link=Donny Osmond|last=Osmond|first=Donny|url=http://content.time.com/time/specials/2007/article/0,28804,1733748_1733752_1734628,00.html#ixzz0pT6GawvW|title=Miley Cyrus \u2013 The 2008 TIME 100|magazine=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|date=April 30, 2009|access-date=June 4, 2010}}</ref> The release of her 2010 album ''Can't Be Tamed'' saw Cyrus officially attempting to distance herself from her teenage persona by releasing controversial music videos for her songs \"Can't Be Tamed\" and \"Who Owns My Heart\".<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/viral-videos/954643/miley-cyrus-hits-the-club-in-who-owns-my-heart-clip|title=Miley Cyrus Hits the Club in 'Who Owns My Heart' Clip|first=Megan|last=Vick|date=October 8, 2010|magazine=Billboard|access-date=October 15, 2010}}</ref><ref name=\"mtvptc\">{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1649660/20101009/cyrus__miley.jhtml|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101011121614/http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1649660/20101009/cyrus__miley.jhtml|url-status=dead|archive-date=October 11, 2010|title=Miley Cyrus 'Who Owns My Heart' Video Blasted By Parents Television Council|first=Mawuse|last=Ziegbe|date=October 9, 2010|work=MTV News|publisher=Viacom|access-date=October 15, 2010}}</ref> Her behavior throughout 2013 and 2014 sparked a substantial amount of controversy, although her godmother Dolly Parton said \"...the girl can write. The girl can sing. The girl is smart. And she doesn't have to be so drastic. But I will respect her choices. I did it my way, so why can't she do it her way?\"<ref>{{cite magazine|author-link=Dolly Parton|last=Parton|first=Dolly|url=http://time.com/70803/miley-cyrus-2014-time-100/|title=Miley Cyrus|magazine=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|date=April 23, 2014|access-date=May 2, 2014}}</ref> Liel Leibovitz at ''[[Tablet (magazine)|Tablet]]'' noted in 2013: \"Talking to the website ''Hunger'', the singer argued that those adults who deem her gyrations too sultry and her music too saccharine were simply too ancient\u2014and Jewish\u2014to get it. 'With magazines, with movies, it's always weird when things are targeted for young people yet they're driven by people that are like 40 years too old', Cyrus opined. And one group stands out in [her] mind as deserving of most of the blame: 'It can't be like this 70-year-old Jewish man that doesn\u2019t leave his desk all day, telling me what the clubs want to hear.'\"<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Leibovitz|first=Liel|url=https://www.tabletmag.com/sections/news/articles/miley-cyrus-anti-semitic-slip-is-showing/|title=Miley Cyrus' Anti-Semitic Slip Is Showing|magazine=[[Tablet (magazine)|Tablet]]|date=October 10, 2013|access-date=June 25, 2024}}</ref>\n\nCyrus was ranked number 17 on ''[[Forbes]]''{{'}}s list of the most powerful celebrities in 2014; the magazine notes that \"The last time she made our list was when she was still rolling in ''Hannah Montana'' money. Now the pop singer is all grown up and courting controversy at every turn.\"<ref name=Forbes14>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/miley-cyrus/|title= Celebrity 100 \u00bb #17 Miley Cyrus |access-date=July 1, 2014|work=[[Forbes]]}}</ref> In August 2014, her life was documented in a comic book titled ''Fame: Miley Cyrus''; it begins with her controversial 2013 MTV Video Music Awards performance and covers her Disney fame as well as exploring her childhood in Tennessee.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/celebritynews/11030138/Miley-Cyrus-life-turned-into-a-comic-book.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140814051353/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/celebritynews/11030138/Miley-Cyrus-life-turned-into-a-comic-book.html|url-status=dead|archive-date=August 14, 2014|title=Miley Cyrus' life turned into a comic book|date=August 13, 2014|website=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|access-date=August 13, 2014}}</ref> The comic book was written by Michael L. Frizell, drawn by Juan Luis Rinc\u00f3n, and is available in both print and digital formats.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1899633/miley-cyrus-comic-book/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140819100841/http://www.mtv.com/news/1899633/miley-cyrus-comic-book/|url-status=dead|archive-date=August 19, 2014|title=Miley Cyrus Is Getting Her Own Comic Book: Get A Sneak Peek|last=Blake | first=Emily |date=August 14, 2014|publisher=MTV|access-date=August 15, 2014}}</ref> In September 2010, Cyrus placed tenth on ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''{{'}}s first-ever edition of its 21 Under 21 listicle;<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/956152/21-under-21-miley-cyrus|title=21 Under 21: Miley Cyrus|date=September 23, 2010|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|access-date=August 15, 2014}}</ref> she was ranked twenty-first in 2011<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.teen.com/2011/09/28/music/billboard-21-minors-under-21-list-justin-bieber-demi-lovato-photos/#1 |title=Billboard Ranks Music's Hottest 21 Under 21! Can You Guess Who's Number 1?! (Pics) |website=teen.com |publisher=Clevver Network. |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170305190544/http://www.teen.com/2011/09/28/music/billboard-21-minors-under-21-list-justin-bieber-demi-lovato-photos/ |archive-date=March 5, 2017 |access-date=March 5, 2017}}</ref> and eighteenth in 2012.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/475072/miley-cyrus-21-under-21-2012|title=Miley Cyrus: 21 Under 21 (2012)|last=Maloy | first=Sarah |date=September 17, 2012|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|access-date=August 15, 2014}}</ref> In 2013, ''[[Maxim (magazine)|Maxim]]'' listed Cyrus as number one on their annual Hot 100 list.<ref>{{cite web|title=Miley Cyrus: Number 1 On Maxim's Hot 100|url=http://www.maxim.com/girls-of-maxim/miley-cyrus-number-1-maxims-hot-100|work=Maxim|access-date=April 7, 2014|date=May 10, 2013}}</ref> Cyrus was chosen by ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' magazine as one of the finalists for [[Time Person of the Year|Person of the Year]] in November 2013;<ref>{{cite web|title=Miley Cyrus Makes Time's Person of the Year List|url=http://www.etonline.com/music/141626_Miley_Cyrus_Makes_Time_s_Person_of_the_Year_List/|publisher=Entertainment Tonight|access-date=April 5, 2014|date=December 10, 2013|archive-date=April 21, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140421082350/http://www.etonline.com/music/141626_Miley_Cyrus_Makes_Time_s_Person_of_the_Year_List/|url-status=dead}}</ref> she came in third place with 16.3% of the staff vote.<ref>{{cite web|last=Franceschi |first=Lorenzo |url=http://mashable.com/2013/12/05/egyptian-general-time-person-year-poll/ |title=Egyptian General Trumps Miley to Win 'Time' Person of the Year Poll |publisher=Mashable|date=December 5, 2013 |access-date=January 12, 2014}}</ref> In March 2014, [[Skidmore College]] in [[New York (state)|New York]] began to offer a special topics sociology course entitled \"The Sociology of Miley Cyrus: Race, Class, Gender and Media\" which was \"using Miley as a lens through which to explore sociological thinking about identity, entertainment, media and fame\".<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/skidmore-college-offer-class-miley-cyrus/story?id=23085821/ |title=Skidmore College Will Offer a Class on Miley Cyrus |work= ABC News|date=March 27, 2014 |access-date=May 11, 2014}}</ref> In 2015, Cyrus was listed as one of the nine runners-up for ''[[The Advocate (LGBT magazine)|The Advocate]]''{{'}}s Person of the Year.<ref>{{cite web|author=<!--Not stated--> |url=http://www.advocate.com/people/2015/11/05/person-year-finalists |title=Person of the Year: The Finalists |work=The Advocate |date= November 5, 2015|access-date=November 6, 2015}}</ref> In March 2024, to commemorate the 65th anniversary of [[International Women's Day]], Cyrus was one of a number of celebrities who had their likeness turned into [[Bratz]] doll.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://exclaim.ca/music/article/sinead-o-connor-remembered-by-bratz-with-her-own-doll|title=Sin\u00e9ad O'Connor Remembered by Bratz with Her Own Doll|last=Brasil|first=Sydney|date=March 18, 2024|magazine=[[Exclaim!]]|access-date=March 18, 2024}}</ref>\n\n==Personal life==\nCyrus currently resides in [[Hidden Hills, California]], and also owns a $5.8 million home in her hometown of [[Franklin, Tennessee|Franklin]].<ref>{{cite web|last=David|first=Mark|url=https://www.dirt.com/entertainers/musicians/miley-cyrus-house-hidden-hills-1203330615/|title = Miley Cyrus Lands Back in Hidden Hills|website=Dirt.com|access-date=February 10, 2022|date = July 23, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Haggard |first1=Amanda |title=Miley Cyrus buys Franklin home for $5.8M |url=https://www.nashvillepost.com/business/development/miley-cyrus-buys-franklin-home-for-5-8m/article_8a104a2f-ff9a-5fa4-95bc-b8876ff5cbe8.html |website=[[NashvillePost.com]] |access-date=February 10, 2022 |date=August 14, 2017}}</ref> While Cyrus was raised as a [[Christians|Christian]] and identified herself as such during her childhood and early adult life,<ref name=baptized /> she includes references to [[Tibetan Buddhism]] in the lyrics to her song \"Milky Milky Milk\" (2015)<ref name=\"vftibet\">{{cite web|url=https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2015/10/miley-cyrus-naked-concert|title=Miley Cyrus Reportedly Planning Naked Concert for Art (or Something)|website=Vanityfair.com|date=October 13, 2015|access-date=December 24, 2015}}</ref> and is also influenced by [[Hindu]] beliefs.<ref>{{cite web|date=February 7, 2017|title=Miley Cyrus' Lakshmi Puja And The West's Obsession With India|url=https://www.mansworldindia.com/people/personalities/talk/miley-cyrus-lakshmi-puja-wests-obsession-india/|access-date=June 11, 2021}}</ref>\n\nSince 2019, she has been a vocally [[Voluntary childlessness|childfree]] person.<ref>{{Cite web |date=July 13, 2019 |title=Miley Cyrus Says Climate Change Has Affected Her Stance on Having Kids |url=https://www.elle.com/culture/celebrities/a28381501/miley-cyrus-climate-change-baby-plans-liam-hemsworth/ |access-date=January 27, 2024 |website=ELLE}}</ref><ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Kaufman |first=Gil |date=August 14, 2020 |title=Miley Cyrus Talks Ditching Weed, Deep Meaning Behind 'Midnight Sky' and Whether She'll Ever Marry Again |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/miley-cyrus-siriusxm-interview-sobriety-marriage-children-9434397/ |access-date=January 27, 2024 |magazine=Billboard}}</ref>\n[[File:Miley Cyrus performs at the Kids Inaugural cropped 2.jpg|left|thumb|upright|Cyrus performing at the [[Verizon Center (Washington, D.C.)|Verizon Center]] in [[Washington, D.C.]] on January 19, 2009]]\n\n===Sexuality and gender===\nCyrus [[Coming out|came out]] to her mother at age 14<ref name=\"Petrusich\">{{cite magazine|first=Amanda|last=Petrusich| title=Free to Be Miley | magazine=Paper Magazine| date=June 9, 2015 | url=http://www.papermag.com/free-to-be-miley-1427581961.html | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160107201726/http://www.papermag.com/free-to-be-miley-1427581961.html | archive-date=January 7, 2016 | url-status=dead}}</ref><ref name=\"Gordon\"/><ref name=\"celebrity.yahoo.com\">{{cite web|title = Miley Cyrus: I Told My Mom I Love Women When I Was 14| date=June 10, 2015 |url = https://celebrity.yahoo.com/blogs/celeb-news/miley-cyrus--i-told-my-mom-i-love-women-at-14-000638339.html|access-date = June 10, 2015}}</ref> and has said: \"I never want to label myself! I am ready to love anyone that loves me for who I am! I am open.\"<ref name=\"Brett Malec\">{{cite web|title=Miley Cyrus: I've Had Relationships That Weren't ''Straight, Heterosexual'' Ones|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/654205/miley-cyrus-i-ve-had-relationships-that-weren-t-straight-heterosexual-ones|publisher=[[E! Online]]|access-date=May 10, 2015|first=Brett | last=Malec |date=May 6, 2015}}</ref> In June 2015, ''Time'' magazine reported she is [[gender fluid]].<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/6598191/miley-cyrus-gender-fluid-nothing-to-do-with-any-parts |title=Miley Cyrus Says She's Gender Fluid: 'It Has Nothing To Do With Any Parts of Me' |magazine=Billboard |date=June 16, 2015 |access-date=September 5, 2015}}</ref><ref name=\"Gordon\">{{cite web|last=Gordon |first=Naomi |url=http://www.digitalspy.com/celebrity/news/a665877/miley-cyrus-opens-up-on-sexuality-im-pansexual-but-im-not-in-a-relationship.html#~pmG7ETX5OITeQL |title=Miley Cyrus opens up on sexuality: \"I'm pansexual - but I'm not in a relationship\" - Celebrity News |website=Digital Spy |date= August 28, 2015|access-date=September 5, 2015}}</ref><ref name=\"celebrity.yahoo.com\"/><ref name=\"Brett Malec\"/> She was quoted as stating she \"doesn't relate to being boy or girl, and I don't have to have my partner relate to boy or girl.\"<ref name=\"Petrusich\"/> Cyrus stated she is \"literally open to every single thing that is consenting and doesn't involve an animal and everyone is of age\".<ref name=\"Petrusich\"/>\n\nCyrus is a supporter of the [[LGBT community]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/photos/photos-from-miley-cyrus-live-in-la/1642003/4970369/photo.jhtml#4970369 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131004224430/http://www.mtv.com/photos/photos-from-miley-cyrus-live-in-la/1642003/4970369/photo.jhtml |url-status=dead |archive-date=October 4, 2013 |title=Miley dedicated 'My Heart Beats for Love' to all her gay fans.|work=MTV News. Viacom|access-date=April 29, 2013}}</ref> Her song ''My Heart Beats for Love'' (2010) was written for one of Cyrus's gay friends,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://oceanup.com/2010/06/16/miley-cyrus-i-wrote-stay-about-liam |title=Miley Cyrus, 'I Wrote 'STAY' About Liam' |publisher=Ocean Up |date=June 16, 2010 |access-date=April 29, 2013}}</ref> while she has since claimed [[London]] to be her favorite place to perform due to its extensive gay scene.<ref>{{cite news|title=Miley Cyrus: I love London because there are so many gay people|url=http://www.pinknews.co.uk/2012/12/31/miley-cyrus-i-love-london-because-there-are-so-many-gay-people/|newspaper=Pink News|access-date=January 1, 2013|last=Roberts | first=Scott |date=December 31, 2012}}</ref> Cyrus also has an [[equals sign]] tattooed on her ring finger in support of same-sex marriage.<ref>{{cite web|last=Ford |first=Rebecca |url=https://hollywoodreporter.com/news/miley-cyrus-supports-gay-marriage-217430 |title=Miley Cyrus Supports Gay Marriage With Tattoo |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=July 30, 2011 |access-date=May 14, 2015}}</ref> After her 2018 marriage to a man, Cyrus went on the record to state she still identified as [[queer]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://people.com/music/miley-cyrus-sexuality-everything-she-has-said/ |title=Everything Miley Cyrus Has Said About Her Sexuality |last=Mizoguchi |first=Karen |date=August 12, 2019 |website=People|access-date=August 16, 2019}}</ref> She founded the [[Happy Hippie Foundation]] in 2014, which works to \"Fight injustice facing [[Homelessness|homeless]] youth, LGBTQ youth and other vulnerable populations\".<ref name=\"The Happy Hippie Foundation\"/>\n\n===Veganism===\nCyrus became a [[vegan]] and stopped eating animal products in 2014.<ref name=MileyVegan>{{Cite web |last=Starostinetskaya |first=Anna |title=Miley Cyrus on Ditching Veganism: \"I Think When You Become the Face of Something, It's a Lot of Pressure.\" |url=https://vegnews.com/2020/9/miley-cyrus-on-ditching-veganism-i-think-when-you-become-the-face-of-something-it-s-a-lot-of-pressure |access-date=July 30, 2022 |website=VegNews.com}}</ref> In September 2020, Cyrus revealed on ''[[The Joe Rogan Experience]]'' that she had to switch to a [[Pescetarianism|pescatarian]] diet after suffering from [[Omega-3 fatty acids|omega-3]] deficiency, saying \"I've been a vegan for a very long time and I had to introduce fish and omegas into my life because my brain wasn't functioning properly.\"<ref name=MileyVegan/> Cyrus further revealed that she cried when eating her first fish after her vegan diet, saying \"I cried for the fish&nbsp;... it really hurts me to eat fish.\"<ref>{{Cite web |last=Leffler |first=Samantha |date=September 3, 2020 |title=Miley Cyrus Cried the 1st Time She Ate Fish After Her Vegan Diet |url=https://www.usmagazine.com/food/news/miley-cyrus-cried-the-1st-time-she-ate-fish-after-vegan-diet/ |access-date=July 30, 2022 |website=Us Weekly}}</ref> Her decision to quit being vegan sparked backlash from people in the vegan and [[vegetarian]] community, who accused Cyrus of \"spreading misinformation about omega-3\" and \"abandoning her vegan diet\".<ref>{{Cite web |title=Miley Cyrus is no longer vegan and people are fuming |url=https://www.capitalfm.com/artists/miley-cyrus/not-vegan-diet-2020/ |access-date=2024-06-09 |website=Capital |language=en}}</ref>\n\n===Cannabis use===\nCyrus has been open about her recreational use of [[Cannabis (drug)|cannabis]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Longmire|first=Becca|title=Happy Birthday Miley Cyrus! Her 21st Year In Pictures: Liam Hemsworth Split, Nakedness, Twerking, More|url=http://www.entertainmentwise.com/photos/133560/5/Happy-Birthday-Miley-Cyrus-Her-21st-Year-In-Pictures-Liam-Hemsworth-Split-Nakedness-Twerking-More|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140409171927/http://www.entertainmentwise.com/photos/133560/5/Happy-Birthday-Miley-Cyrus-Her-21st-Year-In-Pictures-Liam-Hemsworth-Split-Nakedness-Twerking-More|url-status=dead|archive-date=April 9, 2014|publisher=Entertainment Wise|access-date=November 24, 2013|date=November 23, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://abcnews.go.com/blogs/entertainment/2013/06/miley-cyrus-alcohol-more-dangerous-than-weed-2/ |title=Miley Cyrus: Alcohol More Dangerous Than Weed|work=ABC News|date=June 19, 2013 |access-date=October 7, 2013}}</ref> She told ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' in 2013 that it was \"the best drug on earth\" and called it, along with [[MDMA]], a \"happy drug\".<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/miley-cyrus-on-why-she-loves-weed-went-wild-at-the-vmas-and-much-more-20130927|title=Miley Cyrus on Why She Loves Weed, Went Wild at the VMAs and Much More|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date= September 27, 2013|last=Eells | first=John |access-date=October 8, 2013}}</ref> While accepting the Best Video Award at the [[2013 MTV Europe Music Awards]], Cyrus appeared to smoke a [[Joint (cannabis)|joint]] onstage; this was removed from the delayed broadcast of the show in the United States.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/miley-cyrus-smokes-a-joint-on-stage-at-mtv-emas/|title=Miley Cyrus smokes a joint on stage at MTV EMAs|work=[[CBS News]]|date=November 10, 2013|access-date=April 29, 2013}}</ref> In a 2014 interview with ''[[W (magazine)|W]]'' magazine, Cyrus stated \"I love weed\" and \"I just love getting stoned.\"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wmagazine.com/people/celebrities/2014/02/miley-cyrus-ronan-farrow/|title=My Oh Miley!|work=W Magazine|date=February 3, 2014|access-date=February 5, 2014|archive-date=November 10, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161110162516/http://www.wmagazine.com/people/celebrities/2014/02/miley-cyrus-ronan-farrow/|url-status=dead}}</ref> In a 2017 interview on ''[[The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon]]'', Cyrus said that she had quit cannabis before the press tour for her ''Younger Now'' album so she could be \"super clear\" when discussing the record.<ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://ew.com/tv/2017/06/15/miley-cyrus-marijuana-jimmy-fallon/ |title=Miley Cyrus Reveals Why She Quit Smoking Marijuana |last=Romano |first=Nick |date=June 17, 2017 |magazine=Entertainment Weekly|access-date=August 16, 2019}}</ref> During a 2018 interview with [[Andy Cohen (TV personality)|Andy Cohen]], she credited her mother for reintroducing her to cannabis.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/allthemoms/2018/12/10/miley-cyrus-says-mom-got-her-smoking-marijuana-again/2269110002/ |title=Miley Cyrus smoking weed again: 'My mom got me back on it' |last=Haller |first=Sonja |date=December 10, 2018 |website=USA Today|access-date=August 16, 2019}}</ref> In 2019, Cyrus sent \"Nothing Breaks Like a Heart\" collaborator [[Mark Ronson]] a cannabis bouquet from [[Lowell Herb Co]] as a [[tongue-in-cheek]] Valentine's Day gift.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.pedestrian.tv/entertainment/miley-cyrus-mark-ronson-weed-bouquet/ |title=Miley Cyrus Gave Mark Ronson A Weed Bouquet For Valentine's Day |last=Duncan |first=Alasdair |date=February 15, 2019 |website=Pedestrian TV |access-date=August 16, 2019}}</ref> She invested in the [[cannabis company]] in August.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://culturemagazine.com/miley-cyrus-and-other-stars-invest-in-cannabis-company/ |title=Miley Cyrus and Other Stars Invest in Cannabis Company |last=Adams |first=Benjamin M. |date=August 22, 2019 |website=Culture Magazine |access-date=September 15, 2019 |archive-date=June 30, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200630171633/https://culturemagazine.com/miley-cyrus-and-other-stars-invest-in-cannabis-company/ |url-status=dead }}</ref>\n\nBefore and shortly after vocal cord surgery in November 2019, Cyrus stated that she had stayed sober from the use of cannabis and [[alcohol (drug)|alcohol]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Miley Cyrus' Mom Tish Opens Up About Singer's Sobriety: 'She's the Cleanest Person I Know'|url=https://people.com/music/miley-cyrus-mom-tish-opens-up-about-singer-sobriety/|access-date=May 4, 2021|website=People}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.delish.com/just-for-fun/a29552468/miley-cyrus-sober-four-months/|title=Miley Cyrus Said She's Been Sober For Four Months: \"It's The Best I've Ever Felt\"|first=Emily|last=Dixon|date=October 22, 2019|website=Delish}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.delish.com/food-news/a33915279/miley-cyrus-vocal-surgery-sobriety/|title=Miley Cyrus Said She Got Sober After Undergoing Vocal Surgery Last Year|first=Kristin|last=Salaky|date=September 3, 2020|website=Delish}}</ref><ref>{{Cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/9444320/miley-cyrus-vocal-surgery-got-her-sober|title=Miley Cyrus Says Vocal Surgery Got Her Sober|date=September 3, 2020|magazine=Billboard}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.goodmorningamerica.com/culture/story/miley-cyrus-reveals-sobriety-journey-influenced-song-72374179|title=Miley Cyrus reveals how her sobriety journey influenced her new song|website=Good Morning America}}</ref>\n\n===Relationships===\nCyrus has said that she dated singer-actor [[Nick Jonas]] from June 2006 to December 2007,<ref>{{cite web|title=Joe Jonas Confirms Nick and Miley Dating|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1614365/joe-jonas-confirms-nick-miley-dating.jhtml|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121105222222/http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1614365/joe-jonas-confirms-nick-miley-dating.jhtml|url-status=dead|archive-date=November 5, 2012|publisher=[[MTV News]]. Viacom.|access-date=April 29, 2014}}</ref> claiming they were \"in love\" and began dating soon after they first met.<ref>{{cite web|title=Miley Cyrus Says She and Nick Jonas Were 'In Love'|url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/2008/08/07/miley-cyrus-says-and-nick-jonas-were-in-love/|publisher=[[Fox News]]|access-date=August 8, 2008|date=August 7, 2008}}</ref> Their relationship attracted considerable media attention.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1591633/miley-cyrus-super-sorry-for-mocking-demi-lovato-selena-gomez-in-video/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141108002954/http://www.mtv.com/news/1591633/miley-cyrus-super-sorry-for-mocking-demi-lovato-selena-gomez-in-video/|url-status=dead|archive-date=November 8, 2014|title=Miley Cyrus 'Super Sorry' For Mocking Demi Lovato, Selena Gomez In Video|website=Mtv.com|access-date=July 31, 2016}}</ref> Cyrus was in a nine-month relationship with model [[Justin Gaston]] from 2008 to 2009.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.chicagotribune.com/news/ct-xpm-2009-06-10-0906090336-story.html|title=Miley Cyrus, Justin Gaston post to Twitter about their breakup|newspaper=Chicago Tribune|date=June 10, 2009|access-date=May 30, 2019}}</ref> While filming ''The Last Song'', Cyrus began an [[on-again, off-again relationship]] with her co-star [[Liam Hemsworth]] in 2009.<ref name=\"Fisher, Luchina\">{{cite web|title=Liam Hemsworth: Five Things to Know About Miley's Man|url=https://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/things-mileys-man-liam-hemsworth/story?id=16003401|work=[[ABC News (United States)|ABC News]]|access-date=May 2, 2014|last=Fisher | first=Luchina |date=March 26, 2012}}</ref> During the breakups, Cyrus was romantically linked to actors [[Lucas Till]] (2009) and [[Josh Bowman]] (2011).<ref name=\"vulture\">{{cite web |url=https://www.vulture.com/2019/08/miley-cyrus-liam-hemsworth-relationship-timeline.html |title=Miley Cyrus, Liam Hemsworth, and All the People Who Orbited Their Decade-Long Relationship |last=Haylock |first=Zoe |date=August 13, 2019 |website=Vulture.com |access-date=August 15, 2019}}</ref> Cyrus and Hemsworth were first engaged from May 2012 until September 2013.<ref>{{cite news|title=Miley Cyrus engaged to 'Hunger Games' star|url=http://www.cnn.com/2012/06/06/showbiz/miley-cyrus-engaged/|work=CNN|access-date=April 7, 2014|date=June 9, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Heller|first=Corinne|title=Miley Cyrus, Liam Hemsworth end engagement (Confirmed)|url=http://www.ontheredcarpet.com/Miley-Cyrus--Liam-Hemsworth-end-engagement-Confirmed/9250360|publisher=On the Red Carpet|access-date=April 7, 2014|date=September 16, 2013}}</ref> She has also dated actor [[Patrick Schwarzenegger]] (2014\u20132015) and model [[Stella Maxwell]] (2015).<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.elle.com/culture/music/a12505661/miley-cyrus-shes-not-him-lyrics-liam-hemsworth-stella-maxwell-lyrics/|title=All the Liam Hemsworth and Stella Maxwell References in Miley Cyrus's \"She's Not Him\" Lyrics|last=Bailey|first=Alyssa|work=Elle|date=September 29, 2017|access-date=May 30, 2019}}</ref><ref name=\"Fisher, Luchina\"/><ref>{{cite web|last=Saad|first=Nardine|title=Miley Cyrus, Patrick Schwarzenegger reportedly call it quits|date=April 21, 2015|website=[[Los Angeles Times]]|url=https://latimes.com/entertainment/gossip/la-et-mg-miley-cyrus-patrick-schwarzenegger-split-break-up-20150421-story.html|access-date=July 10, 2015}}</ref>\n\nCyrus and Hemsworth rekindled their relationship in March 2016,<ref>{{cite news|last=Ledbetter|first=Carly|title=Dolly Parton Confirms Miley Cyrus And Liam Hemsworth Are Back On|date=March 9, 2016|newspaper=The Huffington Post|url=https://huffingtonpost.com/entry/dolly-parton-miley-cyrus-back-on_us_56e022bae4b065e2e3d4319f|access-date=May 28, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=B. Kile|first=Meredith|title=Miley Cyrus and Liam Hemsworth Attend 'Huntsman' Premiere Together, Fans Freak Out|date=April 11, 2016|publisher=[[Entertainment Tonight]]|url=http://www.etonline.com/news/186541_miley_cyrus_and_liam_hemsworth_attend_huntsman_premiere_together_fans_freak_out/ |access-date=May 28, 2016}}</ref> and became re-engaged that October.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/entertainthis/2016/10/27/miley-cyrus-liam-hemsworth-engagement-ring-ellen-degeneres-show/92827846/|title=Finally! Miley Cyrus addresses her engagement ring from Liam Hemsworth on 'Ellen'|newspaper=USA Today|access-date=October 27, 2016}}</ref> In November 2018, Cyrus and Hemsworth's home burned down in the [[Woolsey Fire]] in [[California]].<ref name=\":3\">{{cite web | url=https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=10156917914262147&id=5845317146&_ft_=mf_story_key.10156917914262147 | title=Miley Cyrus| website=[[Facebook]]}}</ref><ref>{{Cite tweet|number=1061862918281515009|user=MileyCyrus|title=Completely devestated by the fires affecting my community. I am one of the lucky ones. My animals and LOVE OF MY LIFE made it out safely & that's all that matters right now. My house no longer stands but the memories shared with family & friends stand strong. I am grateful for|date=November 12, 2018|author=Miley Ray Cyrus|access-date=March 18, 2019}}</ref> On December 23, Cyrus and Hemsworth married in a private wedding ceremony in their home in [[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/miley-cyrus-liam-hemsworth-are-married-1171589|title=Miley Cyrus and Liam Hemsworth Are Married|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=December 26, 2018}}</ref> She felt that her marriage \"[redefined] what it looks like for someone that's a queer person like [herself] to be in a hetero relationship\" though she was \"still very sexually attracted to women\". Cyrus indicated that the ceremony was \"kind of out of character for [her]\" because \"[they have] worn rings forever [and] definitely didn't need it in any way\". She believed the loss of their home to be the catalyst for getting married, citing that \"the timing felt right\" and that \"no one is promised the next day, or the next, so [she tries] to be 'in the now' as much as possible\".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.elle.com/culture/celebrities/a26443527/miley-cyrus-on-liam-hemsworth-marriage/|title=Miley Cyrus Explains Why She and Liam Hemsworth Got Married Even Though She Felt She 'Didn't Need' To|last=Bailey|first=Alyssa|work=Elle|date=February 21, 2019|access-date=May 30, 2019}}</ref> On August 10, 2019, Cyrus announced their separation;<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.teenvogue.com/story/miley-cyrus-liam-hemsworth-reportedly-split-up|title=Miley Cyrus and Liam Hemsworth Have Reportedly Split Up|last=Elizabeth|first=De|date=August 10, 2019|access-date=August 10, 2019}}</ref> eleven days later, Hemsworth filed for divorce, citing \"irreconcilable differences\",<ref>{{cite web|url=https://people.com/music/liam-hemsworth-files-divorce-miley-cyrus/|title=Liam Hemsworth Files for Divorce from Miley Cyrus After 7 Months of Marriage|magazine=People|first=Jeff|last=Nelson|date=August 21, 2019|access-date=August 21, 2019}}</ref> and their divorce was finalized on January 28, 2020.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/wireStory/miley-cyrus-liam-hemsworth-single-divorce-finalized-68595531|title=Miley Cyrus, Liam Hemsworth single again, divorce finalized|website=ABC News|access-date=January 28, 2020}}</ref>\n\nAfter announcing her separation from Hemsworth, she dated Kaitlynn Carter from August to September 2019.<ref>{{cite web|title=Miley Cyrus Spotted Kissing Kaitlynn Carter in Italy|url=https://www.etonline.com/miley-cyrus-spotted-kissing-brody-jenners-ex-kaitlynn-carter-in-italy-see-the-pda-packed-pics|access-date=August 19, 2020|website=Entertainment Tonight|date=August 10, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|last1=Gonzales|first1=Erica|last2=Sanchez|first2=Chelsey|date=September 26, 2019|title=Miley Cyrus Is Reportedly \"Looking Forward to Being Single\"|url=https://www.harpersbazaar.com/celebrity/latest/a28678451/miley-cyrus-kaitlynn-carter-relationship/|access-date=August 19, 2020|magazine=Harper's BAZAAR}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Carter|first=Kaitlynn|date=November 4, 2019|title=Kaitlynn Carter Opens Up About Her Summer of Self-Discovery|url=https://www.elle.com/culture/celebrities/a29646191/kaitlynn-carter-miley-cyrus-relationship-essay/|access-date=August 19, 2020|website=Elle}}</ref> In October 2019, Cyrus began dating Australian singer [[Cody Simpson]], a longtime friend.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.news.com.au/entertainment/celebrity-life/hook-ups-break-ups/cody-simpson-confirms-relationship-with-passionate-miley-cyrus/news-story/3e83ecbbd7553138c97937794af14f34|title= Cody Simpson confirms relationship with 'passionate' Miley Cyrus|website=News.com.au|last=Coy|first=Bronte|date=October 15, 2019}}</ref> In August 2020, Cyrus announced that she and Simpson had split up.<ref>{{cite web|last=Weaver|first=Hilary|date=August 15, 2020|title=Why Miley Cyrus and Cody Simpson's Relationship 'Fizzled Out'|url=https://www.elle.com/culture/a33612620/miley-cyrus-cody-simpson-breakup-reason/|access-date=August 19, 2020|website=Elle}}</ref> Her announcement coincided with the release of her single \"[[Midnight Sky]]\", which was inspired by her breakups with Hemsworth, Carter, and Simpson.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/new-miley-cyrus-song-declares-i-dont-belong-to-anyone-just-hours-after-cody-simpson-split-054151259.html|title=New Miley Cyrus song declares 'I don't belong to anyone' just hours after Cody Simpson split|date=August 14, 2020|website=Yahoo! Entertainment|publisher=Yahoo|access-date=August 14, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200814215019/https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/new-miley-cyrus-song-declares-i-dont-belong-to-anyone-just-hours-after-cody-simpson-split-054151259.html|archive-date=August 14, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Ryan|first=Patrick|title=Miley Cyrus gets personal on new disco-inspired song 'Midnight Sky,' shares self-directed video|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/music/2020/08/14/miley-cyrus-midnight-sky-new-song-video/3370913001/|access-date=August 19, 2020|website=USA Today}}</ref><ref>{{Cite magazine|date=August 14, 2020|title=She's Here: Miley Cyrus Drops 'Midnight Sky' Single & Video|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/9433998/miley-cyrus-midnight-sky-single-video|access-date=August 19, 2020|magazine=Billboard}}</ref> Cyrus began dating musician Maxx Morando in 2021, who also worked as a producer on her album ''Endless Summer Vacation'' (2023).<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Gibson |first=Kelsie |date=February 7, 2024 |title=Who Is Miley Cyrus' Boyfriend? All About Maxx Morando |url=https://people.com/music/maxx-morando-facts-dating-miley-cyrus/ |access-date=April 19, 2024 |magazine=People}}</ref><ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Park |first=Sabrina |date=February 4, 2024 |title=Who Is Miley Cyrus's Boyfriend, Maxx Morando? |url=https://www.harpersbazaar.com/celebrity/latest/a43272763/who-is-miley-cyrus-new-boyfriend-maxx-morando/ |access-date=April 19, 2024 |magazine=[[Harper's Bazaar]]}}</ref>\n\n==Philanthropy==\nThroughout her career Cyrus has sung on several charity singles such as: \"[[Just Stand Up!]]\", \"[[Send It On (Disney song)|Send It On]]\", \"[[Everybody Hurts (Helping Haiti song)|Everybody Hurts]]\" and \"[[We Are the World 25 for Haiti]]\".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1593043/20080819/carey_mariah.jhtml|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080828040741/http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1593043/20080819/carey_mariah.jhtml|url-status=dead|archive-date=August 28, 2008|title=Mariah Carey, Beyonce, Fergie, Miley Cyrus, More Collaborate On Cancer Benefit Single|last=Kaufman|first=Gil|date=August 19, 2008|work=MTV News. Viacom.|access-date=August 20, 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1608455/20090403/cyrus__miley.jhtml|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090406015055/http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1608455/20090403/cyrus__miley.jhtml|url-status=dead|archive-date=April 6, 2009|title=Miley Cyrus And Nick Jonas Hook Up For Charity|first=Gil|last=Kaufman|date=April 3, 2009|work=MTV News. Viacom.|access-date=November 11, 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/8492058.stm|title=Haiti all-star charity single gets first airplay |work=BBC News|date=February 2, 2010|access-date=February 2, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.usatoday.com/life/music/news/2010-02-15-wearetheworld15_ST_N.htm |title=Quincy Jones, Lionel Richie pass 'We Are the World' baton |last=Gundersen | first=Edna |website=[[USA Today]] |date=February 14, 2010 |access-date=February 15, 2010}}</ref> She is an avid supporter of the [[City of Hope National Medical Center]] in California, having attended benefit concerts in 2008, 2009 and 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wdrb.com/story/8814486/the-walt-disney-company-is-presenting-miley-cyrus-jonas-brothers-and-demi-lovato-in-a-special-concert-to-benefit-city-of-hope-on-september-14|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140808035714/http://www.wdrb.com/story/8814486/the-walt-disney-company-is-presenting-miley-cyrus-jonas-brothers-and-demi-lovato-in-a-special-concert-to-benefit-city-of-hope-on-september-14|url-status=dead|archive-date=August 2008|publisher=WDRB|access-date=July 31, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url= https://www.accessonline.com/articles/miley-cyrus-jesse-mccartney-and-demi-lovato-to-perform-at-concert-for-hope-benefit-77416|title=Miley Cyrus, Jesse McCartney And Demi Lovato To Perform At Concert For Hope Benefit|date=October 16, 2009|work=Access Online|access-date=October 2, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vh1.com/celebrity/2012-10-11/the-singers-big-gown-showdown-miley-cyrus-vs-jordin-sparks-vs-britney-spears/ |archive-date=October 15, 2012 |title=The Singer's Big Gown Showdown: Miley Cyrus Vs.
