Britney Spears |last=Muttoo | first=Ambika |date=October 11, 2012 |publisher=[[VH1]] }}</ref> In 2008 and 2009, during her Best of Both Worlds and Wonder World Tours, for every concert ticket sold, she donated one dollar to the organization.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cityofhope.org/about/publications/news/Pages/miley-cyrus-demi-lovato-and-jesse-mccartney-perform-benefit-concert-for-city-of-hope-on-october-25.aspx |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090928075257/http://www.cityofhope.org/about/publications/news/Pages/miley-cyrus-demi-lovato-and-jesse-mccartney-perform-benefit-concert-for-city-of-hope-on-october-25.aspx |url-status=dead |archive-date=September 28, 2009 |title=Miley Cyrus, Demi Lovato and Jesse McCartney to perform at second annual Concert for Hope presented by Staples, Inc., October 25 at Nokia Theatre L.A. LIVE |date=September 22, 2009 |access-date=October 8, 2009 |publisher=[[City of Hope National Medical Center]] }}</ref> Cyrus celebrated her 16th birthday at Disneyland by delivering a [[US$]]1{{nbsp}}million donation from Disney to [[Youth Service America]].<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://variety.com/2008/tv/news/miley-cyrus-sha-19457/|title=Miley Cyrus: Sharing her 'Sweet 16\u2032 fun at Disneyland|date=October 6, 2008|magazine=Variety|access-date=August 1, 2014}}</ref> In July 2009, Cyrus performed at the [[Elizabeth Glaser Pediatric AIDS Foundation]]'s 20th annual '' Time for Heroes'' celebrity picnic<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.looktothestars.org/news/2574-miley-cyrus-to-give-her-time-for-heroes|title=Miley Cyrus To Give Her Time For Heroes|date=May 26, 2009|publisher=Look to the Stars|access-date=July 31, 2014}}</ref> and donated several items including autographed merchandise, and a script from ''Hannah Montana'' for the Ronald McDonald House Auction.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chattanoogan.com/2009/7/21/155294/Miley-Cyrus-Donates-Items-For-Ronald.aspx|title=Miley Cyrus Donates Items For Ronald McDonald House Auction|date=July 21, 2009|publisher=Chattanoogan|access-date=August 1, 2014}}</ref> \n\nCyrus has supported charities including the [[Elton John AIDS Foundation]], [[Entertainment Industry Foundation]], [[Habitat for Humanity]], [[United Service Organizations]], Youth Service America and [[Music for Relief]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.looktothestars.org/charity/elton-john-aids-foundation|title=Elton John AIDS Foundation Celebrity Supporters & Events|publisher=Look to the Stars|access-date=July 31, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.looktothestars.org/charity/entertainment-industry-foundation|title=Entertainment Industry Foundation Celebrity Supporters & Events|publisher=Look to the Stars|access-date=July 31, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.looktothestars.org/charity/habitat-for-humanity|title=Habitat For Humanity Celebrity Supporters & Events|publisher=Look to the Stars|access-date=July 31, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.looktothestars.org/charity/muhammad-ali-parkinson-center|title=Muhammad Ali Parkinson Center Celebrity Supporters & Events|publisher=Look to the Stars|access-date=July 31, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.looktothestars.org/charity/united-service-organization|title=United Service Organization Celebrity Supporters & Events|publisher=Look to the Stars|access-date=July 31, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://act.mtv.com/posts/miley-cyrus-says-get-your-good-on-encourages-youth-volunteerism/|title=Miley Cyrus Says 'Get Your Good On,' Encourages Youth Volunteerism|last=Walker|first=Caroline|date=July 5, 2011|work=MTV News. Viacom|access-date=July 31, 2014|archive-date=August 9, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140809181111/http://act.mtv.com/posts/miley-cyrus-says-get-your-good-on-encourages-youth-volunteerism/|url-status=dead}}</ref>  In January 2010, Cyrus posted the final video to her ''mileymandy'' YouTube Account.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.youtube.com/user/mileymandy | title=Mileymandy - YouTube | website=[[YouTube]] }}</ref> In the video, Cyrus promoted support for ''[[To Write Love on Her Arms (film)|To Write Love on Her Arms]]'',<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rNLR41afZsQ | title=TWLOHA | website=[[YouTube]] | date=January 20, 2010 }}</ref><ref>{{cite tweet |url=https://twitter.com/twloha/status/8021909563 |title=Miley Cyrus asks her fans to help TWLOHA win $1 million for suicide prevention |user=TWLOHA |number=8021909563 |date=January 21, 2010 |access-date=July 18, 2022}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.seventeen.com/celebrity/music/news/a6613/miley-cyrus-supports-to-write-love-on-her-arms/ | title=Miley Cyrus Supports to Write Love on Her Arms | date=January 22, 2010 }}</ref> and he next day appeared in a promotional video for the film with [[Joaquin Phoenix]], and [[Liv Tyler]].<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tzX6XXVEa4s | title=MILEY CYRUS TEACHES JOAQUIN PHOENIX & LIV TYLER How to Vote for TWLOHA and Suicide Prevention | website=[[YouTube]] | date=January 22, 2010 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.looktothestars.org/video/199-miley-cyrus-teaches-joaquin-phoenix-and-liv-tyler-how-to-support-twloha-com |title=Miley Cyrus Teaches Joaquin Phoenix and Liv Tyler How To Support TWLOHA.com |publisher=Look to the Stars |access-date=July 2, 2022}}</ref>  In February 2010, she donated several items, including the dress she wore to the [[52nd Annual Grammy Awards]], and two tickets to the Hollywood premiere of her film ''The Last Song'', to raise money for the victims of the [[2010 Haiti earthquake]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/showbiz/news/a200707/miley-cyrus-auctions-grammy-dress-for-haiti.html#~oLCiyn4qZ3SGbQ|title=Miley Cyrus auctions Grammy dress for Haiti|last=Martin | first=Lara |date=February 1, 2010|website=[[Digital Spy]]|access-date=July 31, 2014}}</ref> In April 2010, Cyrus, working with the [[Make-A-Wish Foundation]], performed for and met with 29 children at [[The Grove at Farmers Market]] in Los Angeles, California.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zDBH9S4Mfc4 | title=Miley Cyrus Makes Memorable Day for 29 Wish Kids for World Wish Day\u00ae 2010 | website=[[YouTube]] | date=April 10, 2011 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o8AAQeieXmo | title=Miley Cyrus Performs \"The Climb\" at Make-A-Wish\u00ae Celebration for World Wish Day | website=[[YouTube]] | date=April 30, 2010 }}</ref> Cyrus continued to support The Make-A-Wish Foundation, and met with at least 150 children.<ref name=\"youtube1\">{{cite web | url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=veo4U5omHZY | title=MIley Cyrus Talks About Being a Make-A-Wish\u00ae Wish Granter | website=[[YouTube]] | date=April 23, 2012 }}</ref>\n\n[[File:Miley Cyrus at Kids' Inaugural 3 cropped.jpg|thumb|upright|Cyrus performing at the Kids Inaugural: We Are the Future concert in 2009]]\n\nIn January 2011, Cyrus met an ailing fan with [[spina bifida]] with the charity [[Kids Wish Network]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kidswishnetwork.org/2011/02/kids-wish-network-and-miley-cyrus-grant-wish-to-ailing-boy-with-spina-bifida/ |title=Kids Wish Network and Miley Cyrus Grant Wish to Ailing Boy with Spina Bifida |date=January 25, 2011 |publisher=[[Kids Wish Network]] |access-date=July 31, 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140812052614/http://kidswishnetwork.org/2011/02/kids-wish-network-and-miley-cyrus-grant-wish-to-ailing-boy-with-spina-bifida/ |archive-date=August 12, 2014 }}</ref> In April 2011, she appeared in a commercial for the [[American Red Cross]] asking people to pledge $10 to help those affected by the [[2011 T\u014dhoku earthquake and tsunami]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.redcrossyouth.org/2011/04/14/miley-cyrus-psa-japan-relief/|title=Miley Cyrus PSA: Japan Relief|date=April 14, 2014|publisher=Red Cross|access-date=August 1, 2014}}</ref> That same year, [[Hilary Duff]] presented Cyrus with the first-ever Global Action Youth Leadership Award at the first Annual Global Action Awards Gala for her support of [[Blessings in a Backpack]], an organization that works to feed hungry children in schools, and her personal ''Get Ur Good On'' campaign with the Youth Services of America. Cyrus stated: \"I want (kids) to do something they love. Not something that seems like a chore because someone tells them that's the right thing to do or what their parents want or what's important to people around them, but what's in their heart.\"<ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.contactmusic.com/news/cyrus-honoured-with-youth-award_1202984|title=Miley Cyrus \u2013 Cyrus Honoured With Youth Award|author=Wenn|magazine=Contactmusic|date=February 20, 2011|access-date=May 21, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/miley-cyrus-honored-with-youth-leadership-award/|title=Miley Cyrus honored with youth leadership award|last=Lee | first=Joyce |work=[[CBS News]]|date=February 22, 2011|access-date=May 21, 2014}}</ref> In December 2011, she appeared in a commercial for the charity [[J/P Haitian Relief Organization]], and teamed up with her elder brother Trace Cyrus to design a limited-edition T-shirt and hoodie for charity. All proceeds from the sale of these items went to her charity, Get Ur Good On, which supports education for under-privileged children.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AyIGaIIp9lE |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211213/AyIGaIIp9lE |archive-date=December 13, 2021 |url-status=live|title=Miley Cyrus J P HRO Super Give Away [Help Haiti Home]|website=[[YouTube]]|date=December 17, 2011|access-date=July 31, 2014}}{{cbignore}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/the-hook/464800/miley-cyrus-designs-t-shirt-with-brother|title=Miley Cyrus Designs T-Shirt With Brother|last=DelliCarpini | first=Gregory Jr. |date=December 29, 2011|magazine=Billboard|access-date=August 1, 2014}}</ref> That month, she performed \"The Climb\" at the ''CNN Heroes: An All-Star Tribute'' at the Shrine Auditorium in Los Angeles.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.edition.cnn.com/2011/11/30/living/cnnheroes-preview/|title=An awards show unlike any other|last=Almond | first=Kyle |date=December 12, 2011|work=CNN|access-date=August 1, 2014}}</ref>\n\nIn 2012, Cyrus released a cover version of Bob Dylan's \"[[You're Gonna Make Me Lonesome When You Go]]\" with Johnzo West for the charity [[Amnesty International]] as a part of the album ''[[Chimes of Freedom (album)|Chimes of Freedom]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.amnestyusa.org/news/multimedia/miley-cyrus-featuring-johnzo-west-you-re-gonna-make-me-lonesome-when-you-go|title=NMiley Cyrus featuring Johnzo West - 'You're Gonna Make Me Lonesome When You Go'|date=April 30, 2015|publisher=[[Amnesty International]]|access-date=August 7, 2016}}</ref> She also appeared in a commercial for the [[Rock the Vote]] campaign, which encouraged young people to make their voices heard by voting in the 2012 federal election.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://popdust.com/2012/09/19/miley-cyrus-rock-the-vote-campaign-election-2012-video/|title=Miley Cyrus and Her New Hair Encourage You to Vote in This Year's Election|last=Exton | first=Emily |date=September 19, 2012|publisher=Popdust|access-date=July 11, 2014}}</ref> For her 20th birthday, activists at [[People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals]] (PETA) adopted a pig called Nora in her name.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=http://www.contactmusic.com/news/miley-cyrus-thanks-fans-for-birthday-fundraising_3388301|title=Miley Cyrus \u2013 Miley Cyrus Thanks Fans For Birthday Fundraising|author=Wenn|magazine=Contactmusic|date=November 25, 2012|access-date=May 21, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/showbiz/news/a440762/miley-cyrus-thanks-fans-for-birthday-fundraising.html#~oEU6EYoSCAxTxyIn|title=Miley Cyrus thanks fans for birthday fundraising|first1=Zeba|last1=Blay|website=[[Digital Spy]]|date=November 26, 2012|access-date=May 21, 2014}}</ref> Cyrus also supports 39 well-known charities, including [[Make-a-Wish Foundation]], [[Cystic Fibrosis Foundation]], [[St. Jude Children's Research Hospital|St.&nbsp;Jude's Children's Research Hospital]], [[To Write Love on Her Arms]], [[NOH8 Campaign]], [[Love Is Louder Than the Pressure to Be Perfect]] and [[The Jed Foundation]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.noh8campaign.com/article/miley-cyrus-teams-up-with-noh8-and-takes-a-stand-for-equality|title=Miley Cyrus teams up with NOH8 and takes a stand for Equality!|publisher=[[NOH8 Campaign]]|date=December 29, 2011|access-date=July 11, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.seventeen.com/health/tips/celebs-say-love-is-louder#slide-2|title=Celebs Say \"Love Is Louder...\"|last=Zellner | first=Maggie |work=[[Seventeen (American magazine)|Seventeen]]|access-date=July 11, 2014|date=July 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Love is Louder with Demi Lovato|url=http://www.seventeen.com/health/tips/celebs-say-love-is-louder|last=Zellner | first=Maggie |work=[[Seventeen (American magazine)|Seventeen]]|access-date=July 11, 2014|date=July 2011}}</ref> In 2013, Cyrus was named the fourteenth-most-charitable celebrity of the year by [[Do Something]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.latinpost.com/articles/5221/20131226/top-20-celebrities-giving-charity-taylor-swift-justin-bieber-miley.htm|title=Top 20 Celebrities Giving to Charity: Taylor Swift, Justin Bieber, and Miley Cyrus Head List|last=Harding | first=Scharon |publisher=Latin Post|date=December 26, 2013|access-date=May 20, 2014}}</ref> She also appeared with Justin Bieber and [[Pitbull (rapper)|Pitbull]] in a television special entitled ''The Real Change Project: Artists for Education''.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/1555963/justin-bieber-miley-cyrus-pitbull-team-for-educational-tv-special|title=Justin Bieber, Miley Cyrus & Pitbull Team For Educational TV Special|last=Ng | first=Philiana |magazine=Billboard|date=April 4, 2013|access-date=May 20, 2014}}</ref> On August 28, 2014, Miley appeared alongside [[Justin Timberlake]] at an [[HIV/AIDS]] charity event in the White House.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.missuniversusa.com/miss-universe-will-meet-barack-obama/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140808042531/http://missuniversusa.com/miss-universe-will-meet-barack-obama/|url-status=dead|archive-date=August 8, 2014|title=Miss Universe will meet Barack Obama|date=July 26, 2014|publisher=Miss Universe USA|access-date=July 31, 2014}}</ref>\n\nAt the [[2014 MTV Video Music Awards]], Cyrus won [[MTV Video Music Award for Video of the Year|Video of the Year]] for her song ''Wrecking Ball''. Instead of accepting the award herself, she invited a 22-year-old homeless man by the name of Jesse to collect it on her behalf; she had met him at My Friend's Place, an organization that helps homeless youth find shelter, work, health care, and education. His acceptance speech urged musicians to learn more about youth homelessness in Los Angeles through Cyrus's [[Facebook]] page.<ref>{{cite web|first1=Rheana|last1=Murray|title=Entertainment Meet the Homeless Man Who Accepted Miley Cyrus' VMA Award|url=https://abcnews.go.com/US/meet-homeless-man-accepted-miley-cyrus-vma-award/story?id=25114619|work=ABC News|access-date=August 25, 2014|date=August 25, 2014}}</ref> Cyrus then launched a [[Prizeo]] campaign to raise funds for the charity; those who made donations were entered into a sweepstake for a chance to meet Cyrus on her Bangerz Tour in [[Rio de Janeiro]] that September.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/08/25/arts/music/miley-cyrus-steals-video-music-awards-again-this-time-by-staying-in-her-seat.html|title=VMAs 2014: Miley Cyrus Causes a Stir Again, This Time by Staying in Her Seat|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=August 25, 2014 |access-date=December 24, 2015|last1=Barnes |first1=Brooks }}</ref> In early 2015, Cyrus teamed up with [[MAC Cosmetics]] to launch her own branded Viva Glam lipstick, with proceeds to the [[Mac AIDS Fund]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.indiatvnews.com/lifestyle/news/miley-cyrus-to-launch-her-lipstick-for-mac-charity-3956.html|title=Miley Cyrus collaborates with a cosmetic brand to raise money for HIV charity|work=India TV|access-date=November 24, 2020}}</ref>\n\nIn June 2017, Cyrus performed at [[One Love Manchester]], a televised benefit concert organized by [[Ariana Grande]] following the [[Manchester Arena bombing]] on her concert two weeks earlier.<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Smirke|first=Richard|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/7817617/one-love-manchester-concert-ariana-grande-bravery-resilience|title=Bravery, Resilience Shine as Ariana Grande Leads All-Star Benefit Concert for Victims of Manchester Bombing|magazine=Billboard|date=June 4, 2017}}</ref> During an appearance on ''[[The Ellen DeGeneres Show]]'' in August 2017, Cyrus said that she would donate $500,000 to [[Hurricane Harvey]] relief efforts.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.eonline.com/news/877028/miley-cyrus-moved-to-tears-over-hurricane-harvey-and-donates-500-000-to-flood-relief-efforts|title=Miley Cyrus Moved to Tears Over Hurricane Harvey and Donates $500,000 to Flood Relief Efforts|work=[[E!]]|access-date=November 24, 2020}}</ref> In August 2019, she performed at the Sunny Hill Festival in [[Kosovo]], a festival to raise funds to help people with financial difficulties there, created by [[Dua Lipa]] and her father.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.etonline.com/dua-lipa-on-why-it-was-so-special-to-have-miley-cyrus-perform-at-her-sunny-hill-festival-in-kosovo|title=Dua Lipa on Why It Was So Special to Have Miley Cyrus Perform at Her Sunny Hill Festival in Kosovo (Exclusive)|access-date=April 6, 2020|last=Seemayer|first=Zach|date=September 9, 2019 |publisher=Entertainment Tonight}}</ref> In September 2019, Cyrus met with another fan through the Make-A-Wish Foundation at the 2019 [[iHeartRadio Music Festival]] in Las Vegas, Nevada.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6m8HnfWKyiE | title=Miley Cyrus Makes a Fan's Dream Come True! | website=[[YouTube]] | date=October 24, 2019 }}</ref><ref name=\"youtube1\"/> Cyrus and her boyfriend [[Cody Simpson]] donated 120 [[taco]]s to healthcare workers amid the [[COVID-19 pandemic]] in April 2020.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://people.com/music/miley-cyrus-cody-simpson-deliver-tacos-healthcare-workers/|title=Miley Cyrus and Cody Simpson Deliver Tacos to Healthcare Workers amid Coronavirus Pandemic|work=People|access-date=November 24, 2020}}</ref> That same month, she partnered again with MAC Cosmetics's  annual Viva Glam campaign to donate $10 million toward 250 local organizations nationwide heavily impacted by the pandemic.\n\nCyrus showed support for the [[Black Lives Matter]] movement by sharing links and resources on social media, donning a Black Lives Matter face mask, and attending [[George Floyd protests|protests following the murder of George Floyd]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://theindependent.sg/miley-cyrus-and-cody-simpson-take-a-break-from-black-lives-matter-protests/|title=Miley Cyrus and Cody Simpson take a break from Black Lives Matter protests|first=Lydia|last=Koh|website=Theindependent.sg|date=June 15, 2020|access-date=December 5, 2020}}</ref>\n\n===Happy Hippie Foundation===\nCyrus is the founder of the [[Happy Hippie Foundation]], which works to \"fight injustice facing homeless youth, LGBTQ youth, and other vulnerable populations\".<ref name=\"The Happy Hippie Foundation\">{{cite web|url=http://www.happyhippies.org/|title=The Happy Hippie Foundation|website=Happyhippies.org|access-date=July 31, 2016}}</ref> From 2014 to 2016 the foundation served nearly 1,500 homeless youth in Los Angeles, reached more than 25,000 LGBTQ youth and their families with resources about gender, and provided social services to transgender individuals, youth in conflict zones, and people affected by crises.<ref>{{cite news |last=Setoodeh |first=Ramin |title=Miley Cyrus Stands Up for Homeless Youth |url=https://variety.com/2016/music/news/miley-cyrus-happy-hippe-foundation-homeless-youth-1201884032/ |access-date=December 7, 2018 |date=October 11, 2016}}</ref> Happy Hippie encourages Cyrus's fans to support causes including gender equality, LGBTQ rights and mental health through awareness campaigns and fundraising. Leading up to the 2020 presidential election, Happy Hippie encouraged its Instagram followers to seek out [[VoteRiders]] for assistance ensuring that gender identity would not affect their right to vote.\n\nOn June 15, 2015, Cyrus launched the campaign #InstaPride<ref>{{cite magazine |title=Miley Cyrus Instagram Instapride |url=http://time.com/3917249/miley-cyrus-instagram-instapride/ |magazine=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |access-date=October 17, 2018}}</ref> in collaboration with Instagram. The campaign features a series of portraits starring [[transgender]] and gender-expansive people, which were posted to her Instagram feed with the hashtags \"#HappyHippiePresents\" and \"#InstaPride\". It stated that it was aimed at encouraging diversity and tolerance by showing these people in a positive light as examples for others who might be struggling to figure themselves out, and as a reference point for people who didn't know personally anyone in that situation. Cyrus was behind the camera for the entire photoshoot, and interviewed her 14 subjects to share their personal stories. She said she wanted to bring attention to and celebrate people who would not normally find themselves being the stars of a photoshoot or portrayed on the cover of a magazine.<ref>{{cite magazine |title=Miley Cyrus launches Instapride campaign to honor transgender people |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/miley-cyrus-launches-instapride-campaign-to-honor-transgender-people-62976/ |magazine=Rolling Stone  |access-date=October 17, 2018|date=June 15, 2015 }}</ref>\n\nFollowing the loss of Miley and Hemsworth's Malibu home from the [[Woolsey Fire]], the community and they launched the Malibu Foundation for relief efforts following the [[2018 California wildfires]],<ref>{{cite web |url=https://malibufoundation.gvng.org/ |title=Malibu Foundation |work=Malibufoundation.gvng.org |access-date=January 12, 2019 |archive-date=January 12, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190112010803/https://malibufoundation.gvng.org/ |url-status=dead }}</ref> Miley's Happy Hippie Foundation donating $500,000 to the Malibu Foundation.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://malibufoundation.gvng.org/posts/29/details |title=Thank You Miley And Liam! |work=Malibufoundation.gvng.org |date=November 13, 2018 |access-date=January 12, 2019 |archive-date=March 27, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200327151844/https://malibufoundation.gvng.org/posts/29/details |url-status=dead }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|first=Antoinette |last=Bueno |url=https://www.etonline.com/miley-cyrus-and-liam-hemsworth-donate-500k-to-malibu-relief-after-losing-home-to-woolsey-fire |title=Miley Cyrus and Liam Hemsworth Donate $500K to Malibu Relief After Losing Home to Woolsey Fire |work=Entertainment Tonight |date=November 13, 2018 |access-date=January 12, 2019}}</ref>\n\nIn 2024 Cyrus announced that the foundation would be renamed as Miley Cyrus Foundation.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.wmagazine.com/culture/miley-cyrus-cover-interview-2024|title=Miley Cyrus Finally Gets Her \"Flowers\"|last=Hawgood|first=Alex|magazine=[[W (magazine)|W]]|date=June 3, 2024|access-date=June 3, 2024}}</ref>\n\n==Cultural impact and status==\n[[File:InThisLifeUnderGround.jpg|thumb|upright|Cyrus has been compared to the \"Queen of Pop\", [[Madonna]], being considered by many as the \"Madonna of her generation\".<ref name=\"theguardian.com\">{{cite news|date=June 10, 2015|title=Canny and confrontational, Miley Cyrus is this generation's Madonna |first=Rebecca|last=Nicholson|url=http://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2015/jun/10/proper-punk-miley-cyrus-madonna-sexuality|access-date=February 14, 2022|newspaper=The Guardian}}</ref>]]\n\nCyrus's early success as the face of [[Disney Channel]]'s billion-dollar franchise ''[[Hannah Montana]]''<ref>{{Cite book|last=Steinberg|first=Shirley R.|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=jR-yDwAAQBAJ&pg=PP1|title=Kinderculture: The Corporate Construction of Childhood|date=May 4, 2018|publisher=Routledge|isbn=978-0-429-96364-3}}</ref> played an important role in shaping the 2000s teen pop culture, earning her the honorific nickname of \"[[Honorific nicknames in popular music|Teen Queen]]\".<ref>{{cite magazine |date=April 6, 2009 |title=Miley Cyrus: Teen Queen |url=https://parade.com/75655/parade/miley-cyrus-3/ |access-date=February 16, 2021 |magazine=[[Parade (magazine)|Parade]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |date=June 10, 2013 |title=From Teen Queen to Leading Lady: Miley Cyrus' Sizzlin' Style Through the Years! |url=http://www.etonline.com/gallery/featured/85422_From_Teen_Queen_to_Leading_Lady_Miley_Cyrus_Sizzlin_Style_Through_the_Years/index.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130610135948/http://www.etonline.com/gallery/featured/85422_From_Teen_Queen_to_Leading_Lady_Miley_Cyrus_Sizzlin_Style_Through_the_Years/index.html |archive-date=June 10, 2013 |access-date=February 17, 2021 |work=[[Entertainment Tonight]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Kitchener |first=Shaun |date=November 7, 2011 |title=Miley Cyrus Is Dracula's Daughter |url=http://www.entertainmentwise.com/news/64816/Miley-Cyrus-Is-Draculas-Daughter |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130619091256/http://www.entertainmentwise.com/news/64816/Miley-Cyrus-Is-Draculas-Daughter |archive-date=June 19, 2013 |access-date=February 17, 2021 |website=[[Entertainmentwise]]}}</ref> Bickford stated ''Hannah Montana'' adopted a business model of combining celebrity acts with film, television, and popular music for a pre-adolescent audience. He called the series \"genre-defining\"<ref name=\":1\">{{Cite journal|last=Bickford|first=Tyler|date=2015|title=Tween Intimacy and the Problem of Public Life in Children's Media: \"Having It All\" on the Disney Channel's \"Hannah Montana\"|url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/43958468|journal=Women's Studies Quarterly|volume=43|issue=1/2|pages=66\u201382|jstor=43958468|issn=0732-1562}}</ref> and likened this model to [[1990s in music|1990s]] [[teen pop]] artists such as [[Britney Spears]] and [[NSYNC]], who were also marketed to children.<ref name=\":1\" /> Morgan Genevieve Blue of ''Feminist Media Studies'' stated the series' primary female characters, Miley and her alter ego Hannah, are positioned as [[Postfeminism|post-feminist]] subjects in a way their representation is confined to notions of femininity and consumerism.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Blue|first=Morgan Genevieve|date=September 1, 2013|title=The Best of Both Worlds?|url=https://doi.org/10.1080/14680777.2012.724024|journal=Feminist Media Studies|volume=13|issue=4|pages=660\u2013675|doi=10.1080/14680777.2012.724024|s2cid=147354770|issn=1468-0777}}</ref> ''[[The Times]]'' journalist Craig McLean named Cyrus the \"world's biggest-ever teenage star\".<ref>{{Cite news|last=McLean|first=Craig|title=Why Miley Cyrus is the world's biggest ever teenage star|newspaper=[[The Times]]|url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/why-miley-cyrus-is-the-worlds-biggest-ever-teenage-star-3c282393cr2|access-date=February 17, 2021|issn=0140-0460}}</ref>\n\nDuring the Best of Both Worlds Tour, tickets were sold out in minutes and stadiums were completely filled making it the highest-grossing concert tour for a new act in 2007 and 2008.<ref name=\":4\">{{Cite magazine|author=<!--Not stated--> |date=November 20, 2008|title=Springsteen, Chesney Rule Billboard Touring Awards|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/springsteen-chesney-rule-billboard-touring-awards-1043438/|access-date=February 14, 2022|magazine=Billboard}}</ref> According to ''Billboard'' boxscore,<ref>{{Cite magazine|last1=Cohen|first1=Jonathan|date=March 4, 2008|title='Hannah Montana' Tour Heading To CD/DVD|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/hannah-montana-tour-heading-to-cddvd-1046364/|access-date=February 14, 2022|magazine=Billboard}}</ref> the Best of Both Worlds Tour had a total attendance of approximately one million people<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=48SZ4YlqhgEC&q=billboard.biz+boxscore+Miley+Cyrus&pg=PT6|title=Billboard|date=June 27, 2009}}</ref> and grossed over US$54 million, earning Cyrus the award for Breakthrough Act at the 2008 [[Billboard Touring Awards]].<ref name=\":4\" /> In 2012, ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' ranked Cyrus as one of the top 25 teen idol breakout moments of the rock era, which Andy Greene wrote: \"Miley's rise was meteoric. Tickets to her 2007 Best of Both Worlds tour sold out faster than any tour in memory&nbsp;... It seemed like she was poised to become a more stable version of Britney Spears \u2013 especially after singles 'The Climb' and 'Party In The USA'\".<ref>{{Cite magazine|last1=Greene|first1=Andy|date=May 11, 2012|title=The Top 25 Teen Idol Breakout Moments|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-lists/teen-idol-breakouts-158080/|access-date=February 14, 2022|magazine=Rolling Stone}}</ref> Due to her popularity, [[Paul McCartney]] compared their success to that of [[the Beatles]] in an interview during his tour in 2011. In this regard, he commented: \"I think when they have new sensations, like Miley Cyrus or Justin Bieber, teenagers identify with them, in the same way that the boys identified with The Beatles, [...] when you have thousands of teenagers feeling the same, they become elated because they have this love for something in common, whether it is The Beatles, Miley Cyrus, Justin Bieber, or whatever.\"<ref>{{cite web|title=Puranoticia {{!}} Paul McCartney compara a Miley Cyrus y Justin Bieber con los Beatles|url=https://www.puranoticia.cl/front/contenido/2011/05/08/noticia-3422.php|access-date=February 14, 2022|website=www.puranoticia.cl}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|title=Compara Paul McCartney a Cyrus y Bieber con The Beatles|url=https://www.razon.com.mx/entretenimiento/compara-paul-mccartney-a-cyrus-y-bieber-con-the-beatles/|access-date=February 14, 2022|website=La Raz\u00f3n}}</ref>\n\nOver the years, Cyrus's song \"Party in the U.S.A.\" gained popularity in American culture on holidays and historic events. The song has re-entered the charts every [[Independence Day (United States)|Independence Day]] since its release. Following the [[death of Osama bin Laden]] on May 2, 2011, a resurgence in popularity of the music video occurred. The official [[YouTube]] video was flooded with comments regarding the death of bin Laden and it was immediately deemed a celebratory anthem for the event.<ref>{{cite web|last=Abebe|first=Nitsuh|title=Why Miley Cyrus's 'Party in the U.S.A.' Became the Osama Bin Laden Death Anthem - Slideshow|date=May 2, 2011 |url=https://www.vulture.com/2011/05/why_miley_cyruss_party_in_the.html|access-date=February 17, 2021|work=Vulture}}</ref> In 2013, an online petition on the [[White House]]'s \"We the People\" petitions website was urging then-president [[Barack Obama]] to change the U.S. national anthem from \"[[The Star-Spangled Banner]]\" to \"Party in the U.S.A.\"<ref>{{cite news|title=Miley Cyrus Has a 'Party in the U.S.A' in Patriotic Gear for Fourth of July|url=https://people.com/music/miley-cyrus-party-in-the-usa-fourth-of-july/|access-date=February 17, 2021|work=People}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Hernandez|first=Brian Anthony|title=Petition Wants Miley's 'Party in the U.S.A.' to be New National Anthem|date=July 7, 2013|url=https://mashable.com/2013/07/07/miley-cyrus-party-usa/|access-date=February 17, 2021|publisher=Mashable}}</ref> Following the [[2020 United States presidential election|2020 presidential election]], as major news outlets announced [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] nominee [[Joe Biden]] the winner of the presidential race, on November 7, 2020, supporters in New York City started singing \"Party in the U.S.A.\" at [[Times Square]].<ref>{{cite web|title='Party in the USA': People in America take to streets dancing to celebrate Joe Biden's big victory|url=https://www.timesnownews.com/the-buzz/article/party-in-the-usa-people-in-america-take-to-streets-dancing-to-celebrate-joe-bidens-big-victory/678881|access-date=February 17, 2021|website=timesnownews.com|date=November 8, 2020}}</ref>\n[[File:Miley Cyrus figure at Madame Tussauds London (33900187296).jpg|thumb|Miley Cyrus figure at [[Madame Tussauds London]]]]\nCyrus's album ''[[Bangerz]]'' (2013), along with its promotional events, is considered to be one of the most controversial moments in the 2010s wider popular culture and established Cyrus among the decade's most controversial figures.<ref>{{Cite magazine|last=Spanos|first=Brittany|date=May 8, 2017|title=Miley Cyrus' 10 Biggest Scandals|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-lists/miley-cyrus-10-biggest-scandals-108463/|access-date=February 17, 2021|magazine=Rolling Stone}}</ref> ''[[Glamour (magazine)|Glamour]]'' writer Mickey Woods likened the promotional \"era\" for the album to those of [[Britney Spears]]'s and [[Christina Aguilera]]'s third and fourth studio albums ''[[Britney (album)|Britney]]'' (2001) and ''[[Stripped (Christina Aguilera album)|Stripped]]'' (2002), respectively, adding that Cyrus's record \"will probably be retrospectively deemed iconic, maybe even classic\".<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Woods|first=Mickey|title=6 Reasons We Love Miley Cyrus' New Album Bangerz|url=https://www.glamour.com/story/we-love-miley-cyrus-new-album|access-date=February 17, 2021|magazine=Glamour|date=October 8, 2013}}</ref> ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' listed ''Bangerz'' as one of the best and most influential albums of the 2010s noting that \"with this pivotal album release, Cyrus took control of her public persona, surprising less with her provocative antics than with her constant artistic evolution\".<ref>{{Cite magazine|title=The 100 Greatest Albums of the 2010s: Staff Picks|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/list/8543722/best-albums-of-the-2010s-top-100|access-date=February 17, 2021|magazine=Billboard|date=November 19, 2019}}</ref> The album is considered a [[Trendsetting|trendsetter]] in \"weaving together urban and pop influences, what's most revered now is what it represented then\" according to Lyndsey Havens.<ref name=\"wcs_2010s\">{{Cite magazine|title=Songs That Defined the Decade: Miley Cyrus' 'We Can't Stop'|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/songs-that-defined-the-decade/8544137/miley-cyrus-we-cant-stop-songs-that-defined-the-decade/|access-date=February 17, 2021|magazine=Billboard|date=November 21, 2019}}</ref> Patrick Ryan of ''[[USA Today]]'' commented that Cyrus's collaborations with [[Mike Will Made It]] on the album contributed to his new-found prominence, stating that Mike Will Made It's position as an executive producer has helped him \"[jump] to the forefront as an interesting character [...] in an era where a lot of producers have fallen behind the scenes again\".<ref>{{cite web|last=Ryan|first=Patrick|title=Thanks to Miley, hitmaker Mike Will made it|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/music/2013/10/07/producer-mike-will-made-it-miley-cyrus-bangerz/2925501/|access-date=February 17, 2021|work=USA Today}}</ref> ''[[Vice (magazine)|Vice]]'' described Cyrus as \"the most punk rock musician out there right now\" and that she is \"spinning circles around every single pop star who is trying to be edgy right now\".<ref>{{cite web|last=Ozzi|first=Dan |title= Miley Cyrus is Punk AF |url=https://www.vice.com/en/article/rqwqmr/miley-cyrus-is-punk-as-fuck|access-date=June 11, 2021|work=Vice|date=September 19, 2013}}</ref> [[MTV]] named Cyrus their Best Artist of 2013, and James Montgomery of [[MTV News]] elaborated on the network's decision that Cyrus \"[declared] her independence and [dominated] the pop-culture landscape\", adding that \"she schooled{{mdash}}and shocked{{mdash}}us all in 2013, and did so on her own terms.\"<ref>{{cite web|author=<!--Not stated-->|title=Best Artists Of 2013|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1718726/best-artists-2013/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140520004400/http://www.mtv.com/news/1718726/best-artists-2013/|url-status=dead|archive-date=May 20, 2014|access-date=February 17, 2021|publisher=[[MTV News]]}}</ref> ''Billboard'' staff called Cyrus the \"Most Talked About Pop Star\" of 2013, and also recognized the controversial evolution of her career as the \"Top Music Moment\" of the year, elaborating that she was a \"maelstrom that expanded and grazed nearly every aspect of pop culture in 2013.\";<ref>{{Cite magazine|title=Top 20 Music Moments of 2013|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/list/5847822/top-20-music-moments-of-2013|access-date=February 17, 2021|magazine=Billboard|date=December 19, 2012}}</ref> the publication also listed \"We Can't Stop\" as best song of 2013 for being \"one of the bolder musical choices in recent memory, and that risk paid off tremendously.\"<ref>{{Cite magazine|title=20 Best Songs of 2013: Critics' Picks|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/list/5840322/20-best-songs-of-2013-critics-picks|access-date=February 17, 2021|magazine=Billboard}}</ref> and one of the songs that defined the decade stating it \"created a new play in the playbook\" of pop music.<ref name=\"wcs_2010s\" /> The song's music video and her controversial 2013 VMAs performance with Robin Thicke were declared as the 27th greatest music video and one of the most \"defining\" pop culture moments of the 2010s.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=''Billboard'' Staff |date=November 26, 2019 |title=The 100 Greatest Music Videos of the 2010s: Staff Picks |url=https://www.billboard.com/media/lists/best-music-videos-2010s-top-100-8544596/ |access-date=April 20, 2024 |magazine=Billboard}}</ref><ref>{{Cite magazine |last=''Billboard'' Staff |date=December 20, 2019 |title=The 100 Moments That Defined the Decade in Music |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/100-best-music-moments-decade-10s-7873025/ |access-date=April 20, 2024 |magazine=Billboard}}</ref>\n\nIn 2015, Rebecca Nicholson from ''The Guardian'' published an article calling Cyrus the [[Madonna]] of her generation, saying that \"she's a ''Disney'' survivor with a fluid approach to gender identity. And, like the old three-chord punks, she gives really good quote\". According to Nicholson, Cyrus takes \"the 90s Madonna approach to public sexuality: it's deliberately provocative, and crucially, it is not being served up for male consumption.\" Likewise, she defends Cyrus's controversial rebellion, highlighting that behind the character there is a human, talented and strong person who manages to connect with the public, just like the \"Queen of Pop\".<ref name=\"theguardian.com\"/> In November of the same year, ''Billboard'' cataloged the singer as one of the \"Greatest of All Time ''Billboard'' 200 Artists\", occupying position thirty-one; she was on the ninth rank among female artists.<ref>{{Cite magazine |date=November 12, 2015 |title=Greatest of All Time ''Billboard'' 200 Artists |url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/greatest-billboard-200-artists/ |access-date=February 14, 2022 |magazine=Billboard}}</ref> In 2017, the aforementioned magazine also published an article naming the singer a \"Queer Superhero\" for her philanthropic fight for the LGBTQ+ community.<ref>{{Cite magazine|last1=Porter|first1=Zachariah|date=February 26, 2019|title=Miley Cyrus Is a Queer Superhero: 8 Times She Showed Love to the LGBTQ Community|url=https://www.billboard.com/culture/pride/miley-cyrus-queer-lgbtq-drag-race-7933969/|access-date=February 14, 2022|magazine=Billboard}}</ref> In 2019, ''Billboard'' ranked her 62nd on its \"Greatest of All Time Artists\" chart,<ref>{{cite magazine |title=Greatest of All Time Artists |url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/greatest-of-all-time-artists |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191114170915/https://www.billboard.com/charts/greatest-of-all-time-artists |archive-date=November 14, 2019 |access-date=April 19, 2024 |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]}}</ref> and 55th on the [[Billboard Decade-End#2010s|2010s decade-end chart of Top Artists]], signifying the most successful acts of the decade.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Trust |first=Gary |date=November 14, 2019 |title=The Decade in Charts: Mark & Bruno's 'Uptown Funk!' Rules Hot 100 & Adele's '21' Tops ''Billboard'' 200 |url=https://www.billboard.com/pro/decade-in-charts-2010s-hot-100-billboard-200/ |url-access=subscription |access-date=April 20, 2024 |magazine=Billboard}}</ref><ref>{{Cite magazine |date=November 14, 2019 |title=Decade-End Charts: Top Artists (2010s) |url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/decade-end/top-artists/ |url-access=subscription |access-date=April 20, 2024 |magazine=Billboard}}</ref>\n\nCyrus has been nicknamed as the \"Pop Chameleon\" of the music industry by media and several publications, due to her continual artistic reinventions, versatility, and constant sonic and stylistic evolution.<ref>\n* {{Cite magazine |date=August 21, 2023 |title=Miley Cyrus: Unveiling 5 iconic songs that defined her musical journey |url=https://www.outlookindia.com/international/us/miley-cyrus-unveiling-5-iconic-songs-that-defined-her-musical-journey-news-312516/ |access-date=April 20, 2024 |magazine=[[Outlook (Indian magazine)|Outlook]]}}\n* {{Cite news |last=Schaefer |first=Karissa |date=January 31, 2021 |title=\"Plastic Hearts\": Why Miley Cyrus is the musical chameleon of Gen Z |url=https://berkeleybeacon.com/plastic-hearts-why-miley-cyrus-is-the-musical-chameleon-of-gen-z/ |access-date=April 20, 2024 |work=[[The Berkeley Beacon]]}}\n* {{Cite news |last=Chang |first=Rachel |date=November 3, 2020 |title=Hannah Montana to rock goddess: Miley Cyrus is queen of genres |url=https://dailytargum.com//article/2020/11/hannah-montana-to-rock-goddess-miley-cyrus-is-queen-of-genres |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210725163935/https://dailytargum.com/article/2020/11/hannah-montana-to-rock-goddess-miley-cyrus-is-queen-of-genres |archive-date=July 25, 2021 |access-date=March 10, 2022 |newspaper=[[The Daily Targum]]}}\n* {{Cite news |last=Cliff |first=Aimee |date=May 31, 2019 |title=Miley Cyrus: She Is Coming review \u2013 pop chameleon finds her true colours |url=http://www.theguardian.com/music/2019/may/31/miley-cyrus-she-is-coming-ep-review |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220925013530/https://www.theguardian.com/music/2019/may/31/miley-cyrus-she-is-coming-ep-review |archive-date=September 25, 2022 |access-date=September 22, 2022 |newspaper=[[The Guardian]]}}\n* {{Cite magazine |last=Roberts |first=Kayleigh |date=July 6, 2019 |title=Miley Cyrus Fooled Britney Spears' Blood Relatives With This 'Oops!...I Did It Again' Costume |url=https://www.marieclaire.com/celebrity/music/a28306899/miley-cyrus-britney-spears-oops-i-did-it-again-outfit/ |url-status=live |access-date=September 22, 2022 |magazine=[[Marie Claire]]}}\n* {{Cite web |last=Dhindsa |first=Jasleen |date=September 12, 2022 |title=Noah Cyrus and the Delicate Art of Vulnerability {{!}} Interview |url=https://www.thelineofbestfit.com/features/interviews/noah-cyrus-delicate-art-of-vulnerability |url-status=live |access-date=September 22, 2022 |magazine=[[The Line of Best Fit]]}}\n* {{Cite web |last=Henderson |first=Taylor |date=August 5, 2020 |title=Miley Cyrus Teases New Era of Music&nbsp;... 2022 |work=[[Pride.com]]}}</ref> She has also been considered a [[pop icon]] by several media outlets,<ref>* {{Cite news |last=Jim\u00e9nez |first=Andrea |date=November 23, 2022 |title=Miley Cyrus at }}\n* {{Cite web |last=Karl |first=Abigail |date=October 19, 2023 |title=From Disney Darling to Pop Icon: Miley Cyrus' Evolution |url=https://whatstrending.com/from-disney-darling-to-pop-icon-miley-cyrus-evolution/ |access-date=June 4, 2024 |website=[[What's Trending]] }}</ref><ref name=\"greatestpop2023\">{{Cite magazine |last=Atkinson |first=Katie |date=December 8, 2023 |title=Billboard's Greatest Pop Stars of 2023: Comeback Artist of the Year \u2014 Miley Cyrus |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/miley-cyrus-greatest-pop-star-2023-comeback-of-the-year-1235547218/ |access-date=June 6, 2024 |magazine=Billboard}}</ref> with the [[BBC]] calling her \"the ultimate 21st century pop star\".<ref>{{Cite web |last=Levine |first=Nick |date=March 10, 2023 |title=Why Miley Cyrus is the ultimate 21st-Century pop star |url=https://www.bbc.com/culture/article/20230309-why-miley-cyrus-is-the-ultimate-21st-century-pop-star |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230310010813/https://www.bbc.com/culture/article/20230309-why-miley-cyrus-is-the-ultimate-21st-century-pop-star |archive-date=March 10, 2023 |access-date=March 10, 2023 |work=[[BBC Online|BBC Culture]]}}</ref> ''Billboard'' included Cyrus in its \"Greatest Pop Stars of 2023\" listicle, naming her the \"Comeback Artist of the Year\". The magazine noted that her 2023 single \"Flowers\"\u2014\"the biggest chart smash of her career\"\u2014\"re-established [Cyrus] as one of pop's foremost hitmakers\" and led to a commercial resurgence.<ref name=\"greatestpop2023\"/> In 2024, at age 31, Cyrus became the youngest recipient of the [[Disney Legends]] award, for her outstanding contributions to the Walt Disney Company.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Stephan |first=Katcy |date=August 11, 2024 |title=Miley Cyrus Honored as Youngest-Ever Disney Legend at D23: 'It's Legendary to Be Afraid and Do It Anyway' |url=https://variety.com/2024/music/news/miley-cyrus-disney-legend-d23-1236101271/ |access-date=August 12, 2024 |magazine=Variety}}</ref>\n\nArtists that have cited Cyrus or her work as inspiration or an influence include [[Chappell Roan]],<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Kaufman |first=Gil |date=August 13, 2024 |title=Chappell Roan Praises Miley Cyrus for Inspiration, Making Music That's 'So Authentic' in 2024 Disney Legends Ceremony Intro |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/chappell-roan-praises-miley-cyrus-music-so-authentic-2024-disney-legends-ceremony-1235751977/ |access-date=August 26, 2024 |magazine=Billboard}}</ref> [[JoJo Siwa]],<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Kiley |first=Rachel |date=April 2, 2024 |title=JoJo Siwa wants her own Miley Cyrus ''Bangerz'' rebranding moment |url=https://www.out.com/gay-music/jojo-siwa-karma-miley-cyrus-bangerz-inspiration/ |access-date=April 19, 2024 |magazine=[[Out (magazine)|Out]]}}</ref> [[Lea Michele]],<ref>{{cite magazine|last=Ayers|first=Mike|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/5923073/lea-michele-interview-louder-album-cory-monteith-glee|title=Lea Michele Q&A: Talks 'Difficult' Cory Song, Finding Her Voice and Life After 'Glee'|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=March 3, 2014|access-date=August 26, 2024}}</ref> [[Lil Nas X]],<ref>{{Cite magazine |first=Tom\u00e1s |last=Mier |date=September 15, 2021 |title=Lil Nas X Says Miley Cyrus Doesn't 'Even Realize How Much of a Legend' She Is: 'I Really Admire Her' |url=https://people.com/music/lil-nas-x-says-miley-cyrus-doesnt-even-realize-how-much-of-a-legend-she-is/ |magazine=People |access-date=September 23, 2021 |archive-date=September 25, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210925103537/https://people.com/music/lil-nas-x-says-miley-cyrus-doesnt-even-realize-how-much-of-a-legend-she-is/ |url-status=live}}</ref> and [[Troye Sivan]].<ref>{{cite web |last=Barlow |first=Eve |title=Troye Sivan |url=https://www.wonderlandmagazine.com/2018/05/04/troye-sivan/ |magazine=Wonderland |access-date=April 18, 2023 |date=May 4, 2018}}</ref>\n\n==Discography==\n{{Main|Miley Cyrus discography|List of songs recorded by Miley Cyrus}}\n{{See also|Hannah Montana discography}}\n{{col-begin}}\n* ''[[Hannah Montana 2: Meet Miley ''[[Younger Now]]'' (2017)\n* ''[[Plastic Hearts]]'' (2020)\n* ''[[Endless Summer Vacation]]'' (2023)\n{{col-end}}\n\n== Filmography ==\n{{Main|Miley Cyrus videography}}\n{{hatnote|This section lists service)|Stand By You]]'' (2021)\n* ''[[Endless Summer Vacation (Backyard Sessions)]]'' (2023)\n{{col-float-end}}\n\n==Tours==\n{{Main|List of Miley Cyrus live performances}}\n'''Headlining'''\n* [[Best of Both Worlds Tour]] (2007\u20132008)\n* [[Wonder World Tour (Miley Cyrus)|Wonder World Tour]] (2009)\n* [[Gypsy Heart Tour]] (2011)\n* [[Bangerz Tour]] (2014)\n\n'''Promotional'''\n* [[Milky Milky Milk Tour]] (2015)\n* [[Attention Tour]] (2022)\n\n'''Opening act'''\n* [[The Cheetah Girls (group)|The Cheetah Girls]] \u2013 [[The Party's Just Begun Tour]] (2006\u20132007)\n\n==Achievements==\n{{main|List of awards and nominations received by Miley Cyrus}}\n\n==See also==\n{{Portal|United States|Biography|Pop music}}\n* [[Honorific nicknames in popular music]]\n* [[List of Billboard Social 50 number-one artists|List of ''Billboard'' Social 50 number-one artists]]\n* [[List of most-followed Instagram accounts]]\n\n== Notes ==\n=== Explanatory footnotes ===\n{{Notelist}}\n\n=== Citations ===\n{{reflist}}\n\n== Further reading ==\n* {{Cite book |last1=Cyrus |first1=Miley |last2=Liftin |first2=Hilary |name-list-style=amp |year=2009 links==\n{{Sister project links |wikt=no |commons=Miley Cyrus |commonscat=yes |b=no |n=no |q=Miley Cyrus |s=no |v=no |d=Q4235 |m=no|mw=no|species=no}}\n* {{Official website}}\n* {{Amazon Music artist|B00137NS0S}}\n* {{IMDb name|1415323|Miley Cyrus}}\n\n{{Miley Cyrus|state=uncollapsed}}\n{{Miley Cyrus songs}}\n{{Navboxes\n|title = [[List of awards and nominations received by Miley Cyrus|Awards for Miley Cyrus]]\n|list = \n{{Disney Legends Awards 2020s}}\n{{Grammy Award for Record of the Year}}\n{{Grammy Award for Best Pop Solo Performance}}\n{{Nickelodeon Kids' Choice Award for Year}}\n{{MTV Movie Award for Best Musical Moment}}\n{{MTV Europe Music Award for Best US Act}}\n{{Teen Choice Award for Choice Music \u2013 Female Artist}}\n{{Teen Choice Award Choice Hissy
